Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, by the will of God, and Timothy, a brother:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ Jesus who are at Colossa.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Grace be to you and peace, from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ. We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Hearing your faith in Christ Jesus and the love which you have towards all the saints.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For the hope that is laid up for you in heaven, which you have heard in the word of the truth of the gospel,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Which is come unto you, as also it is in the whole world and bringeth forth fruit and groweth, even as it doth in you, since the day you heard and knew the grace of God in truth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: As you learned of Epaphras, our most beloved fellow servant, who is for you a faithful minister of Christ Jesus;

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Who also hath manifested to us your love in the spirit.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Therefore we also, from the day that we heard it, cease not to pray for you and to beg that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will, in all wisdom and spiritual understanding:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: That you may walk worthy of God, in all things pleasing; being fruitful in every good work and increasing in the knowledge of God:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Strengthened with all might according to the power of his glory, in all patience and longsuffering with joy,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Giving thanks to God the Father, who hath made us worthy to be partakers of the lot of the saints in light:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Who hath delivered us from the power of darkness and hath translated us into the kingdom of the Son of his love,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: In whom we have redemption through his blood, the remission of sins:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Who is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature: The firstborn.... That is, first begotten; as the Evangelist declares, the only begotten of his Father: hence, St. Chrisostom explains firstborn, not first created, as he was not created at all, but born of his Father before all ages; that is, coeval with the Father and with the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For in him were all things created in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones, or dominations, or principalities, or powers. All things were created by him and in him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And he is before all: and by him all things consist.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And he is the head of the body, the church: who is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, that in all things he may hold the primacy:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Because in him, it hath well pleased the Father that all fulness should dwell:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And through him to reconcile all things unto himself, making peace through the blood of his cross, both as to the things that are on earth and the things that are in heaven.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And you, whereas you were some time alienated and enemies in mind in evil works:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Yet now he hath reconciled in the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and unspotted and blameless before him:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: If so ye continue in the faith, grounded and settled, and immoveable from the hope of the gospel which you have heard, which is preached in all the creation that is under heaven: whereof I Paul am made a minister.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Who now rejoice in my sufferings for you and fill up those things that are wanting of the sufferings of Christ, in my flesh, for his body, which is the church: Wanting.... There is no want in the sufferings of Christ in himself as head: but many sufferings are still wanting, or are still to come, in his body the church, and his members the faithful.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Whereof I am made a minister according to the dispensation of God, which is given me towards you, that I may fulfil the word of God:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: The mystery which hath been hidden from ages and generations, but now is manifested to his saints,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: To whom God would make known the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ, in you the hope of glory.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Whom we preach, admonishing every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Wherein also I labour, striving according to his working which he worketh in me in power. Colossians Chapter 2 He warns them against the impostures of the philosophers and the Jewish teachers, that would withdraw them from Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For I would have you know what manner of care I have for you and for them that are at Laodicea and whosoever have not seen my face in the flesh:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: That their hearts may be comforted, being instructed in charity and unto all riches of fulness of understanding, unto the knowledge of the mystery of God the Father and of Christ Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: In whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Now this I say, that no man may deceive you by loftiness of words.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For though I be absent in body, yet in spirit I am with you, rejoicing, and beholding your order and the steadfastness of your faith which is in Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: As therefore you have received Jesus Christ the Lord, walk ye in him:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Rooted and built up in him and confirmed in the faith, as also you have learned: abounding in him in thanksgiving.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Beware lest any man cheat you by philosophy and vain deceit: according to the tradition of men according to the elements of the world and not according to Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead corporeally.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And you are filled in him, who is the head of all principality and power.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: In whom also you are circumcised with circumcision not made by hand in despoiling of the body of the flesh: but in the circumcision of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Buried with him in baptism: in whom also you are risen again by the faith of the operation of God who hath raised him up from the dead.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And you, when you were dead in your sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh, he hath quickened together with him, forgiving you all offences:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Blotting out the handwriting of the decree that was against us, which was contrary to us. And he hath taken the same out of the way, fastening it to the cross.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And despoiling the principalities and powers, he hath exposed them confidently in open shew, triumphing over them in himself.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Let no man therefore judge you in meat or in drink or in respect of a festival day or of the new moon or of the sabbaths, In meat, etc.... He means with regard to the Jewish observations of the distinction of clean and unclean meats; and of their festivals, new moons, and sabbaths, as being no longer obligatory.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Which are a shadow of things to come: but the body is of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Let no man seduce you, willing in humility and religion of angels, walking in the things which he hath not seen, in vain puffed up by the sense of his flesh: Willing, etc.... That is, by a self willed, self invented, superstitious worship, falsely pretending humility, but really proceeding from pride. Such was the worship, that many of the philosophers (against whom St. Paul speaks, ver. 8) paid to angels or demons, by sacrificing to them, as carriers of intelligence betwixt God and men; pretending humility in so doing, as if God was too great to be addressed by men; and setting aside the mediatorship of Jesus Christ, who is the head both of angels and men. Such also was the worship paid by the ancient heretics, disciples of Simon and Menander, to the angels, whom they believed to be makers and lords of this lower world. This is certain, that they whom the apostle here condemns, did not hold the head, (ver. 19,) that is, Jesus Christ, and his mediatorship; and therefore what he writes here no way touches the Catholic doctrine and practice, of desiring our good angels to pray to God for us, through Jesus Christ. St. Jerome [Epist. ad Algas.] understands by the religion or service of angels, the Jewish teachers, who sought to subject the new Christians to the observance of the Mosaic law.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And not holding the head, from which the whole body, by joints and bands, being supplied with nourishment and compacted, groweth into the increase of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: If then you be dead with Christ from the elements of this world, why do you yet decree as though living in the world?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Touch not: taste not: handle not. Touch not, etc.... The meaning is, that Christians should not subject themselves, either to the ordinances of the old law, forbidding touching or tasting things unclean; or to the superstitious invention of heretics, imposing such restraints, under pretence of wisdom, humility, or mortification.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Which all are unto destruction by the very use, according to the precepts and doctrines of men.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Which things have indeed a shew of wisdom in superstition and humility, and not sparing the body; not in any honour to the filling of the flesh. Colossians Chapter 3 He exhorts them to put off the old man, and to put on the new. The duties of wives and husbands, children and servants.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Therefore if you be risen with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is sitting at the right hand of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Mind the things that are above, not the things that are upon the earth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For you are dead: and your life is hid with Christ in God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: When Christ shall appear, who is your life, then you also shall appear with him in glory.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth: fornication, uncleanness, lust, evil concupiscence and covetousness, which is the service of idols.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For which things the wrath of God cometh upon the children of unbelief.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: In which you also walked some time, when you lived in them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: But now put you also all away: anger, indignation, malice, blasphemy, filthy speech out of your mouth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Lie not one to another: stripping yourselves of the old man with his deeds,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And putting on the new, him who is renewed unto knowledge, according to the image of him that created him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Where there is neither Gentile nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian nor Scythian, bond nor free. But Christ is all and in all.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Put ye on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, the bowels of mercy, benignity, humility, modesty, patience:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Bearing with one another and forgiving one another, if any have a complaint against another. Even as the Lord hath forgiven you, so do you also.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: But above all these things have charity, which is the bond of perfection.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And let the peace of Christ rejoice in your hearts, wherein also you are called in one body: and be ye thankful.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you abundantly: in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another in psalms, hymns and spiritual canticles, singing in grace in your hearts to God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: All whatsoever you do in word or in work, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Wives, be subject to your husbands, as it behoveth in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Husbands, love your wives and be not bitter towards them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Children, obey your parents in all things: for this is well pleasing to the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Fathers, provoke not your children to indignation, lest they be discouraged.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Servants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh: not serving to the eye, as pleasing men: but in simplicity of heart, fearing God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Whatsoever you do, do it from the heart, as to the Lord, and not to men:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Knowing that you shall receive of the Lord the reward of inheritance. Serve ye the Lord Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For he that doth wrong shall receive for that which he hath done wrongfully. And there is no respect of persons with God. Colossians Chapter 4 He recommends constant prayer and wisdom. Various salutations.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Masters, do to your servants that which is just and equal: knowing that you also have a master in heaven.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Be instant in prayer: watching in it with thanksgiving.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Praying withal for us also, that God may open unto us a door of speech to speak the mystery of Christ (for which also I am bound):

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: That I may make it manifest as I ought to speak.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Walk with wisdom towards them that are without, redeeming the time.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Let your speech be always in grace seasoned with salt: that you may know how you ought to answer every man.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: All the things that concern me, Tychicus, our dearest brother and faithful minister and fellow servant in the Lord, will make known to you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Whom I have sent to you for this same purpose, that he may know the things that concern you and comfort your hearts:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: With Onesimus, a most beloved and faithful brother, who is one of you. All things that are done here, they shall make known to you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, saluteth you: and Mark, the cousin german of Barnabas, touching whom you have received commandments. If he come unto you, receive him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And Jesus that is called Justus: who are of the circumcision. These only are my helpers, in the kingdom of God: who have been a comfort to me.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Epaphras saluteth you, who is one of you, a servant of Christ Jesus, who is always solicitous for you in prayers, that you may stand perfect and full in all the will of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: For I bear him testimony that he hath much labour for you and for them that are at Laodicea and them at Hierapolis.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Luke, the most dear physician, saluteth you: and Demas.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: Salute the brethren who are at Laodicea: and Nymphas and the church that is in his house.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And when this epistle shall have been read with you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans: and that you read that which is of the Laodiceans. And that you read that which is of the Laodiceans.... What this epistle was is uncertain, and annotators have given different opinions concerning it. Some expound these words of an epistle which St. Paul wrote to the Laodiceans, and is since lost, for that now extant is no more than a collection of sentences out of the other epistles of St. Paul; therefore it cannot be considered even as a part of that epistle. Others explain that the text means a letter sent to St. Paul by the Laodiceans, which he sends to the Colossians to be read by them. However, this opinion does not seem well founded. Hence it is more probable that St. Paul wrote an epistle from Rome to the Laodiceans, about the same time that he wrote to the Colossians, as he had them both equally at heart, and that he ordered that epistle to be read by the Colossians for their instructions; and being neighbouring cities, they might communicate to each other what they had received from him; as one epistle might contain some matters not related in the other, and would be equally useful for their concern; and more particularly as they were equally disturbed by intruders and false teachers, against which the apostle was anxious to warn them, lest they should be infected by their pernicious doctrine.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: And say to Archippus: Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfil it.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Colossians
Text: The salutation of Paul with my own hand. Be mindful of my bands. Grace be with you. Amen.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: The words of Amos, who was among the herdsmen of Thecua: which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Ozias king of Juda, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joas king of Israel two years before the earthquake. The earthquake.... Many understand this of a great earthquake, which they say was felt at the time that king Ozias attempted to offer incense in the temple. But the best chronologists prove that the earthquake here spoken of must have been before that time: because Jeroboam the second, under whom Amos prophesied, was dead long before that attempt of Ozias.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And he said: The Lord will roar from Sion, and utter his voice from Jerusalem: and the beautiful places of the shepherds have mourned, and the top of Carmel is withered.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Thus saith the Lord: For three crimes of Damascus, and for four I will not convert it: because they have thrashed Galaad with iron wains. For three crimes—and for four.... That is, for their many unrepented of crimes.—Ibid. I will not convert it.... That is, I will not spare them, nor turn away the punishments I design to inflict upon them.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will send a fire into the house of Azael, and it shall devour the houses of Benadad.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will break the bar of Damascus: and I will cut off the inhabitants from the plain of the idol, and him that holdeth the sceptre from the house of pleasure: and the people of Syria shall be carried away to Cyrene, saith the Lord.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Thus saith the Lord: For three crimes of Gaza, and for four I will not convert it: because they have carried away a perfect captivity to shut them up in Edom.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will send a fire on the wall of Gaza, and it shall devour the houses thereof.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will cut off the inhabitant from Azotus, and him that holdeth the sceptre from Ascalon: and I will turn my hand against Accaron, and the rest of the Philistines shall perish, saith the Lord God.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Thus saith the Lord: For three crimes of Tyre, and for four I will not convert it: because they have shut up an entire captivity in Edom, and have not remembered the covenant of brethren.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will send a fire upon the wall of Tyre, and it shall devour the houses thereof.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Thus saith the Lord: For three crimes of Edom, and for four I will not convert him: because he hath pursued his brother with the sword, and hath cast off all pity, and hath carried on his fury, and hath kept his wrath to the end.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: I will send a fire into Theman: and it shall devour the houses of Bosra.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Thus saith the Lord: For three crimes of the children of Ammon, and for four I will not convert him: because he hath ripped up the women with child of Galaad to enlarge his border.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabba: and it shall devour the houses thereof with shouting in the day of battle, and with a whirlwind in the day of trouble.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And Melchom shall go into captivity, both he, and his princes together, saith the Lord. Melchom.... The god or idol of the Ammonites, otherwise called Moloch, and Melech: which in Hebrew signifies a king, and Melchom their king. Amos Chapter 2 The judgments with which God threatens Moab, Juda, and Israel for their sins, and their ingratitude.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Thus saith the Lord: For three crimes of Moab, and for four I will not convert him: because he hath burnt the bones of the king of Edom even to ashes.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will send a fire into Moab, and it shall devour the houses of Carioth: and Moab shall die with a noise, with the sound of the trumpet:

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will cut off the judge from the midst thereof, and will slay all his princes with him, saith the Lord.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Thus saith the Lord: For three crimes of Juda, and for four I will not convert him: because he hath cast away the law of the Lord, and hath not kept his commandments: for their idols have caused them to err, after which their fathers have walked.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will send a fire into Juda, and it shall devour the houses of Jerusalem.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Thus saith the Lord: For three crimes of Israel, and for four I will not convert him: because he hath sold the just man for silver, and the poor man for a pair of shoes.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: They bruise the heads of the poor upon the dust of the earth, and turn aside the way of the humble: and the son and his father have gone to the same young woman, to profane my holy name.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And they sat down upon garments laid to pledge by every altar: and drank the wine of the condemned in the house of their God.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Yet I cast out the Amorrhite before their face: whose height was like the height of cedars, and who was strong as an oak: and I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots beneath.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: It is I that brought you up out of the land of Egypt, and I led you forty years through the wilderness, that you might possess the land of the Amorrhite.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I raised up of your sons for prophets, and of your young men for Nazarites. Is it not so, O ye children of Israel, saith the Lord?

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And you will present wine to the Nazarites: and command the prophets, saying: Prophesy not.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Behold, I will screak under you as a wain screaketh that is laden with hay. I will screak.... Unable to bear any longer the enormous load of your sins, etc. The spirit of God, as St. Jerome takes notice, accommodates himself to the education of the prophet and inspires him with comparisons taken from country affairs.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And flight shall perish from the swift, and the valiant shall not possess his strength, neither shall the strong save his life.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And he that holdeth the bow shall not stand, and the swift of foot shall not escape, neither shall the rider of the horse save his life.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And the stout of heart among the valiant shall flee away naked in that day, saith the Lord. Amos Chapter 3 The evils that shall fall upon Israel for their sins.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Hear the word that the Lord hath spoken concerning you, O ye children of Israel: concerning the whole family that I brought up out of the land of Egypt, saying:

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: You only have I known of all the families of the earth: therefore will I visit upon you all your iniquities. Visit upon.... That is, punish.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Shall two walk together except they be agreed?

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Will a lion roar in the forest, if he have no prey? will the lion’s whelp cry out of his den, if he have taken nothing?

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Will the bird fall into the snare upon the earth, if there be no fowler? Shall the snare be taken up from the earth, before it hath taken somewhat?

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Shall the trumpet sound in a city, and the people not be afraid? Shall there be evil in a city, which the Lord hath not done? Evil in a city.... He speaks of the evil of punishments of war, famine, pestilence, desolation, etc., but not of the evil of sin, of which God is not the author.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: For the Lord God doth nothing without revealing his secret to his servants the prophets.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: The lion shall roar, who will not fear? The Lord God hath spoken, who shall not prophesy?

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Publish it in the houses of Azotus, and in the houses of the land of Egypt, and say: Assemble yourselves upon the mountains of Samaria, and behold the many follies in the midst thereof, and them that suffer oppression in the inner rooms thereof.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And they have not known to do the right thing, saith the Lord, storing up iniquity, and robberies in their houses.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Therefore thus saith the Lord God: The land shall be in tribulation, and shall be compassed about: and thy strength shall be taken away from thee, and thy houses shall be spoiled.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Thus saith the Lord: As if a shepherd should get out of the lion’s mouth two legs, or the tip of the ear: so shall the children of Israel be taken out that dwell in Samaria, in a place of a bed, and in the couch of Damascus.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Hear ye, and testify in the house of Jacob, saith the Lord the God of hosts:

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: That in the day when I shall begin to visit the transgressions of Israel, I will visit upon him, and upon the altars of Bethel: and the horns of the altars shall be cut off, and shall fall to the ground.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will strike the winter house with the summer house: and the houses of ivory shall perish, and many houses shall be destroyed, saith the Lord. Amos Chapter 4 The Israelites are reproved for their oppressing the poor, for their idolatry, and their incorrigibleness.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Hear this word, ye fat kine that are in the mountains of Samaria: you that oppress the needy, and crush the poor: that say to your masters: Bring, and we will drink. Fat kine.... He means the great ones that lived in plenty and wealth.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: The Lord God hath sworn by his holiness, that lo, the days shall come upon you, when they shall lift you up on pikes, and what shall remain of you in boiling pots.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And you shall go out at the breaches one over against the other, and you shall be cast forth into Armon, saith the Lord. Armon.... A foreign country; some understand it of Armenia.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Come ye to Bethel, and do wickedly: to Galgal, and multiply transgressions: and bring in the morning your victims, your tithes in three days.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And offer a sacrifice of praise with leaven: and call free offerings, and proclaim it: for so you would do, O children of Israel, saith the Lord God.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Whereupon I also have given you dulness of teeth in all your cities, and want of bread in all your places: yet you have not returned to me, saith the Lord.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: I also have withholden the rain from you, when there were yet three months to the harvest: and I caused it to rain upon one city, and caused it not to rain upon another city: one piece was rained upon: and the piece whereupon I rained not, withered.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And two and three cities went to one city to drink water, and were not filled: yet you returned not to me, saith the Lord.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: I struck you with a burning wind, and with mildew, the palmerworm hath eaten up your many gardens, and your vineyards: your olive groves, and fig groves: yet you returned not to me, saith the Lord.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: I sent death upon you in the way of Egypt, I slew your young men with the sword, even to the captivity of your horses: and I made the stench of your camp to come up into your nostrils: yet you returned not to me, saith the Lord.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: I destroyed some of you, as God destroyed Sodom and Gomorrha, and you were as a firebrand plucked out of the burning: yet you returned not to me, saith the Lord.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Therefore I will do these things to thee, O Israel: and after I shall have done these things to thee, be prepared to meet thy God, O Israel.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: For behold he that formeth the mountains and createth the wind, and declareth his word to man, he that maketh the morning mist, and walketh upon the high places of the earth: the Lord the God of hosts is his name. Amos Chapter 5 A lamentation for Israel: an exhortation to return to God.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Hear ye this word, which I take up concerning you for a lamentation. The house of Israel is fallen, and it shall rise no more.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: The virgin of Israel is cast down upon her land, there is none to raise her up.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: For thus saith the Lord God: The city, out of which came forth a thousand, there shall be left in it a hundred: and out of which there came a hundred, there shall be left in it ten, in the house of Israel.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: For thus saith the Lord to the house of Israel: Seek ye me, and you shall live.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: But seek not Bethel, and go not into Galgal, neither shall you pass over to Bersabee: for Galgal shall go into captivity, and Bethel shall be unprofitable. Bethel,—Galgal,—Bersabee.... The places where they worshipped their idols.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Seek ye the Lord, and live: lest the house of Joseph be burnt with fire, and it shall devour, and there shall be none to quench Bethel.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: You that turn judgment into wormwood, and forsake justice in the land,

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Seek him that maketh Arcturus, and Orion, and that turneth darkness into morning, and that changeth day into night: that calleth the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The Lord is his name. Arcturus and Orion.... Arcturus is a bright star in the north: Orion a beautiful constellation in the south.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: He that with a smile bringeth destruction upon the strong, and waste upon the mighty. With a smile.... That is, with all ease, and without making any effort.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: They have hated him that rebuketh in the gate: and have abhorred him that speaketh perfectly.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Therefore because you robbed the poor, and took the choice prey from him: you shall build houses with square stone, and shall not dwell in them: you shall plant most delightful vineyards, and shall not drink the wine of them.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Because I know your manifold crimes, and your grievous sins: enemies of the just, taking bribes, and oppressing the poor in the gate.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Therefore the prudent shall keep silence at that time, for it is an evil time.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Seek ye good, and not evil, that you may live: and the Lord the God of hosts will be with you, as you have said.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Hate evil, and love good, and establish judgment in the gate: it may be the Lord the God of hosts may have mercy on the remnant of Joseph.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Therefore thus saith the Lord the God of hosts the sovereign Lord: In every street there shall be wailing: and in all places that are without, they shall say: Alas, alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and such as are skilful in lamentation to lament.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And in all vineyards there shall be wailing: because I will pass through in the midst of thee, saith the Lord.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Woe to them that desire the day of the Lord: to what end is it for you? the day of the Lord is darkness, and not light.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: As if a man should flee from the face of a lion, and a bear should meet him: or enter into the house, and lean with his hand upon the wall, and a serpent should bite him.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Shall not the day of the Lord be darkness, and not light: and obscurity, and no brightness in it?

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: I hate, and have rejected your festivities: and I will not receive the odour of your assemblies.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And if you offer me holocausts, and your gifts, I will not receive them: neither will I regard the vows of your fat beasts.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Take away from me the tumult of thy songs: and I will not hear the canticles of thy harp.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: But judgment shall be revealed as water, and justice as a mighty torrent.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Did you offer victims and sacrifices to me in the desert for forty years, O house of Israel? Did you offer, etc.... Except the sacrifices that were offered at the first, in the dedication of the tabernacle, the Israelites offered no sacrifices in the desert. 5:26.But you carried a tabernacle for your Moloch, and the image of your idols, the star of your god, which you made to yourselves. A tabernacle, etc.... All this alludes to the idolatry which they committed, when they were drawn away by the daughters of Moab to the worship of their gods. Num. 25.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the Lord, the God of hosts is his name. Amos Chapter 6 The desolation of Israel for their pride and luxury.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Woe to you that are wealthy in Sion, and to you that have confidence in the mountain of Samaria: ye great men, heads of the people, that go in with state into the house of Israel.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Pass ye over to Chalane, and see, and go from thence into Emath the great: and go down into Geth of the Philistines, and to all the best kingdoms of these: if their border be larger than your border.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: You that are separated unto the evil day: and that approach to the throne of iniquity;

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: You that sleep upon beds of ivory, and are wanton on your couches: that eat the lambs out of the flock, and the calves out of the midst of the herd;

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: You that sing to the sound of the psaltery: they have thought themselves to have instruments of music like David;

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: That drink wine in bowls, and anoint themselves with the best ointments: and they are not concerned for the affliction of Joseph.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Wherefore now they shall go captive at the head of them that go into captivity: and the faction of the luxurious ones shall be taken away.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: The Lord God hath sworn by his own soul, saith the Lord the God of hosts: I detest the pride of Jacob, and I hate his houses, and I will deliver up the city with the inhabitants thereof.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And if there remain ten men in one house, they also shall die.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And a man’s kinsman shall take him up, and shall burn him, that he may carry the bones out of the house; and he shall say to him that is in the inner rooms of the house: Is there yet any with thee?

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And he shall answer: There is an end. And he shall say to him: Hold thy peace, and mention not the name of the Lord.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: For behold the Lord hath commanded, and he will strike the greater house with breaches, and the lesser house with clefts.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Can horses run upon the rocks, or can any one plough with buffles? for you have turned judgment into bitterness, and the fruit of justice into wormwood.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: You that rejoice in a thing of nought: you that say: Have we not taken unto us horns by our own strength?

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: But behold, I will raise up a nation against you, O house of Israel, saith the Lord the God of hosts; and they shall destroy you from the entrance of Emath, even to the torrent of the desert. Amos Chapter 7 The prophet sees, in three visions, evils coming upon Israel: he is accused of treason by the false priest of Bethel.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: These things the Lord God shewed to me: and behold the locust was formed in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter rain, and lo, it was the latter rain after the king’s mowing. The locust, etc.... These judgments by locusts and fire, which, by the prophet’s intercession, were moderated, signify the former invasions of the Assyrians under Phul and Theglathphalasar, before the utter desolation of Israel by Salmanasar.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And it came to pass, that when they had made an end of eating the grass of the land, I said: O Lord God, be merciful, I beseech thee: who shall raise up Jacob, for he is very little?

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: The Lord had pity upon this: It shall not be, said the Lord.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: These things the Lord God shewed to me: and behold the Lord called for judgment unto fire, and it devoured the great deep, and ate up a part at the same time.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I said: O Lord God, cease, I beseech thee, who shall raise up Jacob, for he is a little one?

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: The Lord had pity upon this. Yea this also shall not be, said the Lord God.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: These things the Lord shewed to me: and behold the Lord was standing upon a plastered wall, and in his hand a mason’s trowel.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And the Lord said to me: What seest thou, Amos? And I said: A mason’s trowel. And the Lord said: Behold, I will lay down the trowel in the midst of my people Israel. I will plaster them over no more.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And the high places of the idol shall be thrown down, and the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste: and I will rise up against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And Amasias the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying: Amos hath rebelled against thee in the midst of the house of Israel: the land is not able to bear all his words.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: For thus saith Amos: Jeroboam shall die by the sword, and Israel shall be carried away captive out of their own land. Jeroboam shall die by the sword.... The prophet did not say this; but that the Lord would rise up against the house of Jeroboam with the sword: which was verified, when Zacharias, the son and successor of Jeroboam, was slain by the sword. 4 Kings 15.10.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And Amasias said to Amos: Thou seer, go, flee away into the land of Juda: and eat bread there, and prophesy there.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: But prophesy not again any more in Bethel: because it is the king’s sanctuary, and it is the house of the kingdom.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And Amos answered and said to Amasias: I am not a prophet, nor am I the son of a prophet: but I am a herdsman plucking wild figs. I am not a prophet.... That is, I am not a prophet by education: nor is prophesying my calling or profession: but I am a herdsman, whom God was pleased to send hither to prophesy to Israel.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And the Lord took me when I followed the flock, and the Lord said to me: Go, prophesy to my people Israel.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And now hear thou the word of the Lord: Thou sayest, thou shalt not prophesy against Israel, and thou shalt not drop thy word upon the house of the idol. The house of the idol.... Viz., of the calf worshipped in Bethel.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Therefore thus saith the Lord: Thy wife shall play the harlot in the city, and thy sons and thy daughters shall fall by the sword, and thy land shall be measured by a line: and thou shalt die in a polluted land, and Israel shall go into captivity out of their land. Amos Chapter 8 Under the figure of a hook, which bringeth down the fruit, the approaching desolation of Israel is foreshewed for their avarice and injustices.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: These things the Lord shewed to me: and behold a hook to draw down the fruit.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And he said: What seest thou, Amos? And I said: A hook to draw down fruit. And the Lord said to me: The end is come upon my people Israel: I will not again pass by them any more.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And the hinges of the temple shall screak in that day, saith the Lord God: many shall die: silence shall be cast in every place.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Hear this, you that crush the poor, and make the needy of the land to fail,

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Saying: When will the month be over, and we shall sell our wares: and the sabbath, and we shall open the corn: that we may lessen the measure, and increase the sicle, and may convey in deceitful balances,

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: That we may possess the needy for money, and the poor for a pair of shoes, and may sell the refuse of the corn?

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: The Lord hath sworn against the pride of Jacob: surely I will never forget all their works.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Shall not the land tremble for this, and every one mourn that dwelleth therein: and rise up altogether as a river, and be cast out, and run down as the river of Egypt?

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord God, that the sun shall go down at midday, and I will make the earth dark in the day of light:

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will turn your feasts into mourning, and all your songs into lamentation: and I will bring up sackcloth upon every back of yours, and baldness upon every head: and I will make it as the mourning of an only son, and the latter end thereof as a bitter day.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Behold the days come, saith the Lord, and I will send forth a famine into the land: not a famine of bread, nor a thirst of water, but of hearing the word of the Lord.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And they shall move from sea to sea, and from the north to the east: they shall go about seeking the word of the Lord, and shall not find it.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: In that day the fair virgins, and the young men shall faint for thirst.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: They that swear by the sin of Samaria, and say: Thy God, O Dan, liveth: and the way of Bersabee liveth: and they shall fall, and shall rise no more. Amos Chapter 9 The certainty of the desolation of Israel: the restoring of the tabernacle of David, and the conversion of the Gentiles to the church; which shall flourish for ever.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: I saw the Lord standing upon the altar, and he said: Strike the hinges, and let the lintels be shook: for there is covetousness in the head of them all, and I will slay the last of them with the sword: there shall be no flight for them: they shall flee, and he that shall flee of them shall not be delivered.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Though they go down even to hell, thence shall my hand bring them out: and though they climb up to heaven, thence will I bring them down.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And though they be hid in the top of Carmel, I will search and take them away from thence: and though they hide themselves from my eyes in the depth of the sea, there will I command the serpent and he shall bite them.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And if they go into captivity before their enemies, there will I command the sword, and it shall kill them. And I will set my eyes upon them for evil, and not for good.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And the Lord the God of hosts is he who toucheth the earth, and it shall melt: and all that dwell therein shall mourn: and it shall rise up as a river, and shall run down as the river of Egypt.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: He that buildeth his ascension in heaven, and hath founded his bundle upon the earth: who calleth the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth, the Lord is his name. His ascension.... That is, his high throne.—Ibid. His bundle.... That is, his church bound up together by the bands of one faith and communion.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Are not you as the children of the Ethiopians unto me, O children of Israel, saith the Lord? did not I bring up Israel, out of the land of Egypt: and the Philistines out of Cappadocia, and the Syrians out of Cyrene? As the children of the Ethiopians.... That is, as black as they, by your iniquities.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Behold the eyes of the Lord God are upon the sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from the face of the earth: but yet I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob, saith the Lord.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: For behold I will command, and I will sift the house of Israel among all nations, as corn is sifted in a sieve: and there shall not a little stone fall to the ground.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: All the sinners of my people shall fall by the sword: who say: The evils shall not approach, and shall not come upon us.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: In that day I will raise up the tabernacle of David, that is fallen: and I will close up the breaches of the walls thereof, and repair what was fallen: and I will rebuild it as in the days of old.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: That they may possess the remnant of Edom, and all nations, because my name is invoked upon them: saith the Lord that doth these things.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: Behold the days come, saith the Lord, when the ploughman shall overtake the reaper, and the treader of grapes him that soweth seed: and the mountains shall drop sweetness, and every hill shall be tilled. Shall overtake, etc.... By this is meant the great abundance of spiritual blessings; which, as it were, by a constant succession, shall enrich the church of Christ.

Book: The Prophecy of Amos
Text: And I will bring back the captivity of my people Israel: and they shall build the abandoned cities, and inhabit them: and they shall plant vineyards, and drink the wine of them: and shall make gardens, and eat the fruits of them. And I will plant them upon their own land: and I will no more pluck them out of their land which I have given them, saith the Lord thy God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is the man who hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stood in the way of sinners, nor sat in the chair of pestilence:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But his will is in the law of the Lord, and on his law he shall meditate day and night.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shall be like a tree which is planted near the running waters, which shall bring forth its fruit, in due season. And his leaf shall not fall off: and all whatsoever he shall do shall prosper.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Not so the wicked, not so: but like the dust, which the wind driveth from the face of the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore the wicked shall not rise again in judgment: nor sinners in the council of the just.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord knoweth the way of the just: and the way of the wicked shall perish. Psalms Chapter 2 Quare fremuerunt. The vain efforts of persecutors against Christ and his church.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why have the Gentiles raged, and the people devised vain things?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The kings of the earth stood up, and the princes met together, against the Lord, and against his Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let us break their bonds asunder: and let us cast away their yoke from us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh at them: and the Lord shall deride them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then shall he speak to them in his anger, and trouble them in his rage.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I am appointed king by him over Sion, his holy mountain, preaching his commandment.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath said to me: Thou art my son, this day have I begotten thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ask of me, and I will give thee the Gentiles for thy inheritance, and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt rule them with a rod of iron, and shalt break them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And now, O ye kings, understand: receive instruction, you that judge the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Serve ye the Lord with fear: and rejoice unto him with trembling.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Embrace discipline, lest at any time the Lord be angry, and you perish from the just way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When his wrath shall be kindled in a short time, blessed are all they that trust in him. Psalms Chapter 3 Domine, quid multiplicati. The prophet’s danger and delivery from his son Absalom: mystically, the passion and resurrection of Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The psalm of David when he fled from the face of his son Absalom.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why, O Lord, are they multipied that afflict me? many are they who rise up against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many say to my soul: There is no salvation for him in his God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou, O Lord, art my protector, my glory, and the lifter up of my head.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have cried to the Lord with my voice: and he hath heard me from his holy hill.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have slept and have taken my rest: and I have risen up, because the Lord hath protected me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will not fear thousands of the people surrounding me: arise, O Lord; save me, O my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast struck all them who are my adversaries without cause: thou hast broken the teeth of sinners.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Salvation is of the Lord: and thy blessing is upon thy people. Psalms Chapter 4 Cum invocarem. The prophet teacheth us to flee to God in tribulation, with confidence in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, in verses. A psalm for David. Unto the end.... Or, as St. Jerome renders it, victori, to him that overcometh: which some understand of the chief musician; to whom they suppose the psalms, which bear that title, were given to be sung: we rather understand the psalms thus inscribed to refer to Christ, who is the end of the law, and the great conqueror of death and hell, and to the New Testament.—Ibid. In verses, in carminibus.... In the Hebrew, it is neghinoth, supposed by some to be a musical instrument, with which this psalm was to be sung.—Ibid. For David, or to David.... That is, inspired to David himself, or to be sung.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When I called upon him, the God of my justice heard me: when I was in distress, thou hast enlarged me. Have mercy on me: and hear my prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O ye sons of men, how long will you be dull of heart? why do you love vanity, and seek after lying?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Know ye also that the Lord hath made his holy one wonderful: the Lord will hear me when I shall cry unto him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be ye angry, and sin not: the things you say in your hearts, be sorry for them upon your beds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Offer up the sacrifice of justice, and trust in the Lord: many say, Who sheweth us good things?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The light of thy countenance, O Lord, is signed upon us: thou hast given gladness in my heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: By the fruit of their corn, their wine, and oil, they are multiplied.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In peace in the self same I will sleep, and I will rest:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou, O Lord, singularly hast settled me in hope. Psalms Chapter 5 Verba mea auribul. A prayer to God against the iniquities of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for her that obtaineth the inheritance. A psalm for David. For her that obtaineth the inheritance.... That is, for the church of Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give ear, O Lord, to my words, understand my cry.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hearken to the voice of my prayer, O my King and my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For to thee will I pray: O Lord, in the morning thou shalt hear my voice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the morning I will stand before thee, and I will see: because thou art not a God that willest iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Neither shall the wicked dwell near thee: nor shall the unjust abide before thy eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hatest all the workers of iniquity: thou wilt destroy all that speak a lie. The bloody and the deceitful man the Lord will abhor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But as for me in the multitude of thy mercy, I will come into thy house; I will worship towards thy holy temple, in thy fear.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Conduct me, O Lord, in thy justice: because of my enemies, direct my way in thy sight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For there is no truth in their mouth: their heart is vain.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their throat is an open sepulchre: they dealt deceitfully with their tongues: judge them, O God. Let them fall from their devices: according to the multitude of their wickednesses cast them out: for they have provoked thee, O Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But let all them be glad that hope in thee: they shall rejoice for ever, and thou shalt dwell in them. And all they that love thy name shall glory in thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou wilt bless the just. O Lord, thou hast crowned us, as with a shield of thy good will. Psalms Chapter 6 Domine, ne in furore. A prayer of a penitent sinner, under the scourge of God. The first penitential psalm.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, in verses, a psalm for David, for the octave. For the octave.... That is, to be sung on an instrument of eight strings. St. Augustine understands it mystically, of the last resurrection, and the world to come; which is, as it were, the octave, or eighth day, after the seven days of this mortal life: and for this octave, sinners must dispose themselves, like David, by bewailing their sins, whilst they are here upon earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, rebuke me not in thy indignation, nor chastise me in thy wrath.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am weak: heal me, O Lord, for my bones are troubled.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And my soul is troubled exceedingly: but thou, O Lord, how long?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn to me, O Lord, and deliver my soul: O save me for thy mercy’s sake.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For there is no one in death, that is mindful of thee: and who shall confess to thee in hell?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have laboured in my groanings, every night I will wash my bed: I will water my couch with my tears.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My eye is troubled through indignation: I have grown old amongst all my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity: for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath heard my supplication: the Lord hath received my prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let all my enemies be ashamed, and be very much troubled: let them be turned back, and be ashamed very speedily. Psalms Chapter 7 Domine, Deus meus. David, trusting in the justice of his cause, prayeth for God’s help against his enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The psalm of David, which he sung to the Lord, for the words of Chusi, the son of Jemini.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, my God, in thee have I put my trust; save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lest at any time he seize upon my soul like a lion, while there is no one to redeem me, nor to save.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, my God, if I have done this thing, if there be iniquity in my hands:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I have rendered to them that repaid me evils, let me deservedly fall empty before my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the enemy pursue my soul, and take it, and tread down my life, on the earth, and bring down my glory to the dust.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Rise up, O Lord, in thy anger: and be thou exalted in the borders of my enemies. And arise, O Lord, my God, in the precept which thou hast commanded:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And a congregation of people shall surround thee. And for their sakes return thou on high.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord judgeth the people. Judge me, O Lord, according to my justice, and according to my innocence in me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wickedness of sinners shall be brought to nought; and thou shalt direct the just: the searcher of hearts and reins is God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Just is my help from the Lord; who saveth the upright of heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God is a just judge, strong and patient: is he angry every day?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Except you will be converted, he will brandish his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And in it he hath prepared the instruments of death, he hath made ready his arrows for them that burn. For them that burn.... That is, against the persecutors of his saints.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold he hath been in labour with injustice: he hath conceived sorrow, and brought forth iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath opened a pit and dug it: and he is fallen into the hole he made.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His sorrow shall be turned on his own head: and his iniquity shall come down upon his crown.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will give glory to the Lord according to his justice: and will sing to the name of the Lord the most high. Psalms Chapter 8 Domine, Dominus noster. God is wonderful in his works; especially in mankind, singularly exalted by the incarnation of Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the presses: a psalm for David. The presses.... In Hebrew, Gittith, supposed to be a musical instrument.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, our Lord, how admirable is thy name in the whole earth! For thy magnificence is elevated above the heavens.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Out of the mouth of infants and of sucklings thou hast perfected praise, because of thy enemies, that thou mayst destroy the enemy and the avenger.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I will behold thy heavens, the works of thy fingers: the moon and the stars which thou hast founded.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What is man, that thou art mindful of him? or the son of man, that thou visitest him?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast made him a little less than the angels, thou hast crowned him with glory and honour:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And hast set him over the works of thy hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast subjected all things under his feet, all sheep and oxen: moreover, the beasts also of the fields.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The birds of the air, and the fishes of the sea, that pass through the paths of the sea.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, our Lord, how admirable is thy name in the whole earth! Psalms Chapter 9 Confitebor tibi, Domine. The church praiseth God for his protection against her enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the hidden things of the Son. A psalm for David. The hidden things of the Son.... The humility and sufferings of Christ, the Son of God; and of good Christians, who are his sons by adoption; are called hidden things, with regard to the children of this world, who know not the value and merit of them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will give praise to thee, O Lord, with my whole heart: I will relate all thy wonders.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will be glad, and rejoice in thee: I will sing to thy name, O thou most high.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When my enemy shall be turned back: they shall be weakened, and perish before thy face.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast maintained my judgment and my cause: thou hast sat on the throne, who judgest justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast rebuked the Gentiles, and the wicked one hath perished; thou hast blotted out their name for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The swords of the enemy have failed unto the end: and their cities thou hast destroyed. Their memory hath perished with a noise:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the Lord remaineth for ever. He hath prepared his throne in judgment:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shall judge the world in equity, he shall judge the people in justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the Lord is become a refuge for the poor: a helper in due time in tribulation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let them trust in thee who know thy name: for thou hast not forsaken them that seek thee, O Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing ye to the Lord, who dwelleth in Sion: declare his ways among the Gentiles:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For requiring their blood, he hath remembered them: he hath not forgotten the cry of the poor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have mercy on me, O Lord: see my humiliation which I suffer from my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou that liftest me up from the gates of death, that I may declare all thy praises in the gates of the daughter of Sion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will rejoice in thy salvation: the Gentiles have stuck fast in the destruction which they prepared. Their foot hath been taken in the very snare which they hid.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord shall be known when he executeth judgments: the sinner hath been caught in the works of his own hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked shall be turned into hell, all the nations that forget God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the poor man shall not be forgotten to the end: the patience of the poor shall not perish for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O Lord, let not man be strengthened: let the Gentiles be judged in thy sight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Appoint, O Lord, a lawgiver over them: that the Gentiles may know themselves to be but men. Here the late Hebrew doctors divide this psalm into two, making ver. 22 the beginning of Psalm 10. And again they join Psalms 146 and 147 into one, in order that the whole number of psalms should not exceed 150. And in this manner the psalms are numbered in the Protestant Bible. Psalm 10 according to the Hebrews. 9a:1. Why, O Lord, hast thou retired afar off? why dost thou slight us in our wants, in the time of trouble? 9a:2. Whilst the wicked man is proud, the poor is set on fire: they are caught in the counsels which they devise. 9a:3. For the sinner is praised in the desires of his soul: and the unjust man is blessed. 9a:4. The sinner hath provoked the Lord, according to the multitude of his wrath, he will not seek him: 9a:5. God is not before his eyes: his ways are filthy at all times. Thy judgments are removed from his sight: he shall rule over all his enemies. 9a:6. For he hath said in his heart: I shall not be moved from generation to generation, and shall be without evil. 9a:7. His mouth is full of cursing, and of bitterness, and of deceit: under his tongue are labour and sorrow. 9a:8. He sitteth in ambush with the rich, in private places, that he may kill the innocent. 9a:9. His eyes are upon the poor man: he lieth in wait, in secret, like a lion in his den. He lieth in ambush, that he may catch the poor man: so catch the poor, whilst he draweth him to him. 9a:10. In his net he will bring him down, he will crouch and fall, when he shall have power over the poor. 9a:11. For he hath said in his heart: God hath forgotten, he hath turned away his face, not to see to the end. 9a:12. Arise, O Lord God, let thy hand be exalted: forget not the poor. 9a:13. Wherefore hath the wicked provoked God? for he hath said in his heart: He will not require it. 9a:14. Thou seest it, for thou considerest labour and sorrow: that thou mayst deliver them into thy hands. To thee is the poor man left: thou wilt be a helper to the orphan. 9a:15. Break thou the arm of the sinner and of the malignant: his sin shall be sought, and shall not be found. 9a:16. The Lord shall reign to eternity, yea, for ever and ever: ye Gentiles shall perish from his land. 9a:17. The Lord hath heard the desire of the poor: thy ear hath heard the preparation of their heart. 9a:18. To judge for the fatherless and for the humble, that man may no more presume to magnify himself upon earth. Psalms Chapter 10 In Domino confido. The just man’s confidence in God in the midst of persecutions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end. A psalm to David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the Lord I put my trust: how then do you say to my soul: Get thee away from hence to the mountain, like a sparrow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For, lo, the wicked have bent their bow: they have prepared their arrows in the quiver, to shoot in the dark the upright of heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For they have destroyed the things which thou hast made: but what has the just man done?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is in his holy temple, the Lord’s throne is in heaven. His eyes look on the poor man: his eyelids examine the sons of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord trieth the just and the wicked: but he that loveth iniquity, hateth his own soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall rain snares upon sinners: fire and brimstone, and storms of winds, shall be the portion of their cup.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord is just, and hath loved justice: his countenance hath beheld righteousness. Psalms Chapter 11 Salvum me fac. The prophet calls for God’s help against the wicked.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end: for the octave, a psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Save me, O Lord, for there is now no saint: truths are decayed from among the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have spoken vain things, every one to his neighbour: with deceitful lips, and with a double heart have they spoken.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the Lord destroy all deceitful lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who have said: We will magnify our tongue: our lips are our own: who is Lord over us?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: By reason of the misery of the needy, and the groans of the poor, now will I arise, saith the Lord. I will set him in safety: I will deal confidently in his regard.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The words of the Lord are pure words: as silver tried by the fire, purged from the earth, refined seven times.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou, O Lord, wilt preserve us: and keep us from this generation for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked walk round about: according to thy highness, thou hast multiplied the children of men. Psalms Chapter 12 Usquequo, Domine. A prayer in tribulation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David. How long, O Lord, wilt thou forget me unto the end? how long dost thou turn away thy face from me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long shall I take counsels in my soul, sorrow in my heart all the day?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How long shall my enemy be exalted over Me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Consider, and hear me, O Lord, my God. Enlighten my eyes, that I never sleep in death:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lest at any time my enemy say: I have prevailed against him. They that trouble me, will rejoice when I am moved:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I have trusted in thy mercy. My heart shall rejoice in thy salvation: I will sing to the Lord, who giveth me good things: yea, I will sing to the name of the Lord, the most high. Psalms Chapter 13 Dixit insipiens. The general corruption of man before our redemption by Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David. The fool hath said in his heart: There is no God. They are corrupt, and are become abominable in their ways: there is none that doth good, no not one.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there be any that understand and seek God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They are all gone aside, they are become unprofitable together: there is none that doth good: no not one. Their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they acted deceitfully: the poison of asps is under their lips. Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness; their feet are swift to shed blood. Destruction and unhappiness in their ways; and the way of peace they have not known: there is no fear of God before their eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shall not all they know that work iniquity, who devour my people as they eat bread?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have not called upon the Lord: there have they trembled for fear, where there was no fear.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord is in the just generation: you have confounded the counsel of the poor man; but the Lord is his hope.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who shall give out of Sion the salvation of Israel? when the Lord shall have turned away the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad. Psalms Chapter 14 Domine, quis habitabit. What kind of men shall dwell in the heavenly Sion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David. Lord, who shall dwell in thy tabernacle? or who shall rest in thy holy hill?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that walketh without blemish, and worketh justice:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that speaketh truth in his heart, who hath not used deceit in his tongue: Nor hath done evil to his neighbour: nor taken up a reproach against his neighbours.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In his sight the malignant is brought to nothing: but he glorifieth them that fear the Lord. He that sweareth to his neighbour, and deceiveth not;

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He that hath not put out his money to usury, nor taken bribes against the innocent: He that doth these things, shall not be moved for ever. Psalms Chapter 15 Conserva me, Domine. Christ’s future victory and triumph over the world and death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The inscription of a title to David himself. Preserve me, O Lord, for I have put my trust in thee. The inscription of a title.... That is, of a pillar or monument, staylographia: which is as much as to say, that this psalm is most worthy to be engraved on an everlasting monument.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have said to the Lord, thou art my God, for thou hast no need of my goods.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To the saints, who are in his land, he hath made wonderful all my desires in them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their infirmities were multiplied: afterwards they made haste. I will not gather together their meetings for bloodofferings: nor will I be mindful of their names by my lips.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup: it is thou that wilt restore my inheritance to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The lines are fallen unto me in goodly places: for my inheritance is goodly to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will bless the Lord, who hath given me understanding: moreover, my reins also have corrected me even till night.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I set the Lord always in my sight: for he is at my right hand, that I be not moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore my heart hath been glad, and my tongue hath rejoiced: moreover, my flesh also shall rest in hope.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; nor wilt thou give thy holy one to see corruption.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast made known to me the ways of life, thou shalt fill me with joy with thy countenance: at thy right hand are delights even to the end. Psalms Chapter 16 Exaudi, Domine, justitiam. A just man’s prayer in tribulation against the malice of his enemy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The prayer of David. Hear, O Lord, my justice: attend to my supplication. Give ear unto my prayer, which proceedeth not from deceitful lips.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my judgment come forth from thy countenance: let thy eyes behold the things that are equitable.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast proved my heart, and visited it by night, thou hast tried me by fire: and iniquity hath not been found in me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That my mouth may not speak the works of men: for the sake of the words of thy lips, I have kept hard ways.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Perfect thou my goings in thy paths: that my footsteps be not moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have cried to thee, for thou, O God, hast heard me: O incline thy ear unto me, and hear my words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shew forth thy wonderful mercies; thou who savest them that trust in thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From them that resist thy right hand keep me, as the apple of thy eye. Protect me under the shadow of thy wings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From the face of the wicked who have afflicted me. My enemies have surrounded my soul:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have shut up their fat: their mouth hath spoken proudly. Their fat.... That is, their bowels of compassion: for they have none for me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have cast me forth, and now they have surrounded me: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have taken me, as a lion prepared for the prey; and as a young lion dwelling in secret places.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O Lord, disappoint him and supplant him; deliver my soul from the wicked one; thy sword

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From the enemies of thy hand. O Lord, divide them from the few of the earth in their life: their belly is filled from thy hidden stores. They are full of children: and they have left to their little ones the rest of their substance. Divide them from the few, etc.... That is, cut them off from the earth, and the few trifling things thereof; which they are so proud of, or divide them from the few; that is, from thy elect, who are but few; that they may no longer have it in their power to oppress them. It is not meant by way of a curse or imprecation; but, as many other the like passages in the psalms, by way of a prediction, or prophecy of what should come upon them, in punishment of their wickedness. Ibid. Thy hidden stores.... Thy secret treasures, out of which thou furnishest those earthly goods, which, with a bountiful hand thou hast distributed both to the good and the bad.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But as for me, I will appear before thy sight in justice: I shall be satisfied when thy glory shall appear. Psalms Chapter 17 Diligam te, Domine. David’s thanks to God for his delivery from all his enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for David, the servant of the Lord, who spoke to the Lord the words of this canticle, in the day that the Lord delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul: and he said:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will love thee, O Lord, my strength:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is my firmament, my refuge, and my deliverer. My God is my helper, and in him will I put my trust. My protector, and the horn of my salvation, and my support.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praising, I will call upon the Lord: and I shall be saved from my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
