Text: The sorrows of death surrounded me: and the torrents of iniquity troubled me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sorrows of hell encompassed me: and the snares of death prevented me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In my affliction I called upon the Lord, and I cried to my God: And he heard my voice from his holy temple: and my cry before him came into his ears.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The earth shook and trembled: the foundations of the mountains were troubled and were moved, because he was angry with them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There went up a smoke in his wrath: and a fire flamed from his face: coals were kindled by it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He bowed the heavens, and came down, and darkness was under his feet.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he ascended upon the cherubim, and he flew; he flew upon the wings of the winds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he made darkness his covert, his pavilion round about him: dark waters in the clouds of the air.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: At the brightness that was before him the clouds passed, hail and coals of fire.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the Lord thundered from heaven, and the Highest gave his voice: hail and coals of fire.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he sent forth his arrows, and he scattered them: he multiplied lightnings, and troubled them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then the fountains of waters appeared, and the foundations of the world were discovered: At thy rebuke, O Lord, at the blast of the spirit of thy wrath.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent from on high, and took me: and received me out of many waters.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He delivered me from my strongest enemies, and from them that hated me: for they were too strong for me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They prevented me in the day of my affliction: and the Lord became my protector.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he brought me forth into a large place: he saved me, because he was well pleased with me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the Lord will reward me according to my justice; and will repay me according to the cleanness of my hands:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because I have kept the ways of the Lord; and have not done wickedly against my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For all his judgments are in my sight: and his justices I have not put away from me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I shall be spotless with him: and shall keep myself from my iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the Lord will reward me according to my justice: and according to the cleanness of my hands before his eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With the holy thou wilt be holy; and with the innocent man thou wilt be innocent:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And with the elect thou wilt be elect: and with the perverse thou wilt be perverted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou wilt save the humble people; but wilt bring down the eyes of the proud.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou lightest my lamp, O Lord: O my God, enlighten my darkness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For by thee I shall be delivered from temptation; and through my God I shall go over a wall.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As for my God, his way is undefiled: the words of the Lord are fire-tried: he is the protector of all that trust in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For who is God but the Lord? or who is God but our God?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God, who hath girt me with strength; and made my way blameless.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who hath made my feet like the feet of harts: and who setteth me upon high places.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who teacheth my hands to war: and thou hast made my arms like a brazen bow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thou hast given me the protection of thy salvation: and thy right hand hath held me up: And thy discipline hath corrected me unto the end: and thy discipline, the same shall teach me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me; and my feet are not weakened.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will pursue after my enemies, and overtake them: and I will not turn again till they are consumed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will break them, and they shall not be able to stand: they shall fall under my feet.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thou hast girded me with strength unto battle; and hast subdued under me them that rose up against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thou hast made my enemies turn their back upon me, and hast destroyed them that hated me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They cried, but there was none to save them, to the Lord: but he heard them not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I shall beat them as small as the dust before the wind; I shall bring them to nought, like the dirt in the streets.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou wilt deliver me from the contradictions of the people; thou wilt make me head of the Gentiles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A people which I knew not, hath served me: at the hearing of the ear they have obeyed me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The children that are strangers have lied to me, strange children have faded away, and have halted from their paths.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord liveth, and blessed be my God, and let the God of my salvation be exalted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God, who avengest me, and subduest the people under me, my deliverer from my enraged enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thou wilt lift me up above them that rise up against me: from the unjust man thou wilt deliver me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore will I give glory to thee, O Lord, among the nations, and I will sing a psalm to thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Giving great deliverance to his king, and shewing mercy to David, his anointed: and to his seed for ever. Psalms Chapter 18 Coeli enarrant. The works of God shew forth his glory: his law is greatly to be esteemed and loved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end. A Psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The heavens shew forth the glory of God, and the firmament declareth the work of his hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Day to day uttereth speech, and night to night sheweth knowledge.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There are no speeches nor languages, where their voices are not heard.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their sound hath gone forth into all the earth: and their words unto the ends of the world.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath set his tabernacle in the sun: and he as a bridegroom coming out of his bridechamber, Hath rejoiced as a giant to run the way:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His going out is from the end of heaven, And his circuit even to the end thereof: and there is no one that can hide himself from his heat.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The law of the Lord is unspotted, converting souls: the testimony of the Lord is faithful, giving wisdom to little ones.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The justices of the Lord are right, rejoicing hearts: the commandment of the Lord is lightsome, enlightening the eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The fear of the Lord is holy, enduring for ever and ever: the judgments of the Lord are true, justified in themselves.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: More to be desired than gold and many precious stones: and sweeter than honey and the honeycomb.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy servant keepeth them, and in keeping them there is a great reward.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who can understand sins? from my secret ones cleanse me, O Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And from those of others spare thy servant. If they shall have no dominion over me, then shall I be without spot: and I shall be cleansed from the greatest sin.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the words of my mouth shall be such as may please: and the meditation of my heart always in thy sight. O Lord, my helper and my Redeemer. Psalms Chapter 19 Exaudiat te Dominus. A prayer for the king.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end. A psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the Lord hear thee in the day of tribulation: may the name of the God of Jacob protect thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May he send thee help from the sanctuary: and defend thee out of Sion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May he be mindful of all thy sacrifices: and may thy whole burntoffering be made fat.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May he give thee according to thy own heart; and confirm all thy counsels.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: We will rejoice in thy salvation; and in the name of our God we shall be exalted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord fulfil all thy petitions: now have I known that the Lord hath saved his anointed. He will hear him from his holy heaven: the salvation of his right hand is in powers. The salvation of his right hand is in powers.... That is, in strength. His right hand is strong and mighty to save them that trust in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses: but we will call upon the name of the Lord, our God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They are bound, and have fallen: but we are risen, and are set upright. O Lord, save the king: and hear us in the day that we shall call upon thee. Psalms Chapter 20 Domine, in virtute. Praise to God for Christ’s exaltation after his passion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end. A psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In thy strength, O Lord, the king shall joy; and in thy salvation he shall rejoice exceedingly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire: and hast not withholden from him the will of his lips.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast prevented him with blessings of sweetness: thou hast set on his head a crown of precious stones.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He asked life of thee: and thou hast given him length of days for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His glory is great in thy salvation: glory and great beauty shalt thou lay upon him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou shalt give him to be a blessing for ever and ever: thou shalt make him joyful in gladness with thy countenance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the king hopeth in the Lord: and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let thy hand be found by all thy enemies: let thy right hand find out all them that hate thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt make them as an oven of fire, in the time of thy anger: the Lord shall trouble them in his wrath, and fire shall devour them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth: and their seed from among the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For they have intended evils against thee: they have devised counsels which they have not been able to establish.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou shalt make them turn their back: in thy remnants thou shalt prepare their face. In thy remnants thou shalt prepare their face.... Or thou shalt set thy remnants against their faces. That is, thou shalt make them see what punishments remain for them hereafter from thy justice. Instead of remnants, St. Jerome renders it funes, that is, cords or strings, viz., of the bow of divine justice, from which God directs his arrows against the faces of his enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be thou exalted, O Lord, in thy own strength: we will sing and praise thy power. Psalms Chapter 21 Deus Deus meus. Christ’s passion: and the conversion of the Gentiles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the morning protection, a psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God my God, look upon me: why hast thou forsaken me? Far from my salvation are the words of my sins. The words of my sins.... That is, the sins of the world, which I have taken upon myself, cry out against me, and are the cause of all my sufferings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O my God, I shall cry by day, and thou wilt not hear: and by night, and it shall not be reputed as folly in me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou dwellest in the holy place, the praise of Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In thee have our fathers hoped: they have hoped, and thou hast delivered them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They cried to thee, and they were saved: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I am a worm, and no man: the reproach of men, and the outcast of the people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All they that saw me have laughed me to scorn: they have spoken with the lips, and wagged the head.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hoped in the Lord, let him deliver him: let him save him, seeing he delighteth in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou art he that hast drawn me out of the womb: my hope from the breasts of my mother.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I was cast upon thee from the womb. From my mother’s womb thou art my God,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Depart not from me. For tribulation is very near: for there is none to help me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many calves have surrounded me: fat bulls have besieged me. 21:14.They have opened their mouths against me, as a lion ravening and roaring.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am poured out like water; and all my bones are scattered. My heart is become like wax melting in the midst of my bowels.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue hath cleaved to my jaws: and thou hast brought me down into the dust of death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For many dogs have encompassed me: the council of the malignant hath besieged me. They have dug my hands and feet.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have numbered all my bones. And they have looked and stared upon me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They parted my garments amongst them; and upon my vesture they cast lots.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou, O Lord, remove not thy help to a distance from me; look towards my defence.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver, O God, my soul from the sword: my only one from the hand of the dog.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Save me from the lion’s mouth; and my lowness from the horns of the unicorns.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will declare thy name to my brethren: in the midst of the church will I praise thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ye that fear the Lord, praise him: all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let all the seed of Israel fear him: because he hath not slighted nor despised the supplication of the poor man. Neither hath he turned away his face from me: and when I cried to him he heard me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With thee is my praise in a great church: I will pay my vows in the sight of them that fear him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The poor shall eat and shall be filled: and they shall praise the Lord that seek him: their hearts shall live for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All the ends of the earth shall remember, and shall be converted to the Lord: And all the kindreds of the Gentiles shall adore in his sight.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the kingdom is the Lord’s; and he shall have dominion over the nations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All the fat ones of the earth have eaten and have adored: all they that go down to the earth shall fall before him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And to him my soul shall live: and my seed shall serve him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There shall be declared to the Lord a generation to come: and the heavens shall shew forth his justice to a people that shall be born, which the Lord hath made. Psalms Chapter 22 Dominus regit me. God’s spiritual benefits to faithful souls.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David. The Lord ruleth me: and I shall want nothing. Ruleth me.... In Hebrew, Is my shepherd, viz., to feed, guide, and govern me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath set me in a place of pasture. He hath brought me up, on the water of refreshment:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath converted my soul. He hath led me on the paths of justice, for his own name’s sake.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For though I should walk in the midst of the shadow of death, I will fear no evils, for thou art with me. Thy rod and thy staff, they have comforted me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast prepared a table before me against them that afflict me. Thou hast anointed my head with oil; and my chalice which inebriateth me, how goodly is it!

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thy mercy will follow me all the days of my life. And that I may dwell in the house of the Lord unto length of days. Psalms Chapter 23 Domini est terra. Who are they that shall ascend to heaven: Christ’s triumphant ascension thither.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: On the first day of the week, a psalm for David. The earth is the Lord’s and the fulness thereof: the world, and all they that dwell therein.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he hath founded it upon the seas; and hath prepared it upon the rivers.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who shall ascend into the mountain of the Lord: or who shall stand in his holy place?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The innocent in hands, and clean of heart, who hath not taken his soul in vain, nor sworn deceitfully to his neighbour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall receive a blessing from the Lord, and mercy from God his Saviour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This is the generation of them that seek him, of them that seek the face of the God of Jacob.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lift up your gates, O ye princes, and be ye lifted up, O eternal gates: and the King of Glory shall enter in.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is this King of Glory? the Lord who is strong and mighty: the Lord mighty in battle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lift up your gates, O ye princes, and be ye lifted up, O eternal gates: and the King of Glory shall enter in.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is this King of Glory? the Lord of hosts, he is the King of Glory. Psalms Chapter 24 Ad te, Domine, levavi. A prayer for grace, mercy, and protection against our enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David. To thee, O Lord, have I lifted up my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In thee, O my God, I put my trust; let me not be ashamed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Neither let my enemies laugh at me: for none of them that wait on thee shall be confounded.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let all them be confounded that act unjust things without cause. Shew, O Lord, thy ways to me, and teach me thy paths.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Direct me in thy truth, and teach me; for thou art God my Saviour; and on thee have I waited all the day long.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember, O Lord, thy bowels of compassion; and thy mercies that are from the beginning of the world.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sins of my youth and my ignorances do not remember. According to thy mercy remember thou me: for thy goodness’ sake, O Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is sweet and righteous: therefore he will give a law to sinners in the way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He will guide the mild in judgment: he will teach the meek his ways.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All the ways of the Lord are mercy and truth, to them that seek after his covenant and his testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy name’s sake, O Lord, thou wilt pardon my sin: for it is great.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is the man that feareth the Lord? He hath appointed him a law in the way he hath chosen.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His soul shall dwell in good things: and his seed shall inherit the land.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is a firmament to them that fear him: and his covenant shall be made manifest to them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My eyes are ever towards the Lord: for he shall pluck my feet out of the snare.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Look thou upon me, and have mercy on me; for I am alone and poor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The troubles of my heart are multiplied: deliver me from my necessities.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: See my abjection and my labour; and forgive me all my sins.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Consider my enemies for they are multiplied, and have hated me with an unjust hatred.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Keep thou my soul, and deliver me: I shall not be ashamed, for I have hoped in thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The innocent and the upright have adhered to me: because I have waited on thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver Israel, O God, from all his tribulations. Psalms Chapter 25 Judica me, Domine. David’s prayer to God in his distress, to be delivered, that he may come to worship him in his tabernacle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David. Judge me, O Lord, for I have walked in my innocence: and I have put my trust in the Lord, and shall not be weakened.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Prove me, O Lord, and try me; burn my reins and my heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy mercy is before my eyes; and I am well pleased with thy truth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have not sat with the council of vanity: neither will I go in with the doers of unjust things.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have hated the assembly of the malignant; and with the wicked I will not sit.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will wash my hands among the innocent; and will compass thy altar, O Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That I may hear the voice of thy praise: and tell of all thy wondrous works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have loved, O Lord, the beauty of thy house; and the place where thy glory dwelleth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Take not away my soul, O God, with the wicked: nor my life with bloody men:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In whose hands are iniquities: their right hand is filled with gifts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But as for me, I have walked in my innocence: redeem me, and have mercy on me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My foot hath stood in the direct way: in the churches I will bless thee, O Lord. Psalms Chapter 26 Dominus illuminatio. David’s faith and hope in God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The psalm of David before he was anointed. The Lord is my light and my salvation, whom shall I fear? The Lord is the protector of my life: of whom shall I be afraid?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Whilst the wicked draw near against me, to eat my flesh. My enemies that trouble me, have themselves been weakened, and have fallen.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If armies in camp should stand together against me, my heart shall not fear. If a battle should rise up against me, in this will I be confident.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: One thing I have asked of the Lord, this will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life. That I may see the delight of the Lord, and may visit his temple.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he hath hidden me in his tabernacle; in the day of evils, he hath protected me in the secret place of his tabernacle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath exalted me upon a rock: and now he hath lifted up my head above my enemies. I have gone round, and have offered up in his tabernacle a sacrifice of jubilation: I will sing, and recite a psalm to the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear, O Lord, my voice, with which I have cried to thee: have mercy on me and hear me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My heart hath said to thee: My face hath sought thee: thy face, O Lord, will I still seek.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn not away thy face from me; decline not in thy wrath from thy servant. Be thou my helper, forsake me not; do not thou despise me, O God my Saviour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my father and my mother have left me: but the Lord hath taken me up.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Set me, O Lord, a law in thy way, and guide me in the right path, because of my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver me not over to the will of them that trouble me; for unjust witnesses have risen up against me; and iniquity hath lied to itself.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I believe to see the good things of the Lord in the land of the living.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Expect the Lord, do manfully, and let thy heart take courage, and wait thou for the Lord. Psalms Chapter 27 Ad te, Domine, clamabo. David’s prayer that his enemies may not prevail over him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David himself. Unto thee will I cry, O Lord: O my God, be not thou silent to me: lest if thou be silent to me, I become like them that go down into the pit.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear, O Lord, the voice of my supplication, when I pray to thee; when I lift up my hands to thy holy temple.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Draw me not away together with the wicked; and with the workers of iniquity destroy me not: Who speak peace with their neighbour, but evils are in their hearts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give them according to their works, and according to the wickedness of their inventions. According to the works of their hands give thou to them: render to them their reward.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because they have not understood the works of the Lord, and the operations of his hands: thou shalt destroy them, and shalt not build them up.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the Lord, for he hath heard the voice of my supplication.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is my helper and my protector: in him hath my heart confided, and I have been helped. And my flesh hath flourished again, and with my will I will give praise to him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is the strength of his people, and the protector of the salvation of his anointed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Save, O Lord, thy people, and bless thy inheritance: and rule them and exalt them for ever. Psalms Chapter 28 Afferte Domino. An invitation to glorify God, with a commemoration of his mighty works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David, at the finishing of the tabernacle. Bring to the Lord, O ye children of God: bring to the Lord the offspring of rams.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bring to the Lord glory and honour: bring to the Lord glory to his name: adore ye the Lord in his holy court.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The voice of the Lord is upon the waters; the God of majesty hath thundered, The Lord is upon many waters.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The voice of the Lord is in power; the voice of the Lord in magnificence.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedars: yea, the Lord shall break the cedars of Libanus.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And shall reduce them to pieces, as a calf of Libanus, and as the beloved son of unicorns. Shall reduce them to pieces, etc.... In Hebrew, shall make them to skip like a calf. The psalmist here describes the effects of thunder (which he calls the voice of the Lord) which sometimes breaks down the tallest and strongest trees; and makes their broken branches skip, etc. All this is to be understood mystically of the powerful voice of God’s word in his church; which has broken the pride of the great ones of this world, and brought many of them meekly and joyfully to submit their necks to the sweet yoke of Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The voice of the Lord divideth the flame of fire:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The voice of the Lord shaketh the desert: and the Lord shall shake the desert of Cades.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The voice of the Lord prepareth the stags: and he will discover the thick woods: and in his temple all shall speak his glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord maketh the flood to dwell: and the Lord shall sit king for ever. The Lord will give strength to his people: the Lord will bless his people with peace. Psalms Chapter 29 Exaltabo te, Domine. David praiseth God for his deliverance, and his merciful dealings with him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm of a canticle, at the dedication of David’s house.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will extol thee, O Lord, for thou hast upheld me: and hast not made my enemies to rejoice over me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord my God, I have cried to thee, and thou hast healed me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast brought forth, O Lord, my soul from hell: thou hast saved me from them that go down into the pit.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing to the Lord, O ye his saints: and give praise to the memory of his holiness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For wrath is in his indignation; and life in his good will. In the evening weeping shall have place, and in the morning gladness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And in my abundance I said: I shall never be moved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, in thy favour, thou gavest strength to my beauty. Thou turnedst away thy face from me, and I became troubled.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To thee, O Lord, will I cry: and I will make supplication to my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What profit is there in my blood, whilst I go down to corruption? Shall dust confess to thee, or declare thy truth?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath heard, and hath had mercy on me: the Lord became my helper.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast turned for me my mourning into joy: thou hast cut my sackcloth, and hast compassed me with gladness:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To the end that my glory may sing to thee, and I may not regret: O Lord my God, I will give praise to thee for ever. Psalms Chapter 30 In te, Domine, speravi. A prayer of a just man under affliction.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David, in an ecstasy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In thee, O Lord, have I hoped, let me never be confounded: deliver me in thy justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bow down thy ear to me: make haste to deliver me. Be thou unto me a God, a protector, and a house of refuge, to save me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou art my strength and my refuge; and for thy name’s sake thou wilt lead me, and nourish me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou wilt bring me out of this snare, which they have hidden for me: for thou art my protector.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Into thy hands I commend my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O Lord, the God of truth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast hated them that regard vanities, to no purpose. But I have hoped in the Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy. For thou hast regarded my humility, thou hast saved my soul out of distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thou hast not shut me up in the hands of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a spacious place.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have mercy on me, O Lord, for I am afflicted: my eye is troubled with wrath, my soul, and my belly:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my life is wasted with grief: and my years in sighs. My strength is weakened through poverty and my bones are disturbed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am become a reproach among all my enemies, and very much to my neighbours; and a fear to my acquaintance. They that saw me without fled from me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am forgotten as one dead from the heart. I am become as a vessel that is destroyed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I have heard the blame of many that dwell round about. While they assembled together against me, they consulted to take away my life.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I have put my trust in thee, O Lord: I said: Thou art my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My lots are in thy hands. Deliver me out of the hands of my enemies; and from them that persecute me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant; save me in thy mercy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let me not be confounded, O Lord, for I have called upon thee. Let the wicked be ashamed, and be brought down to hell.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let deceitful lips be made dumb. Which speak iniquity against the just, with pride and abuse.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O how great is the multitude of thy sweetness, O Lord, which thou hast hidden for them that fear thee! Which thou hast wrought for them that hope in thee, in the sight of the sons of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou shalt hide them in the secret of thy face, from the disturbance of men. Thou shalt protect them in thy tabernacle from the contradiction of tongues.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the Lord, for he hath shewn his wonderful mercy to me in a fortified city.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I said in the excess of my mind: I am cast away from before thy eyes. Therefore thou hast heard the voice of my prayer, when I cried to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O love the Lord, all ye his saints: for the Lord will require truth, and will repay them abundantly that act proudly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Do ye manfully, and let your heart be strengthened, all ye that hope in the Lord. Psalms Chapter 31 Beati quorum. The second penitential psalm.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To David himself, understanding. Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven, and whose sins are covered.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is the man to whom the Lord hath not imputed sin, and in whose spirit there is no guile.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because I was silent my bones grew old; whilst I cried out all the day long. Because I was silent, etc.... That is, whilst I kept silence, by concealing, or refusing to confess my sins, thy hand was heavy upon me, etc.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me: I am turned in my anguish, whilst the thorn is fastened. I am turned, etc.... That is, I turn and roll about in my bed to seek for ease in my pain whilst the thorn of thy justice pierces my flesh, and sticks fast in me. Or, I am turned: that is, I am converted to thee, my God, by being brought to a better understanding by thy chastisements. In the Hebrew it is, my moisture is turned into the droughts of the summer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have acknowledged my sin to thee, and my injustice I have not concealed. I said I will confess against my self my injustice to the Lord: and thou hast forgiven the wickedness of my sin.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For this shall every one that is holy pray to thee in a seasonable time. And yet in a flood of many waters, they shall not come nigh unto him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art my refuge from the trouble which hath encompassed me: my joy, deliver me from them that surround me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will give thee understanding, and I will instruct thee in this way, in which thou shalt go: I will fix my eyes upon thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Do not become like the horse and the mule, who have no understanding. With bit and bridle bind fast their jaws, who come not near unto thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many are the scourges of the sinner, but mercy shall encompass him that hopeth in the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, ye just, and glory, all ye right of heart. Psalms Chapter 32 Exultate, justi. An exhortation to praise God, and to trust in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David. Rejoice in the Lord, O ye just: praise becometh the upright.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give praise to the Lord on the harp; sing to him with the psaltery, the instrument of ten strings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing to him a new canticle, sing well unto him with a loud noise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the word of the Lord is right, and all his works are done with faithfulness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He loveth mercy and judgment; the earth is full of the mercy of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: By the word of the Lord the heavens were established; and all the power of them by the spirit of his mouth:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Gathering together the waters of the sea, as in a vessel; laying up the depths in storehouses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let all the earth fear the Lord, and let all the inhabitants of the world be in awe of him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he spoke and they were made: he commanded and they were created.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord bringeth to nought the counsels of nations; and he rejecteth the devices of people, and casteth away the counsels of princes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the counsel of the Lord standeth for ever: the thoughts of his heart to all generations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord: the people whom he hath chosen for his inheritance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath looked from heaven: he hath beheld all the sons of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From his habitation which he hath prepared, he hath looked upon all that dwell on the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He who hath made the hearts of every one of them: who understandeth all their works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The king is not saved by a great army: nor shall the giant be saved by his own great strength.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Vain is the horse for safety: neither shall he be saved by the abundance of his strength.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold the eyes of the Lord are on them that fear him: and on them that hope in his mercy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To deliver their souls from death; and feed them in famine.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our soul waiteth for the Lord: for he is our helper and protector.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For in him our heart shall rejoice: and in his holy name we have trusted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let thy mercy, O Lord, be upon us, as we have hoped in thee. Psalms Chapter 33 Benedicam Dominum. An exhortation to the praise, and service of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For David, when he changed his countenance before Achimelech, who dismissed him, and he went his way. [1 Kings 21.]

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will bless the Lord at all times, his praise shall be always in my mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the Lord shall my soul be praised: let the meek hear and rejoice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O magnify the Lord with me; and let us extol his name together.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I sought the Lord, and he heard me; and he delivered me from all my troubles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Come ye to him and be enlightened: and your faces shall not be confounded.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him: and saved him out of all his troubles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The angel of the Lord shall encamp round about them that fear him: and shall deliver them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O taste, and see that the Lord is sweet: blessed is the man that hopeth in him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Fear the Lord, all ye his saints: for there is no want to them that fear him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The rich have wanted, and have suffered hunger: but they that seek the Lord shall not be deprived of any good.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Come, children, hearken to me: I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is the man that desireth life: who loveth to see good days?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn away from evil and do good: seek after peace and pursue it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The eyes of the Lord are upon the just: and his ears unto their prayers.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the countenance of the Lord is against them that do evil things: to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The just cried, and the Lord heard them: and delivered them out of all their troubles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is nigh unto them that are of a contrite heart: and he will save the humble of spirit.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many are the afflictions of the just; but out of them all will the Lord deliver them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord keepeth all their bones, not one of them shall be broken.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The death of the wicked is very evil: and they that hate the just shall be guilty.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord will redeem the souls of his servants: and none of them that trust in him shall offend. Psalms Chapter 34 Judica, Domine, nocentes me. David, in the person of Christ, prayeth against his persecutors: prophetically foreshewing the punishments that shall fall upon them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For David himself. Judge thou, O Lord, them that wrong me: overthrow them that fight against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Take hold of arms and shield: and rise up to help me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bring out the sword, and shut up the way against them that persecute me: say to my soul: I am thy salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them be confounded and ashamed that seek after my soul. Let them be turned back and be confounded that devise evil against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them become as dust before the wind: and let the angel of the Lord straiten them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let their way become dark and slippery; and let the angel of the Lord pursue them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For without cause they have hidden their net for me unto destruction: without cause they have upbraided my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the snare which he knoweth not come upon him: and let the net which he hath hidden catch him: and into that very snare let them fall.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But my soul shall rejoice in the Lord; and shall be delighted in his salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All my bones shall say: Lord, who is like to thee? Who deliverest the poor from the hand of them that are stronger than he; the needy and the poor from them that strip him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unjust witnesses rising up have asked me things I knew not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They repaid me evil for good: to the depriving me of my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But as for me, when they were troublesome to me, I was clothed with haircloth. I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer shall be turned into my bosom.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As a neighbour and as an own brother, so did I please: as one mourning and sorrowful so was I humbled.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But they rejoiced against me, and came together: scourges were gathered together upon me, and I knew not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They were separated, and repented not: they tempted me, they scoffed at me with scorn: they gnashed upon me with their teeth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lord, when wilt thou look upon me? rescue thou my soul from their malice: my only one from the lions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will give thanks to thee in a great church; I will praise thee in a strong people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let not them that are my enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: who have hated me without cause, and wink with the eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For they spoke indeed peaceably to me; and speaking in the anger of the earth they devised guile.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they opened their mouth wide against me; they said: Well done, well done, our eyes have seen it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast seen, O Lord, be not thou silent: O Lord, depart not from me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, and be attentive to my judgment: to my cause, my God, and my Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Judge me, O Lord my God according to thy justice, and let them not rejoice over me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them not say in their hearts: It is well, it is well, to our mind: neither let them say: We have swallowed him up.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them blush: and be ashamed together, who rejoice at my evils. Let them be clothed with confusion and shame, who speak great things against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them rejoice and be glad, who are well pleased with my justice, and let them say always: The Lord be magnified, who delights in the peace of his servant.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And my tongue shall meditate thy justice, thy praise all the day long. Psalms Chapter 35 Dixit injustus. The malice of sinners, and the goodness of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the servant of God, David himself.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The unjust hath said within himself, that he would sin: there is no fear of God before his eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For in his sight he hath done deceitfully, that his iniquity may be found unto hatred. Unto hatred.... That is, hateful to God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The words of his mouth are iniquity and guile: he would not understand that he might do well.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath devised iniquity on his bed, he hath set himself on every way that is not good: but evil he hath not hated.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, thy mercy is in heaven, and thy truth reacheth even to the clouds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy justice is as the mountains of God, thy judgments are a great deep. Men and beasts thou wilt preserve, O Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O how hast thou multiplied thy mercy, O God! But the children of men shall put their trust under the covert of thy wings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They shall be inebriated with the plenty of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the torrent of thy pleasure.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For with thee is the fountain of life; and in thy light we shall see light.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Extend thy mercy to them that know thee, and thy justice to them that are right in heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let not the foot of pride come to me, and let not the hand of the sinner move me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There the workers of iniquity are fallen, they are cast out, and could not stand. Psalms Chapter 36 Noli aemulari. An exhortation to despise this world; and the short prosperity of the wicked; and to trust in Providence.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be not emulous of evildoers; nor envy them that work iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For they shall shortly wither away as grass, and as the green herbs shall quickly fall.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Trust in the Lord, and do good, and dwell in the land, and thou shalt be fed with its riches.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Delight in the Lord, and he will give thee the requests of thy heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Commit thy way to the Lord, and trust in him, and he will do it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he will bring forth thy justice as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be subject to the Lord and pray to him. Envy not the man who prospereth in his way; the man who doth unjust things.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Cease from anger, and leave rage; have no emulation to do evil.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For evildoers shall be cut off: but they that wait upon the Lord, they shall inherit the land.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be: and thou shalt seek his place, and shalt not find it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the meek shall inherit the land, and shall delight in abundance of peace.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sinner shall watch the just man: and shall gnash upon him with his teeth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the Lord shall laugh at him: for he foreseeth that his day shall come.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked have drawn out the sword: they have bent their bow. To cast down the poor and needy, to kill the upright of heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let their sword enter into their own hearts, and let their bow be broken.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Better is a little to the just, than the great riches of the wicked.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken in pieces; but the Lord strengtheneth the just.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord knoweth the days of the undefiled; and their inheritance shall be for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They shall not be confounded in the evil time; and in the days of famine they shall be filled:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because the wicked shall perish. And the enemies of the Lord, presently after they shall be honoured and exalted, shall come to nothing and vanish like smoke.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sinner shall borrow, and not pay again; but the just sheweth mercy and shall give.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For such as bless him shall inherit the land: but such as curse him shall perish.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With the Lord shall the steps of a man be directed, and he shall like well his way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When he shall fall he shall not be bruised, for the Lord putteth his hand under him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have been young and now am old; and I have not seen the just forsaken, nor his seed seeking bread.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sheweth mercy, and lendeth all the day long; and his seed shall be in blessing.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Decline from evil and do good, and dwell for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord loveth judgment, and will not forsake his saints: they shall be preserved for ever. The unjust shall be punished, and the seed of the wicked shall perish.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the just shall inherit the land, and shall dwell therein for evermore.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The mouth of the just shall meditate wisdom: and his tongue shall speak judgment.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The law of his God is in his heart, and his steps shall not be supplanted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked watcheth the just man, and seeketh to put him to death,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the Lord will not leave him in his hands; nor condemn him when he shall be judged.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Expect the Lord and keep his way: and he will exalt thee to inherit the land: when the sinners shall perish thou shalt see.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have seen the wicked highly exalted, and lifted up like the cedars of Libanus.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I passed by, and lo, he was not: and I sought him and his place was not found.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Keep innocence, and behold justice: for there are remnants for the peaceable man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the unjust shall be destroyed together: the remnants of the wicked shall perish.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But the salvation of the just is from the Lord, and he is their protector in the time of trouble.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the Lord will help them and deliver them: and he will rescue them from the wicked, and save them because they have hoped in him. Psalms Chapter 37 Domine, ne in furore. A prayer of a penitent for the remission of his sins. The third penitential psalm.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David, for a remembrance of the sabbath. For a remembrance.... Viz., of our miseries and sins: and to be sung on the sabbath day.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Rebuke me not, O Lord, in thy indignation; nor chastise me in thy wrath.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy arrows are fastened in me: and thy hand hath been strong upon me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There is no health in my flesh, because of thy wrath: there is no peace for my bones, because of my sins.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my iniquities are gone over my head: and as a heavy burden are become heavy upon me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My sores are putrified and corrupted, because of my foolishness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am become miserable, and am bowed down even to the end: I walked sorrowful all the day long.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For my loins are filled with illusions; and there is no health in my flesh.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am afflicted and humbled exceedingly: I roared with the groaning of my heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lord, all my desire is before thee, and my groaning is not hidden from thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My heart is troubled, my strength hath left me, and the light of my eyes itself is not with me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My friends and my neighbours have drawn near, and stood against me. And they that were near me stood afar off:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they that sought my soul used violence. And they that sought evils to me spoke vain things, and studied deceits all the day long.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I, as a deaf man, heard not: and as a dumb man not opening his mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I became as a man that heareth not: and that hath no reproofs in his mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For in thee, O Lord, have I hoped: thou wilt hear me, O Lord my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I said: Lest at any time my enemies rejoice over me: and whilst my feet are moved, they speak great things against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I am ready for scourges: and my sorrow is continually before me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I will declare my iniquity: and I will think for my sin.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But my enemies live, and are stronger than I: and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that render evil for good, have detracted me, because I followed goodness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For sake me not, O Lord my God: do not thou depart from me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Attend unto my help, O Lord, the God of my salvation. Psalms Chapter 38 Dixi custodiam. A just man’s peace and patience in his sufferings; considering the vanity of the world, and the providence of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for Idithun himself, a canticle of David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I said: I will take heed to my ways: that I sin not with my tongue. I have set a guard to my mouth, when the sinner stood against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I was dumb, and was humbled, and kept silence from good things: and my sorrow was renewed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My heart grew hot within me: and in my meditation a fire shall flame out.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I spoke with my tongue: O Lord, make me know my end. And what is the number of my days: that I may know what is wanting to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold thou hast made my days measurable, and my substance is as nothing before thee. And indeed all things are vanity: every man living.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Surely man passeth as an image: yea, and he is disquieted in vain. He storeth up: and he knoweth not for whom he shall gather these things.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And now what is my hope? is it not the Lord? and my substance is with thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver thou me from all my iniquities: thou hast made me a reproach to the fool.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I was dumb, and I opened not my mouth, because thou hast done it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remove thy scourges from me. The strength of thy hand hath made me faint in rebukes:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast corrected man for iniquity. And thou hast made his soul to waste away like a spider: surely in vain is any man disquieted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and my supplication: give ear to my tears. Be not silent: for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner as all my fathers were.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O forgive me, that I may be refreshed, before I go hence, and be no more. Psalms Chapter 39 Expectans expectavi. Christ’s coming, and redeeming mankind.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David himself.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With expectation I have waited for the Lord, and he was attentive to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he heard my prayers, and brought me out of the pit of misery and the mire of dregs. And he set my feet upon a rock, and directed my steps.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he put a new canticle into my mouth, a song to our God. Many shall see, and shall fear: and they shall hope in the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is the man whose trust is in the name of the Lord; and who hath not had regard to vanities, and lying follies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast multiplied thy wonderful works, O Lord my God: and in thy thoughts there is no one like to thee. I have declared and I have spoken they are multiplied above number.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sacrifice and oblation thou didst not desire; but thou hast pierced ears for me. Burnt offering and sin offering thou didst not require:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then said I, Behold I come. In the head of the book it is written of me

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That I should do thy will: O my God, I have desired it, and thy law in the midst of my heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have declared thy justice in a great church, lo, I will not restrain my lips: O Lord, thou knowest it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have not hid thy justice within my heart: I have declared thy truth and thy salvation. I have not concealed thy mercy and thy truth from a great council.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Withhold not thou, O Lord, thy tender mercies from me: thy mercy and thy truth have always upheld me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For evils without number have surrounded me; my iniquities have overtaken me, and I was not able to see. They are multiplied above the hairs of my head: and my heart hath forsaken me. My iniquities.... That is, the sins of all mankind, which I have taken upon me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me: look down, O Lord, to help me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them be confounded and ashamed together, that seek after my soul to take it away. Let them be turned backward and be ashamed that desire evils to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them immediately bear their confusion, that say to me: ’Tis well, ’tis well. ’Tis well.... The Hebrew here is an interjection of insult and derision, like the Vah. Matt. 27.49.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let all that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: and let such as love thy salvation say always: The Lord be magnified.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But I am a beggar and poor: the Lord is careful for me. Thou art my helper and my protector: O my God, be not slack. Psalms Chapter 40 Beatus qui intelligit. The happiness of him that shall believe in Christ; notwithstanding the humility and poverty in which he shall come: the malice of his enemies, especially of the traitor Judas.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David himself.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is he that understandeth concerning the needy and the poor: the Lord will deliver him in the evil day.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord preserve him and give him life, and make him blessed upon the earth: and deliver him not up to the will of his enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord help him on his bed of sorrow: thou hast turned all his couch in his sickness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I said: O Lord, be thou merciful to me: heal my soul, for I have sinned against thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My enemies have spoken evils against me: when shall he die and his name perish?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And if he came in to see me, he spoke vain things: his heart gathered together iniquity to itself. He went out and spoke to the same purpose.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All my enemies whispered together against me: they devised evils to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They determined against me an unjust word: shall he that sleepeth rise again no more?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For even the man of my peace, in whom I trusted, who ate my bread, hath greatly supplanted me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou, O Lord, have mercy on me, and raise me up again: and I will requite them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: By this I know, that thou hast had a good will for me: because my enemy shall not rejoice over me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou hast upheld me by reason of my innocence: and hast established me in thy sight for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the Lord the God of Israel from eternity to eternity. So be it. So be it. Psalms Chapter 41 Quemadmodum desiderat. The fervent desire of the just after God: hope in afflictions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, understanding for the sons of Core.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As the hart panteth after the fountains of water; so my soul panteth after thee, O God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul hath thirsted after the strong living God; when shall I come and appear before the face of God?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My tears have been my bread day and night, whilst it is said to me daily: Where is thy God?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: These things I remembered, and poured out my soul in me: for I shall go over into the place of the wonderful tabernacle, even to the house of God: With the voice of joy and praise; the noise of one feasting.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why art thou sad, O my soul? and why dost thou trouble me? Hope in God, for I will still give praise to him: the salvation of my countenance,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And my God. My soul is troubled within my self: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan and Hermoniim, from the little hill.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deep calleth on deep, at the noise of thy flood-gates. All thy heights and thy billows have passed over me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the daytime the Lord hath commanded his mercy; and a canticle to him in the night. With me is prayer to the God of my life.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will say to God: Thou art my support. Why hast thou forgotten me? and why go I mourning, whilst my enemy afflicteth me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Whilst my bones are broken, my enemies who trouble me have reproached me; Whilst they say to me day by day: Where is thy God?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why dost thou disquiet me? Hope thou in God, for I will still give praise to him: the salvation of my countenance, and my God. Psalms Chapter 42 Judica me, Deus. The prophet aspireth after the temple and altar of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David. Judge me, O God, and distinguish my cause from the nation that is not holy: deliver me from the unjust and deceitful man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou art God my strength: why hast thou cast me off? and why do I go sorrowful whilst the enemy afflicteth me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Send forth thy light and thy truth: they have conducted me, and brought me unto thy holy hill, and into thy tabernacles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I will go in to the altar of God: to God who giveth joy to my youth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To thee, O God my God, I will give praise upon the harp: why art thou sad, O my soul? and why dost thou disquiet me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hope in God, for I will still give praise to him: the salvation of my countenance, and my God. Psalms Chapter 43 Deus auribus nostris. The church commemorates former favours, and present afflictions; under which she prays for succour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the sons of Core, to give understanding.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: We have heard, O God, with our ears: our fathers have declared to us, The work thou hast wrought in their days, and in the days of old.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy hand destroyed the Gentiles, and thou plantedst them: thou didst afflict the people and cast them out.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For they got not the possession of the land by their own sword: neither did their own arm save them. But thy right hand and thy arm, and the light of thy countenance: because thou wast pleased with them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art thyself my king and my God, who commandest the saving of Jacob.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Through thee we will push down our enemies with the horn: and through thy name we will despise them that rise up against us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I will not trust in my bow: neither shall my sword save me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou hast saved us from them that afflict us: and hast put them to shame that hate us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In God shall we glory all the day long: and in thy name we will give praise for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But now thou hast cast us off, and put us to shame: and thou, O God, wilt not go out with our armies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast made us turn our back to our enemies: and they that hated us plundered for themselves.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast given us up like sheep to be eaten: thou hast scattered us among the nations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast sold thy people for no price: and there was no reckoning in the exchange of them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast made us a reproach to our neighbours, a scoff and derision to them that are round about us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast made us a byword among the Gentiles: a shaking of the head among the people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All the day long my shame is before me: and the confusion of my face hath covered me,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: At the voice of him that reproacheth and detracteth me: at the face of the enemy and persecutor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All these things have come upon us, yet we have not forgotten thee: and we have not done wickedly in thy covenant.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And our heart hath not turned back: neither hast thou turned aside our steps from thy way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast humbled us in the place of affliction: and the shadow of death hath covered us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If we have forgotten the name of our God, and if we have spread forth our hands to a strange god:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Shall not God search out these things: for he knoweth the secrets of the heart. Because for thy sake we are killed all the day long: we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, and cast us not off to the end.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why turnest thou thy face away? and forgettest our want and our trouble?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For our soul is humbled down to the dust: our belly cleaveth to the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O Lord, help us and redeem us for thy name’s sake. Psalms Chapter 44 Eructavit cor meum. The excellence of Christ’s kingdom, and the endowments of his church.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for them that shall be changed, for the sons of Core, for understanding. A canticle for the Beloved. For them that shall be changed.... i.e., for souls happily changed, by being converted to God.—Ibid. The Beloved.... Viz., Our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My heart hath uttered a good word: I speak my works to the king: My tongue is the pen of a scrivener that writeth swiftly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art beautiful above the sons of men: grace is poured abroad in thy lips; therefore hath God blessed thee for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O thou most mighty.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With thy comeliness and thy beauty set out, proceed prosperously, and reign. Because of truth and meekness and justice: and thy right hand shall conduct thee wonderfully.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy arrows are sharp: under thee shall people fall, into the hearts of the king’s enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy throne, O God, is forever and ever: the sceptre of thy kingdom is a sceptre of uprightness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast loved justice, and hated iniquity: therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Myrrh and stacte and cassia perfume thy garments, from the ivory houses: out of which

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The daughters of kings have delighted thee in thy glory. The queen stood on thy right hand, in gilded clothing; surrounded with variety.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hearken, O daughter, and see, and incline thy ear: and forget thy people and thy father’s house.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the king shall greatly desire thy beauty; for he is the Lord thy God, and him they shall adore.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And the daughters of Tyre with gifts, yea, all the rich among the people, shall entreat thy countenance.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All the glory of the king’s daughter is within in golden borders,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Clothed round about with varieties. After her shall virgins be brought to the king: her neighbours shall be brought to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They shall be brought with gladness and rejoicing: they shall be brought into the temple of the king.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Instead of thy fathers, sons are born to thee: thou shalt make them princes over all the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They shall remember thy name throughout all generations. Therefore shall people praise thee for ever; yea, for ever and ever. Psalms Chapter 45 Deus noster refugium. The church in persecution trusteth in the protection of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the sons of Core, for the hidden.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our God is our refuge and strength: a helper in troubles, which have found us exceedingly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore we will not fear, when the earth shall be troubled; and the mountains shall be removed into the heart of the sea.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their waters roared and were troubled: the mountains were troubled with his strength.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The stream of the river maketh the city of God joyful: the most High hath sanctified his own tabernacle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God is in the midst thereof, it shall not be moved: God will help it in the morning early.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Nations were troubled, and kingdoms were bowed down: he uttered his voice, the earth trembled.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord of armies is with us: the God of Jacob is our protector.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Come and behold ye the works of the Lord: what wonders he hath done upon earth,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Making wars to cease even to the end of the earth. He shall destroy the bow, and break the weapons: and the shield he shall burn in the fire.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be still and see that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, and I will be exalted in the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord of armies is with us: the God of Jacob is our protector. Psalms Chapter 46 Omnes gentes, plaudite. The Gentiles are invited to praise God for the establishment of the kingdom of Christ.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, for the sons of Core.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O clap your hands, all ye nations: shout unto God with the voice of joy,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord is high, terrible: a great king over all the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath subdued the people under us; and the nations under our feet.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath chosen for us his inheritance, the beauty of Jacob which he hath loved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God is ascended with jubilee, and the Lord with the sound of trumpet.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing praises to our God, sing ye: sing praises to our king, sing ye.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For God is the king of all the earth: sing ye wisely.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God shall reign over the nations: God sitteth on his holy throne.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The princes of the people are gathered together, with the God of Abraham: for the strong gods of the earth are exceedingly exalted. Psalms Chapter 47 Magnus Dominus. God is greatly to be praised for the establishment of his church.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm of a canticle, for the sons of Core, on the second day of the week.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Great is the Lord, and exceedingly to be praised in the city of our God, in his holy mountain.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With the joy of the whole earth is mount Sion founded, on the sides of the north, the city of the great king.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In her houses shall God be known, when he shall protect her.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For behold the kings of the earth assembled themselves: they gathered together.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So they saw, and they wondered, they were troubled, they were moved:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Trembling took hold of them. There were pains as of a woman in labour.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With a vehement wind thou shalt break in pieces the ships of Tharsis.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As we have heard, so have we seen, in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God: God hath founded it for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: We have received thy mercy, O God, in the midst of thy temple.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: According to thy name, O God, so also is thy praise unto the ends of the earth: thy right hand is full of justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let mount Sion rejoice, and the daughters of Juda be glad; because of thy judgments, O Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Surround Sion, and encompass her: tell lye in her towers.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Set your hearts on her strength; and distribute her houses, that ye may relate it in another generation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For this is God, our God unto eternity, and for ever and ever: he shall rule us for evermore. Psalms Chapter 48 Audite haec, omnes gentes. The folly of worldlings, who live on in sin, without thinking of death or hell.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for the sons of Core.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear these things, all ye nations: give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All you that are earthborn, and you sons of men: both rich and poor together.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My mouth shall speak wisdom: and the meditation of my heart understanding.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will incline my ear to a parable; I will open my proposition on the psaltery.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Why shall I fear in the evil day? the iniquity of my heel shall encompass me. The iniquity of my heel.... That is, the iniquity of my steps or ways: or the iniquity of my pride, with which as with the heel, I have spurned and kicked at my neighbours: or the iniquity of my heel, that is, the iniquity in which I shall be found in death. The meaning of this verse is, Why should I now indulge those passions and sinful affections, or commit now those sins, which will cause me so much fear and anguish in the evil day; when the sorrows of death shall compass me, and the perils of hell shall find me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that trust in their own strength, and glory in the multitude of their riches, They that trust, etc.... As much as to say, let them fear that trust in their strength or riches: for they have great reason to fear: seeing no brother or other man, how much a friend soever, can by any price or labour rescue them from death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: No brother can redeem, nor shall man redeem: he shall not give to God his ransom,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Nor the price of the redemption of his soul: and shall labour for ever, And shall labour for ever, etc.... This seems to be a continuation of the foregoing sentence: as much as to say no man can by any price or ransom prolong his life, that so he may still continue to labour here, and live to the end of the world. Others understand it of the eternal sorrows, and dying life of hell, which is the dreadful consequence of dying in sin.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And shall still live unto the end.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall not see destruction, when he shall see the wise dying: the senseless and the fool shall perish together: And they shall leave their riches to strangers: He shall not see destruction, etc.... Or, shall he not see destruction? As much as to say, however thoughtless he may be of his death, he must not expect to escape; when even the wise and the good are not exempt from dying.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And their sepulchres shall be their houses for ever. Their dwelling places to all generations: they have called their lands by their names. They have called, etc.... That is, they have left their names on their graves, which alone remain of their lands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And man when he was in honour did not understand; he is compared to senseless beasts, and is become like to them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This way of theirs is a stumblingblock to them: and afterwards they shall delight in their mouth. They shall delight in their mouth.... Notwithstanding the wretched way in which they walk, they shall applaud themselves with their mouths, and glory in their doings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They are laid in hell like sheep: death shall feed upon them. And the just shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their help shall decay in hell from their glory. In the morning.... That is, in the resurrection to a new life; when the just shall judge and condemn the wicked. Ibid. From their glory.... That is, when their short-lived glory in this world shall be past, and be no more.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But God will redeem my soul from the hand of hell, when he shall receive me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be not thou afraid, when a man shall be made rich, and when the glory of his house shall be increased.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For when he shall die he shall take nothing away; nor shall his glory descend with him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For in his lifetime his soul will be blessed: and he will praise thee when thou shalt do well to him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
