Text: Blessed be the Lord the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say: So be it, so be it. Psalms Chapter 106 Confitemini Domino. All are invited to give thanks to God for his perpetual providence over men. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give glory to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them say so that have been redeemed by the Lord, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy: and gathered out of the countries.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From the rising and from the setting of the sun, from the north and from the sea.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They wandered in a wilderness, in a place without water: they found not the way of a city for their habitation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They were hungry and thirsty: their soul fainted in them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they cried to the Lord in their tribulation: and he delivered them out of their distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he led them into the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: and his wonderful works to the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he hath satisfied the empty soul, and hath filled the hungry soul with good things.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death: bound in want and in iron.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because they had exasperated the words of God: and provoked the counsel of the most High:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And their heart was humbled with labours: they were weakened, and there was none to help them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he delivered them out of their distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he brought them out of darkness, and the shadow of death; and broke their bonds in sunder.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him, and his wonderful works to the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he hath broken gates of brass, and burst iron bars.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He took them out of the way of their iniquity: for they were brought low for their injustices.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their soul abhorred all manner of meat: and they drew nigh even to the gates of death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he delivered them out of their distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent his word, and healed them: and delivered them from their destructions.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: and his wonderful works to the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let them sacrifice the sacrifice of praise: and declare his works with joy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that go down to the sea in ships, doing business in the great waters:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: These have seen the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He said the word, and there arose a storm of wind: and the waves thereof were lifted up.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They mount up to the heavens, and they go down to the depths: their soul pined away with evils.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They were troubled, and reeled like a drunken man; and all their wisdom was swallowed up.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they cried to the Lord in their affliction: and he brought them out of their distresses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he turned the storm into a breeze: and its waves were still.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they rejoiced because they were still: and he brought them to the haven which they wished for.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him, and his wonderful works to the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let them exalt him in the church of the people: and praise him in the chair of the ancients.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath turned rivers into a wilderness: and the sources of waters into dry ground:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath turned a wilderness into pools of waters, and a dry land into water springs.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And hath placed there the hungry; and they made a city for their habitation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they sowed fields, and planted vineyards: and they yielded fruit of birth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he blessed them, and they were multiplied exceedingly: and their cattle he suffered not to decrease.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then they were brought to be few: and they were afflicted through the trouble of evils and sorrow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Contempt was poured forth upon their princes: and he caused them to wander where there was no passing, and out of the way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he helped the poor out of poverty: and made him families like a flock of sheep.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The just shall see, and shall rejoice, and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is wise, and will keep these things; and will understand the mercies of the Lord? Psalms Chapter 107 Paratum cor meum. The prophet praiseth God for benefits received.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A canticle of a psalm for David himself.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My heart is ready, O God, my heart is ready: I will sing, and will give praise, with my glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, my glory; arise, psaltery and harp: I will arise in the morning early.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: and I will sing unto thee among the nations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth even unto the clouds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens, and thy glory over all the earth:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That thy beloved may be delivered. Save with thy right hand and hear me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: God hath spoken in his holiness. I will rejoice, and I will divide Sichem and I will mete out the vale of tabernacles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Galaad is mine: and Manasses is mine and Ephraim the protection of my head. Juda is my king:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Moab the pot of my hope. Over Edom I will stretch out my shoe: the aliens are become my friends.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our armies?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O grant us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Through God we shall do mightily: and he will bring our enemies to nothing. Psalms Chapter 108 Deus, laudem meam. David in the person of Christ, prayeth against his persecutors; more especially the traitor Judas: foretelling and approving his just punishment for his obstinacy in sin and final impenitence.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm for David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O God, be not thou silent in my praise: for the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful man is opened against me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have spoken against me with deceitful tongues; and they have compassed me about with words of hatred; and have fought against me without cause.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Instead of making me a return of love, they detracted me: but I gave myself to prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they repaid me evil for good: and hatred for my love.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Set thou the sinner over him: and may the devil stand at his right hand. Set thou the sinner over him, etc.... Give to the devil, that arch-sinner, power over him: let him enter into him, and possess him. The imprecations, contained in the thirty verses of this psalm, are opposed to the thirty pieces of silver for which Judas betrayed our Lord; and are to be taken as prophetic denunciations of the evils that should befall the traitor and his accomplices the Jews; and not properly as curses.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When he is judged, may he go out condemned; and may his prayer be turned to sin.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May his days be few: and his bishopric let another take.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let his children be carried about vagabonds, and beg; and let them be cast out of their dwellings.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the usurer search all his substance: and let strangers plunder his labours.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May there be none to help him: nor none to pity his fatherless offspring.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May his posterity be cut off; in one generation may his name be blotted out.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the iniquity of his fathers be remembered in the sight of the Lord: and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May they be before the Lord continually, and let the memory of them perish from the earth:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: because he remembered not to shew mercy,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But persecuted the poor man and the beggar; and the broken in heart, to put him to death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he loved cursing, and it shall come unto him: and he would not have blessing, and it shall be far from him. And he put on cursing, like a garment: and it went in like water into his entrails, and like oil in his bones.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May it be unto him like a garment which covereth him; and like a girdle with which he is girded continually.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This is the work of them who detract me before the Lord; and who speak evils against my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But thou, O Lord, do with me for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy is sweet. Do thou deliver me,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is troubled within me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am taken away like the shadow when it declineth: and I am shaken off as locusts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My knees are weakened through fasting: and my flesh is changed for oil. For oil.... Propter oleum. The meaning is, my flesh is changed, being perfectly emaciated and dried up, as having lost all its oil or fatness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I am become a reproach to them: they saw me and they shaked their heads.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Help me, O Lord my God; save me; according to thy mercy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let them know that this is thy hand: and that thou, O Lord, hast done it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They will curse and thou wilt bless: let them that rise up against me be confounded: but thy servant shall rejoice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them that detract me be clothed with shame: and let them be covered with their confusion as with a double cloak.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will give great thanks to the Lord with my mouth: and in the midst of many I will praise him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he hath stood at the right hand of the poor, to save my soul from persecutors. Psalms Chapter 109 Dixit Dominus. Christ’s exaltation and everlasting priesthood.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm for David. The Lord said to my Lord: Sit thou at my right hand: Until I make thy enemies thy footstool.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord will send forth the sceptre of thy power out of Sion: rule thou in the midst of thy enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With thee is the principality in the day of thy strength: in the brightness of the saints: from the womb before the day star I begot thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath sworn, and he will not repent: Thou art a priest for ever according to the order of Melchisedech.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord at thy right hand hath broken kings in the day of his wrath.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall judge among nations, he shall fill ruins: he shall crush the heads in the land of many.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall drink of the torrent in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head. Psalms Chapter 110 Confitebor tibi, Domine. God is to be praised for his graces, and benefits to his church. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise thee, O Lord, with my whole heart; in the council of the just, and in the congregation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Great are the works of the Lord: sought out according to all his wills.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His work is praise and magnificence: and his justice continueth for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath made a remembrance of his wonderful works, being a merciful and gracious Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath given food to them that fear him. He will be mindful for ever of his covenant:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He will shew forth to his people the power of his works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That he may give them the inheritance of the Gentiles: the works of his hands are truth and judgment.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All his commandments are faithful: confirmed for ever and ever, made in truth and equity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath sent redemption to his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever. Holy and terrible is his name:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom. A good understanding to all that do it: his praise continueth for ever and ever. Psalms Chapter 111 Beatus vir. The good man is happy. Alleluia, of the returning of Aggeus and Zacharias. Of the returning, etc.... This is in the Greek and Latin, but not in the Hebrew. It signifies that this psalm was proper to be sung at the time of the return of the people from their captivity; to inculcate to them, how happy they might be, if they would be constant in the service of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is the man that feareth the Lord: he shall delight exceedingly in his commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the righteous shall be blessed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Glory and wealth shall be in his house: and his justice remaineth for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To the righteous a light is risen up in darkness: he is merciful, and compassionate and just.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Acceptable is the man that sheweth mercy and lendeth: he shall order his words with judgment:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he shall not be moved for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The just shall be in everlasting remembrance: he shall not fear the evil hearing. His heart is ready to hope in the Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His heart is strengthened, he shall not be moved until he look over his enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath distributed, he hath given to the poor: his justice remaineth for ever and ever: his horn shall be exalted in glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked shall see, and shall be angry, he shall gnash with his teeth and pine away: the desire of the wicked shall perish. Psalms Chapter 112 Laudate, pueri. God is to be praised for his regard to the poor and humble. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise the Lord, ye children: praise ye the name of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the name of the Lord, from henceforth now and for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same, the name of the Lord is worthy of praise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is high above all nations; and his glory above the heavens.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who is as the Lord our God, who dwelleth on high:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: and looketh down on the low things in heaven and in earth?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Raising up the needy from the earth, and lifting up the poor out of the dunghill:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: That he may place him with princes, with the princes of his people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who maketh a barren woman to dwell in a house, the joyful mother of children. Psalms Chapter 113 In exitu Israel. God hath shewn his power in delivering his people: idols are vain. The Hebrews divide this into two psalms. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a barbarous people:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Judea was made his sanctuary, Israel his dominion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sea saw and fled: Jordan was turned back.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The mountains skipped like rams, and the hills like the lambs of the flock.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What ailed thee, O thou sea, that thou didst flee: and thou, O Jordan, that thou wast turned back?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams, and ye hills, like lambs of the flock?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: At the presence of the Lord the earth was moved, at the presence of the God of Jacob:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who turned the rock into pools of water, and the stony hill into fountains of waters.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Not to us, O Lord, not to us; but to thy name give glory.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy mercy, and for thy truth’s sake: lest the Gentiles should say: Where is their God?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But our God is in heaven: he hath done all things whatsoever he would.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The idols of the Gentiles are silver and gold, the works of the hands of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have mouths and speak not: they have eyes and see not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have ears and hear not: they have noses and smell not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have hands and feel not: they have feet and walk not: neither shall they cry out through their throat.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them that make them become like unto them: and all such as trust in them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The house of Israel hath hoped in the Lord: he is their helper and their protector.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The house of Aaron hath hoped in the Lord: he is their helper and their protector.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that fear the Lord have hoped in the Lord: he is their helper and their protector.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath been mindful of us, and hath blessed us. He hath blessed the house of Israel: he hath blessed the house of Aaron.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath blessed all that fear the Lord, both little and great.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the Lord add blessings upon you: upon you, and upon your children.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be you of the Lord, who made heaven and earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The heaven of heaven is the Lord’s: but the earth he has given to the children of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The dead shall not praise thee, O Lord: nor any of them that go down to hell.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But we that live bless the Lord: from this time now and for ever. Psalms Chapter 114 Dilexi. The prayer of a just man in affliction, with a lively confidence in God. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have loved, because the Lord will hear the voice of my prayer.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he hath inclined his ear unto me: and in my days I will call upon him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sorrows of death have compassed me: and the perils of hell have found me. I met with trouble and sorrow:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I called upon the name of the Lord. O Lord, deliver my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is merciful and just, and our God sheweth mercy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is the keeper of little ones: I was humbled, and he delivered me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn, O my soul, into thy rest: for the Lord hath been bountiful to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he hath delivered my soul from death: my eyes from tears, my feet from falling.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will please the Lord in the land of the living. Psalms Chapter 115 Credidi. This in the Hebrew is joined with the foregoing psalm, and continues to express the faith and gratitude of the psalmist. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have believed, therefore have I spoken; but I have been humbled exceedingly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I said in my excess: Every man is a liar.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What shall I render to the Lord, for all the things that he hath rendered to me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will take the chalice of salvation; and I will call upon the name of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will pay my vows to the Lord before all his people:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of his saints.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, for I am thy servant: I am thy servant, and the son of thy handmaid. Thou hast broken my bonds:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will sacrifice to thee the sacrifice of praise, and I will call upon the name of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will pay my vows to the Lord in the sight of all his people:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the courts of the house of the Lord, in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Psalms Chapter 116 Laudate Dominum. All nations are called upon to praise God for his mercy and truth. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Praise the Lord, all ye nations: praise him, all ye people.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For his mercy is confirmed upon us: and the truth of the Lord remaineth for ever. Psalms Chapter 117 Confitemini Domino. The psalmist praiseth God for his delivery from evils: putteth his whole trust in him; and foretelleth the coming of Christ. Alleluia.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give praise to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let Israel now say, that he is good: that his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them that fear the Lord now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In my trouble I called upon the Lord: and the Lord heard me, and enlarged me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is my helper: I will not fear what man can do unto me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is my helper: and I will look over my enemies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is good to confide in the Lord, rather than to have confidence in man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is good to trust in the Lord, rather than to trust in princes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All nations compassed me about; and, in the name of the Lord I have been revenged on them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Surrounding me they compassed me about: and in the name of the Lord I have been revenged on them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They surrounded me like bees, and they burned like fire among thorns: and in the name of the Lord I was revenged on them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Being pushed I was overturned that I might fall: but the Lord supported me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is my strength and my praise: and he is become my salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The voice of rejoicing and of salvation is in the tabernacles of the just.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The right hand of the Lord hath wrought strength: the right hand of the Lord hath exalted me: the right hand of the Lord hath wrought strength.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I shall not die, but live: and shall declare the works of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord chastising hath chastised me: but he hath not delivered me over to death.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Open ye to me the gates of justice: I will go in to them, and give praise to the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This is the gate of the Lord, the just shall enter into it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will give glory to thee because thou hast heard me: and art become my salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The stone which the builders rejected; the same is become the head of the corner.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This is the Lord’s doing, and it is wonderful in our eyes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This is the day which the Lord hath made: let us be glad and rejoice therein.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, save me: O Lord, give good success.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the Lord. We have blessed you out of the house of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is God, and he hath shone upon us. Appoint a solemn day, with shady boughs, even to the horn of the altar.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, and I will exalt thee. I will praise thee, because thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O praise ye the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever. Psalms Chapter 118 Beati immaculati. Of the excellence of virtue consisting in the love and observance of the commandments of God. Alleluia. ALEPH. Aleph.... The first eight verses of this psalm in the original begin with Aleph, which is the name of the first letter of the Hebrew alphabet. The second eight verses begin with Beth, the name of the second letter of the Hebrew alphabet; and so to the end of the whole alphabet, in all twenty-two letters, each letter having eight verses. This order is variously expounded by the holy fathers; which shews the difficulty of understanding the holy scriptures, and consequently with what humility, and submission to the Church they are to be read.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed are the undefiled in the way, who walk in the law of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed are they that search his testimonies: that seek him with their whole heart. His testimonies.... The commandments of God are called his testimonies, because they testify his holy will unto us. Note here, that in almost every verse of this psalm (which in number are 176) the word and law of God, and the love and observance of it, is perpetually inculcated, under a variety of denominations, all signifying the same thing.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For they that work iniquity, have not walked in his ways.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast commanded thy commandments to be kept most diligently.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O! that my ways may be directed to keep thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then shall I not be confounded, when I shall look into all thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned the judgments of thy justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will keep thy justifications: O! do not thou utterly forsake me. BETH.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: By what doth a young man correct his way? by observing thy words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With my whole heart have I sought after thee: let me not stray from thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy words have I hidden in my heart, that I may not sin against thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed art thou, O Lord: teach me thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With my lips I have pronounced all the judgments of thy mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have been delighted in the way of thy testimonies, as in all riches.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will meditate on thy commandments: and I will consider thy ways.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will think of thy justifications: I will not forget thy words. GIMEL.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give bountifully to thy servant, enliven me: and I shall keep thy words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Open thou my eyes: and I will consider the wondrous things of thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am a sojourner on the earth: hide not thy commandments from me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul hath coveted to long for thy justifications, at all times.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast rebuked the proud: they are cursed who decline from thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remove from me reproach and contempt: because I have sought after thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For princes sat, and spoke against me: but thy servant was employed in thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy testimonies are my meditation: and thy justifications my counsel. DALETH.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul hath cleaved to the pavement: quicken thou me according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have declared my ways, and thou hast heard me: teach me thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Make me to understand the way of thy justifications: and I shall be exercised in thy wondrous works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul hath slumbered through heaviness: strengthen thou me in thy words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remove from me the way of iniquity: and out of thy law have mercy on me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have chosen the way of truth: thy judgments I have not forgotten.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have stuck to thy testimonies, O Lord: put me not to shame.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have run the way of thy commandments, when thou didst enlarge my heart. HE.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Set before me for a law the way of thy justifications, O Lord: and I will always seek after it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give me understanding, and I will search thy law; and I will keep it with my whole heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lead me into the path of thy commandments; for this same I have desired.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Incline my heart into thy testimonies and not to covetousness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn away my eyes that they may not behold vanity: quicken me in thy way.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Establish thy word to thy servant, in thy fear.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn away my reproach, which I have apprehended: for thy judgments are delightful.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold I have longed after thy precepts: quicken me in thy justice. VAU.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let thy mercy also come upon me, O Lord: thy salvation according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So shall I answer them that reproach me in any thing; that I have trusted in thy words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And take not thou the word of truth utterly out of my mouth: for in thy words, I have hoped exceedingly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: So shall I always keep thy law, for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I walked at large: because I have sought after thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I spoke of thy testimonies before kings: and I was not ashamed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I meditated also on thy commandments, which I loved.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I lifted up my hands to thy commandments, which I loved: and I was exercised in thy justifications. ZAIN.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Be thou mindful of thy word to thy servant, in which thou hast given me hope.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This hath comforted me in my humiliation: because thy word hath enlivened me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The proud did iniquitously altogether: but I declined not from thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I remembered, O Lord, thy judgments of old: and I was comforted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A fainting hath taken hold of me, because of the wicked that forsake thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy justifications were the subject of my song, in the place of my pilgrimage.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the night I have remembered thy name, O Lord: and have kept thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This happened to me: because I sought after thy justifications. HETH.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, my portion, I have said, I would keep thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I entreated thy face with all my heart: have mercy on me according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have thought on my ways: and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am ready, and am not troubled: that I may keep thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The cords of the wicked have encompassed me: but I have not forgotten thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I rose at midnight to give praise to thee; for the judgments of thy justification.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am a partaker with all them that fear thee, and that keep thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The earth, O Lord, is full of thy mercy: teach me thy justifications. TETH.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast done well with thy servant, O Lord, according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Teach me goodness and discipline and knowledge; for I have believed thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Before I was humbled I offended; therefore have I kept thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art good; and in thy goodness teach me thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The iniquity of the proud hath been multiplied over me: but I will seek thy commandments with my whole heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their heart is curdled like milk: but I have meditated on thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is good for me that thou hast humbled me, that I may learn thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The law of thy mouth is good to me, above thousands of gold and silver. JOD.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy hands have made me and formed me: give me understanding, and I will learn thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that fear thee shall see me, and shall be glad: because I have greatly hoped in thy words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I know, O Lord, that thy judgments are equity: and in thy truth thou hast humbled me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O! let thy mercy be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let thy tender mercies come unto me, and I shall live: for thy law is my meditation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let the proud be ashamed, because they have done unjustly towards me: but I will be employed in thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them that fear thee turn to me: and they that know thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my heart be undefiled in thy justifications, that I may not be confounded. CAPH.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul hath fainted after thy salvation: and in thy word I have very much hoped.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My eyes have failed for thy word, saying: When wilt thou comfort me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I am become like a bottle in the frost: I have not forgotten thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How many are the days of thy servant: when wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked have told me fables: but not as thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: All thy statutes are truth: they have persecuted me unjustly, do thou help me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They had almost made an end of me upon earth: but I have not forsaken thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Quicken thou me according to thy mercy: and I shall keep the testimonies of thy mouth. LAMED.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For ever, O Lord, thy word standeth firm in heaven.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy truth unto all generations: thou hast founded the earth, and it continueth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: By thy ordinance the day goeth on: for all things serve thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unless thy law had been my meditation, I had then perhaps perished in my abjection.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy justifications I will never forget: for by them thou hast given me life.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am thine, save thou me: for I have sought thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I have understood thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have seen an end of all perfection: thy commandment is exceeding broad. MEM.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O how have I loved thy law, O Lord! it is my meditation all the day.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Through thy commandment, thou hast made me wiser than my enemies: for it is ever with me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have understood more than all my teachers: because thy testimonies are my meditation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have had understanding above ancients: because I have sought thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have restrained my feet from every evil way: that I may keep thy words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have not declined from thy judgments, because thou hast set me a law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How sweet are thy words to my palate! more than honey to my mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: By thy commandments I have had understanding: therefore have I hated every way of iniquity. NUN.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy word is a lamp to my feet, and a light to my paths.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have sworn and am determined to keep the judgments of thy justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have been humbled, O Lord, exceedingly: quicken thou me according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The free offerings of my mouth make acceptable, O Lord: and teach me thy judgments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul is continually in my hands: and I have not forgotten thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sinners have laid a snare for me: but I have not erred from thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have purchased thy testimonies for an inheritance for ever: because they are the joy of my heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have inclined my heart to do thy justifications for ever, for the reward. SAMECH.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have hated the unjust: and have loved thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art my helper and my protector: and in thy word I have greatly hoped.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Depart from me, ye malignant: and I will search the commandments of my God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Uphold me according to thy word, and I shall live: and let me not be confounded in my expectation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Help me, and I shall be saved: and I will meditate always on thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast despised all them that fall off from thy judgments; for their thought is unjust.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have accounted all the sinners of the earth prevaricators: therefore have I loved thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Pierce thou my flesh with thy fear: for I am afraid of thy judgments. AIN.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have done judgment and justice: give me not up to them that slander me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Uphold thy servant unto good: let not the proud calumniate me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My eyes have fainted after thy salvation: and for the word of thy justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deal with thy servant according to thy mercy: and teach me thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am thy servant: give me understanding that I may know thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is time, O Lord, to do: they have dissipated thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore have I loved thy commandments above gold and the topaz.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Therefore was I directed to all thy commandments: I have hated all wicked ways. PHE.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore my soul hath sought them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The declaration of thy words giveth light: and giveth understanding to little ones.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I opened my mouth, and panted: because I longed for thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Look thou upon me, and have mercy on me according to the judgment of them that love thy name.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Direct my steps according to thy word: and let no iniquity have dominion over me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Redeem me from the calumnies of men: that I may keep thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Make thy face to shine upon thy servant: and teach me thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My eyes have sent forth springs of water: because they have not kept thy law. SADE.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art just, O Lord: and thy judgment is right.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast commanded justice thy testimonies: and thy truth exceedingly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My zeal hath made me pine away: because my enemies forgot thy words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy word is exceedingly refined: and thy servant hath loved it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I am very young and despised; but I forget not thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy justice is justice for ever: and thy law is the truth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Trouble and anguish have found me: thy commandments are my meditation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy testimonies are justice for ever: give me understanding, and I shall live. COPH.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I cried with my whole heart, hear me, O Lord: I will seek thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I cried unto thee, save me: that I may keep thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I prevented the dawning of the day, and cried: because in thy words I very much hoped.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My eyes to thee have prevented the morning: that I might meditate on thy words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear thou my voice, O Lord, according to thy mercy: and quicken me according to thy judgment.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that persecute me have drawn nigh to iniquity; but they are gone far off from thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou art near, O Lord: and all thy ways are truth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have known from the beginning concerning thy testimonies: that thou hast founded them for ever. RES.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: See my humiliation and deliver me for I have not forgotten thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Judge my judgment and redeem me: quicken thou me for thy word’s sake.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Salvation is far from sinners; because they have not sought thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many, O Lord, are thy mercies: quicken me according to thy judgment.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Many are they that persecute me and afflict me; but I have not declined from thy testimonies.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I beheld the transgressors, and pined away; because they kept not thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold I have loved thy commandments, O Lord; quicken me thou in thy mercy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The beginning of thy words is truth: all the judgments of thy justice are for ever. SIN.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Princes have persecuted me without cause: and my heart hath been in awe of thy words.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will rejoice at thy words, as one that hath found great spoil.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have hated and abhorred iniquity; but I have loved thy law.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Seven times a day I have given praise to thee, for the judgments of thy justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Much peace have they that love thy law, and to them there is no stumbling block.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I looked for thy salvation, O Lord: and I loved thy commandments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul hath kept thy testimonies and hath loved them exceedingly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have kept thy commandments and thy testimonies: because all my ways are in thy sight. TAU.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my supplication, O Lord, come near in thy sight: give me understanding according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my request come in before thee; deliver thou me according to thy word.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My lips shall utter a hymn, when thou shalt teach me thy justifications.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My tongue shall pronounce thy word: because all thy commandments are justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let thy hand be with me to save me; for I have chosen thy precepts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have longed for thy salvation, O Lord; and thy law is my meditation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul shall live and shall praise thee: and thy judgments shall help me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost: seek thy servant, because I have not forgotten thy commandments. Psalms Chapter 119 Ad Dominum. A prayer in tribulation. A gradual canticle. A gradual canticle.... The following psalms, in number fifteen, are called gradual psalms, or canticles, from the word gradus, signifying steps, ascensions, or degrees: either because they were appointed to be sung on the fifteen steps, by which the people ascended to the temple: or, that in the singing of them the voice was to be raised by certain steps or ascensions: or, that they were to be sung by the people returning from their captivity and ascending to Jerusalem, which was seated amongst mountains. The holy fathers, in a mystical sense, understand these steps, or ascensions, of the degrees by which Christians spiritually ascend to virtue and perfection; and to the true temple of God in the heavenly Jerusalem.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In my trouble I cried to the Lord: and he heard me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, deliver my soul from wicked lips, and a deceitful tongue.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: What shall be given to thee, or what shall be added to thee, to a deceitful tongue?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sharp arrows of the mighty, with coals that lay waste.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Woe is me, that my sojourning is prolonged! I have dwelt with the inhabitants of Cedar:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My soul hath been long a sojourner.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With them that hated peace I was peaceable: when I spoke to them they fought against me without cause. Psalms Chapter 120 Levavi oculos. God is the keeper of his servants. A gradual canticle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have lifted up my eyes to the mountains, from whence help shall come to me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My help is from the Lord, who made heaven and earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May he not suffer thy foot to be moved: neither let him slumber that keepeth thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold he shall neither slumber nor sleep, that keepeth Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is thy keeper, the Lord is thy protection upon thy right hand.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sun shall not burn thee by day: nor the moon by night.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord keepeth thee from all evil: may the Lord keep thy soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the Lord keep thy coming in and thy going out; from henceforth now and for ever. Psalms Chapter 121 Laetatus sum in his. The desire and hope of the just for the coming of the kingdom of God, and the peace of his church. A gradual canticle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I rejoiced at the things that were said to me: We shall go into the house of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our feet were standing in thy courts, O Jerusalem.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Jerusalem, which is built as a city, which is compact together.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thither did the tribes go up, the tribes of the Lord: the testimony of Israel, to praise the name of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because their seats have sat in judgment, seats upon the house of David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Pray ye for the things that are for the peace of Jerusalem: and abundance for them that love thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let peace be in thy strength: and abundance in thy towers.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the sake of my brethren, and of my neighbours, I spoke peace of thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because of the house of the Lord our God, I have sought good things for thee. Psalms Chapter 122 Ad te levavi. A prayer in affliction, with confidence in God. A gradual canticle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To thee have I lifted up my eyes, who dwellest in heaven.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold as the eyes of servants are on the hands of their masters, As the eyes of the handmaid are on the hands of her mistress: so are our eyes unto the Lord our God, until he have mercy on us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have mercy on us, O Lord, have mercy on us: for we are greatly filled with contempt.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For our soul is greatly filled: we are a reproach to the rich, and contempt to the proud. Psalms Chapter 123 Nisi quia Domini. The church giveth glory to God for her deliverance, from the hands of her enemies. A gradual canticle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If it had not been that the Lord was with us, let Israel now say:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If it had not been that the Lord was with us, When men rose up against us,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Perhaps they had swallowed us up alive. When their fury was enkindled against us,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Perhaps the waters had swallowed us up.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our soul hath passed through a torrent: perhaps our soul had passed through a water insupportable.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the Lord, who hath not given us to be a prey to their teeth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our soul hath been delivered as a sparrow out of the snare of the fowlers. The snare is broken, and we are delivered.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Our help is in the name of the Lord, who made heaven and earth. Psalms Chapter 124 Qui confidunt. The just are always under God’s protection. A gradual canticle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that trust in the Lord shall be as mount Sion: he shall not be moved for ever that dwelleth

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In Jerusalem. Mountains are round about it: so the Lord is round about his people from henceforth now and for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord will not leave the rod of sinners upon the lot of the just: that the just may not stretch forth their hands to iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Do good, O Lord, to those that are good, and to the upright of heart.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But such as turn aside into bonds, the Lord shall lead out with the workers of iniquity: peace upon Israel. Psalms Chapter 125 In convertendo. The people of God rejoice at their delivery from captivity. A gradual canticle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When the Lord brought back the captivity of Sion, we became like men comforted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Then was our mouth filled with gladness; and our tongue with joy. Then shall they say among the Gentiles: The Lord hath done great things for them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath done great things for us: we are become joyful.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Turn again our captivity, O Lord, as a stream in the south.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Going they went and wept, casting their seeds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But coming they shall come with joyfulness, carrying their sheaves. Psalms Chapter 126 Nisi Dominus. Nothing can be done without God’s grace and blessing. A gradual canticle of Solomon.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unless the Lord build the house, they labour in vain that build it. Unless the Lord keep the city, he watcheth in vain that keepeth it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: It is vain for you to rise before light, rise ye after you have sitten, you that eat the bread of sorrow. When he shall give sleep to his beloved, It is vain for you to rise before light.... That is, your early rising, your labour and worldly solicitude, will be vain, that is, will avail you nothing, without the light, grace, and blessing of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold the inheritance of the Lord are children: the reward, the fruit of the womb.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As arrows in the hand of the mighty, so the children of them that have been shaken.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is the man that hath filled the desire with them; he shall not be confounded when he shall speak to his enemies in the gate. Psalms Chapter 127 Beati omnes. The fear of God is the way to happiness. A gradual canticle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed are all they that fear the Lord: that walk in his ways.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou shalt eat the labours of thy hands: blessed art thou, and it shall be well with thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy wife as a fruitful vine, on the sides of thy house. Thy children as olive plants, round about thy table.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold, thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the Lord bless thee out of Sion: and mayst thou see the good things of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And mayst thou see thy children’s children, peace upon Israel. Psalms Chapter 128 Saepe expugnaverunt. The church of God is invincible: her persecutors come to nothing. A gradual canticle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Often have they fought against me from my youth, let Israel now say.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Often have they fought against me from my youth: but they could not prevail over me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked have wrought upon my back: they have lengthened their iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord who is just will cut the necks of sinners:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them all be confounded and turned back that hate Sion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them be as grass upon the tops of houses: which withereth before it be plucked up:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who with the mower filleth not his hand: nor he that gathereth sheaves his bosom.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they that passed by have not said: The blessing of the Lord be upon you: we have blessed you in the name of the Lord. Psalms Chapter 129 De profundis. A prayer of a sinner, trusting in the mercies of God. The sixth penitential psalm. A gradual canticle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Out of the depths I have cried to thee, O Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lord, hear my voice. Let thy ears be attentive to the voice of my supplication.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If thou, O Lord, wilt mark iniquities: Lord, who shall stand it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For with thee there is merciful forgiveness: and by reason of thy law, I have waited for thee, O Lord. My soul hath relied on his word:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: my soul hath hoped in the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: From the morning watch even until night, let Israel hope in the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because with the Lord there is mercy: and with him plentiful redemption.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities. Psalms Chapter 130 Domine, none est. The prophet’s humility. A gradual canticle of David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lord, my heart is not exalted: nor are my eyes lofty. Neither have I walked in great matters, nor in wonderful things above me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I was not humbly minded, but exalted my soul: As a child that is weaned is towards his mother, so reward in my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let Israel hope in the Lord, from henceforth now and for ever. Psalms Chapter 131 Memento, Domine. A prayer for the fulfilling of the promise made to David. A gradual canticle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, remember David, and all his meekness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How he swore to the Lord, he vowed a vow to the God of Jacob:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I shall enter into the tabernacle of my house: if I shall go up into the bed wherein I lie:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I shall give sleep to my eyes, or slumber to my eyelids,

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Or rest to my temples: until I find out a place for the Lord, a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold we have heard of it in Ephrata: we have found it in the fields of the wood. We have heard of it in Ephrata.... When I was young, and lived in Bethlehem, otherwise called Ephrata, I heard of God’s tabernacle and ark, and had a devout desire of seeking it; and accordingly I found it at Cariathiarim, the city of the woods: where it was till it was removed to Jerusalem. See 1 Par. 13.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: We will go into his tabernacle: we will adore in the place where his feet stood.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Arise, O Lord, into thy resting place: thou and the ark, which thou hast sanctified.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let thy priests be clothed with justice: and let thy saints rejoice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thy servant David’s sake, turn not away the face of thy anointed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord hath sworn truth to David, and he will not make it void: of the fruit of thy womb I will set upon thy throne.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If thy children will keep my covenant, and these my testimonies which I shall teach them: Their children also for evermore shall sit upon thy throne.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord hath chosen Sion: he hath chosen it for his dwelling.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: This is my rest for ever and ever: here will I dwell, for I have chosen it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessing I will bless her widow: I will satisfy her poor with bread.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will clothe her priests with salvation, and her saints shall rejoice with exceeding great joy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: There will I bring forth a horn to David: I have prepared a lamp for my anointed.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His enemies I will clothe with confusion: but upon him shall my sanctification flourish. Psalms Chapter 132 Ecce quam bonum. The happiness of brotherly love and concord. A gradual canticle of David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Like the precious ointment on the head, that ran down upon the beard, the beard of Aaron, Which ran down to the skirt of his garment:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As the dew of Hermon, which descendeth upon mount Sion. For there the Lord hath commanded blessing, and life for evermore. Psalms Chapter 133 Ecce nunc benedicite. An exhortation to praise God continually. A gradual canticle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold now bless ye the Lord, all ye servants of the Lord: Who stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the nights lift up your hands to the holy places, and bless ye the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May the Lord out of Sion bless thee, he that made heaven and earth. Psalms Chapter 134 Laudate nomen. An exhortation to praise God: the vanity of idols.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Alleluia. Praise ye the name of the Lord: O you his servants, praise the Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: You that stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise ye the Lord, for the Lord is good: sing ye to his name, for it is sweet.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord hath chosen Jacob unto himself: Israel for his own possession.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For I have known that the Lord is great, and our God is above all gods.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Whatsoever the Lord pleased he hath done, in heaven, in earth, in the sea, and in all the deeps.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He bringeth up clouds from the end of the earth: he hath made lightnings for the rain. He bringeth forth winds out of his stores:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He slew the firstborn of Egypt from man even unto beast.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sent forth signs and wonders in the midst of thee, O Egypt: upon Pharao, and upon all his servants.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He smote many nations, and slew mighty kings:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sehon king of the Amorrhites, and Og king of Basan, and all the kingdoms of Chanaan.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And gave their land for an inheritance, for an inheritance to his people Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy name, O Lord, is for ever: thy memorial, O Lord, unto all generations.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord will judge his people, and will be entreated in favour of his servants.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The idols of the Gentiles are silver and gold, the works of men’s hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have a mouth, but they speak not: they have eyes, but they see not.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have ears, but they hear not: neither is there any breath in their mouths.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them that make them be like to them: and every one that trusteth in them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bless the Lord, O house of Israel: bless the Lord, O house of Aaron.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bless the Lord, O house of Levi: you that fear the Lord, bless the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the Lord out of Sion, who dwelleth in Jerusalem. Psalms Chapter 135 Confitemini Domino. God is to be praised for his wonderful works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Alleluia. Praise the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever. Praise the Lord.... By this invitation to praise the Lord, thrice repeated, we profess the Blessed Trinity, One God in three distinct Persons, the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise ye the God of gods: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise ye the Lord of lords: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who alone doth great wonders: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who made the heavens in understanding: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who established the earth above the waters: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who made the great lights: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The sun to rule the day: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The moon and the stars to rule the night: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who smote Egypt with their firstborn: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who brought out Israel from among them: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: With a mighty hand and with a stretched out arm: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who divided the Red Sea into parts: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And brought out Israel through the midst thereof: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And overthrew Pharao and his host in the Red Sea: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who led his people through the desert: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who smote great kings: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And slew strong kings: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sehon king of the Amorrhites: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And Og king of Basan: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he gave their land for an inheritance: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For an inheritance to his servant Israel: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For he was mindful of us in our affliction: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And he redeemed us from our enemies: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who giveth food to all flesh: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give glory to the God of heaven: for his mercy endureth for ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give glory to the Lord of lords: for his mercy endureth for ever. Psalms Chapter 136 Super flumina. The lamentation of the people of God in their captivity in Babylon. A psalm of David, for Jeremias. For Jeremias.... For the time of Jeremias, and the captivity of Babylon.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Upon the rivers of Babylon, there we sat and wept: when we remembered Sion:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: On the willows in the midst thereof we hung up our instruments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For there they that led us into captivity required of us the words of songs. And they that carried us away, said: Sing ye to us a hymn of the songs of Sion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: How shall we sing the song of the Lord in a strange land?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand be forgotten.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my tongue cleave to my jaws, if I do not remember thee: If I make not Jerusalem the beginning of my joy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Remember, O Lord, the children of Edom, in the day of Jerusalem: Who say: Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O daughter of Babylon, miserable: blessed shall he be who shall repay thee thy payment which thou hast paid us.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be he that shall take and dash thy little ones against the rock. Dash thy little ones, etc.... In the spiritual sense, we dash the little ones of Babylon against the rock, when we mortify our passions, and stifle the first motions of them, by a speedy recourse to the rock which is Christ. Psalms Chapter 137 Confitebor tibi. Thanksgiving to God for his benefits.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For David himself. I will praise thee, O Lord, with my whole heart: for thou hast heard the words of my mouth. I will sing praise to thee in the sight of the angels:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will worship towards thy holy temple, and I will give glory to thy name. For thy mercy, and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy holy name above all.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In what day soever I shall call upon thee, hear me: thou shalt multiply strength in my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: May all the kings of the earth give glory to thee: for they have heard all the words of thy mouth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And let them sing in the ways of the Lord: for great is the glory of the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord is high, and looketh on the low: and the high he knoweth afar off.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I shall walk in the midst of tribulation, thou wilt quicken me: and thou hast stretched forth thy hand against the wrath of my enemies: and thy right hand hath saved me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord will repay for me: thy mercy, O Lord, endureth for ever: O despise not the works of thy hands. Psalms Chapter 138 Domine, probasti. God’s special providence over his servants.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm of David. Lord, thou hast proved me, and known me:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast known my sitting down, and my rising up.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou hast understood my thoughts afar off: my path and my line thou hast searched out.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And thou hast foreseen all my ways: for there is no speech in my tongue. There is no speech, etc.... Viz., unknown to thee: or when there is no speech in my tongue; yet my whole interior and my most secret thoughts are known to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Behold, O Lord, thou hast known all things, the last and those of old: thou hast formed me, and hast laid thy hand upon me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy knowledge is become wonderful to me: it is high, and I cannot reach to it.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy face?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I ascend into heaven, thou art there: if I descend into hell, thou art present.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If I take my wings early in the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Even there also shall thy hand lead me: and thy right hand shall hold me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And I said: Perhaps darkness shall cover me: and night shall be my light in my pleasures.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But darkness shall not be dark to thee, and night shall be light all the day: the darkness thereof, and the light thereof are alike to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast protected me from my mother’s womb.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will praise thee, for thou art fearfully magnified: wonderful are thy works, and my soul knoweth right well.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My bone is not hidden from thee, which thou hast made in secret: and my substance in the lower parts of the earth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy eyes did see my imperfect being, and in thy book all shall be written: days shall be formed, and no one in them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But to me thy friends, O God, are made exceedingly honourable: their principality is exceedingly strengthened.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I will number them, and they shall be multiplied above the sand, I rose up and am still with thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: If thou wilt kill the wicked, O God: ye men of blood, depart from me:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because you say in thought: They shall receive thy cities in vain. Because you say in thought, etc.... Depart from me, you wicked, who plot against the servants of God, and think to cast them out of the cities of their habitation; as if they have received them in vain, and to no purpose.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Have I not hated them, O Lord, that hated thee: and pined away because of thy enemies?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have hated them with a perfect hatred: and they are become enemies to me. I have hated them.... Not with an hatred of malice, but a zeal for the observance of God’s commandments; which he saw were despised by the wicked, who are to be considered enemies to God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Prove me, O God, and know my heart: examine me, and know my paths.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And see if there be in me the way of iniquity: and lead me in the eternal way. Psalms Chapter 139 Eripe me, Domine. A prayer to be delivered from the wicked.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Unto the end, a psalm of David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver me, O Lord, from the evil man: rescue me from the unjust man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who have devised iniquities in their hearts: all the day long they designed battles.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent: the venom of asps is under their lips.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Keep me, O Lord, from the hand of the wicked: and from unjust men deliver me. Who have proposed to supplant my steps:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The proud have hidden a net for me. And they have stretched out cords for a snare: they have laid for me a stumblingblock by the wayside.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I said to the Lord: Thou art my God: hear, O Lord, the voice of my supplication.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: O Lord, Lord, the strength of my salvation: thou hast overshadowed my head in the day of battle.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Give me not up, O Lord, from my desire to the wicked: they have plotted against me; do not thou forsake me, lest they should triumph.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The head of them compassing me about: the labour of their lips shall overwhelm them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Burning coals shall fall upon them; thou wilt cast them down into the fire: in miseries they shall not be able to stand.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A man full of tongue shall not be established in the earth: evil shall catch the unjust man unto destruction.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I know that the Lord will do justice to the needy, and will revenge the poor.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But as for the just, they shall give glory to thy name: and the upright shall dwell with thy countenance. Psalms Chapter 140 Domine, clamavi. A prayer against sinful words, and deceitful flatterers. A psalm of David.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I have cried to thee, O Lord, hear me: hearken to my voice, when I cry to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let my prayer be directed as incense in thy sight; the lifting up of my hands, as evening sacrifice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Set a watch, O Lord, before my mouth: and a door round about my lips.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Incline not my heart to evil words; to make excuses in sins. With men that work iniquity: and I will not communicate with the choicest of them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The just man shall correct me in mercy, and shall reprove me: but let not the oil of the sinner fatten my head. For my prayer shall still be against the things with which they are well pleased: Let not the oil of the sinner, etc.... That is, the flattery, or deceitful praise.—Ibid. For my prayer, etc.... So far from coveting their praises, who are never well pleased but with things that are evil; I shall continually pray to be preserved from such things as they are delighted with.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their judges falling upon the rock have been swallowed up. They shall hear my words, for they have prevailed: Their judges, etc.... Their rulers, or chiefs, quickly vanish and perish, like ships dashed against the rocks, and swallowed up by the waves. Let them then hear my words, for they are powerful and will prevail; or, as it is in the Hebrew, for they are sweet.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: As when the thickness of the earth is broken up upon the ground: Our bones are scattered by the side of hell.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: But to thee, O Lord, Lord, are my eyes: in thee have I put my trust, take not away my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Keep me from the snare, which they have laid for me, and from the stumblingblocks of them that work iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The wicked shall fall in his net: I am alone until I pass. I am alone, etc.... Singularly protected by the Almighty, until I pass all their nets and snares. Psalms Chapter 141 Voce mea. A prayer of David in extremity of danger.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Of understanding for David, A prayer when he was in the cave. [1 Kings 24.]

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I cried to the Lord with my voice: with my voice I made supplication to the Lord.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In his sight I pour out my prayer, and before him I declare my trouble:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: When my spirit failed me, then thou knewest my paths. In this way wherein I walked, they have hidden a snare for me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I looked on my right hand, and beheld, and there was no one that would know me. Flight hath failed me: and there is no one that hath regard to my soul.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I cried to thee, O Lord: I said: Thou art my hope, my portion in the land of the living.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Attend to my supplication: for I am brought very low. Deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name: the just wait for me, until thou reward me. Psalms Chapter 142 Domine, exaudi. The psalmist in tribulation calleth upon God for his delivery. The seventh penitential psalm.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: A psalm of David, when his son Absalom pursued him. [2 Kings 17.] Hear, O Lord, my prayer: give ear to my supplication in thy truth: hear me in thy justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight no man living shall be justified.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul: he hath brought down my life to the earth. He hath made me to dwell in darkness as those that have been dead of old:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And my spirit is in anguish within me: my heart within me is troubled.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I remembered the days of old, I meditated on all thy works: I meditated upon the works of thy hands.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: I stretched forth my hands to thee: my soul is as earth without water unto thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Hear me speedily, O Lord: my spirit hath fainted away. Turn not away thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Cause me to hear thy mercy in the morning; for in thee have I hoped. Make the way known to me, wherein I should walk: for I have lifted up my soul to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver me from my enemies, O Lord, to thee have I fled:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Teach me to do thy will, for thou art my God. Thy good spirit shall lead me into the right land:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: for thy name’s sake, O Lord, thou wilt quicken me in thy justice. Thou wilt bring my soul out of trouble:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And in thy mercy thou wilt destroy my enemies. And thou wilt cut off all them that afflict my soul: for I am thy servant. Psalms Chapter 143 Benedictus Dominus. The prophet praiseth God, and prayeth to be delivered from his enemies. No worldly happiness is to be compared with that of serving God. A psalm of David against Goliath.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed be the Lord my God, who teacheth my hands to fight, and my fingers to war.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My mercy, and my refuge: my support, and my deliverer: My protector, and I have hoped in him: who subdueth my people under me.

Book: The Book of Psalms
