Text: Lord, what is man, that thou art made known to him? or the son of man, that thou makest account of him?

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Man is like to vanity: his days pass away like a shadow.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Lord, bow down thy heavens and descend: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Send forth lightning, and thou shalt scatter them: shoot out thy arrows, and thou shalt trouble them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Put forth thy hand from on high, take me out, and deliver me from many waters: from the hand of strange children:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Whose mouth hath spoken vanity: and their right hand is the right hand of iniquity.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To thee, O God, I will sing a new canticle: on the psaltery and an instrument of ten strings I will sing praises to thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who givest salvation to kings: who hast redeemed thy servant David from the malicious sword:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Deliver me, And rescue me out of the hand of strange children; whose mouth hath spoken vanity: and their right hand is the right hand of iniquity:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Whose sons are as new plants in their youth: Their daughters decked out, adorned round about after the similitude of a temple:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their storehouses full, flowing out of this into that. Their sheep fruitful in young, abounding in their goings forth:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Their oxen fat. There is no breach of wall, nor passage, nor crying out in their streets.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They have called the people happy, that hath these things: but happy is that people whose God is the Lord. Psalms Chapter 144 Exaltabo te, Deus. A psalm of praise, to the infinite majesty of God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise, for David himself. I will extol thee, O God my king: and I will bless thy name for ever; yea, for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Every day will I bless thee: and I will praise thy name for ever; yea, for ever and ever.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised: and of his greatness there is no end.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Generation and generation shall praise thy works: and they shall declare thy power.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They shall speak of the magnificence of the glory of thy holiness: and shall tell thy wondrous works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: And they shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and shall declare thy greatness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They shall publish the memory of the abundance of thy sweetness: and shall rejoice in thy justice.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is gracious and merciful: patient and plenteous in mercy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is sweet to all: and his tender mercies are over all his works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let all thy works, O lord, praise thee: and let thy saints bless thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom: and shall tell of thy power:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To make thy might known to the sons of men: and the glory of the magnificence of thy kingdom.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thy kingdom is a kingdom of all ages: and thy dominion endureth throughout all generations. The Lord is faithful in all his words: and holy in all his works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord lifteth up all that fall: and setteth up all that are cast down.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The eyes of all hope in thee, O Lord: and thou givest them meat in due season.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Thou openest thy hand, and fillest with blessing every living creature.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is just in all his ways: and holy in all his works.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him: to all that call upon him in truth.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He will do the will of them that fear him: and he will hear their prayer, and save them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord keepeth all them that love him; but all the wicked he will destroy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: My mouth shall speak the praise of the Lord: and let all flesh bless his holy name forever; yea, for ever and ever. Psalms Chapter 145 Lauda, anima. We are not to trust in men, but in God alone.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Alleluia, of Aggeus and Zacharias.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise the Lord, O my soul, in my life I will praise the Lord: I will sing to my God as long as I shall be. Put not your trust in princes:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: In the children of men, in whom there is no salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: His spirit shall go forth, and he shall return into his earth: in that day all their thoughts shall perish.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Blessed is he who hath the God of Jacob for his helper, whose hope is in the Lord his God:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all things that are in them.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who keepeth truth for ever: who executeth judgment for them that suffer wrong: who giveth food to the hungry. The Lord looseth them that are fettered:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord enlighteneth the blind. The Lord lifteth up them that are cast down: the Lord loveth the just.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord keepeth the strangers, he will support the fatherless and the widow: and the ways of sinners he will destroy.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord shall reign for ever: thy God, O Sion, unto generation and generation. Psalms Chapter 146 Laudate Dominum. An exhortation to praise God for his benefits.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Alleluia. Praise ye the Lord, because psalm is good: to our God be joyful and comely praise.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord buildeth up Jerusalem: he will gather together the dispersed of Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who healeth the broken of heart, and bindeth up their bruises.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who telleth the number of the stars: and calleth them all by their names.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Great is our Lord, and great is his power: and of his wisdom there is no number.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord lifteth up the meek, and bringeth the wicked down even to the ground.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Sing ye to the Lord with praise: sing to our God upon the harp.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who covereth the heaven with clouds, and prepareth rain for the earth. Who maketh grass to grow on the mountains, and herbs for the service of men.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who giveth to beasts their food: and to the young ravens that call upon him.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall not delight in the strength of the horse: nor take pleasure in the legs of a man.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The Lord taketh pleasure in them that fear him: and in them that hope in his mercy. Psalms Chapter 147 Lauda, Jerusalem. The church is called upon to praise God for his peculiar graces and favours to his people. In the Hebrew, this psalm is joined to the foregoing.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Alleluia. Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem: praise thy God, O Sion.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Because he hath strengthened the bolts of thy gates, he hath blessed thy children within thee.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who hath placed peace in thy borders: and filleth thee with the fat of corn.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who sendeth forth his speech to the earth: his word runneth swiftly.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who giveth snow like wool: scattereth mists like ashes.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He sendeth his crystal like morsels: who shall stand before the face of his cold? He sendeth his crystal.... That is, his ice. Some understand it of hail, which is, as it were, ice, divided into particles or morsels.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He shall send out his word, and shall melt them: his wind shall blow, and the waters shall run.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Who declareth his word to Jacob: his justices and his judgments to Israel.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath not done in like manner to every nation: and his judgments he hath not made manifest to them. Alleluia. Psalms Chapter 148 Laudate Dominum de caelis. All creatures are invited to praise their Creator.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Alleluia. Praise ye the Lord from the heavens: praise ye him in the high places.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise ye him, all his angels, praise ye him, all his hosts.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise ye him, O sun and moon: praise him, all ye stars and light.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise him, ye heavens of heavens: and let all the waters that are above the heavens

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise the name of the Lord. For he spoke, and they were made: he commanded, and they were created.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: He hath established them for ever, and for ages of ages: he hath made a decree, and it shall not pass away.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise the Lord from the earth, ye dragons, and all ye deeps:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Fire, hail, snow, ice, stormy winds, which fulfil his word:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Mountains and all hills, fruitful trees and all cedars:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Beasts and all cattle: serpents and feathered fowls:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Kings of the earth and all people: princes and all judges of the earth:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Young men and maidens: let the old with the younger, praise the name of the Lord:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For his name alone is exalted.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The praise of him is above heaven and earth: and he hath exalted the horn of his people. A hymn to all his saints to the children of Israel, a people approaching to him. Alleluia. Psalms Chapter 149 Cantate Domino. The church is particularly bound to praise God.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Alleluia. Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle: let his praise be in the church of the saints.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: and let the children of Sion be joyful in their king.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Let them praise his name in choir: let them sing to him with the timbrel and the psaltery.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: For the Lord is well pleased with his people: and he will exalt the meek unto salvation.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The saints shall rejoice in glory: they shall be joyful in their beds.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: The high praises of God shall be in their mouth: and two-edged swords in their hands:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To execute vengeance upon the nations, chastisements among the people:

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To bind their kings with fetters, and their nobles with manacles of iron.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: To execute upon them the judgment that is written: this glory is to all his saints. Alleluia. Psalms Chapter 150 Laudate Dominum in sanctis. An exhortation to praise God with all sorts of instruments.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Alleluia. Praise ye the Lord in his holy places: praise ye him in the firmament of his power.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise ye him for his mighty acts: praise ye him according to the multitude of his greatness.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise him with the sound of trumpet: praise him with psaltery and harp.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise him with timbrel and choir: praise him with strings and organs.

Book: The Book of Psalms
Text: Praise him on high sounding cymbals: praise him on cymbals of joy: let every spirit praise the Lord. Alleluia.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the strangers dispersed through Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia and Bithynia, elect,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: According to the foreknowledge of God the Father, unto the sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ. Grace unto you and peace be multiplied.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to his great mercy hath regenerated us unto a lively hope, by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Unto an inheritance, incorruptible, and undefiled and that cannot fade, reserved in heaven for you,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who, by the power of God, are kept by faith unto salvation, ready to be revealed in the last time.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherein you shall greatly rejoice, if now you must be for a little time made sorrowful in divers temptations:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: That the trial of your faith (much more precious than gold which is tried by the fire) may be found unto praise and glory and honour at the appearing of Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Whom having not seen, you love: in whom also now though you see him not, you believe and, believing, shall rejoice with joy unspeakable and glorified;

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Receiving the end of your faith, even the salvation of your souls.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Of which salvation the prophets have inquired and diligently searched, who prophesied of the grace to come in you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Searching what or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ in them did signify, when it foretold those sufferings that are in Christ and the glories that should follow.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: To whom it was revealed that, not to themselves but to you, they ministered those things which are now declared to you by them that have preached the gospel to you: the Holy Ghost being sent down from heaven, on whom the angels desire to look.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherefore, having the loins of your mind girt up, being sober, trust perfectly in the grace which is offered you in the revelation of Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As children of obedience, not fashioned according to the former desires of your ignorance,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But according to him that hath called you, who is holy, be you also in all manner of conversation holy:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Because it is written: You shall be holy, for I am holy.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And if you invoke as Father him who, without respect of persons, judgeth according to every one’s work: converse in fear during the time of your sojourning here.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Knowing that you were not redeemed with corruptible things, as gold or silver, from your vain conversation of the tradition of your fathers:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb unspotted and undefiled.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Foreknown indeed before the foundation of the world, but manifested in the last times for you:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who through him are faithful in God who raised him up from the dead and hath given him glory, that your faith and hope might be in God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Purifying your souls in the obedience of charity, with a brotherly love, from a sincere heart love one another earnestly:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Being born again, not of corruptible seed, but incorruptible, by the word of God who liveth and remaineth for ever.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For all flesh is as grass and all the glory thereof as the flower of grass. The grass is withered and the flower thereof is fallen away.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But the word of the Lord endureth for ever. And this is the word which by the gospel hath been preached unto you. 1 Peter Chapter 2 We are to lay aside all guile and go to Christ the living stone, and, as being now his people, walk worthily of him, with submission to superiors and patience under sufferings.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherefore laying away all malice and all guile and dissimulations and envies and all detractions,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As newborn babes, desire the rational milk without guile, that thereby you may grow unto salvation:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: If so be you have tasted that the Lord is sweet.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Unto whom coming, as to a living stone, rejected indeed by men but chosen and made honourable by God:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Be you also as living stones built up, a spiritual house, a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherefore it is said in the scripture: Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious. And he that shall believe in him shall not be confounded.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: To you therefore that believe, he is honour: but to them that believe not, the stone which the builders rejected, the same is made the head of the corner:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And a stone of stumbling and a rock of scandal, to them who stumble at the word, neither do believe, whereunto also they are set.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But you are a chosen generation, a kingly priesthood, a holy nation, a purchased people: that you may declare his virtues, who hath called you out of darkness into his marvelous light:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who in time past were not a people: but are now the people of God. Who had not obtained mercy: but now have obtained mercy.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, I beseech you, as strangers and pilgrims, to refrain yourselves from carnal desires which war against the soul,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Having your conversation good among the Gentiles: that whereas they speak against you as evildoers, they may, by the good works which they shall behold in you, glorify God in the day of visitation.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Be ye subject therefore to every human creature for God’s sake: whether it be to the king as excelling,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Or to governors as sent by him for the punishment of evildoers and for the praise of the good.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For so is the will of God, that by doing well you may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As free and not as making liberty a cloak for malice, but as the servants of God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Honour all men. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honour the king.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Servants, be subject to your masters with all fear, not only to the good and gentle but also to the froward.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For this is thankworthy: if, for conscience towards God, a man endure sorrows, suffering wrongfully.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For what glory is it, if, committing sin and being buffeted for it, you endure? But if doing well you suffer patiently: this is thankworthy before God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For unto this are you called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving you an example that you should follow his steps.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who, when he was reviled, did not revile: when he suffered, he threatened not, but delivered himself to him that judged him unjustly.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who his own self bore our sins in his body upon the tree: that we, being dead to sins, should live to justice: by whose stripes you were healed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For you were as sheep going astray: but you are now converted to the shepherd and bishop of your souls. 1 Peter Chapter 3 How wives are to behave to their husbands. What ornaments they are to seek. Exhortations to divers Virtues.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: In like manner also, let wives be subject to their husbands: that, if any believe not the word, they may be won without the word, by the conversation of the wives,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Considering your chaste conversation with fear.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Whose adorning, let it not be the outward plaiting of the hair, or the wearing of gold, or the putting on of apparel:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But the hidden man of the heart, in the incorruptibility of a quiet and a meek spirit which is rich in the sight of God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For after this manner heretofore, the holy women also who trusted in God adorned themselves, being in subjection to their own husbands:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As Sara obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose daughters you are, doing well and not fearing any disturbance.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Ye husbands, likewise dwelling with them according to knowledge, giving honour to the female as to the weaker vessel and as to the co-heirs of the grace of life: that your prayers be not hindered.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And in fine, be ye all of one mind, having compassion one of another, being lovers of the brotherhood, merciful, modest, humble:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Not rendering evil for evil, nor railing for railing, but contrariwise, blessing: for unto this are you called, that you may inherit a blessing.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For he that will love life and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil, and his lips that they speak no guile.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Let him decline from evil and do good: Let him seek after peace and pursue it:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Because the eyes of the Lord are upon the just, and his ears unto their prayers but the countenance of the Lord upon them that do evil things.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And who is he that can hurt you, if you be zealous of good?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But if also you suffer any thing for justice’ sake, blessed are ye. And be not afraid of their fear: and be not troubled.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But sanctify the Lord Christ in your hearts, being ready always to satisfy every one that asketh you a reason of that hope which is in you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But with modesty and fear, having a good conscience: that whereas they speak evil of you, they may be ashamed who falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For it is better doing well (if such be the will of God) to suffer than doing ill.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Because Christ also died once for our sins, the just for the unjust: that he might offer us to God, being put to death indeed in the flesh, but enlivened in the spirit,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: In which also coming he preached to those spirits that were in prison: Spirits that were in prison.... See here a proof of a third place, or middle state of souls: for these spirits in prison, to whom Christ went to preach, after his death, were not in heaven; nor yet in the hell of the damned: because heaven is no prison: and Christ did not go to preach to the damned.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Which had been some time incredulous, when they waited for the patience of God in the days of Noe, when the ark was a building: wherein a few, that is, eight souls, were saved by water.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Whereunto baptism, being of the like form, now saveth you also: not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but, the examination of a good conscience towards God by the resurrection of Jesus Christ. Whereunto baptism, etc.... Baptism is said to be of the like form with the water by which Noe was saved, because the one was a figure of the other. Not the putting away, etc.... As much as to say, that baptism has not its efficacy, in order to salvation, from its washing away any bodily filth or dirt; but from its purging the conscience from sin, when accompanied with suitable dispositions in the party, to answer the interrogations made at that time, with relation to faith, the renouncing of Satan with all his works; and the obedience to God’s commandments.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who is on the right hand of God, swallowing down death that we might be made heirs of life everlasting: being gone into heaven, the angels and powers and virtues being made subject to him. 1 Peter Chapter 4 Exhortations to cease from sin, to mutual charity, to do all for the glory of God, to be willing to suffer for Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Christ therefore having suffered in the flesh, be you also armed with the same thought: for he that hath suffered in the flesh hath ceased from sins:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: That now he may live the rest of his time in the flesh, not after the desires of men but according to the will of God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For the time past is sufficient to have fulfilled the will of the Gentiles, for them who have walked in riotousness, lusts, excess of wine, revellings, banquetings and unlawful worshipping of idols.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherein they think it strange that you run not with them into the same confusion of riotousness: speaking evil of you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Who shall render account to him who is ready to judge the living and the dead.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For, for this cause was the gospel preached also to the dead: That they might be judged indeed according to men, in the flesh: but may live according to God, in the Spirit.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But the end of all is at hand. Be prudent therefore and watch in prayers.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But before all things have a constant mutual charity among yourselves: for charity covereth a multitude of sins.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Using hospitality one towards another, without murmuring,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As every man hath received grace, ministering the same one to another: as good stewards of the manifold grace of God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: If any man speak, let him speak, as the words of God. If any minister, let him do it, as of the power which God administereth: that in all things God may be honoured through Jesus Christ: to whom is glory and empire for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, think not strange the burning heat which is to try you: as if some new thing happened to you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But if you partake of the sufferings of Christ, rejoice that, when his glory shall be revealed, you may also be glad with exceeding joy.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: If you be reproached for the name of Christ, you shall be blessed: for that which is of the honour, glory and power of God, and that which is his Spirit resteth upon you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But let none of you suffer as a murderer or a thief or a railer or a coveter of other men’s things.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But, if as a Christian, let him not be ashamed: but let him glorify God in that name.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For the time is, that judgment should begin at the house of God. And if at first at us, what shall be the end of them that believe not the gospel of God?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And if the just man shall scarcely be saved, where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear? Scarcely.... That is, not without much labour and difficulty; and because of the dangers which constantly surround, the temptations of the world, of the devil, and of our own corrupt nature.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherefore let them also that suffer according to the will of God commend their souls in good deeds to the faithful Creator. 1 Peter Chapter 5 He exhorts both priests and laity to their respective duties and recommends to all humility and watchfulness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: The ancients therefore that are among you, I beseech who am myself also an ancient and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, as also a partaker of that glory which is to be revealed in time to come:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Feed the flock of God which is among you, taking care of it, not by constraint but willingly, according to God: not for filthy lucre’s sake but voluntarily:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Neither as lording it over the clergy but being made a pattern of the flock from the heart.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And when the prince of pastors shall appear, you shall receive a never fading crown of glory.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: In like manner, ye young men, be subject to the ancients. And do you all insinuate humility one to another: for God resisteth the proud, but to the humble he giveth grace.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Be you humbled therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in the time of visitation:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Casting all your care upon him, for he hath care of you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Be sober and watch: because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, goeth about seeking whom he may devour.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Whom resist ye, strong in faith: knowing that the same affliction befalls, your brethren who are in the world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But the God of all grace, who hath called us unto his eternal glory in Christ Jesus, after you have suffered a little, will himself perfect you and confirm you and establish you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: To him be glory and empire, for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: By Sylvanus, a faithful brother unto you, as I think, I have written briefly: beseeching and testifying that this is the true grace of God, wherein you stand.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: The church that is in Babylon, elected together with you, saluteth you. And so doth my son, Mark.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Salute one another with a holy kiss. Grace be to all you who are in Christ Jesus. Amen.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Paul and Sylvanus and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians. In God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Grace unto you: and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: We are bound to give thanks always to God for you, brethren, as it is fitting, because your faith groweth exceedingly and the charity of every one of you towards each other aboundeth.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: So that we ourselves also glory in you in the churches of God, for your patience and faith, and in all your persecutions and tribulations: which you endure

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For an example of the just judgment of God, that you may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for which also you suffer.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Seeing it is a just thing with God to repay tribulation to them that trouble you:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And to you who are troubled, rest with us, when the Lord Jesus shall be revealed from heaven with the angels of his power:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: In a flame of fire, giving vengeance to them who know not God and who obey not the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Who shall suffer eternal punishment in destruction, from the face of the Lord and from the glory of his power:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: When he shall come to be glorified in his saints and to be made wonderful in all them who have believed; because our testimony was believed upon you in that day.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Wherefore also we pray always for you: That our God would make you worthy of his vocation and fulfil all the good pleasure of his goodness and the work of faith in power:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: That the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you, and you in him, according to the grace of our God and of the Lord Jesus Christ. 2 Thessalonians Chapter 2 The day of the Lord is not to come till the man of sin be revealed. The apostle’s traditions are to be observed.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And we beseech you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and of our gathering together unto him:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: That you be not easily moved from your sense nor be terrified, neither by spirit nor by word nor by epistle, as sent from us, as if the day of the Lord were at hand.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Let no man deceive you by any means: for unless there come a revolt first, and the man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition, A revolt.... This revolt, or falling off, is generally understood, by the ancient fathers, of a revolt from the Roman empire, which was first to be destroyed, before the coming of Antichrist. It may, perhaps, be understood also of a revolt of many nations from the Catholic Church; which has, in part, happened already, by means of Mahomet, Luther, &c., and it may be supposed, will be more general in the days of the Antichrist. The man of sin.... Here must be meant some particular man, as is evident from the frequent repetition of the Greek article: o`, ‘the’ man of sin, ‘the’ son of perdition, ‘the’ adversary or opposer. It agrees to the wicked and great Antichrist, who will come before the end of the world.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Who opposeth and is lifted up above all that is called God or that is worshipped, so that he sitteth in the temple of God, shewing himself as if he were God. In the temple.... Either that of Jerusalem which some think he will rebuild; or in some Christian church, which he will pervert to his own worship: as Mahomet has done by the churches of the east.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Remember you not that, when I was yet with you, I told you these things?

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And now you know what withholdeth, that he may be revealed in his time.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For the mystery of iniquity already worketh: only that he who now holdeth do hold, until he be taken out of the way.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And then that wicked one shall be revealed: whom the Lord Jesus shall kill with the spirit of his mouth and shall destroy with the brightness of his coming: him

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Whose coming is according to the working of Satan, in all power and signs and lying wonders:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And in all seduction of iniquity to them that perish: because they receive not the love of the truth, that they might be saved. Therefore God shall send them the operation of error, to believe lying: God shall send.... That is God shall suffer them to be deceived by lying wonders, and false miracles, in punishment of their not entertaining the love of truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: That all may be judged who have not believed the truth but have consented to iniquity.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But we ought to give thanks to God always for you, brethren, beloved of God, for that God hath chosen you firstfruits unto salvation, in sanctification of the spirit and faith of the truth:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Whereunto also he hath called you by our gospel, unto the purchasing of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Therefore, brethren, stand fast: and hold the traditions, which you have learned, whether by word or by our epistle. Traditions.... See here that the unwritten traditions are no less to be received than their epistles.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God and our Father, who hath loved us and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope in grace,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Exhort your hearts and confirm you in every good work and word. 2 Thessalonians Chapter 3 He begs their prayers and warns them against idleness.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For the rest, brethren, pray for us that the word of God may run and may be glorified, even as among you: May run.... That is, may spread itself, and have free course.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And that we may be delivered from importunate and evil men: for all men have not faith.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But God is faithful, who will strengthen and keep you from evil.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And we have confidence concerning you in the Lord that the things which we command, you both do and will do.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And the Lord direct your hearts, in the charity of God and the patience of Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And we charge you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you withdraw yourselves from every brother walking disorderly and not according to the tradition which they have received of us.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For yourselves know how you ought to imitate us. For we were not disorderly among you.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Neither did we eat any man’s bread for nothing: but in labour and in toil we worked night and day, lest we should be chargeable to any of you.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Not as if we had not power: but that we might give ourselves a pattern unto you, to imitate us.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For also, when we were with you, this we declared to you: that, if any man will not work, neither let him eat.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: For we have heard there are some among you who walk disorderly: working not at all, but curiously meddling.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Now we charge them that are such and beseech them by the Lord Jesus Christ that, working with silence, they would eat their own bread.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: But you, brethren, be not weary in well doing.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: And if any man obey not our word by this epistle, note that man and do not keep company with him, that he may be ashamed.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Yet do not esteem him as an enemy but admonish him as a brother.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: Now the Lord of peace himself give you everlasting peace in every place. The Lord be with you all.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: The salutation of Paul with my own hand: which is the sign in every epistle. So I write.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Thessalonians
Text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: The former treatise I made, O Theophilus, of all things which Jesus began to do and to teach,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Until the day on which, giving commandments by the Holy Ghost to the apostles whom he had chosen, he was taken up.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: To whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion, by many proofs, for forty days appearing to them, and speaking of the kingdom of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And eating together with them, he commanded them, that they should not depart from Jerusalem, but should wait for the promise of the Father, which you have heard (saith he) by my mouth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For John indeed baptized with water: but you shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost, not many days hence.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: They therefore who were come together, asked him, saying: Lord, wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom of Israel?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But he said to them: It is not for you to know the times or moments, which the Father hath put in his own power:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But you shall receive the power of the Holy Ghost coming upon you, and you shall be witnesses unto me in Jerusalem, and in all Judea, and Samaria, and even to the uttermost part of the earth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had said these things, while they looked on, he was raised up: and a cloud received him out of their sight.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And while they were beholding him going up to heaven, behold two men stood by them in white garments.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who also said: Ye men of Galilee, why stand you looking up to heaven? This Jesus who is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come as you have seen him going into heaven.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mount that is called Olivet, which is nigh Jerusalem, within a sabbath day’s journey.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they were come in, they went up into an upper room, where abode Peter and John, James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James of Alpheus and Simon Zelotes and Jude the brother of James.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: All these were persevering with one mind in prayer with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: In those days Peter rising up in the midst of the brethren, said (now the number of persons together was about an hundred and twenty):

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Men, brethren, the scripture must needs be fulfilled, which the Holy Ghost spoke before by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who was the leader of them that apprehended Jesus:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who was numbered with us, and had obtained part of this ministry.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he indeed hath possessed a field of the reward of iniquity, and being hanged, burst asunder in the midst: and all his bowels gushed out.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it became known to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem: so that the same field was called in their tongue, Haceldama, that is to say, The field of blood.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For it is written in the book of Psalms: Let their habitation become desolate, and let there be none to dwell therein. And his bishopric let another take.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Wherefore of these men who have companied with us, all the time that the Lord Jesus came in and went out among us,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Beginning from the baptism of John, until the day wherein he was taken up from us, one of these must be made a witness with us of his resurrection.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they appointed two, Joseph, called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And praying, they said: Thou, Lord, who knowest the heart of all men, shew whether of these two thou hast chosen,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: To take the place of this ministry and apostleship, from which Judas hath by transgression fallen, that he might go to his own place.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they gave them lots, and the lot fell upon Matthias, and he was numbered with the eleven apostles. Acts Chapter 2 The disciples receive the Holy Ghost. Peter’s sermon to the people. The piety of the first converts.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when the days of the Pentecost were accomplished, they were all together in one place:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And suddenly there came a sound from heaven, as of a mighty wind coming: and it filled the whole house where they were sitting.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there appeared to them parted tongues, as it were of fire: and it sat upon every one of them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they were all filled with the Holy Ghost: and they began to speak with divers tongues, according as the Holy Ghost gave them to speak.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now there were dwelling at Jerusalem, Jews, devout men, out of every nation under heaven.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when this was noised abroad, the multitude came together, and were confounded in mind, because that every man heard them speak in his own tongue.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they were all amazed, and wondered, saying: Behold, are not all these that speak Galileans?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And how have we heard, every man our own tongue wherein we were born?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Parthians and Medes and Elamites and inhabitants of Mesopotamia, Judea, and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and strangers of Rome,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Jews also, and proselytes, Cretes, and Arabians: we have heard them speak in our own tongues the wonderful works of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they were all astonished, and wondered, saying one to another: What meaneth this?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But others mocking, said: These men are full of new wine.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Peter standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and spoke to them: Ye men of Judea, and all you that dwell in Jerusalem, be this known to you and with your ears receive my words.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For these are not drunk, as you suppose, seeing it is but the third hour of the day:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But this is that which was spoken of by the prophet Joel:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it shall come to pass, in the last days, (saith the Lord), I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh: and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy: and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And upon my servants indeed and upon my handmaids will I pour out in those days of my spirit: and they shall prophesy.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And I will shew wonders in the heaven above, and signs on the earth beneath: blood and fire, and vapour of smoke.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: The sun shall be turned into darkness and the moon into blood, before the great and manifest day of the Lord shall come.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Ye men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved of God among you by miracles and wonders and signs, which God did by him, in the midst of you, as you also know:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This same being delivered up, by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God, you by the hands of wicked men have crucified and slain. By the determinate, etc.... God delivered up his Son; and his Son delivered up himself, for the love of us, and for the sake of our salvation; and so Christ’s being delivered up was holy, and was God’s own determination. But they who betrayed and crucified him, did wickedly, following therein their own malice and the instigation of the devil; not the will and determination of God, who was by no means the author of their wickedness; though he permitted it; because he could, and did draw out of it so great a good, viz., the salvation of man.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Whom God hath raised up, having loosed the sorrows of hell, as it was impossible that he should be holden by it. Having loosed the sorrow, etc.... Having overcome the grievous pains of death and all the power of hell.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For David saith concerning him: I foresaw the Lord before my face: because he is at my right hand, that I may not be moved.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For this my heart hath been glad, and my tongue hath rejoiced: moreover my flesh also shall rest in hope.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell: nor suffer thy Holy One to see corruption.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Thou hast made known to me the ways of life: thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Ye men, brethren, let me freely speak to you of the patriarch David: that he died and was buried; and his sepulchre is with us to this present day.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Whereas therefore he was a prophet and knew that God hath sworn to him with an oath, that of the fruit of his loins one should sit upon his throne.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Foreseeing this, he spoke of the resurrection of Christ. For neither was he left in hell: neither did his flesh see corruption.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This Jesus hath God raised again, whereof all we are witnesses.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Being exalted therefore by the right hand of God and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost, he hath poured forth this which you see and hear.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For David ascended not into heaven; but he himself said: The Lord said to my Lord: Sit thou on my right hand,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Until I make thy enemies thy footstool.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Therefore let all the house of Israel know most certainly that God hath made both Lord and Christ, this same Jesus, whom you have crucified.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now when they had heard these things, they had compunction in their heart and said to Peter and to the rest of the apostles: What shall we do, men and brethren?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Peter said to them: Do penance: and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ, for the remission of your sins. And you shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For the promise is to you and to your children and to all that are far off, whomsoever the Lord our God shall call.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And with very many other words did he testify and exhort them, saying: Save yourselves from this perverse generation.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: They therefore that received his word were baptized: and there were added in that day about three thousand souls.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they were persevering in the doctrine of the apostles and in the communication of the breaking of bread and in prayers.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And fear came upon every soul. Many wonders also and signs were done by the apostles in Jerusalem: and there was great fear in all.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And all they that believed were together and had all things common.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Their possessions and goods they sold and divided them to all, according as every one had need.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And continuing daily with one accord in the temple and breaking bread from house to house, they took their meat with gladness and simplicity of heart:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Praising God and having favour with all the people. And the Lord increased daily together such as should be saved. Acts Chapter 3 The miracle upon the lame man, followed by the conversion of many.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now Peter and John went up into the temple at the ninth hour of prayer.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And a certain man who was lame from his mother’s womb was carried: whom they laid every day at the gate of the temple, which is called Beautiful, that he might ask alms of them that went into the temple.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: He, when he had seen Peter and John, about to go into the temple, asked to receive an alms.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Peter with John, fastening his eyes upon him, said: Look upon us.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But he looked earnestly upon them, hoping that he should receive something of them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Peter said: Silver and gold I have none; but what I have, I give thee. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, arise and walk.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And taking him by the right hand, he lifted him up: and forthwith his feet and soles received strength.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he leaping up, stood and walked and went in with them into the temple, walking and leaping and praising God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And all the people saw him walking and praising God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they knew him, that it was he who sat begging alms at the Beautiful gate of the temple: and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened to him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as he held Peter and John, all the people ran to them, to the porch which is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Peter seeing, made answer to the people: Ye men of Israel, why wonder you at this? Or why look you upon us, as if by our strength or power we had made this man to walk?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: The God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob, the God of our fathers, hath glorified his Son Jesus, whom you indeed delivered up and denied before the face of Pilate, when he judged he should be released.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But you denied the Holy One and the Just: and desired a murderer to be granted unto you.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But the author of life you killed, whom God hath raised from the dead: of which we are witnesses.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And in the faith of his name, this man, whom you have seen and known, hath his name strengthened. And the faith which is by him hath given this perfect soundness in the sight of you all.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And now, brethren, I know that you did it through ignorance: as did also your rulers.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But those things which God before had shewed by the mouth of all the prophets, that his Christ should suffer, he hath so fulfilled.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Be penitent, therefore, and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: That when the times of refreshment shall come from the presence of the Lord, and he shall send him who hath been preached unto you, Jesus Christ.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Whom heaven indeed must receive, until the times of the restitution of all things, which God hath spoken by the mouth of his holy prophets, from the beginning of the world.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For Moses said: A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me: him you shall hear according to all things whatsoever he shall speak to you.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it shall be, that every soul which will not hear that prophet shall be destroyed from among the people.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And all the prophets, from Samuel and afterwards, who have spoken, have told of these days.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: You are the children of the prophets and of the testament which God made to our fathers, saying to Abraham: And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: To you first, God, raising up his Son, hath sent him to bless you: that every one may convert himself from his wickedness. Acts Chapter 4 Peter and John are apprehended. Their constancy. The church is increased.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as they were speaking to the people the priests and the officer of the temple and the Sadducees came upon them,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Being grieved that they taught the people and preached in Jesus the resurrection from the dead:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they laid hands upon them and put them in hold till the next day: for it was now evening.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But many of them who had heard the word believed: and the number of the men was made five thousand.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it came to pass on the morrow, that their princes and ancients and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Annas the high priest and Caiphas and John and Alexander: and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And setting them in the midst, they asked: By what power or by what name, have you done this?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Ghost, said to them: Ye princes of the people and ancients, hear.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: If we this day are examined concerning the good deed done to the infirm man, by what means he hath been made whole:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Be it known to you all and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God hath raised from the dead, even by him, this man standeth here before you, whole.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This is the stone which was rejected by you the builders, which is become the head of the corner.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Neither is there salvation in any other. For there is no other name under heaven given to men, whereby we must be saved.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now seeing the constancy of Peter and of John, understanding that they were illiterate and ignorant men, they wondered: and they knew them that they had been with Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Seeing the man also who had been healed, standing with them, they could say nothing against it.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But they commanded them to go aside out of the council: and they conferred among themselves,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Saying: What shall we do to these men? For indeed a miracle hath been done by them, known to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem. It is manifest: and we cannot deny it.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But that it may be no farther spread among the people, let us threaten them that they speak no more in this name to any man.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And calling them, they charged them not to speak at all, nor teach in the name of Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Peter and John answering, said to them: If it be just, in the sight of God, to hear you rather than God, judge ye.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But they, threatening, sent them away, not finding how they might punish them, because of the people: for all men glorified what had been done, in that which had come to pass.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For the man was above forty years old, in whom that miraculous cure had been wrought.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And being let go, they came to their own company and related all that the chief priests and ancients had said to them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who having heard it, with one accord lifted up their voice to God and said: Lord, thou art he that didst make heaven and earth, the sea and all things that are in them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who, by the Holy Ghost, by the mouth of our father David, thy servant, hast said: Why did the Gentiles rage: and the people meditate vain things?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: The kings of the earth stood up: and the princes assembled together against the Lord and his Christ.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For of a truth there assembled together in this city against thy holy child Jesus, whom thou hast anointed, Herod, and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: To do what thy hand and thy counsel decreed to be done.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And now, Lord, behold their threatenings: and grant unto thy servants that with all confidence they may speak thy word,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: By stretching forth thy hand to cures and signs and wonders, to be done by the name of thy holy Son, Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had prayed, the place was moved wherein they were assembled: and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost: and they spoke the word of God with confidence.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the multitude of believers had but one heart and one soul. Neither did any one say that aught of the things which he possessed was his own: but all things were common unto them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And with great power did the Apostles give testimony of the resurrection of Jesus Christ our Lord: and great grace was in them all.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For neither was there any one needy among them. For as many as were owners of lands or houses sold them and brought the price of the things they sold,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And laid it down before the feet of the apostles. And distribution was made to every one, according as he had need.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Joseph, who, by the apostles, was surnamed Barnabas (which is, by interpretation, The son of consolation), a Levite, a Cyprian born,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Having land, sold it and brought the price and laid it at the feet of the Apostles. Acts Chapter 5 The judgment of God upon Ananias and Saphira. The apostles are cast into prison.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But a certain man named Ananias, with Saphira his wife, sold a piece of land,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And by fraud kept back part of the price of the land, his wife being privy thereunto: and bringing a certain part of it, laid it at the feet of the apostles.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Peter said: Ananias, why hath Satan tempted thy heart, that thou shouldst lie to the Holy Ghost and by fraud keep part of the price of the land?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Whilst it remained, did it not remain to thee? And after it was sold, was it not in thy power? Why hast thou conceived this thing in thy heart? Thou hast not lied to men, but to God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Ananias, hearing these words, fell down and gave up the ghost. And there came great fear upon all that heard it.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the young men rising up, removed him, and carrying him out, buried him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what had happened, came in.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Peter said to her: Tell me, woman, whether you sold the land for so much? And she said: Yea, for so much.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Peter said unto her: Why have you agreed together to tempt the spirit of the Lord? Behold the feet of them who have buried thy husband are at the door: and they shall carry thee out,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Immediately, she fell down before his feet and gave up the ghost. And the young men coming in found her dead: and carried her out and buried her by her husband.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there came great fear upon the whole church and upon all that heard these things.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people. And they were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But of the rest no man durst join himself unto them: but the people magnified them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the multitude of men and women who believed in the Lord was more increased:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets and laid them on beds and couches, that, when Peter came, his shadow at the least might overshadow any of them and they might be delivered from their infirmities.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there came also together to Jerusalem a multitude out of the neighbouring cities, bringing sick persons and such as were troubled with unclean spirits: who were all healed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then the high priest rising up, and all they that were with him (which is the heresy of the Sadducees) were filled with envy.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they laid hands on the apostles and put them in the common prison.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But an angel of the Lord by night, opening the doors of the prison and leading them out, said:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Go, and standing speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who having heard this, early in the morning, entered into the temple and taught. And the high priest coming, and they that were with him, called together the council and all the ancients of the children of Israel: and they sent to the prison to have them brought.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But when the ministers came and opening the prison found them not there, they returned and told,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Saying: The prison indeed we found shut with all diligence, and the keepers standing before the doors; but opening it, we found no man within.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now when the officer of the temple and the chief priests heard these words, they were in doubt concerning them, what would come to pass.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But one came and told them: Behold, the men whom you put in prison are in the temple, standing and teaching the people.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then went the officer with the ministers and brought them without violence: for they feared the people, lest they should be stoned.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had brought them, they set them before the council. And the high priest asked them,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Saying: Commanding, we commanded you that you should not teach in this name. And behold, you have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine: and you have a mind to bring the blood of this man upon us.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Peter and the apostles answering, said: We ought to obey God rather than men.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: The God of our fathers hath raised up Jesus, whom you put to death, hanging him upon a tree.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Him hath God exalted with his right hand, to be Prince and Saviour, to give repentance to Israel and remission of sins.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And we are witnesses of these things: and the Holy Ghost, whom God hath given to all that obey him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: When they had heard these things, they were cut to the heart: and they thought to put them to death.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But one in the council rising up, a Pharisee, named Gamaliel, a doctor of the law, respected by all the people, commanded the men to be put forth a little while.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he said to them: Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what you intend to do, as touching these men.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For before these days rose up Theodas, affirming himself to be somebody, to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves. Who was slain: and all that believed him were scattered and brought to nothing.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: After this man, rose up Judas of Galilee, in the days of the enrolling, and drew away the people after him. He also perished: and all, even as many as consented to him, were dispersed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And now, therefore, I say to you: Refrain from these men and let them alone. For if this council or this work be of men, it will come to nought:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But if it be of God, you cannot overthrow it, lest perhaps you be found even to fight against God. And they consented to him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And calling in the apostles, after they had scourged them, they charged them that they should not speak at all in the name of Jesus. And they dismissed them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they indeed went from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were accounted worthy to suffer reproach for the name of Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And every day they ceased not, in the temple and from house to house, to teach and preach Christ Jesus. Acts Chapter 6 The ordination of the seven deacons. The zeal of Stephen.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And in those days, the number of the disciples increasing, there arose a murmuring of the Greeks against the Hebrews, for that their widows were neglected in the daily ministration. Greeks.... So they called the Jews that were born and brought up in Greece.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then the twelve, calling together the multitude of the disciples, said: It is not reason that we should leave the word of God and serve tables.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Wherefore, brethren, look ye out among you seven men of good reputation, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer and to the ministry of the word.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the saying was liked by all the multitude. And they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost, and Philip and Prochorus and Nicanor, and Timon and Parmenas and Nicolas, a proselyte of Antioch.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: These they set before the apostles: and they praying, imposed hands upon them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the word of the Lord increased: and the number of the disciples was multiplied in Jerusalem exceedingly. A great multitude also of the priests obeyed the faith.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Stephen, full of grace and fortitude, did great wonders and signs among the people.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now there arose some, of that which is called the synagogue of the Libertines and of the Cyrenians and of the Alexandrians and of them that were of Cilicia and Asia, disputing with Stephen.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit that spoke.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then they suborned men to say they had heard him speak words of blasphemy against Moses and against God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they stirred up the people and the ancients and the scribes. And running together, they took him and brought him to the council.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they set up false witnesses, who said: This man ceaseth not to speak words against the holy place and the law.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place and shall change the traditions which Moses delivered unto us.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And all that sat in the council, looking on him, saw his face as if it had been the face of an angel. Acts Chapter 7 Stephen’s speech before the council. His martyrdom.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then the high priest said: Are these things so?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who said: Ye men, brethren and fathers, hear. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Charan.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And said to him: Go forth out of thy country and from thy kindred: and come into the land which I shall shew thee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then he went out of the land of the Chaldeans and dwelt in Charan. And from thence, after his father was dead, he removed him into this land, wherein you now dwell.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he gave him no inheritance in it: no, not the pace of a foot. But he promised to give it him in possession, and to his seed after him, when as yet he had no child.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And God said to him: That his seed should sojourn in a strange country, and that they should bring them under bondage and treat them evil four hundred years.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the nation which they shall serve will I judge (said the Lord): and after these things they shall go out and shall serve me in this place.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision. And so he begot Isaac and circumcised him the eighth day: and Isaac begot Jacob: and Jacob, the twelve patriarchs.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the patriarchs, through envy, sold Joseph into Egypt. And God was with him,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And delivered him out of all his tribulations: and he gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharao, the king of Egypt. And he appointed him governor over Egypt and over all his house.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now there came a famine upon all Egypt and Chanaan, and great tribulation: and our fathers found no food.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But when Jacob had heard that there was corn in Egypt, he sent our fathers first.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And at the second time, Joseph was known by his brethren: and his kindred was made known to Pharao.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Joseph sending, called thither Jacob, his father, and all his kindred, seventy-five souls.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: So Jacob went down into Egypt. And he died, and our fathers.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they were translated into Sichem and were laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Hemor, the son of Sichem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when the time of the promise drew near, which God had promised to Abraham, the people increased and were multiplied in Egypt.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Till another king arose in Egypt, who knew not Joseph.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This same, dealing craftily with our race, afflicted our fathers, that they should expose their children, to the end they might not be kept alive.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: At the same time was Moses born: and he was acceptable to God. Who was nourished three months in his father’s house.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he was exposed, Pharao’s daughter took him up and nourished him for her own son.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians: and he was mighty in his words and in his deeds.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he was full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren, the children of Israel.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had seen one of them suffer wrong, he defended him: and striking the Egyptian, he avenged him who suffered the injury.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he thought that his brethren understood that God by his hand would save them. But they understood it not.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the day following, he shewed himself to them when they were at strife and would have reconciled them in peace, saying: Men, ye are brethren. Why hurt you one another?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But he that did the injury to his neighbour thrust him away, saying: Who hath appointed thee prince and judge over us:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: What! Wilt thou kill me, as thou didst yesterday kill the Egyptian?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Moses fled upon this word: and was a stranger in the land of Madian, where he begot two sons.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when forty years were expired, there appeared to him, in the desert of mount Sina, an angel in a flame of fire in a bush.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
