Text: And Moses seeing it wondered at the sight. And as he drew near to view it, the voice of the Lord came unto him, saying:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: I am the God of thy fathers: the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob. And Moses being terrified durst not behold.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the Lord said to him: Loose the shoes from thy feet: for the place wherein thou standest is holy ground.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Seeing, I have seen the affliction of my people which is in Egypt: and I have heard their groaning and am come down to deliver them. And now come: and I will send thee into Egypt.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This Moses, whom they refused, saying: Who hath appointed thee prince and judge? Him God sent to be prince and redeemer, by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: He brought them out, doing wonders and signs in the land of Egypt and in the Red Sea and in the desert, forty years.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This is that Moses who said to the children of Israel: A prophet shall God raise up to you of your own brethren, as myself. Him shall you hear.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This is he that was in the church in the wilderness, with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sina and with our fathers. Who received the words of life to give unto us.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Whom our fathers would not obey: but thrust him away and in their hearts turned back into Egypt,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Saying to Aaron: Make us gods to go before us. For as for this Moses, who brought us out of the land of Egypt, we know not what is become of him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they made a calf in those days and offered sacrifices to the idol and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And God turned and gave them up to serve the host of heaven, as it is written in the books of the prophets: Did you offer victims and sacrifices to me for forty years, in the desert, O house of Israel?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And you took unto you the tabernacle of Moloch and the star of your god Rempham, figures which you made to adore them. And I will carry you away beyond Babylon.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: The tabernacle of the testimony was with our fathers in the desert, as God ordained for them, speaking to Moses, that he should make it according to the form which he had seen.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Which also our fathers receiving, brought in with Jesus, into the possession of the Gentiles: whom God drove out before the face of our fathers, unto the days of David, Jesus.... That is Josue, so called in Greek.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who found grace before God and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Solomon built him a house,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Yet the most High dwelleth not in houses made by hands, as the prophet saith: Dwelleth not in houses, etc.... That is, so as to stand in need of earthly dwellings, or to be contained, or circumscribed by them. Though, otherwise by his immense divinity, he is in our houses; and every where else; and Christ in his humanity dwelt in houses; and is now on our altars.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Heaven is my throne and the earth my footstool. What house will you build me (saith the Lord)? Or what is the place of my resting?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Hath not my hand made all these things?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: You stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, you always resist the Holy Ghost. As your fathers did, so do you also.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted? And they have slain them who foretold of the coming of the Just One: of whom you have been now the betrayers and murderers.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who have received the law by the disposition of angels and have not kept it.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now hearing these things, they were cut to the heart: and they gnashed with their teeth at him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But he, being full of the Holy Ghost, looking up steadfastly to heaven, saw the glory of God and Jesus standing on the right hand of God. And he said: Behold, I see the heavens opened and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they, crying out with a loud voice, stopped their ears and with one accord ran violently upon him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And casting him forth without the city, they stoned him. And the witnesses laid down their garments at the feet of a young man, whose name was Saul.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they stoned Stephen, invoking and saying: Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And falling on his knees, he cried with a loud voice, saying: Lord, lay not this sin to their charge. And when he had said this, he fell asleep in the Lord. And Saul was consenting to his death. Acts Chapter 8 Philip converts the Samaritans and baptizes the eunuch.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And at that time, there was raised a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem. And they were all dispersed through the countries of Judea, and Samaria, except the apostles.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And devout men took order for Stephen’s funeral and made great mourning over him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Saul made havock of the church, entering in from house to house: and dragging away men and women, committed them to prison.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: They therefore that were dispersed went about preaching the word of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Philip, going down to the city of Samaria, preached Christ unto them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the people with one accord were attentive to those things which were said by Philip, hearing, and seeing the miracles which he did.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For many of them who had unclean spirits, crying with a loud voice, went out.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And many, taken with the palsy, and that were lame, were healed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: There was therefore great joy in that city. Now there was a certain man named Simon who before had been a magician in that city, seducing the people of Samaria, giving out that he was some great one:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: To whom they all gave ear, from the least to the greatest, saying: This man is the power of God, which is called great.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they were attentive to him, because, for a long time, he had bewitched them with his magical practices.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But when they had believed Philip preaching of the kingdom of God, in the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Simon himself believed also and, being baptized, he adhered to Philip. And being astonished, wondered to see the signs and exceeding great miracles which were done.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now, when the apostles, who were in Jerusalem, had heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who, when they were come, prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For he was not as yet come upon any of them: but they were only baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then they laid their hands upon them: and they received the Holy Ghost. They laid their hands upon them, etc.... The apostles administered the sacrament of confirmation, by imposition of hands, and prayer; and the faithful thereby received the Holy Ghost. Not but they had received the grace of the Holy Ghost at their baptism: yet not that plenitude of grace and those spiritual gifts which they afterwards received from bishops in the sacrament of confirmation, which strengthened them to profess their faith publicly.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when Simon saw that, by the imposition of the hands of the apostles, the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Saying: Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I shall lay my hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost. But Peter said to him:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Keep thy money to thyself, to perish with thee: because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Thou hast no part nor lot in this matter. For thy heart is not right in the sight of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Do penance therefore for this thy wickedness: and pray to God, that perhaps this thought of thy heart may be forgiven thee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For I see thou art in the gall of bitterness and in the bonds of iniquity.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Simon answering, said: Pray you for me to the Lord that none of these things which you have spoken may come upon me.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they indeed, having testified and preached the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem: and preached the gospel to many countries of the Samaritans.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying: Arise, go towards the south, to the way that goeth down from Jerusalem into Gaza: this is desert.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And rising up, he went. And behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch, of great authority under Candace the queen of the Ethiopians, who had charge over all her treasures, had come to Jerusalem to adore.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he was returning, sitting in his chariot and reading Isaias the prophet.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the Spirit said to Philip: Go near and join thyself to this chariot.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Philip running thither, heard him reading the prophet Isaias. And he said: Thinkest thou that thou understandest what thou readest?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who said: And how can I, unless some man shew me? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the place of the scripture which he was reading was this: He was led as a sheep to the slaughter: and like a lamb without voice before his shearer, so openeth he not his mouth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: In humility his judgment was taken away. His generation who shall declare, for his life shall be taken from the earth?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the eunuch answering Philip, said: I beseech thee, of whom doth the prophet speak this? Of himself, or of some other man?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Philip, opening his mouth and beginning at this scripture, preached unto him Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as they went on their way, they came to a certain water. And the eunuch said: See, here is water: What doth hinder me from being baptized?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Philip said: If thou believest with all thy heart, thou mayest. And he answering, said: I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God. If thou believest with all thy heart.... The scripture many times mentions only one disposition, as here belief, when others equally necessary are not expressed, viz., a sorrow for sins, a firm hope, and the love of God. Moreover, believing with the whole heart signifies a belief of every thing necessary for salvation.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he commanded the chariot to stand still. And they went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch. And he baptized him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord took away Philip: and the eunuch saw him no more. And he went on his way rejoicing.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Philip was found in Azotus: and passing through, he preached the gospel to all the cities, till he came to Cæsarea. Acts Chapter 9 Paul’s conversion and zeal. Peter heals Eneas and raises up Tabitha to life.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Saul, as yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And asked of him letters to Damascus, to the synagogues: that if he found any men and women of this way, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as he went on his journey, it came to pass that he drew nigh to Damascus. And suddenly a light from heaven shined round about him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And falling on the ground, he heard a voice saying to him: Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who said: Who art thou, Lord? And he: I am Jesus whom thou persecutest. It is hard for thee to kick against the goad.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he, trembling and astonished, said: Lord, what wilt thou have me to do?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the Lord said to him: Arise and go into the city; and there it shall be told thee what thou must do. Now the men who went in company with him stood amazed, hearing indeed a voice but seeing no man.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Saul arose from the ground: and when his eyes were opened, he saw nothing. But they, leading him by the hands, brought him to Damascus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he was there three days without sight: and he did neither eat nor drink.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias. And the Lord said to him in a vision: Ananias, And he said: Behold I am here, Lord.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the Lord said to him: Arise and go into the street that is called Strait and seek in the house of Judas, one named Saul of Tarsus. For behold he prayeth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: (And he saw a man named Ananias coming in and putting his hands upon him, that he might receive his sight.)

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Ananias answered: Lord, I have heard by many of this man, how much evil he hath done to thy saints in Jerusalem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that invoke thy name.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the Lord said to him: Go thy way: for this man is to me a vessel of election, to carry my name before the Gentiles and kings and the children of Israel.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name’s sake.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Ananias went his way and entered into the house. And laying his hands upon him, he said: Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus hath sent me, he that appeared to thee in the way as thou camest, that thou mayest receive thy sight and be filled with the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And immediately there fell from his eyes as it were scales: and he received his sight. And rising up, he was baptized.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had taken meat, he was strengthened. And he was with the disciples that were at Damascus, for some days.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And immediately he preached Jesus in the synagogues, that he is the son of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And all that heard him were astonished and said: Is not this he who persecuted in Jerusalem those that called upon this name and came hither for that intent, that he might carry them bound to the chief priests?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Saul increased much more in strength and confounded the Jews who dwelt at Damascus, affirming that this is the Christ.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when many days were passed, the Jews consulted together to kill him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But their lying in wait was made known to Saul. And they watched the gates also day and night, that they might kill him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But the disciples, taking him in the night, conveyed him away by the wall, letting him down in a basket.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he was come into Jerusalem, he essayed to join himself to the disciples: and they all were afraid of him, not believing that he was a disciple.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles and told them how he had seen the Lord, and that he had spoken to him: and how in Damascus he had dealt confidently in the name of Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he was with them, coming in and going out in Jerusalem and dealing confidently in the name of the Lord.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: He spoke also to the Gentiles and disputed with the Greeks. But they sought to kill him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Which when the brethren had known, they brought him down to Cæsarea and sent him away to Tarsus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now, the church had peace throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria: and was edified, walking in the fear of the Lord: and was filled with the consolation of the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it came to pass that Peter, as he passed through, visiting all, came to the saints who dwelt at Lydda.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he found there a certain man named Eneas, who had kept his bed for eight years, who was ill of the palsy.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Peter said to him: Eneas, the Lord Jesus Christ healeth thee. Arise and make thy bed. And immediately he arose.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him: who were converted to the Lord.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And in Joppe there was a certain disciple named Tabitha, which by interpretation is called Dorcas. This woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it came to pass in those days that she was sick and died. Whom when they had washed, they laid her in an upper chamber.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And forasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppe, the disciples, hearing that Peter was there, sent unto him two men, desiring him that he would not be slack to come unto them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Peter rising up went with them. And when he was come, they brought him into the upper chamber. And all the widows stood about him, weeping and shewing him the coats and garments which Dorcas made them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they all being put forth, Peter, kneeling down, prayed. And turning to the body, he said: Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes and, seeing Peter, sat up.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And giving her his hand, he lifted her up. And when he had called the saints and the widows, he presented her alive.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it was made known throughout all Joppe. And many believed in the Lord.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it came to pass that he abode many days in Joppe, with one Simon a tanner. Acts Chapter 10 Cornelius is received into the church. Peter’s vision.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there was a certain man in Cæsarea, named Cornelius, a centurion of that which is called the Italian band:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: A religious man, and fearing God with all his house, giving much alms to the people and always praying to God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This man saw in a vision manifestly, about the ninth hour of the day, an angel of God coming in unto him and saying to him: Cornelius.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he, beholding him, being seized with fear, said: What is it, Lord? And he said to him: Thy prayers and thy alms are ascended for a memorial in the sight of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And now send men to Joppe: and call hither one Simon, who is surnamed Peter.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: He lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side. He will tell thee what thou must do.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when the angel who spoke to him was departed, he called two of his household servants and a soldier who feared the Lord, of them that were under him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: To whom when he had related all, he sent them to Joppe.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And on the next day, whilst they were going on their journey and drawing nigh to the city, Peter went up to the higher parts of the house to pray, about the sixth hour.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And being hungry, he was desirous to taste somewhat. And as they were preparing, there came upon him an ecstasy of mind.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he saw the heaven opened and a certain vessel descending, as it were a great linen sheet let down by the four corners from heaven to the earth:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Wherein were all manner of four-footed beasts and creeping things of the earth and fowls of the air.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there came a voice to him: Arise, Peter. Kill and eat.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Peter said: Far be it from me. For I never did eat any thing that is common and unclean.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the voice spoke to him again the second time: That which God hath cleansed, do not thou call common.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And this was done thrice. And presently the vessel was taken up into heaven.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now, whilst Peter was doubting within himself what the vision that he had seen should mean, behold the men who were sent from Cornelius, inquiring for Simon’s house, stood at the gate.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had called, they asked if Simon, who is surnamed Peter, were lodged there.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as Peter was thinking of the vision, the Spirit said to him: Behold three men seek thee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Arise, therefore: get thee down and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Peter, going down to the men, said: Behold, I am he whom you seek. What is the cause for which you are come?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who said: Cornelius, a centurion, a just man and one that feareth God, and having good testimony from all the nation of the Jews, received an answer of an holy angel, to send for thee into his house And to hear words of thee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then bringing them in, he lodged them. And the day following, he arose and went with them: and some of the brethren from Joppe accompanied him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the morrow after, he entered into Cæsarea. And Cornelius waited for them, having called together his kinsmen and special friends.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it came to pass that when Peter was come in, Cornelius came to meet him and falling at his feet adored.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Peter lifted him up, saying: Arise: I myself also am a man.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And talking with him, he went in and found many that were come together.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he said to them: you know how abominable it is for a man that is a Jew to keep company or to come unto one of another nation: but God hath shewed to me, to call no man common or unclean.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For which cause, making no doubt, I came when I was sent for. I ask, therefore, for what cause you have sent for me?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Cornelius said: Four days ago, unto this hour, I was praying in my house, at the ninth hour and behold a man stood before me in white apparel and said:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Cornelius, thy prayer is heard and thy alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Send therefore to Joppe: and call hither Simon, who is surnamed Peter. He lodgeth in the house of Simon a tanner, by the sea side.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Immediately therefore I sent to thee: and thou hast done well in coming. Now, therefore, all we are present in thy sight to hear all things whatsoever are commanded thee by the Lord.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Peter opening his mouth, said: in very deed I perceive that God is not a respecter of persons.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But in every nation, he that feareth him and worketh justice is acceptable to him. In every nation, etc.... That is to say, not only Jews, but Gentiles also, of what nation soever, are acceptable to God, if they fear him and work justice. But then true faith is always to be presupposed, without which (saith St. Paul, Heb. 11. 6) it is impossible to please God. Beware then of the error of those, who would infer from this passage, that men of all religions may be pleasing to God. For since none but the true religion can be from God, all other religions must be from the father of lies, and therefore highly displeasing to the God of truth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: God sent the word to the children of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ (He is Lord of all).

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: You know the word which hath been published through all Judea: for it began from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Jesus of Nazareth: how God anointed him with the Holy Ghost and with power, who went about doing good and healing all that were oppressed by the devil, for God was with him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And we are witnesses of all things that he did in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem: whom they killed, hanging him upon a tree.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Him God raised up the third day and gave him to be made manifest,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Not to all the people, but to witnesses preordained by God, even to us, who did eat and drink with him, after he arose again from the dead.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that it is he who was appointed by God to be judge of the living and of the dead.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: To him all the prophets give testimony, that by his name all receive remission of sins, who believe in him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: While Peter was yet speaking these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them that heard the word.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the faithful of the circumcision, who came with Peter, were astonished for that the grace of the Holy Ghost was poured out upon the Gentiles also.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For they heard them speaking with tongues and magnifying God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Peter answered: Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, who have received the Holy Ghost, as well as we?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ. Then they desired him to tarry with them some days. Acts Chapter 11 Peter defends his having received the Gentiles into the church.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the apostles and brethren, who were in Judea, heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they that were of the circumcision contended with him,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Saying: Why didst thou go in to men uncircumcised and didst eat with them?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Peter began and declared to them the matter in order, saying:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: I was in the city of Joppe praying: and I saw in an ecstasy of mind a vision, a certain vessel descending, as it were a great sheet let down from heaven by four corners. And it came even unto me.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Into which looking, I considered and saw fourfooted creatures of the earth and beasts and creeping things and fowls of the air.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And I heard also a voice saying to me: Arise, Peter. Kill and eat.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And I said: Not so, Lord: for nothing common or unclean hath ever entered into my mouth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the voice answered again from heaven: What God hath made clean, do not thou call common.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And this was done three times. And all were taken up again into heaven.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And behold, immediately there were three men come to the house wherein I was, sent to me from Cæsarea.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the Spirit said to me that I should go with them, nothing doubting. And these six brethren went with me also: and we entered into the man’s house.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he told us how he had seen an angel in his house, standing and saying to him: Send to Joppe and call hither Simon, who is surnamed Peter,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who shall speak to thee words whereby thou shalt be saved, and all thy house.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when I had begun to speak, the Holy Ghost fell upon them, as upon us also in the beginning.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And I remembered the word of the Lord, how that he said: John indeed baptized with water but you shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: If then God gave them the same grace as to us also who believed in the Lord Jesus Christ: who was I, that could withstand God?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Having heard these things, they held their peace and glorified God, saying: God then hath also to the Gentiles given repentance, unto life.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now they who had been dispersed by the persecution that arose on occasion of Stephen went about as far as Phenice and Cyprus and Antioch, speaking the word to none, but to the Jews only.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they were entered into Antioch, spoke also to the Greeks, preaching the Lord Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the hand of he Lord was with them: and a great number believing, were converted to the Lord.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the tidings came to the ears of the church that was at Jerusalem, touching these things: and they sent Barnabas as far as Antioch.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who, when he was come and had seen the grace of God, rejoiced. And he exhorted them all with purpose of heart to continue in the Lord.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For he was a good man and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith. And a great multitude was added to the Lord.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Barnabas went to Tarsus to seek Saul: whom, when he had found, he brought to Antioch.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they conversed there in the church a whole year: and they taught a great multitude, so that at Antioch the disciples were first named Christians.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And in these days there came prophets from Jerusalem to Antioch.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And one of them named Agabus, rising up, signified by the Spirit that there should be a great famine over the whole world, which came to pass under Claudius.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the disciples, every man according to his ability, purposed to send relief to the brethren who dwelt in Judea.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Which also they did, sending it to the ancients, by the hands of Barnabas and Saul. Acts Chapter 12 Herod’s persecution. Peter’s deliverance by an angel. Herod’s punishment.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And at the same time, Herod the king stretched forth his hands, to afflict some of the church.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he killed James, the brother of John, With the sword.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And seeing that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to take up Peter also. Now it was in the days of the Azymes. Azymes.... The festival of the unleavened bread, or the pasch, which answers to our Easter.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had apprehended him, he cast him into prison, delivering him to four files of soldiers, to be kept, intending, after the pasch, to bring him forth to the people.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Peter therefore was kept in prison. But prayer was made without ceasing by the church unto God for him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when Herod would have brought him forth, the same night, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and the keepers before the door kept the prison.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And behold an angel of the Lord stood by him and a light shined in the room. And he, striking Peter on the side, raised him up, saying: Arise quickly. And the chains fell off from his hands.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the angel said to him: Gird thyself and put on thy sandals. And he did so. And he said to him: Cast thy garment about thee and follow me,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And going out, he followed him. And he knew not that it was true which was done by the angel: but thought he saw a vision.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And passing through the first and the second ward, they came to the iron gate that leadeth to the city which of itself opened to them. And going out, they passed on through one street. And immediately the angel departed from him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Peter coming to himself, said: Now I know in very deed that the Lord hath sent his angel and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod and from all the expectation of the people of the Jews.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And considering, he came to the house of Mary the mother of John, who was surnamed Mark, where many were gathered together and praying.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came to hearken, whose name was Rhode.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as soon as she knew Peter’s voice, she opened not the gate for joy: but running in she told that Peter stood before the gate.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But they said to her: Thou art mad. But she affirmed that it was so. Then said they: It is his angel.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Peter continued knocking. And when they had opened, they saw him and were astonished.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But he, beckoning to them with his hand to hold their peace, told how the Lord had brought him out of prison. And he said: Tell these things to James and to the brethren. And going out, he went into another place.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now when day was come, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when Herod had sought for him and found him not, having examined the keepers, he commanded they should be put to death. And going down from Judea to Cæsarea, he abode there.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he was angry with the Tyrians and the Sidonians. But they with one accord came to him: and, having gained Blastus who was the king’s chamberlain, they desired peace, because their countries were nourished by him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And upon a day appointed, Herod being arrayed in kingly apparel, sat in the judgment seat and made an oration to them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the people made acclamation, saying: It is the voice of a god, and not of a man.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And forthwith an angel of the Lord struck him, because he had not given the honour to God: and, being eaten up by worms, he gave up the ghost.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But the word of the Lord increased and multiplied.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Barnabas and Saul, returned from Jerusalem, having fulfilled their ministry, taking with them John who was surnamed Mark. Acts Chapter 13 Saul and Barnabas are sent forth by the Holy Ghost. They preach in Cyprus and in Antioch of Pisidia.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now there were in the church which was at Antioch prophets and doctors, among whom was Barnabas and Simon who was called Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene and Manahen who was the foster brother of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as they were ministering to the Lord and fasting, the Holy Ghost said to them: Separate me Saul and Barnabas, for the work whereunto I have taken them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then they fasting and praying and imposing their hands upon them, sent them away.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: So they, being sent by the Holy Ghost, went to Seleucia: and from thence they sailed to Cyprus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they were come to Salamina, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. And they had John also in the ministry.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had gone through the whole island, as far as Paphos, they found a certain man, a magician, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar-Jesu:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who was with the proconsul Sergius Paulus, a prudent man. He, sending for Barnabas and Saul, desired to hear the word of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Elymas the magician (for so his name is interpreted) withstood them, seeking to turn away the proconsul from the faith.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Saul, otherwise Paul, filled with the Holy Ghost, looking upon him,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Said: O full of all guile and of all deceit, child of the devil, enemy of all justice, thou ceasest not to pervert the right ways of the Lord.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And now behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thee: and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a time. And immediately there fell a mist and darkness upon him: and going about, he sought some one to lead him by the hand.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then the proconsul, when he had seen what was done, believed, admiring at the doctrine of the Lord.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now when Paul and they that were with him had sailed from Paphos, they came to Perge in Pamphylia. And John departing from them, returned to Jerusalem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But they, passing through Perge, came to Antioch in Pisidia: and, entering into the Synagogue on the sabbath day, they sat down.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after the reading of the law and the prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent to them, saying: Ye men, brethren, if you have any word of exhortation to make to the people, speak.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Paul rising up and with his hand bespeaking silence, said: Ye men of Israel and you that fear God, give ear.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: The God of the people of Israel chose our fathers and exalted the people when they were sojourners in the land of Egypt: And with an high arm brought them out from thence:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And for the space of forty years endured their manners in the desert:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And, destroying seven nations in the land of Chanaan, divided their land among them by lot.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: As it were, after four hundred and fifty years. And after these things, he gave unto them judges, until Samuel the prophet.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after that they desired a king: and God gave them Saul the son of Cis, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, forty years.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had removed him, he raised them up David to be king: to whom giving testimony, he said: I have found David, the son of Jesse, a man according to my own heart, who shall do all my wills.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Of this man’s seed, God, according to his promise, hath raised up to Israel a Saviour Jesus:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: John first preaching, before his coming, the baptism of penance to all the people of Israel.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when John was fulfilling his course, he said: I am not he whom you think me to be. But behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoes of his feet I am not worthy to loose.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Men, brethren, children of the stock of Abraham, and whosoever among you fear God: to you the word of this salvation is sent.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For they that inhabited Jerusalem and the rulers thereof, not knowing him, nor the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath, judging him, have fulfilled them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And finding no cause of death in him, they desired of Pilate that they might kill him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had fulfilled all things that were written of him, taking him down from the tree, they laid him in a sepulchre.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But God raised him up from the dead the third day.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who was seen for many days by them who came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who to this present are his witnesses to the people.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And we declare unto you that the promise which was made to our fathers,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This same God hath fulfilled to our children, raising up Jesus, as in the second psalm also is written: Thou art my Son: this day have I begotten thee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And to shew that he raised him up from the dead, not to return now any more to corruption, he said thus: I will give you the holy things of David, faithful. I will give you the holy, etc.... These are the words of the prophet Isaias, 55. 3. According to the Septuagint, the sense is: I will faithfully fulfil the promises I made to David.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And therefore, in another place also, he saith: Thou shalt not suffer thy holy one to see corruption.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For David, when he had served in his generation, according to the will of God, slept: and was laid unto his fathers and saw corruption.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But he whom God hath raised from the dead saw no corruption.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Be it known therefore to you, men, brethren, that through him forgiveness of sins is preached to you: and from all the things from which you could not be justified by the law of Moses.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: In him every one that believeth is justified.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Beware, therefore, lest that come upon you which is spoken in the prophets:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Behold, ye despisers, and wonder and perish: for I work a work in your days, a work which you will not believe, if any man shall tell it you.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as they went out, they desired them that on the next sabbath they would speak unto them these words.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when the synagogue was broken up, many of the Jews and of the strangers who served God followed Paul and Barnabas: who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But the next sabbath day, the whole city almost came together, to hear the word of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the Jews, seeing the multitudes, were filled with envy and contradicted those things which were said by Paul, blaspheming.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Paul and Barnabas said boldly: To you it behoved us first to speak the word of God: but because you reject it and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold we turn to the Gentiles.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For so the Lord hath commanded us: I have set thee to be the light of the Gentiles: that thou mayest be for salvation unto the utmost part of the earth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the Gentiles hearing it were glad and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained to life everlasting believed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the word of the Lord was published throughout the whole country.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But the Jews stirred up religious and honourable women and the chief men of the city: and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas: and cast them out of their coasts.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But they, shaking off the dust of their feet against them, came to Iconium.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Ghost. Acts Chapter 14 Paul and Barnabas preach in Iconium and Lystra. Paul heals a cripple. They are taken for gods. Paul is stoned. They preach in Derbe and Perge.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it came to pass in Iconium that they entered together into the synagogue of the Jews and so spoke that a very great multitude both of the Jews and of the Greeks did believe.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up and incensed the minds of the Gentiles against the brethren.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: A long time therefore they abode there, dealing confidently in the Lord, who gave testimony to the word of his grace, granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the multitude of the city was divided. And some of them indeed held with the Jews, but some with the apostles.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when there was an assault made by the Gentiles and the Jews with their rulers, to use them contumeliously and to stone them:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: They, understanding it, fled to Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and to the whole country round about: and were there preaching the gospel.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there sat a certain man at Lystra, impotent in his feet, a cripple from his mother’s womb, who never had walked.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This same heard Paul speaking. Who looking upon him and seeing that he had faith to be healed,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Said with a loud voice: Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped up and walked.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when the multitudes had seen what Paul had done, they lifted up their voice in the Lycaonian tongue, saying: The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they called Barnabas, Jupiter: but Paul, Mercury: because he was chief speaker.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: The priest also of Jupiter that was before the city, bringing oxen and garlands before the gate, would have offered sacrifice with the people.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Which, when the apostles Barnabas and Paul had heard, rending their clothes, they leaped out among the people, crying,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And saying: Ye men, why do ye these things? We also are mortals, men like unto you, preaching to you to be converted from these vain things to the living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all things that are in them:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who in times past, suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Nevertheless he left not himself without testimony, doing good from heaven, giving rains and fruitful Seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And speaking these things, they scarce restrained the people from sacrificing to them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now there came thither certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium: and, persuading the multitude and stoning Paul, drew him out of the city, thinking him to be dead.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But as the disciples stood round about him, he rose up and entered into the city: and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had preached the gospel to that city and had taught many, they returned again to Lystra and to Iconium and to Antioch:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Confirming the souls of the disciples and exhorting them to continue in the faith: and that through many tribulations we must enter into the kingdom of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had ordained to them priests in every church and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, in whom they believed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And passing through Pisidia, they came into Pamphylia.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And having spoken the word of the Lord in Perge, they went down into Attalia.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And thence they sailed to Antioch, from whence they had been delivered to the grace of God, unto the work which they accomplished.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they were come and had assembled the church, they related what great things God had done with them and how he had opened the door of faith to the Gentiles.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they abode no small time with the disciples. Acts Chapter 15 A dissension about circumcision. The decision and letter of the council of Jerusalem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And some, coming down from Judea, taught the brethren: That, except you be circumcised after the manner of Moses, you cannot be saved.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when Paul and Barnabas had no small contest with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas and certain others of the other side should go up to the apostles and priests to Jerusalem, about this question.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: They therefore, being brought on their way by the church, passed through Phenice and Samaria, relating the conversion of the Gentiles. And they caused great joy to all the brethren.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received by the church and by the apostles and ancients, declaring how great things God had done with them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But there arose of the sect of the Pharisees some that believed, saying: They must be circumcised and be commanded to observe the law of Moses.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the apostles and ancients assembled to consider of this matter.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when there had been much disputing, Peter, rising up, said to them: Men, brethren, you know that in former days God made choice among us, that by my mouth the Gentiles should hear the word of the gospel and believe.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And God, who knoweth the hearts, gave testimony, giving unto them the Holy Ghost, as well as to us:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now therefore, why tempt you God to put a yoke upon the necks of the disciples which neither our fathers nor we have been able to bear?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But by the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, we believe to be saved, in like manner as they also.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And all the multitude held their peace: and they heard Barnabas and Paul telling what great signs and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying: Men, brethren, hear me.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Simon hath related how God first visited to take of the Gentiles, a people to his name.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And to this agree the words of the prophets, as it is written:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: After these things I will return and will rebuild the tabernacle of David, which is fallen down: and the ruins thereof I will rebuild. And I will set it up:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: That the residue of men may seek after the Lord, and all nations upon whom my name is invoked, saith the Lord, who doth these things.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: To the Lord was his own work known from the beginning of the world.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For which cause I judge that they who from among the Gentiles are converted to God are not to be disquieted:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But that we write unto them, that they refrain themselves from the pollutions of idols and from fornication and from things strangled and from blood.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him in the synagogues, where he is read every sabbath.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then it pleased the apostles and ancients, with the whole church, to choose men of their own company and to send to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas, namely, Judas, who was surnamed Barsabas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Writing by their hands: The apostles and ancients, brethren, to the brethren of the Gentiles that are at Antioch and in Syria and Cilicia, greeting.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Forasmuch as we have heard that some going out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, to whom we gave no commandment:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: It hath seemed good to us, being assembled together, to choose out men and to send them unto you, with our well beloved Barnabas and Paul:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Men that have given their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who themselves also will, by word of mouth, tell you the same things.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For it hath seemed good to the Holy Ghost and to us to lay no further burden upon you than these necessary things:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: That you abstain from things sacrificed to idols and from blood and from things strangled and from fornication: from which things keeping yourselves, you shall do well. Fare ye well. From blood, and from things strangled.... The use of these things, though of their own nature indifferent, was here prohibited, to bring the Jews more easily to admit of the society of the Gentiles; and to exercise the latter in obedience. But this prohibition was but temporary, and has long since ceased to oblige; more especially in the western churches.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: They therefore, being dismissed, went down to Antioch and, gathering together the multitude, delivered the epistle.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Which when they had read, they rejoiced for the consolation.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Judas and Silas, being prophets also themselves, with many words comforted the brethren and confirmed them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after they had spent some time there, they were let go with peace by the brethren unto them that had sent them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But it seemed good unto Silas to remain there: and Judas alone departed to Jerusalem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Paul and Barnabas continued at Antioch, teaching and preaching, with many others, the word of the Lord.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after some days, Paul said to Barnabas: Let us return and visit our brethren in all the cities wherein we have preached the word of the Lord, to see how they do.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Barnabas would have taken with them John also, that was surnamed Mark.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Paul desired that he (as having departed from them out of Pamphylia and not gone with them to the work) might not be received.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there arose a dissension so that they departed one from another. And Barnabas indeed, taking Mark, sailed to Cyprus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Paul, choosing Silas, departed, being delivered by the brethren to the grace of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches, commanding them to keep the precepts of the apostles and the ancients. Acts Chapter 16 Paul visits the churches. He is called to preach in Macedonia. He is scourged at Philippi.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he came to Derbe and Lystra. And behold, there was a certain disciple there named Timothy, the son of a Jewish woman that believed: but his father was a Gentile.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: To this man the brethren that were in Lystra and Iconium gave a good testimony.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Him Paul would have to go along with him: and taking him, he circumcised him, because of the Jews who were in those places. For they all knew that his father was a Gentile.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as they passed through the cities, they delivered unto them the decrees for to keep, that were decreed by the apostles and ancients who were at Jerusalem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the churches were confirmed in faith and increased in number daily.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had passed through Phrygia and the country of Galatia, they were forbidden by the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they were come into Mysia, they attempted to go into Bithynia: and the Spirit of Jesus suffered them not.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had passed through Mysia, they went down to Troas.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And a vision was shewed to Paul in the night, which was a man of Macedonia standing and beseeching him and saying: Pass over into Macedonia and help us.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as soon as he had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go into Macedonia: being assured that God had called us to preach the gospel to them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And sailing from Troas, we came with a straight course to Samothracia, and the day following to Neapolis.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And from thence to Philippi, which is the chief city of part of Macedonia, a colony. And we were in this city some days conferring together.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And upon the Sabbath day, we went forth without the gate by a river side, where it seemed that there was prayer: and sitting down, we spoke to the women that were assembled.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And a certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, one that worshipped God, did hear: whose heart the Lord opened to attend to those things which were said by Paul.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when she was baptized, and her household, she besought us, saying: If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house and abide there. And she constrained us.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain girl having a pythonical spirit met us, who brought to her masters much gain by divining. A pythonical spirit.... That is, a spirit pretending to divine, and tell fortunes.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This same following Paul and us, cried out, saying: These men are the servants of the Most High God, who preach unto you the way of salvation.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And this she did many days. But Paul being grieved, turned and said to the spirit: I command thee, in the name of Jesus Christ, to go out from her. And he went out the same hour.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But her masters, seeing that the hope of their gain was gone, apprehending Paul and Silas, brought them into the market place to the rulers.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And presenting them to the magistrates, they said: These men disturb our city, being Jews:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And preach a fashion which it is not lawful for us to receive nor observe, being Romans.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the people ran together against them: and the magistrates, rending off their clothes, commanded them to be beaten with rods.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they cast them into prison, charging the gaoler to keep them diligently.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who having received such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison and made their feet fast in the stocks.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And at midnight, Paul and Silas, praying, praised God. And they that were in prison heard them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken. And immediately all the doors were opened and the bands of all were loosed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the keeper of the prison, awakening out of his sleep and seeing the doors of the prison open, drawing his sword, would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had been fled.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying: Do thyself no harm, for we all are here.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then calling for a light, he went in: and trembling, fell down at the feet of Paul and Silas.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And bringing them out, he said: Masters, what must I do, that I may be saved?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But they said: believe in the Lord Jesus: and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they preached the word of the Lord to him and to all that were in his house.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he, taking them the same hour of the night, washed their stripes: and himself was baptized, and all his house immediately.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had brought them into his own house, he laid the table for them: and rejoiced with all his house, believing God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when the day was come, the magistrates sent the serjeants, saying: Let those men go.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the keeper of the prison told these words to Paul: The magistrates have sent to let you go. Now therefore depart. And go in peace.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Paul said to them: They have beaten us publicly, uncondemned, men that are Romans, and have cast us into prison. And now do they thrust us out privately? Not so: but let them come.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And let us out themselves. And the serjeants told these words to the magistrates. And they were afraid: hearing that they were Romans.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And coming, they besought them: and bringing them out, they desired them to depart out of the city.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they went out of the prison and entered into the house of Lydia: and having seen the brethren, they comforted them and departed. Acts Chapter 17 Paul preaches to the Thessalonians and Bereans. His discourse to the Athenians.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a synagogue of the Jews.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Paul, according to his custom, went in unto them. And for three sabbath days he reasoned with them out of the scriptures:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Declaring and insinuating that the Christ was to suffer and to rise again from the dead; and that this is Jesus Christ, whom I preach to you.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And some of them believed and were associated to Paul and Silas: and of those that served God and of the Gentiles a great multitude: and of noble women not a few.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But the Jews, moved with envy and taking unto them some wicked men of the vulgar sort and making a tumult, set the city in an uproar: and besetting Jason’s house, sought to bring them out unto the people.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And not finding them, they drew Jason and certain brethren to the rulers of the city, crying: They that set the city in an uproar are come hither also: City. Urbem.... In the Greek, the world.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Whom Jason hath received. And these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they stirred up the people: and the rulers of the city, hearing these things,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And having taken satisfaction of Jason and of the rest, they let them go.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea. Who, when they were come thither, went into the synagogue of the Jews.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now these were more noble than those in Thessalonica, who received the word with all eagerness, daily searching the scriptures, whether these things were so. More noble.... The Jews of Berea are justly commended, for their eagerly embracing the truth, and searching the scriptures, to find out the texts alleged by the apostle: which was a far more generous proceeding than that of their countrymen at Thessalonica, who persecuted the preachers of the gospel, without examining the grounds they alleged for what they taught.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And many indeed of them believed: and of honourable women that were Gentiles and of men, not a few.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was also preached by Paul at Berea, they came thither also, stirring up and troubling the multitude.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul, to go unto the sea: but Silas and Timothy remained there.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they that conducted Paul brought him as far as Athens: and receiving a commandment from him to Silas and Timothy, that they should come to him with all speed, they departed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now whilst Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred within him, seeing the city wholly given to idolatry.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: He disputed, therefore, in the synagogue with the Jews and with them that served God: and in the market place, every day, with them that were there.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And certain philosophers of the Epicureans and of the Stoics disputed with him. And some said: What is it that this word sower would say? But others: He seemeth to be a setter forth of new gods. Because he preached to them Jesus and the resurrection.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And taking him, they brought him to the Areopagus, saying: May we know what this new doctrine is, which thou speakest of?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For thou bringest in certain new things to our ears. We would know therefore what these things mean.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: (Now all the Athenians and strangers that were there employed themselves in nothing else, but either in telling or in hearing some new thing.)

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Paul, standing in the midst of the Areopagus, said: Ye men of Athens, I perceive that in all things you are too superstitious.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For passing by and seeing your idols, I found an altar also, on which was written: To the Unknown God. What therefore you worship without knowing it, that I preach to you:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: God, who made the world and all things therein, he being Lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in temples made with hands. Dwelleth not in temples.... God is not contained in temples; so as to need them for his dwelling, or any other uses, as the heathens imagined. Yet by his omnipresence, he is both there and everywhere.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Neither is he served with men’s hands, as though he needed any thing: seeing it is he who giveth to all life and breath and all things:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And hath made of one, all mankind, to dwell upon the whole face of the earth, determining appointed times and the limits of their habitation.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: That they should seek God, if haply they may feel after him or find him, although he be not far from every one of us.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For in him we live and move and are: as some also of your own poets said: For we are also his offspring.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Being therefore the offspring of God, we must not suppose the divinity to be like unto gold or silver or stone, the graving of art and device of man.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And God indeed having winked at the times of this ignorance, now declareth unto men that all should every where do penance.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Because he hath appointed a day wherein he will judge the world in equity, by the man whom he hath appointed: giving faith to all, by raising him up from the dead.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had heard of the resurrection of the dead, some indeed mocked. But others said: We will hear thee again concerning this matter.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: So Paul went out from among them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But certain men, adhering to him, did believe: among whom was also Dionysius the Areopagite and a woman named Damaris and others with them. Acts Chapter 18 Paul founds the church of Corinth and preaches at Ephesus and in other places. Apollo goes to Corinth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: After these things, departing from Athens, he came to Corinth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And finding a certain Jew, named Aquila, born in Pontus, lately come from Italy, with Priscilla his wife (because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome), he came to them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And because he was of the same trade, he remained with them and wrought. (Now they were tentmakers by trade.)

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, bringing in the name of the Lord Jesus. And he persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when Silas and Timothy were come from Macedonia, Paul was earnest in preaching, testifying to the Jews that Jesus is the Christ.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But they gainsaying and blaspheming, he shook his garments and said to them: Your blood be upon your own heads: I am clean. From henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And departing thence, he entered into the house of a certain man, named Titus Justus, one that worshipped God, whose house was adjoining to the synagogue.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue, believed in the Lord, with all his house. And many of the Corinthians hearing, believed and were baptized.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the Lord said to Paul in the night, by a vision: Do not fear, but speak. And hold not thy peace,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Because I am with thee and no man shall set upon thee, to hurt thee. For I have much people in this city.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he stayed there a year and six months, teaching among them the word of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one accord rose up against Paul and brought him to the judgment seat,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Saying: This man persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when Paul was beginning to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews: If it were some matter of injustice or an heinous deed, O Jews, I should with reason bear with you.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But if they be questions of word and names and of your law, look you to it. I will not be judge of such things.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he drove them from the judgment seat.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And all laying hold on Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, beat him before the judgment seat. And Gallio cared for none of those things.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Paul, when he had stayed yet many days, taking his leave of the brethren, sailed thence into Syria (and with him Priscilla and Aquila), having shorn his head in Cenchrae. For he had a vow.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he came to Ephesus and left them there. But he himself, entering into the synagogue, disputed with the Jews.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they desired him that he would tarry a longer time, he consented not:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But taking his leave and saying: I will return to you again, God willing, he departed from Ephesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And going down to Cæsarea, he went up to Jerusalem and saluted the church: and so came down to Antioch.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after he had spent some time there, he departed and went through the country of Galatia and Phrygia, in order, confirming all the disciples.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now a certain Jew, named Apollo, born at Alexandria, an eloquent man, came to Ephesus, one mighty in the scriptures.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord: and being fervent in spirit, spoke and taught diligently the things that are of Jesus, knowing only the baptism of John.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This man therefore began to speak boldly in the synagogue. Whom when Priscilla and Aquila had heard, they took him to them and expounded to him the way of the Lord more diligently.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And whereas he was desirous to go to Achaia, the brethren exhorting wrote to the disciples to receive him. Who, when he was come, helped them much who had believed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For with much vigour he convinced the Jews openly, shewing by the scriptures that Jesus is the Christ. Acts Chapter 19 Paul establishes the church at Ephesus. The tumult of the silversmiths.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it came to pass, while Apollo was at Corinth, that Paul, having passed through the upper coasts, came to Ephesus and found certain disciples.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he said to them: Have you received the Holy Ghost since ye believed? But they said to him: We have not so much as heard whether there be a Holy Ghost.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he said: In what then were you baptized? Who said: In John’s baptism.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Paul said: John baptized the people with the baptism of penance saying: That they should believe in him, who was to come after him, that is to say, in Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Having heard these things, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when Paul had imposed his hands on them, the Holy Ghost came upon them: and they spoke with tongues and prophesied.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And all the men were about twelve.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And entering into the synagogue, he spoke boldly for the space of three months, disputing and exhorting concerning the kingdom of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But when some were hardened and believed not, speaking evil of the way of the Lord before the multitude, departing from them, he separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And this continued for the space of two years, so that all who dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord, both Jews and Gentiles.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And God wrought by the hand of Paul more than common miracles.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: So that even there were brought from his body to the sick, handkerchiefs and aprons: and the diseases departed from them: and the wicked spirits went out of them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now some also of the Jewish exorcists, who went about, attempted to invoke over them that had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying: I conjure you by Jesus, whom Paul preacheth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there were certain men, seven sons of Sceva, a Jew, a chief priest, that did this.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But the wicked spirit, answering, said to them: Jesus I know: and Paul I know. But who are you?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the man in whom the wicked spirit was, leaping upon them and mastering them both, prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And this became known to all the Jews and the Gentiles that dwelt a Ephesus. And fear fell on them all: and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And many of them that believed came, confessing and declaring their deeds.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And many of them who had followed curious arts brought together their books and burnt them before all. And, counting the price of them, they found the money to be fifty thousand pieces of silver.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: So mightily grew the word of God and was confirmed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when these things were ended, Paul purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying: After I have been there, I must see Rome also.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And sending into Macedonia two of them that ministered to him, Timothy and Erastus, he himself remained for a time in Asia.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now at that time there arose no small disturbance about the way of the Lord.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith, who made silver temples for Diana, brought no small gain to the craftsmen.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Whom he calling together with the workmen of like occupation, said: Sirs, you know that our gain is by this trade.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And you see and hear that this Paul, by persuasion hath drawn away a great multitude, not only of Ephesus, but almost of all Asia, saying: they are not gods which are made by hands.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
