Text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought, but also the temple of great Diana shall be reputed for nothing! Yea, and her majesty shall begin to be destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worshippeth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Having heard these things, they were full of anger and cried out, saying: Great is Diana of the Ephesians!

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the whole city was filled with confusion. And having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul’s companions, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And some also of the rulers of Asia, who were his friends, sent unto him, desiring that he would not venture himself into the theatre.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now some cried one thing, some another. For the assembly was confused: and the greater part knew not for what cause they were come together.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they drew forth Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews thrusting him forward. And Alexander, beckoning with his hand for silence, would have given the people satisfaction,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But as soon as they perceived him to be a Jew, all with one voice, for the space of about two, hours, cried out: Great is Diana of the Ephesians!

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when the town clerk had appeased the multitudes, he said: Ye men of Ephesus, what man is there that knoweth not that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great Diana and of Jupiter’s offspring?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For as much therefore as these things cannot be contradicted, you ought to be quiet and to do nothing rashly.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For you have brought hither these men, who are neither guilty of sacrilege nor of blasphemy against your goddess.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But if Demetrius and the craftsmen that are with him have a matter against any man, the courts of justice are open: and there are proconsuls. Let them accuse one another.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And if you inquire after any other matter, it may be decided in a lawful assembly.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For we are even in danger to be called in question for this day’s uproar, there being no man guilty (of whom we may give account) of this concourse. And when he had said these things, he dismissed the assembly. Acts Chapter 20 Paul passes through Macedonia and Greece. He raises a dead man to life at Troas. His discourse to the clergy of Ephesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after the tumult was ceased, Paul calling to him the disciples and exhorting them, took his leave and set forward to go into Macedonia.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had gone over those parts and had exhorted them with many words, he came into Greece:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Where, when he had spent three months, the Jews laid wait for him, as he was about to sail into Syria. So he took a resolution to return through Macedonia.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there accompanied him Sopater, the son of Pyrrhus, of Berea: and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus: and Gaius of Derbe and Timothy: and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: These, going before, stayed for us at Troas.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But we sailed from Philippi after the days of the azymes and came to them to Troas in five days, where we abode seven days.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And on the first day of the week, when we were assembled to break bread, Paul discoursed with them, being to depart on the morrow. And he continued his speech until midnight. And on the first day of the week.... Here St. Chrysostom and many other interpreters of the scripture explain, that the Christians even at this time, must have changed the sabbath into the first day of the week, (the Lord’s day,) as all Christians now keep it. This change was undoubtedly made by the authority of the church; hence the exercise of the power, which Christ had given to her: for he is Lord of the sabbath.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there were a great number of lamps in the upper chamber where we were assembled.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And a certain young man named Eutychus, sitting on the window, being oppressed with a deep sleep (as Paul was long preaching), by occasion of his sleep fell from the third loft down and was taken up dead.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: To whom, when Paul had gone down, he laid himself upon him and, embracing him, said: Be not troubled, for his soul is in him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then going up and breaking bread and tasting and having talked a long time to them, until daylight, so he departed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they brought the youth alive and were not a little comforted.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But we going aboard the ship, sailed to Assos, being there to take in Paul. For so he had appointed, himself purposing to travel by land.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had met with us at Assos, we took him in and came to Mitylene.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And sailing thence, the day following we came over against Chios: and the next day we arrived at Samos: and the day following we came to Miletus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus, lest he should be stayed any time in Asia. For he hasted, if it were possible for him, to keep the day of Pentecost at Jerusalem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And sending from Miletus to Ephesus, he called the ancients of the church.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they were come to him and were together, he said to them: You know from the first day that I came into Asia, in what manner I have been with you, for all the time.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Serving the Lord with all humility and with tears and temptations which befell me by the conspiracies of the Jews:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: How I have kept back nothing that was profitable to you, but have preached it to you, and taught you publicly, and from house to house,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Testifying both to Jews and Gentiles penance towards God and faith in our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And now, behold, being bound in the spirit, I go to Jerusalem: not knowing the things which shall befall me there:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Save that the Holy Ghost in every city witnesseth to me, saying: That bands and afflictions wait for me at Jerusalem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But I fear none of these things, neither do I count my life more precious than myself, so that I may consummate my course and the ministry of the word which I received from the Lord Jesus, to testify the gospel of the grace of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And now behold, I know that all you, among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God, shall see my face no more.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Wherefore I take you to witness this day that I am clear from the blood of all men.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For I have not spared to declare unto you all, the counsel of God.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Take heed to yourselves and to the whole flock, wherein the Holy Ghost hath placed you bishops, to rule the Church of God which he hath purchased with his own blood.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: I know that after my departure ravening wolves will enter in among you, not sparing the flock.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And of your own selves shall arise men speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Therefore watch, keeping in memory that for three years I ceased not with tears to admonish every one of you, night and day.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And now I commend you to God and to the word of his grace, who is able to build up and to give an inheritance among all the sanctified.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: I have not coveted any man’s silver, gold or apparel, as

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: You yourselves know. For such things as were needful for me and them that are with me, these hands have furnished.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring you ought to support the weak and to remember the word of the Lord Jesus, how he said: It is a more blessed thing to give, rather than to receive.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had said these things, kneeling down, he prayed with them all.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there was much weeping among them all. And falling on the neck of Paul, they kissed him,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Being grieved most of all for the word which he had said, that they should see his face no more. And they brought him on his way to the ship. Acts Chapter 21 Paul goes up to Jerusalem. He is apprehended by the Jews in the temple.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when it came to pass that, being parted from them, we set sail, we came with a straight course to Coos, and the day following to Rhodes: and from thence to Patara.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when we had found a ship sailing over to Phenice, we went aboard and set forth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when we had discovered Cyprus, leaving it on the left hand, we sailed into Syria, and came to Tyre: for there the ship was to unlade her burden.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And finding disciples, we tarried there seven days: who said to Paul, through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the days being expired, departing we went forward, they all bringing us on our way, with their wives and children, till we were out of the city. And we kneeled down on the shore: and we prayed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when we had bid one another farewell, we took ship. And they returned home.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But we, having finished the voyage by sea, from Tyre came down to Ptolemais: and saluting the brethren, we abode one day with them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the next day departing, we came to Cæsarea. And entering into the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, we abode with him. The evangelist.... That is, the preacher of the gospel; the same that before converted the Samaritans, and baptized the eunuch, chap. 8., being one of the first seven deacons.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he had four daughters, virgins, who did prophesy.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as we tarried there for some days, there came from Judea a certain prophet, named Agabus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who, when he was come to us, took Paul’s girdle: and binding his own feet and hands, he said: Thus saith the Holy Ghost: The man whose girdle this is, the Jews shall bind in this manner in Jerusalem and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Which when we had heard, both we and they that were of that place desired him that he would not go up to Jerusalem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Paul answered and said: What do you mean, weeping and afflicting my heart? For I am ready not only to be bound, but to die also in Jerusalem, for the name of the Lord Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when we could not persuade him, we ceased, saying: The will of the Lord be done.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after those days, being prepared, we went up to Jerusalem.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there went also with us some of the disciples from Cæsarea, bringing with them one Mnason a Cyprian, an old disciple, with whom we should lodge.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the day following, Paul went in with us unto James: and all the ancients were assembled.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Whom when he had saluted, he related particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But they hearing it, glorified God and said to him: Thou seest, brother, how many thousands there are among the Jews that have believed: and they are all zealous for the law.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now they have heard of thee that thou teachest those Jews, who are among the Gentiles to depart from Moses: saying that they ought not to circumcise their children, nor walk according to the custom.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: What is it therefore? The multitude must needs come together: for they will hear that thou art come.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Do therefore this that we say to thee. We have four men, who have a vow on them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Take these and sanctify thyself with them: and bestow on them, that they may shave their heads. And all will know that the things which they have heard of thee are false: but that thou thyself also walkest keeping the law. Keeping the law.... The law, though now no longer obligatory, was for a time observed by the Christian Jews: to bury, as it were, the synagogue with honour.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But, as touching the Gentiles that believe, we have written, decreeing that they should only refrain themselves from that which has been offered to idols and from blood and from things strangled and from fornication.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Paul took the men and, the next day being purified with them, entered into the temple, giving notice of the accomplishment of the days of purification, until an oblation should be offered for every one of them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But when the seven days were drawing to an end, those Jews that were of Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the people and laid hands upon him, crying out:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Men of Israel, help: This is the man that teacheth all men every where against the people and the law and this place; and moreover hath brought in Gentiles into the temple and hath violated this holy place.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: (For they had seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with him. whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.)

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the whole city was in an uproar: and the people ran together. And taking Paul, they drew him out of the temple: and immediately the doors were shut.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as they went about to kill him, it was told the tribune of the band that all Jerusalem was in confusion.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who, forthwith taking with him soldiers and centurions, ran down to them. And when they saw the tribune and the soldiers, they left off beating Paul.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then the tribune, coming near, took him and commanded him to be bound with two chains: and demanded who he was and what he had done.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And some cried one thing, some another, among the multitude. And when he could not know the certainty for the tumult, he commanded him to be carried into the castle.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he was come to the stairs, it fell out that he was carried by the soldiers, because of the violence of the people.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For the multitude of the people followed after, crying: Away with him!

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as Paul was about to be brought into the castle, he saith to the tribune: May I speak something to thee? Who said: Canst thou speak Greek?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Art not thou that Egyptian who before these days didst raise a tumult and didst lead forth into the desert four thousand men that were murderers?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Paul said to him: I am a Jew of Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no mean city. And I beseech thee, suffer me to speak to the people.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had given him leave, Paul standing on the stairs, beckoned with his hand to the people. And a great silence being made, he spoke unto them in the Hebrew tongue, saying: Acts Chapter 22 Paul declares to the people the history of his conversion. He escapes scourging by claiming the privilege of a Roman citizen.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Men, brethren and fathers, hear ye the account which I now give unto you.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: (And when they heard that he spoke to them in the Hebrew tongue, they kept the more silence.)

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he saith: I am a Jew, born at Tarsus in Cilicia, but brought up in this city, at the feet of Gamaliel, taught according to the truth of the law of the fathers, zealous for the law, as also all you are this day:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who persecuted this way unto death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: As the high priest doth bear me witness and all the ancients. From whom also receiving letters to the brethren, I went to Damascus, that I might bring them bound from thence to Jerusalem to be punished.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it came to pass, as I was going and drawing nigh to Damascus, at mid-day, that suddenly from heaven there shone round about me a great light:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And falling on the ground, I heard a voice saying to me: Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And I answered: Who art thou, Lord? And he said to me: I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom thou persecutest.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they that were with me saw indeed the light: but they heard not the voice of him that spoke with me. Heard not the voice.... That is, they distinguished not the words; though they heard the voice. Acts 9. 7.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And I said: What shall I do, Lord? And the Lord said to me: Arise and go to Damascus; and there it shall be told thee of all things that thou must do.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And whereas I did not see for the brightness of that light, being led by the hand by my companions, I came to Damascus,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And one Ananias, a man according to the law, having testimony of all the Jews who dwelt there,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Coming to me and standing by me, said to me: Brother Saul, look up. And I, the same hour, looked upon him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But he said: The God of our fathers hath preordained thee that thou shouldst know his will and see the Just One and shouldst hear the voice from his mouth. Just One.... Our Saviour, who appeared to St. Paul, Acts 9. 17.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For thou shalt be his witness to all men of those things which thou hast seen and heard.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And now why tarriest thou? Rise up and be baptized and wash away thy sins, invoking his name.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it came to pass, when I was come again to Jerusalem and was praying in the temple, that I was in a trance,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And saw him saying unto me: Make haste and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem: because they will not receive thy testimony concerning me.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And I said: Lord, they know that I cast into prison and beat in every synagogue them that believed in thee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when the blood of Stephen thy witness was shed, I stood by and consented: and kept the garments of them that killed him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he said to me: Go, for unto the Gentiles afar off will I send thee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they heard him until this word and then lifted up their voice, saying: Away with such an one from the earth. For it is not fit that he should live.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as they cried out and threw off their garments and cast dust into the air,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: The tribune commanded him to be brought into the castle, and that he should be scourged and tortured: to know for what cause they did so cry out against him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had bound him with thongs, Paul saith to the centurion that stood by him: Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman and uncondemned?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Which the centurion hearing, went to the tribune and told him, saying: What art thou about to do? For this man is a Roman citizen.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the tribune coming, said to him: Tell me. Art thou a Roman? But he said: Yea.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the tribune answered: I obtained the being free of this city with a great sum. And Paul said: But I was born so.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Immediately therefore they departed from him that were about to torture him. The tribune also was afraid after he understood that he was a Roman citizen and because he had bound him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But on the next day, meaning to know more diligently for what cause he was accused by the Jews, he loosed him and commanded the priests to come together and all the council: and, bringing forth Paul, he set him before them. Acts Chapter 23 Paul stands before the council. The Jews conspire his death. He is sent away to Cesarea.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Paul, looking upon the council, said: Men, brethren, I have conversed with all good conscience before God until this present day.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the high priest, Ananias, commanded them that stood by him to strike him on the mouth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Paul said to him: God shall strike thee, thou whited wall. For, sittest thou to judge me according to the law and, contrary to the law, commandest me to be struck?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they that stood by said: Dost thou revile the high priest of God?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Paul said: I knew not, brethren, that he is the high priest. For it is written: Thou shalt not speak evil of the prince of thy people.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Paul, knowing that the one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees, cried out in the council: Men, brethren, I am a Pharisee, the son of Pharisees: concerning the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had so said, there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees. And the multitude was divided.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel, nor spirit: but the Pharisees confess both.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there arose a great cry. And some of the Pharisees rising up, strove, saying: We find no evil in this man. What if a spirit hath spoken to him, or an angel?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when there arose a great dissension, the tribune, fearing lest Paul should be pulled in pieces by them, commanded the soldiers to go down and to take him by force from among them and to bring him into the castle.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the night following, the Lord standing by him, said: Be constant: for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when day was come, some of the Jews gathered together and bound themselves under a curse, saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they killed Paul.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And they were more than forty men that had made this conspiracy.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who came to the chief priests and the ancients and said: We have bound ourselves under a great curse that we will eat nothing till we have slain Paul.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now therefore do you with the council signify to the tribune, that he bring him forth to you, as if you meant to know something more certain touching him. And we, before he come near, are ready to kill him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Which when Paul’s sister’s son had heard, of their lying in wait, he came and entered into the castle and told Paul.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Paul, calling to him one of the centurions, said: Bring this young man to the tribune: for he hath some thing to tell him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he, taking him, brought him to the tribune and said: Paul, the prisoner, desired me to bring this young man unto thee, who hath some thing to say to thee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the tribune, taking him by the hand, went aside with him privately and asked him: What is it that thou hast to tell me?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he said: The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldst bring forth Paul to-morrow into the council, as if they meant to inquire some thing more certain touching him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But do not thou give credit to them: for there lie in wait for him more than forty men of them, who have bound themselves by oath neither to eat nor to drink, till they have killed him. And they are now ready, looking for a promise from thee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: The tribune therefore dismissed the young man, charging him that he should tell no man that he had made known these things unto him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then having called two centurions, he said to them: Make ready two hundred soldiers to go as far as Cæsarea: and seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmen, for the third hour of the night.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And provide beasts, that they may set Paul on and bring him safe to Felix the governor.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: (For he feared lest perhaps the Jews might take him away by force and kill him: and he should afterwards be slandered, as if he was to take money.) And he wrote a letter after this manner:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Claudius Lysias to the most excellent governor, Felix, greeting:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: This man, being taken by the Jews and ready to be killed by them, I rescued, coming in with an army, understanding that he is a Roman.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And meaning to know the cause which they objected unto him, I brought him forth into their council.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Whom I found to be accused concerning questions of their law; but having nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bands.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when I was told of ambushes that they had prepared for him, I sent him to thee, signifying also to his accusers to plead before thee. Farewell.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then the soldiers, according as it was commanded them, taking Paul, brought him by night to Antipatris.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the next day, leaving the horsemen to go with him, they returned to the castle.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who, when they were come to Cæsarea and had delivered the letter to the governor, did also present Paul before him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had read it and had asked of what province he was and understood that he was of Cilicia:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: I will hear thee, said he, when thy accusers come. And he commanded him to be kept in Herod’s judgment hall. Acts Chapter 24 Paul defends his innocence before Felix the governor. He preaches the faith to him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after five days, the high priest, Ananias, came down with some ancients and one Tertullus, an orator, who went to the governor against Paul.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Paul being called for, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying: Whereas, through thee we live in much peace and many things are rectified by thy providence,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: We accept it always and in all places, most excellent Felix, with all thanksgiving.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But that I be no further tedious to thee, I desire thee of thy clemency to hear us in a few words.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: We have found this to be a pestilent man and raising seditions among all the Jews throughout the world: and author of the sedition of the sect of the Nazarenes.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple: whom, we having apprehended, would also have judged according to our law.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Lysias the tribune, coming upon us with great violence, took him away out of our hands;

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Commanding his accusers to come to thee. Of whom thou mayest thyself, by examination, have knowledge of all these things whereof we accuse him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the Jews also added and said that these things were so.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Paul answered (the governor making a sign to him to speak): Knowing that for many years thou hast been judge over this nation, I will with good courage answer for myself.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For thou mayest understand that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to adore in Jerusalem:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And neither in the temple did they find me disputing with any man or causing any concourse of the people: neither in the synagogues, nor in the city.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Neither can they prove unto thee the things whereof they now accuse me.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But this I confess to thee that according to the way which they call a heresy, so do I serve the Father and my God, believing all things which are written in the law and the prophets:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Having hope in God, which these also themselves look for, that there shall be a resurrection of the just and unjust.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And herein do I endeavour to have always a conscience without offence, towards God and towards men.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now after many years, I came to bring alms to my nation and offerings and vows.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: In which I was found purified in the temple: neither with multitude nor with tumult.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But certain Jews of Asia, who ought to be present before thee and to accuse, if they had anything against me:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Or let these men themselves say if they found in me any iniquity, when standing before the council,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Except it be for this one voice only that I cried, standing among them: Concerning the resurrection of the dead am I judged this day by you.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Felix put them off, having most certain knowledge of this way, saying: When Lysias the tribune shall come down, I will hear you.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he commanded a centurion to keep him: and that he should be easy and that he should not prohibit any of his friends to minister unto him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after some days, Felix, coming with Drusilla his wife, who was a Jew, sent for Paul and heard of him the faith that is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as he treated of justice and chastity and of the judgment to come, Felix, being terrified, answered: For this time, go thy way: but when I have a convenient time, I will send for thee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Hoping also withal that money should be given him by Paul: for which cause also oftentimes sending for him, he spoke with him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But when two years were ended, Felix had for successor Portius Festus. And Felix being willing to shew the Jews a pleasure, left Paul bound. Acts Chapter 25 Paul appeals to Caesar. King Agrippa desires to hear him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now when Festus was come into the province, after three days, he went up to Jerusalem from Cæsarea.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the chief priests and principal men of the Jews went unto him against Paul: and they besought him,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Requesting favour against him, that he would command him to be brought to Jerusalem, laying wait to kill him in the way.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Festus answered: That Paul was kept in Cæsarea: and that he himself would very shortly depart thither.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Let them, therefore, saith he, among you that are able, go down with me and accuse him, if there be any crime in the man.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And having tarried among them no more than eight or ten days, he went down to Cæsarea. And the next day, he sat in the judgment seat and commanded Paul to be brought.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who being brought, the Jews stood about him, who were come down from Jerusalem, objecting many and grievious causes, which they could not prove:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Paul making answer for himself: Neither against the law of the Jews, nor against the temple, nor against Caesar, have I offended in any thing.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Festus, willing to shew the Jews a pleasure, answering Paul, said: Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem and there be judged of these things before me?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Paul said: I stand at Caesar’s judgment seat, where I ought to be judged. To the Jews I have done no injury, as thou very well knowest.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For if I have injured them or have committed any thing worthy of death, I refuse not to die. But if there be none of these things whereof they accuse me, no man may deliver me to them. I appeal to Caesar.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Festus, having conferred with the council, answered: Hast thou appealed to Caesar? To Caesar shalt thou go.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after some days, king Agrippa and Bernice came down to Cæsarea, to salute Festus.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And as they tarried there many days, Festus told the king of Paul, saying: A certain man was left prisoner by Felix.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: About whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the ancients of the Jews came unto me, desiring condemnation against him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: To whom I answered: it is not the custom of the Romans to condemn any man, before that he who is accused have his accusers present and have liberty to make his answer, to clear himself of the things laid to his charge.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: When therefore they were come hither, without any delay, on the day following, sitting in the judgment seat, I commanded the man to be brought.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Against whom, when the accusers stood up, they brought no accusation of this which I thought ill of:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But had certain questions of their own superstition against him, and of one Jesus deceased, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: I therefore being in a doubt of this manner of question, asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem and there be judged of these things.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But Paul, appealing to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus, I commanded him to be kept, till I might send him to Caesar.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Agrippa said to Festus: I would also hear the man, myself. To-morrow, said he, thou shalt hear him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And on the next day, when Agrippa and Bernice were come with great pomp and had entered into the hall of audience with the tribunes and principal men of the city, at Festus’ commandment, Paul was brought forth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Festus saith: King Agrippa and all ye men who are here present with us, you see this man, about whom all the multitude of the Jews dealt with me at Jerusalem, requesting and crying out that he ought not to live any longer.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Yet have I found nothing that he hath committed worthy of death. But forasmuch as he himself hath appealed to Augustus, I have determined to send him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Of whom I have nothing certain to write to my lord. For which cause, I have brought him forth before you, and especially before thee, O king Agrippa, that, examination being made, I may have what to write.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner and not to signify the things laid to his charge. Acts Chapter 26 Paul gives an account to Agrippa of his life, conversion and calling.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then Agrippa said to Paul: Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Paul, stretching forth his hand, began to make his answer.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: I think myself happy, O king Agrippa, that I am to answer for myself this day before thee, touching all the things whereof I am accused by the Jews.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Especially as thou knowest all, both customs and questions, that are among the Jews. Wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And my life indeed from my youth, which was from the beginning among my own nation in Jerusalem, all the Jews do know:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Having known me from the beginning (if they will give testimony) that according to the most sure sect of our religion I lived, a Pharisee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And now for the hope of the promise that was made by God to the fathers, do I stand subject to judgment:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Unto which, our twelve tribes, serving night and day, hope to come. For which hope, O king, I am accused by the Jews.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Why should it be thought a thing incredible that God should raise the dead?

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And I indeed did formerly think that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Which also I did at Jerusalem: and many of the saints did I shut up in prison, having received authority of the chief priests. And when they were put to death, I brought the sentence.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And oftentimes punishing them, in every synagogue, I compelled them to blaspheme: and being yet more mad against them, I persecuted them even unto foreign cities.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Whereupon, when I was going to Damascus with authority and permission of the chief priest,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: At midday, O king, I saw in the way a light from heaven, above the brightness of the sun, shining round about me and them that were in company with me.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when we were all fallen down on the ground, I heard a voice speaking to me in the Hebrew tongue: Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? It is hard for thee to kick against the goad.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And I said: Who art thou, Lord? And the Lord answered: I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But rise up and stand upon thy feet: for to this end have I appeared to thee, that I may make thee a minister and a witness of those things which thou hast seen and of those things wherein I will appear to thee,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Delivering thee from the people and from the nations unto which now I send thee:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: To open their eyes, that they may be converted from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins and a lot among the saints, by the faith that is in me.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Whereupon, O king Agrippa, I was not incredulous to the heavenly vision.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But to them first that are at Damascus and at Jerusalem, and unto all the country of Judea, and to the Gentiles did I preach, that they should do penance and turn to God, doing works worthy of penance.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For this cause, the Jews, when I was in the temple, having apprehended me, went about to kill me.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But being aided by the help of God, I stand unto this day, witnessing both to small and great, saying no other thing than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come to pass:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: That Christ should suffer and that he should be the first that should rise from the dead and should shew light to the people and to the Gentiles.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: As he spoke these things and made his answer, Festus said with a loud voice: Paul, thou art beside thyself: much learning doth make thee mad.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Paul said: I am not mad, most excellent Festus, but I speak words of truth and soberness.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For the king knoweth of these things, to whom also I speak with confidence. For I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him. For neither was any of these things done in a corner.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Believest thou the prophets, O king Agrippa? I know that thou believest.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Agrippa said to Paul: In a little thou persuadest me to become a Christian.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Paul said: I would to God that both in a little and in much, not only thou, but also all that hear me this day, should become such as I also am, except these bands.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the king rose up, and the governor and Bernice and they that sat with them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they were gone aside, they spoke among themselves, saying: This man hath done nothing worthy of death or of bands.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And Agrippa said to Festus: This man might have been set at liberty, if he had not appealed to Caesar. Acts Chapter 27 Paul is shipped for Rome. His voyage and shipwreck.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when it was determined that he should sail into Italy and that Paul, with the other prisoners, should be delivered to a centurion, named Julius, of the band Augusta,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Going on board a ship of Adrumetum, we launched, meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia, Aristarchus, the Macedonian of Thessalonica, continuing with us.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the day following, we came to Sidon. And Julius, treating Paul courteously, permitted him to go to his friends and to take care of himself.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when we had launched from thence, we sailed under Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And sailing over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Lystra, which is in Lycia.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And there, the centurion, finding a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy, removed us into it.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when for many days we had sailed slowly and were scarce come over against Gnidus, the wind not suffering us, we sailed near Crete by Salmone.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And with much ado sailing by it, we came into a certain place, which is called Good-havens, nigh to which was the city of Thalassa.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when much time was spent and when sailing now was dangerous, because the fast was now past, Paul comforted them,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Saying to them: Ye men, I see that the voyage beginneth to be with injury and much damage, not only of the lading and ship, but also of our lives.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But the centurion believed the pilot and the master of the ship, more than those things which were said by Paul.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And whereas it was not a commodious haven to winter in, the greatest part gave counsel to sail thence, if by any means they might reach Phenice, to winter there, which is a haven of Crete, looking towards the south-west and north-west.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the south wind gently blowing, thinking that they had obtained their purpose, when they had loosed from Asson, they sailed close by Crete.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But not long after, there arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroaquilo.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when the ship was caught and could not bear up against the wind, giving up the ship to the winds, we were driven.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And running under a certain island that is called Cauda, we had much work to come by the boat.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Which being taken up, they used helps, undergirding the ship: and fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands, they let down the sail yard and so were driven.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And we, being mightily tossed with the tempest, the next day they lightened the ship.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the third day they cast out with their own hands the tackling of the ship.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when neither sun nor stars appeared for many days and no small storm lay on us, all hope of our being saved was now taken away.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after they had fasted a long time, Paul standing forth in the midst of them, said: You should indeed, O ye men, have hearkened unto me and not have loosed from Crete and have gained this harm and loss.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer. For there shall be no loss of any man’s life among you, but only of the ship.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For an angel of God, whose I am and whom I serve, stood by me this night,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Saying: Fear not, Paul, thou must be brought before Caesar; and behold, God hath given thee all them that sail with thee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe God, that it shall so be, as it hath been told me.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And we must come unto a certain island.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But after the fourteenth night was come, as we were sailing in Adria, about midnight, the shipmen deemed that they discovered some country.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who also sounding, found twenty fathoms: and going on a little further, they found fifteen fathoms.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then fearing lest we should fall upon rough places, they cast four anchors out of the stern: and wished for the day.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But as the shipmen sought to fly out of the ship, having let down the boat into the sea, under colour, as though they would have cast anchors out of the forepart of the ship,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers: Except these stay in the ship, you cannot be saved.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat and let her fall off.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when it began to be light, Paul besought them all to take meat, saying: This day is the fourteenth day that you have waited and continued fasting, taking nothing.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Wherefore, I pray you to take some meat for your health’s sake: for there shall not an hair of the head of any of you perish.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had said these things, taking bread, he gave thanks to God in the sight of them all. And when he had broken it, he began to eat.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Then were they all of better cheer: and they also took some meat.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, casting the wheat into the sea.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when it was day, they knew not the land. But they discovered a certain creek that had a shore, into which they minded, if they could, to thrust in the ship.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had taken up the anchors, they committed themselves to the sea, loosing withal the rudder bands. And hoisting up the mainsail to the wind, they made towards shore.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when we were fallen into a place where two seas met, they run the ship aground. And the forepart indeed, sticking fast, remained unmoveable: but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the sea.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the soldiers’ counsel was that they should kill the prisoners, lest any of them, swimming out should escape.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But the centurion, willing to save Paul, forbade it to be done. And he commanded that they who could swim should cast themselves first into the sea and save themselves and get to land.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And the rest, some they carried on boards and some on those things that belonged to the ship. And so it came to pass that every soul got safe to land. Acts Chapter 28 Paul, after three months’ stay in Melita, continues his voyage and arrives at Rome. His conference there with the Jews.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when we had escaped, then we knew that the island was called Melita. But the barbarians shewed us no small courtesy.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For kindling a fire, they refreshed us all, because of the present rain and of the cold.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when Paul had gathered together a bundle of sticks and had laid them on the fire, a viper, coming out of the heat, fastened on his hand.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when the barbarians saw the beast hanging on his hand, they said one to another: Undoubtedly this man is a murderer, who, though he hath escaped the sea, yet vengeance doth not suffer him to live.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he indeed, shaking off the beast into the fire, suffered no harm.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But they supposed that he would begin to swell up and that he would suddenly fall down and die. But expecting long and seeing that there came no harm to him, changing their minds, they said that he was a god.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Now in these places were possessions of the chief man of the island, named Publius: who, receiving us for three days, entertained us courteously.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And it happened that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux. To whom Paul entered in. And when he had prayed and laid his hands on him, he healed him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Which being done, all that had diseases in the island came and were healed.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who also honoured us with many honours: and when we were to set sail, they laded us with such things as were necessary.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after three months, we sailed in a ship of Alexandria, that had wintered in the island, whose sign was the Castors.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when we were come to Syracusa, we tarried there three days.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: From thence, compassing by the shore, we came to Rhegium: and after one day, the south wind blowing, we came the second day to Puteoli:

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Where, finding brethren, we were desired to tarry with them seven days. And so we went to Rome.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And from thence, when the brethren had heard of us, they came to meet us as far as Appii Forum and the Three Taverns. Whom when Paul saw, he gave thanks to God and took courage.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when we were come to Rome, Paul was suffered to dwell by himself, with a soldier that kept him.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And after the third day, he called together the chief of the Jews. And when they were assembled, he said to them: Men, brethren, I, having done nothing against the people or the custom of our fathers, was delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Who, when they had examined me, would have released me, for that there was no cause of death in me.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But the Jews contradicting it, I was constrained to appeal unto Caesar: not that I had anything to accuse my nation of.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For this cause therefore I desired to see you and to speak to you. Because that for the hope of Israel, I am bound with this chain.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But they said to him: We neither received letters concerning thee from Judea: neither did any of the brethren that came hither relate or speak any evil of thee.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as concerning this sect, we know that it is every where contradicted.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they had appointed him a day, there came very many to him unto his lodgings. To whom he expounded, testifying the kingdom of God and persuading them concerning Jesus, out of the law of Moses and the prophets, from morning until evening.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And some believed the things that were said: but some believed not.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when they agreed not among themselves, they departed, Paul speaking this one word: Well did the Holy Ghost speak to our fathers by Isaias the prophet,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Saying: Go to this people and say to them: With the ear you shall hear and shall not understand: and seeing you shall see and shall not perceive.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: For the heart of this people is grown gross, and with their ears have they heard heavily and their eyes they have shut, lest perhaps they should see with their eyes and hear with their ears and understand with their heart and should be converted: and I should heal them.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Be it known therefore to you that this salvation of God is sent to the Gentiles: and they will hear it.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And when he had said these things, the Jews went out from him, having much reasoning among themselves.

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: And he remained two whole years in his own hired lodging: and he received all that came in to him,

Book: The Acts of the Apostles
Text: Preaching the kingdom of God and teaching the things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ, with all confidence, without prohibition.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, by the will of God, to all the saints who are at Ephesus and to the faithful in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Grace be to you and peace, from God the Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with spiritual blessings in heavenly places, in Christ: In heavenly places.... or, in heavenly things. In coelestibus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: As he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and unspotted in his sight in charity.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Who hath predestinated us unto the adoption of children through Jesus Christ unto himself: according to the purpose of his will:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Unto the praise of the glory of his grace, in which he hath graced us, in his beloved son.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In whom we have redemption through his blood, the remission of sins, according to the riches of his, grace,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Which hath superabounded in us, in all wisdom and prudence,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That he might make known unto us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure, which he hath purposed in him,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In the dispensation of the fulness of times, to re-establish all things in Christ, that are in heaven and on earth, in him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In whom we also are called by lot, being predestinated according to the purpose of him who worketh all things according to the counsel of his will.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That we may be unto the praise of his glory: we who before hoped in Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In whom you also, after you had heard the word of truth (the gospel of your salvation), in whom also believing, you were signed with the holy Spirit of promise.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Who is the pledge of our inheritance, unto the redemption of acquisition, unto the praise of his glory. Acquisition.... that is, a purchased possession.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore, I also, hearing of your faith that is in the Lord Jesus and of your love towards all the saints,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Cease not to give thanks for you, making commemoration of you in my prayers,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give unto you the spirit of wisdom and of revelation, in the knowledge of him:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: The eyes of your heart enlightened that you may know what the hope is of his calling and what are the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And what is the exceeding greatness of his power towards us, who believe according to the operation of the might of his power,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Which he wrought in Christ, raising him up from the dead and setting him on his right hand in the heavenly places.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Above all principality and power and virtue and dominion and every name that is named, not only in this world, but also in that which is to come.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And he hath subjected all things under his feet and hath made him head over all the church,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Which is his body and the fulness of him who is filled all in all. Ephesians Chapter 2 All our good comes through Christ. He is our peace.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And you, when you were dead in your offences and sins,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherein in time past you walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of this air, of the spirit that now worketh on the children of unbelief:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In which also we all conversed in time past, in the desires of our flesh, fulfilling the will of the flesh and of our thoughts, and were by nature children of wrath, even as the rest:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But God (who is rich in mercy) for his exceeding charity wherewith he loved us

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Even when we were dead in sins, hath quickened us together in Christ (by whose grace you are saved)

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And hath raised us up together and hath made us sit together in the heavenly places, through Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That he might shew in the ages to come the abundant riches of his grace, in his bounty towards us in Christ Jesus.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For by grace you are saved through faith: and that not of yourselves, for it is the gift of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Not of works, that no man may glory. Not of works.... as of our own growth, or from ourselves; but as from the grace of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus in good works, which God hath prepared that we should walk in them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For which cause be mindful that you, being heretofore gentiles in the flesh, who are called uncircumcision by that which is called circumcision in the flesh, made by hands:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That you were at that time without Christ, being aliens from the conversation of Israel and strangers to the testament, having no hope of the promise and without God in this world.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But now in Christ Jesus, you, who some time were afar off, are made nigh by the blood of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For he is our peace, who hath made both one, and breaking down the middle wall of partition, the enmities in his flesh:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Making void the law of commandments contained in decrees: that he might make the two in himself into one new man, making peace.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And might reconcile both to God in one body by the cross, killing the enmities in himself.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And coming, he preached peace to you that were afar off: and peace to them that were nigh.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For by him we have access both in one Spirit to the Father.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Now therefore you are no more strangers and foreigners: but you are fellow citizens with the saints and the domestics of God,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ himself being the chief corner stone:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In whom all the building, being framed together, groweth up into an holy temple in the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In whom you also are built together into an habitation of God in the Spirit. Ephesians Chapter 3 The mystery hidden from former ages was discovered to the apostle, to be imparted to the Gentiles. He prays that they may be strengthened in God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For this cause, I Paul, the prisoner of Jesus Christ, for you Gentiles:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: If yet you have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which is given me towards you:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: How that, according to revelation, the mystery has been made known to me, as I have written above in a few words:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: As you reading, may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Which in other generations was not known to the sons of men, as it is now revealed to his holy apostles and prophets in the Spirit:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That the Gentiles should be fellow heirs and of the same body: and copartners of his promise in Christ Jesus, by the gospel

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Of which I am made a minister, according to the gift of the grace of God, which is given to me according to the operation of his power.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: To me, the least of all the saints, is given this grace, to preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And to enlighten all men, that they may see what is the dispensation of the mystery which hath been hidden from eternity in God who created all things:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That the manifold wisdom of God may be made known to the principalities and powers in heavenly places through the church,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: According to the eternal purpose which he made in Christ Jesus our Lord:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore I pray you not to faint at my tribulations for you, which is your glory.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For this cause I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Of whom all paternity in heaven and earth is named: All paternity.... Or, the whole family. God is the Father, both of angels and men; whosoever besides is named father, is so named with subordination to him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened by his Spirit with might unto the inward man:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That Christ may dwell by faith in your hearts: that, being rooted and founded in charity,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: You may be able to comprehend, with all the saints, what is the breadth and length and height and depth,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: To know also the charity of Christ, which surpasseth all knowledge: that you may be filled unto all the fulness of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Now to him who is able to do all things more abundantly than we desire or understand, according to the power that worketh in us:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: To him be glory in the church and in Christ Jesus, unto all generations, world without end. Amen. Ephesians Chapter 4 He exhorts them to unity, to put on the new man, and to fly sin.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: I therefore, a prisoner in the Lord, beseech you that you walk worthy of the vocation in which you are called:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: With all humility and mildness, with patience, supporting one another in charity.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Careful to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: One body and one Spirit: as you are called in one hope of your calling.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: One Lord, one faith, one baptism.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: One God and Father of all, who is above all, and through all, and in us all.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But to every one of us is given grace, according to the measure of the giving of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore he saith: Ascending on high, he led captivity captive: he gave gifts to men.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Now that he ascended, what is it, but because he also descended first into the lower parts of the earth?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: He that descended is the same also that ascended above all the heavens: that he might fill all things.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And he gave some apostles, and some prophets, and other some evangelists, and other some pastors and doctors: Gave some apostles—Until we all meet, etc.... Here it is plainly expressed, that Christ has left in his church a perpetual succession of orthodox pastors and teachers, to preserve the faithful in unity and truth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For the perfecting of the saints, for the work of the ministry, for the edifying of the body of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Until we all meet into the unity of faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the measure of the age of the fulness of Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That henceforth we be no more children tossed to and fro and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the wickedness of men, by cunning craftiness by which they lie in wait to deceive.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But doing the truth in charity, we may in all things grow up in him who is the head, even Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: From whom the whole body, being compacted and fitly joined together, by what every joint supplieth, according to the operation in the measure of every part, maketh increase of the body, unto the edifying of itself in charity.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: This then I say and testify in the Lord: That henceforward you walk not as also the Gentiles walk in the vanity of their mind:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Having their understanding darkened: being alienated from the life of God through the ignorance that is in them, because of the blindness of their hearts.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Who despairing have given themselves up to lasciviousness, unto the working of all uncleanness, unto covetousness.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But you have not so learned Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: If so be that you have heard him and have been taught in him, as the truth is in Jesus:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: To put off, according to former conversation, the old man, who is corrupted according to the desire of error.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And be renewed in the spirit of your mind:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And put on the new man, who according to God is created in justice and holiness of truth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore, putting away lying, speak ye the truth, every man with his neighbour. For we are members one of another.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Be angry: and sin not. Let not the sun go down upon your anger.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Give not place to the devil.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: He that stole, let him now steal no more: but rather let him labour, working with his hands the thing which is good, that he may have something to give to him that suffereth need.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Let no evil speech proceed from your mouth: but that which is good, to the edification of faith: that it may administer grace to the hearers.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And grieve not the holy Spirit of God: whereby you are sealed unto the day of redemption.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Let all bitterness and anger and indignation and clamour and blasphemy be put away from you, with all malice.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And be ye kind one to another: merciful, forgiving one another, even as God hath forgiven you in Christ. Ephesians Chapter 5 Exhortations to a virtuous life. The mutual duties of man and wife, by the example of Christ and of the Church.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Be ye therefore followers of God, as most dear children:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us and hath delivered himself for us, an oblation and a sacrifice to God for an odour of sweetness.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But fornication and all uncleanness or covetousness, let it not so much as be named among you, as becometh saints:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Or obscenity or foolish talking or scurrility, which is to no purpose: but rather giving of thanks.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For know you this and understand: That no fornicator or unclean or covetous person (which is a serving of idols) hath inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Let no man deceive you with vain words. For because of these things cometh the anger of God upon the children of unbelief.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Be ye not therefore partakers with them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For you were heretofore darkness, but now light in the Lord. Walk then as children of the light.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For the fruit of the light is in all goodness and justice and truth:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Proving what is well pleasing to God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness: but rather reprove them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For the things that are done by them in secret, it is a shame even to speak of.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light: for all that is made manifest is light.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore he saith: Rise, thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead: and Christ shall enlighten thee.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: See therefore, brethren, how you walk circumspectly: not as unwise,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But as wise: redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Wherefore, become not unwise: but understanding what is the will of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is luxury: but be ye filled with the Holy Spirit,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual canticles, singing and making melody in your hearts to the Lord:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Giving thanks always for all things, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to God and the Father:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Being subject one to another, in the fear of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Let women be subject to their husbands, as to the Lord:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Because the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ is the head of the church. He is the saviour of his body.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Therefore as the church is subject to Christ: so also let the wives be to their husbands in all things. As the church is subject to Christ.... The church then, according to St. Paul, is ever obedient to Christ, and can never fall from him, but remain faithful to him, unspotted and unchanged to the end of the world.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Husbands, love your wives, as Christ also loved the church and delivered himself up for it:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That he might sanctify it, cleansing it by the laver of water in the word of life:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That he might present it to himself, a glorious church, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: So also ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his wife loveth himself.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For no man ever hated his own flesh, but nourisheth and cherisheth it, as also Christ doth the church:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Because we are members of his body, of his flesh and of his bones.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother: and shall cleave to his wife. And they shall be two in one flesh.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: This is a great sacrament: but I speak in Christ and in the church.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Nevertheless, let every one of you in particular love his wife as himself: And let the wife fear her husband. Ephesians Chapter 6 Duties of children and servants. The Christian’s armour.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is just.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Honour thy father and thy mother, which is the first commandment with a promise:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: That it may be well with thee, and thou mayest be long lived upon earth.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And you, fathers, provoke not your children to anger: but bring them up in the discipline and correction of the Lord.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Servants, be obedient to them that are your lords according to the flesh, with fear and trembling, in the simplicity of your heart, as to Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Not serving to the eye, as it were pleasing men: but, as the servants of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: With a good will serving, as to the Lord, and not to men.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Knowing that whatsoever good thing any man shall do, the same shall he receive from the Lord, whether he be bond or free.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And you, masters, do the same things to them, forbearing threatenings: knowing that the Lord both of them and you is in heaven. And there is no respect of persons with him.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Finally, brethren, be strengthened in the Lord and in the might of his power.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Put you on the armour of God, that you may be able to stand against the deceits of the devil.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For our wrestling is not against flesh and blood; but against principalities and powers, against the rulers of the world of this darkness, against the spirits of wickedness in the high places.
