High places, or heavenly places.... That is to say, in the air, the lowest of the celestial regions; in which God permits these wicked spirits or fallen angels to wander.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Therefore, take unto you the armour of God, that you may be able to resist in the evil day and to stand in all things perfect.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Stand therefore, having your loins girt about with truth and having on the breastplate of justice:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: In all things taking the shield of faith, wherewith you may be able to extinguish all the fiery darts of the most wicked one.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And take unto you the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit (which is the word of God).

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: By all prayer and supplication praying at all times in the spirit: and in the same watching with all instance and supplication for all the saints:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: And for me, that speech may be given me, that I may open my mouth with confidence, to make known the mystery of the gospel,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: For which I am an ambassador in a chain: so that therein I may be bold to speak according as I ought.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: But that you also may know the things that concern me and what I am doing, Tychicus, my dearest brother and faithful minister in the Lord, will make known to you all things:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Whom I have sent to you for this same purpose: that you may know the things concerning us, and that he may comfort your hearts.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Peace be to the brethren and charity with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul to the Ephesians
Text: Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in incorruption. Amen. In incorruption.... That is, with a pure and perfect love.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Simon Peter, servant and apostle of Jesus Christ: to them that have obtained equal faith with us in the justice of our God and Saviour Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Grace to you and peace be accomplished in the knowledge of God and of Christ Jesus our Lord.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As all things of his divine power which appertain to life and godliness are given us through the knowledge of him who hath called us by his own proper glory and virtue.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: By whom he hath given us most great and precious promises: that by these you may be made partakers of the divine nature: flying the corruption of that concupiscence which is in the world.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And you, employing all care, minister in your faith, virtue: And in virtue, knowledge:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And in knowledge, abstinence: and in abstinence, patience: and in patience, godliness:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And in godliness, love of brotherhood: and in love of brotherhood, charity.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For if these things be with you and abound, they will make you to be neither empty nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For he that hath not these things with him is blind and groping, having forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherefore, brethren, labour the more, that by good works you may make sure your calling and election. For doing these things, you shall not sin at any time.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For so an entrance shall be ministered to you abundantly into the ever-lasting kingdom of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For which cause, I will begin to put you always in remembrance of these things: though indeed you know them and are confirmed in the present truth.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But I think it meet, as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by putting you in remembrance.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Being assured that the laying away of this my tabernacle is at hand, according as our Lord Jesus Christ also hath signified to me.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And I will endeavour that you frequently have after my decease whereby you may keep a memory of these things.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For we have not by following artificial fables made known to you the power and presence of our Lord Jesus Christ: but we were eyewitnesses of his greatness.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For he received from God the Father honour and glory, this voice coming down to him from the excellent glory: This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased. Hear ye him.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And this voice, we heard brought from heaven, when we were with him in the holy mount.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And we have the more firm prophetical word: whereunto you do well to attend, as to a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn and the day star arise in your hearts.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Understanding this first: That no prophecy of scripture is made by private interpretation. No prophecy of scripture is made by private interpretation.... This shows plainly that the scriptures are not to be expounded by any one’s private judgment or private spirit, because every part of the holy scriptures were written by men inspired by the Holy Ghost, and declared as such by the Church; therefore they are not to be interpreted but by the Spirit of God, which he hath left, and promised to remain with his Church to guide her in all truth to the end of the world. Some may tell us, that many of our divines interpret the scriptures: they may do so, but they do it always with a submission to the judgment of the Church, and not otherwise.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For prophecy came not by the will of man at any time: but the holy men of God spoke, inspired by the Holy Ghost. 2 Peter Chapter 2 He warns them against false teachers and foretells their punishment.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But there were also false prophets among the people, even as there shall be among you lying teachers who shall bring in sects of perdition and deny the Lord who bought them: bringing upon themselves swift destruction. Seeds of perdition.... That is, heresies destructive of salvation.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And many shall follow their riotousnesses, through whom the way of truth shall be evil spoken of.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And through covetousness shall they with feigned words make merchandise of you. Whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not: and their perdition slumbereth not.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For if God spared not the angels that sinned, but delivered them, drawn down by infernal ropes to the lower hell, unto torments, to be reserved unto judgment:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And spared not the original world, but preserved Noe, the eighth person, the preacher of justice, bringing in the flood upon the world of the ungodly.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And reducing the cities of the Sodomites and of the Gomorrhites into ashes, condemned them to be overthrown, making them an example to those that should after act wickedly,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And delivered just Lot, oppressed by the injustice and lewd conversation of the wicked:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For in sight and hearing he was just, dwelling among them who from day to day vexed the just soul with unjust works.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: The Lord knoweth how to deliver the godly from temptation, but to reserve the unjust unto the day of judgment to be tormented:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And especially them who walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness and despise government: audacious, self willed, they fear not to bring in sects, blaspheming.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Whereas angels, who are greater in strength and power, bring not against themselves a railing judgment. Bring not a railing judgment, etc.... That is, they use no railing, nor cursing sentence; not even in their conflicts with the evil angels. See St. Jude, ver. 9.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But these men, as irrational beasts, naturally tending to the snare and to destruction, blaspheming those things which they know not, shall perish in their corruption:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Receiving the reward of their injustice, counting for a pleasure the delights of a day: stains and spots, sporting themselves to excess, rioting in their feasts with you: The delights of a day: that is, the short delights of this world, in which they place all their happiness.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Having eyes full of adultery and of sin that ceaseth not: alluring unstable souls: having their heart exercised with covetousness: children of malediction.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Leaving the right way, they have gone astray, having followed the way of Balaam of Bosor who loved the wages of iniquity,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But had a check of his madness, the dumb beast used to the yoke, which, speaking with man’s voice, forbade the folly of the prophet.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: These are fountains without water and clouds tossed with whirlwinds, to whom the mist of darkness is reserved.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For, speaking proud words of vanity, they allure by the desires of fleshly riotousness those who for a little while escape, such as converse in error:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Promising them liberty, whereas they themselves are the slaves of corruption. For by whom a man is overcome, of the same also he is the slave.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For if, flying from the pollutions of the world, through the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, they be again entangled in them and overcome: their latter state is become unto them worse than the former.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For it had been better for them not to have known the way of justice than, after they have known it, to turn back from that holy commandment which was delivered to them.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For, that of the true proverb has happened to them: The dog is returned to his vomit; and: The sow that was washed to her wallowing in the mire. 2 Peter Chapter 3 Against scoffers denying the second coming of Christ. He declares the sudden dissolution of this world and exhorts to holiness of life.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Behold this second epistle I write to you, my dearly beloved, in which, I stir up by way of admonition your sincere mind:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: That you may be mindful of those words which I told you before from the holy prophets, and of your apostles, of the precepts of the Lord and Saviour.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Knowing this first: That in the last days there shall come deceitful scoffers, walking after their own lusts,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Saying: Where is his promise or his coming? For since the time that the fathers slept, all things continue as they were from the beginning of the creation.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: For this they are wilfully ignorant of: That the heavens were before, and the earth out of water and through water, consisting by the word of God:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Whereby the world that then was, being overflowed with water, perished.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But the heavens and the earth which are now, by the same word are kept in store, reserved unto fire against the day of judgment and perdition of the ungodly men.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But of this one thing be not ignorant, my beloved, that one day with the Lord is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: The Lord delayeth not his promise, as some imagine, but dealeth patiently for your sake, not willing that any should perish, but that all should return to penance,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But the day of the Lord shall come as a thief, in which the heavens shall pass away with great violence and the elements shall be melted with heat and the earth and the works which are in it shall be burnt up.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Seeing then that all these things are to be dissolved, what manner of people ought you to be in holy conversation and godliness?

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Looking for and hasting unto the coming of the day of the Lord, by which the heavens being on fire shall be dissolved, and the elements shall melt with the burning heat?

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But we look for new heavens and a new earth according to his promises, in which justice dwelleth.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: Wherefore, dearly beloved, waiting for these things, be diligent that you may be found before him unspotted and blameless in peace.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: And account the longsuffering of our Lord, salvation: as also our most dear brother Paul, according to the wisdom given him, hath written to you:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: As also in all his epistles, speaking in them of these things; in which are certain things hard to be understood, which the unlearned and unstable wrest, as they do also the other scriptures, to their own destruction.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: You therefore, brethren, knowing these things before, take heed, lest being led aside by the error of the unwise, you fall from your own steadfastness.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Peter the Apostle
Text: But grow in grace and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and unto the day of eternity, Amen.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: In the days of one of the judges, when the judges ruled, there came a famine in the land. And a certain man of Bethlehem Juda, went to sojourn in the land of Moab with his wife and his two sons.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: He was named Elimelech, and his wife Noemi: and his two sons, the one Mahalon, and the other Chelion, Ephrathites of Bethlehem Juda. And entering into the country of Moab, they abode there.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Elimelech the husband of Noemi died: and she remained with her sons.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And they took wives of the women of Moab, of which one was called Orpha, and the other Ruth. And they dwelt there ten years,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And they both died, to wit, Mahalon and Chelion: and the woman was left alone, having lost both her sons and her husband.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she arose to go from the land of Moab to her own country, with both her daughters in law: for she had heard that the Lord had looked upon his people, and had given them food.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Wherefore she went forth out of the place of her sojournment, with both her daughters in law: and being now in the way to return into the land of Juda,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: She said to them: Go ye home to your mothers, the Lord deal mercifully with you, as you have dealt with the dead and with me.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: May he grant you to find rest in the houses of the husbands whom you shall take. And she kissed them. And they lifted up their voice, and began to weep,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And to say: We will go on with thee to thy people.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: But she answered them: Return, my daughters: why come ye with me? have I any more sons in my womb, that you may hope for husbands of me?

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Return again, my daughters, and go your ways: for I am now spent with age, and not fit for wedlock. Although I might conceive this night, and bear children,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: If you would wait till they were grown up, and come to man’s estate, you would be old women before you marry. Do not so, my daughters, I beseech you: for I am grieved the more for your distress, and the hand of the Lord is gone out against me.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And they lifted up their voice, and began to weep again: Orpha kissed her mother in law, and returned: Ruth stuck close to her mother in law.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Noemi said to her: Behold thy kinswoman is returned to her people, and to her gods, go thou with her. To her gods, etc.... Noemi did not mean to persuade Ruth to return to the false gods she had formerly worshipped: but by this manner of speech, insinuated to her, that if she would go with her, she must renounce her false gods and return to the Lord the God of Israel.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: She answered: Be not against me, to desire that I should leave thee and depart: for whithersoever thou shalt go, I will go: and where thou shalt dwell, I also will dwell. Thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: The land that shall receive thee dying, in the same will I die: and there will I be buried. The Lord do so and so to me, and add more also, if aught but death part me and thee. The Lord do so and so, etc.... A form of swearing usual in the history of the Old Testament, by which the person wished such and such evils to fall upon them, if they did not do what they said.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Then Noemi seeing that Ruth was steadfastly determined to go with her, would not be against it, nor persuade her any more to return to her friends:

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: So they went together, and came to Bethlehem. And when they were come into the city, the report was quickly spread among all: and the women said: This is that Noemi.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: But she said to them: Call me not Noemi (that is, beautiful,) but call me Mara (that is, bitter), for the Almighty hath quite filled me with bitterness.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: I went out full and the Lord hath brought me back empty. Why then do you call me Noemi, whom the Lord hath humbled, and the Almighty hath afflicted?

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: So Noemi came with Ruth, the Moabitess, her daughter in law, from the land of her sojournment: and returned into Bethlehem, in the beginning of the barley harvest. Ruth Chapter 2 Ruth gleaneth in the field of Booz, who sheweth her favour.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Now her husband Elimelech had a kinsman, a powerful man, and very rich, whose name was Booz.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Ruth, the Moabitess, said to her mother in law: If thou wilt, I will go into the field, and glean the ears of corn that escape the hands of the reapers, wheresoever I shall find grace with a householder, that will be favourable to me. And she answered her: Go, my daughter.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: She went, therefore, and gleaned the ears of corn after the reapers. And it happened that the owner of that field was Booz, who was of the kindred of Elimelech.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And behold, he came out of Bethlehem, and said to the reapers: The Lord be with you. And they answered him: The Lord bless thee.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Booz said to the young man that was set over the reapers: Whose maid is this?

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And he answered him: This is the Moabitess, who came with Noemi, from the land of Moab,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she desired leave to glean the ears of corn that remain, following the steps of the reapers: and she hath been in the field from morning till now, and hath not gone home for one moment.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Booz said to Ruth: Hear me, daughter, do not go to glean in any other field, and do not depart from this place: but keep with my maids,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And follow where they reap. For I have charged my young men, not to molest thee: and if thou art thirsty, go to the vessels, and drink of the waters whereof the servants drink.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: She fell on her face, and worshipping upon the ground, said to him: Whence cometh this to me, that I should find grace before thy eyes, and that thou shouldst vouchsafe to take notice of me, a woman of another country?

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And he answered her: All hath been told me, that thou hast done to thy mother in law after the death of thy husband: and how thou hast left thy parents, and the land wherein thou wast born, and art come to a people which thou knewest not heretofore.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: The Lord render unto thee for thy work, and mayst thou receive a full reward of the Lord the God of Israel, to whom thou art come, and under whose wings thou art fled.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she said: I have found grace in thy eyes, my lord, who hast comforted me, and hast spoken to the heart of thy handmaid, who am not like to one of thy maids.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Booz said to her: At mealtime come thou hither, and eat of the bread, and dip thy morsel in the vinegar. So she sat at the side of the reapers, and she heaped to herself frumenty, and ate and was filled, and took the leavings.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she arose from thence, to glean the ears of corn as before. And Booz commanded his servants, saying: If she would even reap with you, hinder her not:

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And let fall some of your handfuls of purpose, and leave them, that she may gather them without shame, and let no man rebuke her when she gathereth them.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: She gleaned therefore in the field till evening: and beating out with a rod, and threshing what she had gleaned, she found about the measure of an ephi of barley, that is, three bushels:

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Which she took up, and returned into the city, and shewed it to her mother in law: moreover, she brought out, and gave her of the remains of her meat, wherewith she had been filled.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And her mother in law said to her: Where hast thou gleaned today, and where hast thou wrought? blessed be he that hath had pity on thee. And she told her with whom she had wrought: and she told the man’s name, that he was called Booz.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Noemi answered her: Blessed be he of the Lord: because the same kindness which he shewed to the living, he hath kept also to the dead. And again she said: The man is our kinsman.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Ruth said: He also charged me, that I should keep close to his reapers, till all the corn should be reaped.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And her mother in law said to her: It is better for thee, my daughter, to go out to reap with his maids, lest in another man’s field some one may resist thee.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: So she kept close to the maids of Booz: and continued to glean with them, till all the barley and the wheat were laid up in the barns. Ruth Chapter 3 Ruth instructed by her mother in law lieth at Booz’s feet, claiming him for her husband by the law of affinity: she receiveth a good answer, and six measures of barley.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: After she was returned to her mother in law, Noemi said to her: My daughter, I will seek rest for thee, and will provide that it may be well with thee.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: This Booz, with whose maids thou wast joined in the field, is our near kinsman, and behold this night he winnoweth barley in the threshingfloor.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Wash thyself therefore and anoint thee, and put on thy best garments, and go down to the barnfloor: but let not the man see thee, till he shall have done eating and drinking.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And when he shall go to sleep, mark the place wherein he sleepeth: and thou shalt go in, and lift up the clothes wherewith he is covered towards his feet, and shalt lay thyself down there: and he will tell thee what thou must do.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: She answered: Whatsoever thou shalt command, I will do.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she went down to the barnfloor, and did all that her mother in law had bid her.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And when Booz had eaten, and drunk, and was merry, he went to sleep by the heap of sheaves, and she came softly, and uncovering his feet, laid herself down.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And behold, when it was now midnight the man was afraid, and troubled: and he saw a woman lying at his feet,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And he said to her: Who art thou? And she answered: I am Ruth, thy handmaid: spread thy coverlet over thy servant, for thou art a near kinsman.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And he said: Blessed art thou of the Lord, my daughter, and thy latter kindness has surpassed the former: because thou hast not followed young men either poor or rich. Thy latter kindness, viz.... to thy husband deceased in seeking to keep up his name and family by marrying his relation according to the law, and not following after young men. For Booz, it seems, was then in years.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Fear not therefore, but whatsoever thou shalt say to me I will do to thee. For all the people that dwell within the gates of my city, know that thou art a virtuous woman.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Neither do I deny myself to be near of kin, but there is another nearer than I.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Rest thou this night: and when morning is come, if he will take thee by the right of kindred, all is well: but if he will not, I will undoubtedly take thee, as the Lord liveth: sleep till the morning.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: So she slept at his feet till the night was going off. And she arose before men could know one another, and Booz said: Beware lest any man know that thou camest hither.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And again he said: Spread thy mantle, wherewith thou art covered, and hold it with both hands. And when she spread it and held it, he measured six measures of barley, and laid it upon her. And she carried it, and went into the city,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And came to her mother in law; who said to her: What hast thou done, daughter? And she told her all that the man had done to her.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And she said: Behold he hath given me six measures of barley: for he said: I will not have thee return empty to thy mother in law.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Noemi said: Wait, my daughter, till we see what end the thing will have. For the man will not rest until he have accomplished what he hath said. Ruth Chapter 4 Upon the refusal of the nearer kinsman, Booz marrieth Ruth, who bringeth forth Obed, the grandfather of David.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Then Booz went up to the gate, and sat there. And when he had seen the kinsman going by, of whom he had spoken before, he said to him, calling him by his name: Turn aside for a little while, and sit down here. He turned aside, and sat down.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Booz, taking ten men of the ancients of the city, said to them: Sit ye down here.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: They sat down, and he spoke to the kinsman: Noemi, who is returned from the country of Moab will sell a parcel of land that belonged to our brother Elimelech.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: I would have thee to understand this, and would tell thee before all that sit here, and before the ancients of my people. If thou wilt take possession of it by the right of kindred: buy it, and possess it: but if it please thee not, tell me so, that I may know what I have to do. For there is no near kinsman besides thee, who art first, and me, who am second. But he answered: I will buy the field.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Booz said to him: When thou shalt buy the field at the woman’s hand, thou must take also Ruth, the Moabitess, who was the wife of the deceased: to raise up the name of thy kinsman in his inheritance.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: He answered: I yield up my right of next akin: for I must not cut off the posterity of my own family. Do thou make use of my privilege, which I profess I do willingly forego.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Now this in former times was the manner in Israel between kinsmen, that if at any time one yielded his right to another: that the grant might be sure, the man put off his shoe and gave it to his neighbour; this was a testimony of cession of right in Israel.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: So Booz said to his kinsman: Put off thy shoe. And immediately he took it off from his foot.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And he said to the ancients, and to all the people: You are witnesses this day, that I have bought all that was Elimelech’s, and Chelion’s, and Mahalon’s, of the hand of Noemi:

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And have taken to wife Ruth, the Moabitess, the wife of Mahalon, to raise up the name of the deceased in his inheritance lest his name be cut off, from among his family and his brethren and his people. You, I say, are witnesses of this thing.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Then all the people that were in the gate, and the ancients, answered: We are witnesses: The Lord make this woman who cometh into thy house, like Rachel, and Lia, who built up the house of Israel: that she may be an example of virtue in Ephrata, and may have a famous name in Bethlehem: Ephrata.... Another name of Bethlehem.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And that the house may be, as the house of Phares, whom Thamar bore unto Juda, of the seed which the Lord shall give thee of this young woman.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Booz therefore took Ruth, and married her: and went in unto her, and the Lord gave her to conceive, and to bear a son.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And the women said to Noemi: Blessed be the Lord, who hath not suffered thy family to want a successor: that his name should be preserved in Israel.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And thou shouldst have one to comfort thy soul, and cherish thy old age. For he is born of thy daughter in law: who loveth thee: and is much better to thee, than if thou hadst seven sons.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And Noemi taking the child, laid it in her bosom, and she carried it, and was a nurse unto it.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: And the women, her neighbours, congratulating with her, and saying, There is a son born to Noemi, called his name Obed: he is the father of Isai, the father of David.

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: These are the generations of Phares: Phares begot Esron,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Esron begot Aram, Aram begot Aminadab,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Aminadab begot Nahasson, Nahasson begot Salmon,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Salmon begot Booz, Booz begot Obed,

Book: The Book of Ruth
Text: Obed begot Isai, Isai begot David.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the commandment of God our Saviour and Christ Jesus our hope:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: To Timothy, his beloved son in faith. Grace, mercy and peace, from God the Father and from Christ Jesus our Lord.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: As I desired thee to remain at Ephesus when I went into Macedonia, that thou mightest charge some not to teach otherwise:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Not to give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which furnish questions rather than the edification of God which is in faith.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Now the end of the commandment is charity from a pure heart, and a good conscience, and an unfeigned faith.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: From which things some, going astray, are turned aside unto vain babbling:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Desiring to be teachers of the law: understanding neither the things they say, nor whereof they affirm.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But we know that the law is good, if a man use it lawfully.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Knowing this: That the law is not made for the just man but for the unjust and disobedient, for the ungodly and for sinners, for the wicked and defiled, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers, The law is not.... He means, that the just man doth good, and avoideth evil, not as compelled by the law, and merely for fear of the punishment appointed for transgressors; but voluntarily, and out of the love of God and virtue; and would do so, though there were no law.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For fornicators, for them who defile themselves with mankind, for menstealers, for liars, for perjured persons, and whatever other thing is contrary to sound doctrine:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Which is according to the gospel of the glory of the blessed God which hath been committed to my trust.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I give him thanks who hath strengthened me, even to Christ Jesus our Lord, for that he hath counted me faithful, putting me in the ministry:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Who before was a blasphemer and a persecutor and contumelious. But I obtained the mercy of God, because I did it ignorantly in unbelief.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Now the grace of our Lord hath abounded exceedingly with faith and love, which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: A faithful saying, and worthy of all acceptation, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am the chief.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But for this cause have I obtained mercy: that in me first Christ Jesus might shew forth all patience, for the information of them that shall believe in him unto life everlasting.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Now to the king of ages, immortal, invisible, the only God, be honour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: This precept, I commend to thee, O son Timothy: according to the prophecies going before on thee, that thou war in them a good warfare,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Having faith and a good conscience, which some rejecting have made shipwreck concerning the faith.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Of whom is Hymeneus and Alexander, whom I have delivered up to Satan, that they may learn not to blaspheme. 1 Timothy Chapter 2 Prayers are to be said for all men, because God wills the salvation of all. Women are not to teach.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I desire therefore, first of all, that supplications, prayers, intercessions and thanksgivings be made for all men:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For kings and for all that are in high station: that we may lead a quiet and a peaceable life in all piety and chastity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Saviour,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Who will have all men to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For there is one God: and one mediator of God and men, the man Christ Jesus: One mediator.... Christ is the one and only mediator of redemption, who gave himself, as the apostle writes in the following verse.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Who gave himself a redemption for all, a testimony in due times. A redemption for all.... He is also the only mediator, who stands in need of no other to recommend his petitions to the Father. But this is not against our seeking the prayers and intercession, as well of the faithful upon earth, as of the saints and angels in heaven, for obtaining mercy, grace, and salvation, through Jesus Christ. As St. Paul himself often desired the help of the prayers of the faithful, without any injury to the mediatorship of Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Whereunto I am appointed a preacher and an apostle (I say the truth, I lie not), a doctor of the Gentiles in faith and truth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I will therefore that men pray in every place, lifting up pure hands, without anger and contention.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: In like manner, women also in decent apparel: adorning themselves with modesty and sobriety, not with plaited hair, or gold, or pearls, or costly attire:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But, as it becometh women professing godliness, with good works.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to use authority over the man: but to be in silence. 2:13.For Adam was first formed; then Eve.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And Adam was not seduced; but the woman, being seduced, was in the transgression.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Yet she shall be saved through child bearing; if she continue in faith and love and sanctification with sobriety. 1 Timothy Chapter 3 What sort of men are to be admitted into the clergy. The church is the pillar of truth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: A faithful saying: If a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: It behoveth therefore a bishop to be blameless, the husband of one wife, sober, prudent, of good behaviour, chaste, given to hospitality, a teacher, Of one wife.... The meaning is not that every bishop should have a wife (for St. Paul himself had none), but that no one should be admitted to the holy orders of bishop, priest, or deacon, who had been married more than once.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Not given to wine, no striker, but modest, not quarrelsome, not covetous, but

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: One that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all chastity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Not a neophyte: lest, being puffed up with pride, he fall into the judgment of the devil. A neophyte.... That is, one lately baptized, a young convert.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Moreover, he must have a good testimony of them who are without: lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Deacons in like manner: chaste, not double tongued, not given to much wine, not greedy of filthy lucre:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Holding the mystery of faith in a pure conscience.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And let these also first be proved: and so let them minister, having no crime.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: The women in like manner: chaste, not slanderers, but sober, faithful in all things.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Let deacons be the husbands of one wife: who rule well their children and their own houses.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For they that have ministered well shall purchase to themselves a good degree and much confidence in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: These things I write to thee, hoping that I shall come to thee shortly.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth. The pillar and ground of the truth.... Therefore the church of the living God can never uphold error, nor bring in corruptions, superstition, or idolatry.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And evidently great is the mystery of godliness, which was manifested in the flesh, was justified in the spirit, appeared unto angels, hath been preached unto the Gentiles, is believed in the world, is taken up in glory. 1 Timothy Chapter 4 He warns him against heretics, and exhorts him to the exercise of piety.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Now the Spirit manifestly saith that in the last times some shall depart from the faith, giving heed to spirits of error and doctrines of devils,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Speaking lies in hypocrisy and having their conscience seared,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Forbidding to marry, to abstain from meats, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving by the faithful and by them that have known the truth. Forbidding to marry, to abstain from meats.... He speaks of the Gnostics, the Marcionites, the Eneratites, the Manicheans, and other ancient heretics, who absolutely condemned marriage, and the use of all kind of meat; because they pretended that all flesh was from an evil principle. Whereas the church of God, so far from condemning marriage, holds it a holy sacrament; and forbids it to none but such as by vow have chosen the better part: and prohibits not the use of any meats whatsoever in proper times and seasons; though she does not judge all kind of diet proper for days of fasting and penance.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For every creature of God is good, and nothing to be rejected that is received with thanksgiving:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: These things proposing to the brethren, thou shalt be a good minister of Christ Jesus, nourished up in the words of faith and of the good doctrine which thou hast attained unto.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But avoid foolish and old wives fables: and exercise thyself unto godliness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For bodily exercise is profitable to little: but godliness is profitable to all things, having promise of the life that now is and of that which is to come.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: A faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For therefore we labour and are reviled, because we hope in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, especially of the faithful.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: These things command and teach:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Let no man despise thy youth: but be thou an example of the faithful, in word, in conversation, in charity, in faith, in chastity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Till I come, attend unto reading, to exhortation and to doctrine.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Neglect not the grace that is in thee, which was given thee by prophecy, with imposition of the hands of the priesthood.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Meditate upon these things, be wholly in these things: that thy profiting may be manifest to all.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Take heed to thyself and to doctrine: be earnest in them. For in doing this thou shalt both save thyself and them that hear thee. 1 Timothy Chapter 5 He gives him lessons concerning widows, and how he is to behave to his clergy.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: An ancient man rebuke not, but entreat him as a father: young men, as brethren:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Old women, as mothers: young women, as sisters, in all chastity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Honour widows that are widows indeed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But if any widow have children or grandchildren, let her learn first to govern her own house and to make a return of duty to her parents; for this is acceptable before God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But she that is a widow indeed, and desolate, let her trust in God and continue in supplications and prayers night and day.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For she that liveth in pleasures is dead while she is living.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And this give in charge, that they may be blameless.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But if any man have not care of his own and especially of those of his house, he hath denied the faith and is worse than an infidel.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Let a widow be chosen of no less than threescore years of age, who hath been the wife of one husband.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Having testimony for her good works, if she have brought up children, if she have received to harbour, if she have washed the saints’ feet, if she have ministered to them that suffer tribulation, if she have diligently followed every good work.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But the younger widows avoid. For when they have grown wanton in Christ, they will marry:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Having damnation, because they have made void their first faith. Their first faith.... Their vow, by which they had engaged themselves to Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: And withal being idle they learn to go about from house to house: and are not only idle, but tattlers also and busy bodies, speaking things which they ought not.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I will, therefore, that the younger should marry, bear children, be mistresses of families, give no occasion to the adversary to speak evil.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For some are already turned aside after Satan.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: If any of the faithful have widows, let him minister to them, and let not the church be charged: that there may be sufficient for them that are widows indeed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Let the priests that rule well be esteemed worthy of double honour: especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For the scripture saith: Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn: and, The labourer is worthy of his reward.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Against a priest receive not an accusation, but under two or three witnesses.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Them that sin reprove before all that the rest also may have fear.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I charge thee, before God and Christ Jesus and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without prejudice, doing nothing by declining to either side.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Impose not hands lightly upon any man, neither be partaker of other men’s sins. Keep thyself chaste.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Do not still drink water, but use a little wine for thy stomach’s sake and thy frequent infirmities.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Some men’s sins are manifest, going before to judgment: and some men they follow after.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: In like manner also good deeds are manifest: and they that are otherwise cannot be hid. 1 Timothy Chapter 6 Duties of servants. The danger of covetousness. Lessons for the rich.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Whosoever are servants under the yoke, let them count their masters worthy of all honour; lest the name of the Lord and his doctrine be blasphemed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But they that have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brethren; but serve them the rather, because they are faithful and beloved, who are partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: If any man teach otherwise and consent not to the sound words of our Lord Jesus Christ and to that doctrine which is according to godliness,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: He is proud, knowing nothing, but sick about questions and strifes of words; from which arise envies, contentions, blasphemies, evil suspicions,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Conflicts of men corrupted in mind and who are destitute of the truth, supposing gain to be godliness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For we brought nothing into this world: and certainly we can carry nothing out.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But having food and wherewith to be covered, with these we are content.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For they that will become rich fall into temptation and into the snare of the devil and into many unprofitable and hurtful desires, which drown men into destruction and perdition.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: For the desire of money is the root of all evils; which some coveting have erred from the faith and have entangled themselves in many sorrows.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: But thou, O man of God, fly these things: and pursue justice, godliness, faith, charity, patience, mildness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Fight the good fight of faith. Lay hold on eternal life, whereunto thou art called and hast confessed a good confession before many witnesses.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: I charge thee before God who quickeneth all things, and before Christ Jesus who gave testimony under Pontius Pilate, a good confession:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: That thou keep the commandment without spot, blameless, unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Which in his times he shall shew, who is the Blessed and only Mighty, the King of kings and Lord of lords:

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Who only hath immortality and inhabiteth light inaccessible: whom no man hath seen, nor can see: to whom be honour and empire everlasting. Amen.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Charge the rich of this world not to be highminded nor to trust in the uncertainty of riches, but in the living God (who giveth us abundantly all things to enjoy)

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: To do good, to be rich in good works, to give easily, to communicate to others,

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: To lay up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold on the true life.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: O Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust, avoiding the profane novelties of words and oppositions of knowledge falsely so called.

Book: The First Epistle of St. Paul to Timothy
Text: Which some promising, have erred concerning the faith. Grace be with thee. Amen.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: The word of the Lord, that came to Joel, the son of Phatuel.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Hear this, ye old men, and give ear, all ye inhabitants of the land: did this ever happen in your days, or in the days of your fathers?

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Tell ye of this to your children, and let your children tell their children, and their children to another generation.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: That which the palmerworm hath left, the locust hath eaten: and that which the locust hath left, the bruchus hath eaten: and that which the bruchus hath left, the mildew hath destroyed. That which the palmerworm hath left, etc.... Some understand this literally of the desolation of the land by these insects: others understand it of the different invasions of the Chaldeans, or other enemies.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Awake, ye that are drunk, and weep, and mourn all ye that take delight; in drinking sweet wine: for it is cut off from your mouth.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: For a nation is come up upon my land, strong, and without number: his teeth are like the teeth of a lion: and his cheek teeth as of a lion’s whelp.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: He hath laid my vineyard waste, and hath pilled off the bark of my fig tree: he hath stripped it bare, and cast it away; the branches thereof are made white.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Lament like a virgin girded with sackcloth for the husband of her youth.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Sacrifice and libation is cut off from the house of the Lord: the priests, the Lord’s ministers, have mourned:

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: The country is destroyed, the ground hath mourned: for the corn is wasted, the wine is confounded, the oil hath languished.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: The husbandmen are ashamed, the vinedressers have howled for the wheat, and for the barley, because the harvest of the field is perished.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: The vineyard is confounded, and the fig tree hath languished: the pomegranate tree, and the palm tree, and the apple tree, and all the trees of the field are withered: because joy is withdrawn from the children of men.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Gird yourselves, and lament, O ye priests, howl, ye ministers of the altars: go in, lie in sackcloth, ye ministers of my God: because sacrifice and libation is cut off from the house of your God.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Sanctify ye a fast, call an assembly, gather together the ancients, all the inhabitants of the land into the house of your God: and cry ye to the Lord:

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Ah, ah, ah, for the day: because the day of the Lord is at hand, and it shall come like destruction from the mighty.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Is not your food cut off before your eyes, joy and gladness from the house of our God?

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: The beasts have rotted in their dung, the barns are destroyed, the storehouses are broken down: because the corn is confounded.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Why did the beasts groan, why did the herds of cattle low? because there is no pasture for them: yea, and the flocks of sheep are perished.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: To thee, O Lord, will I cry: because fire hath devoured the beautiful places of the wilderness: and the flame hath burnt all the trees of the country.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Yea, and the beasts of the field have looked up to thee, as a garden bed that thirsteth after rain, for the springs of waters are dried up, and fire hath devoured the beautiful places of the wilderness. Joel Chapter 2

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Blow ye the trumpet in Sion, sound an alarm in my holy mountain, let all the inhabitants of the land tremble: because the day of the Lord cometh, because it is nigh at hand. The day of the Lord.... That is, the time when he will execute justice upon sinners.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: A day of darkness, and of gloominess, a day of clouds and whirlwinds: a numerous and strong people as the morning spread upon the mountains: the like to it hath not been from the beginning, nor shall be after it, even to the years of generation and generation. A numerous and strong people.... The Assyrians, or Chaldeans. Others understand all this of an army of locusts laying waste the land.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Before the face thereof a devouring fire, and behind it a burning flame: the land is like a garden of pleasure before it, and behind it a desolate wilderness, neither is there any one that can escape it.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: The appearance of them is as the appearance of horses, and they shall run like horsemen.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: They shall leap like the noise of chariots upon the tops of mountains, like the noise of a flame of fire devouring the stubble, as a strong people prepared to battle.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: At their presence the people shall be in grievous pains: all faces shall be made like a kettle.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: They shall run like valiant men: like men of war they shall scale the wall: the men shall march every one on his way, and they shall not turn aside from their ranks.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: No one shall press upon his brother: they shall walk every one in his path: yea, and they shall fall through the windows, and shall take no harm.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: They shall enter into the city: they shall run upon the wall, they shall climb up the houses, they shall come in at the windows, as a thief.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: At their presence the earth hath trembled, the heavens are moved: the sun and moon are darkened, and the stars have withdrawn their shining.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And the Lord hath uttered his voice before the face of his army: for his armies are exceedingly great, for they are strong, and execute his word: for the day of the Lord is great and very terrible: and who can stand it?

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Now, therefore, saith the Lord. Be converted to me with all your heart, in fasting, and in weeping, and in mourning.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And rend your hearts, and not your garments and turn to the Lord your God: for he is gracious and merciful, patient and rich in mercy, and ready to repent of the evil.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Who knoweth but he will return, and forgive, and leave a blessing behind him, sacrifice and libation to the Lord your God?

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Blow the trumpet in Sion, sanctify a fast, call a solemn assembly,

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Gather together the people, sanctify the church, assemble the ancients, gather together the little ones, and them that suck at the breasts: let the bridegroom go forth from his bed, and the bride out of her bridal chamber.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Between the porch and the altar the priests, the Lord’s ministers, shall weep, and shall say: Spare, O Lord, spare thy people: and give not thy inheritance to reproach, that the heathens should rule over them. Why should they say among the nations: Where is their God?

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: The Lord hath been zealous for his land, and hath spared his people.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And the Lord answered, and said to his people: Behold I will send you corn, and wine, and oil, and you shall be filled with them: and I will no more make you a reproach among the nations.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And I will remove far off from you the northern enemy: and I will drive him into a land unpassable, and desert, with his face towards the east sea, and his hinder part towards the utmost sea: and his stench shall ascend, and his rottenness shall go up, because he hath done proudly. The northern enemy.... Some understand this of Holofernes and his army: others, of the locusts.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Fear not, O land, be glad, and rejoice: for the Lord hath done great things.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Fear not, ye beasts of the fields: for the beautiful places of the wilderness are sprung, for the tree hath brought forth its fruit, the fig tree, and the vine have yielded their strength.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And you, O children of Sion, rejoice, and be joyful in the Lord your God: because he hath given you a teacher of justice, and he will make the early and the latter rain to come down to you as in the beginning.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And the floors shall be filled with wheat, and the presses shall overflow with wine, and oil.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And I will restore to you the years which the locust, and the bruchus, and the mildew, and the palmerworm hath eaten; my great host which I sent upon you.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And you shall eat in plenty, and shall be filled and you shall praise the name of the Lord your God; who hath done wonders with you, and my people shall not be confounded for ever.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And you shall know that I am in the midst of Israel: and I am the Lord your God, and there is none besides: and my people shall not be confounded forever.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And it shall come to pass after this, that I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh: and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy: your old men shall dream dreams, and your young men shall see visions.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Moreover, upon my servants and handmaids in those days I will pour forth my spirit.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And I will shew wonders in heaven; and in earth, blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood: before the great and dreadful day of the Lord doth come.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And it shall come to pass, that every one that shall call upon the name of the Lord, shall be saved: for in Mount Sion, and in Jerusalem shall be salvation, as the Lord hath said, and in the residue whom the Lord shall call. Joel Chapter 3

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: For behold in those days, and in that time when I shall bring back the captivity of Juda, and Jerusalem:

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: I will gather together all nations and will bring them down into the valley of Josaphat: and I will plead with them there for my people, and for my inheritance, Israel, whom they have scattered among the nations, and have parted my land.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And they have cast lots upon my people: and the boy they have put in the stews, and the girl they have sold for wine, that they might drink.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: But what have you to do with me, O Tyre, and Sidon, and all the coast of the Philistines? will you revenge yourselves on me? and if you revenge yourselves on me, I will very soon return you a recompense upon your own head.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: For you have taken away my silver, and my gold: and my desirable, and most beautiful things you have carried into your temples.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And the children of Juda, and the children of Jerusalem, you have sold to the children of the Greeks, that you might remove them far off from their own country.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Behold, I will raise them up out of the place wherein you have sold them: and I will return your recompense upon your own heads.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And I will sell your sons, and your daughters, by the hands of the children of Juda, and they shall sell them to the Sabeans, a nation far off, for the Lord hath spoken it.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Proclaim ye this among the nations: Prepare war, rouse up the strong: let them come, let all the men of war come up.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Cut your ploughshares into swords, and your spades into spears. Let the weak say: I am strong.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Break forth, and come, all ye nations from round about, and gather yourselves together: there will the Lord cause all thy strong ones to fall down.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Let them arise, and let the nations come up into the valley of Josaphat: for there I will sit to judge all nations round about.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Put ye in the sickles, for the harvest is ripe: come and go down, for the press is full, the fats run over: for their wickedness is multiplied.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Nations, nations in the valley of destruction: for the day of the Lord is near in the valley of destruction.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: The sun and the moon are darkened, and the stars have withdrawn their shining.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And the Lord shall roar out of Sion, and utter his voice from Jerusalem: and the heavens and the earth shall be moved, and the Lord shall be the hope of his people, and the strength of the children of Israel.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And you shall know that I am the Lord your God, dwelling in Sion, my holy mountain: and Jerusalem shall be holy, and strangers shall pass through it no more.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the mountains shall drop down sweetness, and the hills shall flow with milk: and waters shall flow through all the rivers of Juda: and a fountain shall come forth of the house of the Lord, and shall water the torrent of thorns. A fountain shall come forth of the house of the Lord, etc.... Viz., the fountain of grace in the church militant, and of glory in the church triumphant: which shall water the torrent or valley of thorns, that is, the souls that before, like barren ground brought forth nothing but thorns; or that were afflicted with the thorns of crosses and tribulations.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: Egypt shall be a desolation, and Edom a wilderness destroyed: because they have done unjustly against the children of Juda, and have shed innocent blood in their land.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And Judea shall be inhabited for ever, and Jerusalem to generation and generation. Judea—and Jerusalem.... That is, the spiritual Jerusalem, viz., the church of Christ.

Book: The Prophecy of Joel
Text: And I will cleanse their blood, which I had not cleansed: and the Lord will dwell in Sion.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, called to be an apostle, separated unto the gospel of God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Which he had promised before, by his prophets, in the holy scriptures,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Concerning his Son, who was made to him of the seed of David, according to the flesh,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Who was predestinated the Son of God in power, according to the spirit of sanctification, by the resurrection of our Lord Jesus Christ from the dead: Predestinated, etc.... Christ as man, was predestinated to be the Son of God: and declared to be so (as the apostle here signifies) first, by power, that is, by his working stupendous miracles; secondly, by the spirit of sanctification, that is, by his infinite sanctity; thirdly, by his ressurection, or raising himself from the dead.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: By whom we have received grace and apostleship for obedience to the faith, in all nations, for his name:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Among whom are you also the called of Jesus Christ:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: To all that are at Rome, the beloved of God, called to be saints. Grace to you and peace, from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: First, I give thanks to my God, through Jesus Christ, for you all: because your faith is spoken of in the whole world.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the gospel of his Son, that without ceasing I make a commemoration of you:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Always in my prayers making request, if by any means now at length I may have a prosperous journey, by the will of God, to come unto you.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For I long to see you that I may impart unto you some spiritual grace, to strengthen you:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: That is to say, that I may be comforted together in you by that which is common to us both, your faith and mine.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that I have often purposed to come unto you (and have been hindered hitherto) that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among other Gentiles.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: To the Greeks and to the barbarians, to the wise and to the unwise, I am a debtor.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: So (as much as is in me) I am ready to preach the gospel to you also that are at Rome.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel. For it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth: to the Jew first and to the Greek.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For the justice of God is revealed therein, from faith unto faith, as it is written: The just man liveth by faith.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and injustice of those men that detain the truth of God in injustice:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Because that which is known of God is manifest in them. For God hath manifested it unto them.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made. His eternal power also and divinity: so that they are inexcusable.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Because that, when they knew God, they have not glorified him as God or given thanks: but became vain in their thoughts. And their foolish heart was darkened.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For, professing themselves to be wise, they became fools.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And they changed the glory of the incorruptible God into the likeness of the image of a corruptible man and of birds, and of fourfooted beasts and of creeping things.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Wherefore, God gave them up to the desires of their heart, unto uncleanness: to dishonour their own bodies among themselves.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Who changed the truth of God into a lie and worshipped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed for ever. Amen.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For this cause, God delivered them up to shameful affections. For their women have changed the natural use into that use which is against nature. God delivered them up.... Not by being author of their sins, but by withdrawing his grace, and so permitting them, in punishment of their pride, to fall into those shameful sins.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And, in like manner, the men also, leaving the natural use of the women, have burned in their lusts, one towards another: men with men, working that which is filthy and receiving in themselves the recompense which was due to their error.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And as they liked not to have God in their knowledge, God delivered them up to a reprobate sense, to do those things which are not convenient.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Being filled with all iniquity, malice, fornication, avarice, wickedness: full of envy, murder, contention, deceit, malignity: whisperers,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Detractors, hateful to God, contumelious, proud, haughty, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Foolish, dissolute: without affection, without fidelity, without mercy.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Who, having known the justice of God, did not understand that they who do such things, are worthy of death: and not only they that do them, but they also that consent to them that do them. Romans Chapter 2 The Jews are censured, who make their boast of the law and keep it not. He declares who are the true Jews.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Wherefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest. For wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself. For thou dost the same things which thou judgest.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For we know that the judgment of God is, according to truth, against them that do such things.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And thinkest thou this, O man, that judgest them who do such things and dost the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and patience and longsuffering? Knowest thou not that the benignity of God leadeth thee to penance?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But according to thy hardness and impenitent heart, thou treasurest up to thyself wrath, against the day of wrath and revelation of the just judgment of God:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Who will render to every man according to his works.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: To them indeed who, according to patience in good work, seek glory and honour and incorruption, eternal life:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But to them that are contentious and who obey not the truth but give credit to iniquity, wrath and indignation.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Tribulation and anguish upon every soul of man that worketh evil: of the Jew first, and also of the Greek.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But glory and honour and peace to every one that worketh good: to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For there is no respect of persons with God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For whosoever have sinned without the law shall perish without the law: and whosoever have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For not the hearers of the law are just before God: but the doers of the law shall be justified.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For when the Gentiles, who have not the law, do by nature those things that are of the law; these, having not the law, are a law to themselves.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Who shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience bearing witness to them: and their thoughts between themselves accusing or also defending one another,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ, according to my gospel.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But if thou art called a Jew and restest in the law and makest thy boast of God,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And knowest his will and approvest the more profitable things, being instructed by the law:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them that are in darkness,

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: An instructor of the foolish, a teacher of infants, having the form of knowledge and of truth in the law.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Thou therefore, that teachest another, teachest not thyself: thou, that preachest that men should not steal, stealest.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Thou, that sayest men should not commit adultery, committest adultery: thou, that abhorrest idols, committest sacrilege:

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Thou, that makest thy boast of the law, by transgression of the law dishonourest God.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: (For the name of God through you is blasphemed among the Gentiles, as it is written.)

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: Circumcision profiteth indeed, if thou keep the law: but if thou be a transgressor of the law, thy circumcision is made uncircumcision.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: If then, the uncircumcised keep the justices of the law, shall not this uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: And shall not that which by nature is uncircumcision, if it fulfil the law, judge thee, who by the letter and circumcision art a transgressor of the law?

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: For it is not he is a Jew, who is so outwardly: nor is that circumcision which is outwardly in the flesh.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
Text: But he is a Jew that is one inwardly and the circumcision is that of the heart, in the spirit not in the letter: whose praise is not of men, but of God. Romans Chapter 3 The advantages of the Jews. All men are sinners and none can be justified by the works of the law, but only by the grace of Christ.

Book: The Epistle of St. Paul the Apostle to the Romans
