Text: And saith to them: Go into the village that is over against you, and immediately at your coming in thither, you shall find a colt tied, upon which no man yet hath sat. Loose him and bring him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And if any man shall say to you: What are you doing? Say ye that the Lord hath need of him. And immediately he will let him come hither.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And going their way, they found the colt tied before the gate without, in the meeting of two ways. And they loose him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And some of them that stood there said to them: What do you loosing the colt?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Who said to them as Jesus had commanded them. And they let him go with them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they brought the colt to Jesus. And they lay their garments on him: and he sat upon him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And many spread their garments in the way: and others cut down boughs from the trees and strewed them in the way.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they that went before and they that followed cried, saying: Hosanna: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Blessed be the kingdom of our father David that cometh: Hosanna in the highest.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he entered into Jerusalem, into the temple: and having viewed all things round about, when now the eventide was come, he went out to Bethania with the twelve.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the next day when they came out from Bethania, he was hungry.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when he had seen afar off a fig tree having leaves, he came, if perhaps he might find any thing on it. And when he was come to it, he found nothing but leaves. For it was not the time for figs.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And answering he said to it: May no man hereafter eat fruit of thee any more for ever! And his disciples heard it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they came to Jerusalem. And when he was entered into the temple, he began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple: and over threw the tables of the moneychangers and the chairs of them that sold doves.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he suffered not that any man should carry a vessel through the temple.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he taught, saying to them: Is it not written: My house shall be called the house of prayer to all nations, but you have made it a den of thieves.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Which when the chief priests and the scribes had heard, they sought how they might destroy him. For they feared him, because the whole multitude was in admiration at his doctrine.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when evening was come, he went forth out of the city.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when they passed by in the morning they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Peter remembering, said to him: Rabbi, behold the fig tree which thou didst curse is withered away.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus answering, saith to them: Have the faith of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Amen I say to you that whosoever shall say to this mountain, Be thou removed and be cast into the sea, and shall not stagger in his heart, but believe that whatsoever he saith shall be done; it shall be done unto him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Therefore I say unto you, all things, whatsoever you ask when ye pray, believe that you shall receive: and they shall come unto you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when you shall stand to pray, forgive, if you have aught against any man: that your Father also, who is in heaven, may forgive you your sins.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But if you will not forgive, neither will your father that is in heaven forgive you your sins.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they come again to Jerusalem. And when he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests and the scribes and the ancients.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they say to him: By what authority dost thou these things? And who hath given thee this authority that thou shouldst do these things?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus answering, said to them: I will also ask you one word. And answer you me: and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: The baptism of John, was it from heaven or from men? Answer me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But they thought with themselves, saying: If we say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did you not believe him?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: If we say, From men, we fear the people. For all men counted John that he was a prophet indeed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they answering, say to Jesus: We know not. And Jesus answering, saith to them: Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things. Mark Chapter 12 The parable of the vineyard and husbandmen. Caesar’s right to tribute. The Sadducees are confuted. The first commandment. The widow’s mite.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he began to speak to them in parables: A certain man planted a vineyard and made a hedge about it and dug a place for the winefat and built a tower and let it to husbandmen: and went into a far country.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant to receive of the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Who, having laid hands on him, beat and sent him away empty.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And again he sent to them another servant: and him they wounded in the head and used him reproachfully.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And again he sent another, and him they killed: and many others, of whom some they beat, and others they killed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Therefore, having yet one son, most dear to him, he also sent him unto them last of all, saying: They will reverence my son.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But the husbandmen said one to another: This is the heir. Come let us kill him and the inheritance shall be ours.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And laying hold on him, they killed him and cast him out of the vineyard.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy those husbandmen and will give the vineyard to others.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And have you not read this scripture, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is made the head of the corner:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: By the Lord has this been done, and it is wonderful in our eyes.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they sought to lay hands on him: but they feared the people. For they knew that he spoke this parable to them. And leaving him, they went their way.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they sent to him some of the Pharisees and of the Herodians: that they should catch him in his words.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Who coming, say to him: Master, we know that thou art a true speaker and carest not for any man; for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth. Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar? Or shall we not give it?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Who knowing their wiliness, saith to them: Why tempt you me? Bring me a penny that I may see it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they brought it him. And he saith to them: Whose is this image and inscription? They say to him, Caesar’s.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus answering, said to them: Render therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s and to God the things that are God’s. And they marvelled at him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And there came to him the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection. And they asked him, saying:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Master, Moses wrote unto us that if any man’s brother die and leave his wife behind him and leave no children, his brother should take his wife and raise up seed to his brother.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Now there were seven brethren: and the first took a wife and died leaving no issue.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the second took her and died: and neither did he leave any issue. And the third in like manner.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the seven all took her in like manner and did not leave issue. Last of all the woman also died.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: In the resurrection therefore, when they shall rise again, whose wife shall she be of them? For the seven had her to wife.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus answering, saith to them: Do ye not therefore err, because you know not the scriptures nor the power of God?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: For when they shall rise again from the dead, they shall neither marry, nor be married, but are as the angels in heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And as concerning the dead that they rise again have you not read in the book of Moses, how in the bush God spoke to him, saying: I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You therefore do greatly err.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And there came one of the scribes that had heard them reasoning together, and seeing that he had answered them well, asked him which was the first commandment of all.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus answered him: The first commandment of all is, Hear, O Israel: the Lord thy God is one God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with thy whole heart and with thy whole soul and with thy whole mind and with thy whole strength. This is the first commandment.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the second is like to it: Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself. There is no other commandment greater than these.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the scribe said to him: Well, Master, thou hast said in truth that there is one God and there is no other besides him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And that he should be loved with the whole heart and with the whole understanding and with the whole soul and with the whole strength. And to love one’s neighbour as one’s self is a greater thing than all holocausts and sacrifices.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus seeing that he had answered wisely, said to him: Thou art not far from the kingdom of God. And no man after that durst ask him any question.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus answering, said, teaching in the temple: How do the scribes say that Christ is the son of David?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: For David himself saith by the Holy Ghost: The Lord said to my Lord: Sit on my right hand, until I make thy enemies thy footstool.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: David therefore himself calleth him Lord. And whence is he then his son? And a great multitude heard him gladly.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he said to them in his doctrine: Beware of the scribes, who love to walk in long robes and to be saluted in the marketplace,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And to sit in the first chairs in the synagogues and to have the highest places at suppers:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Who devour the houses of widows under the pretence of long prayer. These shall receive greater judgment.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus sitting over against the treasury, beheld how the people cast money into the treasury. And many that were rich cast in much.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And there came a certain poor widow: and she cast in two mites, which make a farthing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And calling his disciples together, he saith to them: Amen I say to you, this poor widow hath cast in more than all they who have cast into the treasury.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: For all they did cast in of their abundance; but she of her want cast in all she had, even her whole living. Mark Chapter 13 Christ foretells the destruction of the temple and the signs that shall forerun the day of judgment.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And as he was going out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him: Master, behold what manner of stones and what buildings are here.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus answering, said to him: Seest thou all these great buildings? There shall not be left a stone upon a stone, that shall not be thrown down.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And as he sat on the mount of Olivet over against the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him apart:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Tell us, when shall these things be and what shall be the sign when all these things shall begin to be fulfilled?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus answering, began to say to them: Take heed lest any man deceive you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: For many shall come in my name saying, I am he: and they shall deceive many.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when you shall hear of wars and rumours of wars, fear ye not. For such things must needs be: but the end is not yet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: For nation shall rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places and famines. These things are the beginning of sorrows.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But look to yourselves. For they shall deliver you up to councils: and in the synagogues you shall be beaten: and you shall stand before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony unto them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And unto all nations the gospel must first be preached.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when they shall lead you and deliver you up, be not thoughtful beforehand what you shall speak: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye. For it is not you that speak, but the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the brother shall betray his brother unto death, and the father his son; and children shall rise up against their parents and shall work their death.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And you shall be hated by all men for my name’s sake. But he that shall endure unto the end, he shall be saved.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when you shall see the abomination of desolation, standing where it ought not (he that readeth let him understand): then let them that are in Judea flee unto the mountains.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house nor enter therein to take any thing out of the house.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And let him that shall be in the field not turn back to take up his garment.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And woe to them that are with child and that give suck in those days.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But pray ye that these things happen not in winter.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: For in those days shall be such tribulations as were not from the beginning of the creation which God created until now: neither shall be.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And unless the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh should be saved: but, for the sake of the elect which he hath chosen, he hath shortened the days.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And then if any man shall say to you: Lo, here is Christ. Lo, he is here: do not believe.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: For there will rise up false Christs and false prophets: and they shall shew signs and wonders, to seduce (if it were possible) even the elect.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Take you heed therefore: behold, I have foretold you all things.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun shall be darkened and the moon shall not give her light.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the stars of heaven shall be falling down and the powers that are in heaven shall be moved.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in the clouds, with great power and glory.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And then shall he send his angels and shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Now of the fig tree learn ye a parable. When the branch thereof is now tender and the leaves are come forth, you know that summer is very near.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: So you also when you shall see these things come to pass, know ye that it is very nigh, even at the doors.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Amen, I say to you that this generation shall not pass until all these things be done.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my word shall not pass away.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But of that day or hour no man knoweth, neither the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but the Father. Nor the Son.... Not that the Son of God is absolutely ignorant of the day of judgment, but that he knoweth it not, as our teacher; that is, he knoweth it not so as to teach it to us, as not being expedient.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Take ye heed, watch and pray. For ye know not when the time is.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Even as a man who, going into a far country, left his house and gave authority to his servants over every work and commanded the porter to watch.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Watch ye therefore (for you know not when the lord of the house cometh, at even, or at midnight, or at the cock crowing, or in the morning):

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Lest coming on a sudden, he find you sleeping.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And what I say to you, I say to all: Watch. Mark Chapter 14 The first part of the history of the passion of Christ.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Now the feast of the pasch and of the Azymes was after two days: and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might by some wile lay hold on him and kill him. Azymes.... That is, the feast of the unleavened bread.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But they said: Not on the festival day, lest there should be a tumult among the people.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when he was in Bethania, in the house of Simon the leper, and was at meat, there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of precious spikenard. And breaking the alabaster box, she poured it out upon his head.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Now there were some that had indignation within themselves and said: Why was this waste of the ointment made?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: For this ointment might have been sold for more than three hundred pence and given to the poor. And they murmured against her.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But Jesus said: Let her alone. Why do you molest her? She hath wrought a good work upon me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: For the poor you have always with you: and whensoever you will, you may do them good: but me you have not always.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: She hath done what she could: she is come beforehand to anoint my body for the burial.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Amen, I say to you, wheresoever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world, that also which she hath done shall be told for a memorial of her.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went to the chief priests, to betray him to them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Who hearing it were glad: and they promised him they would give him money. And he sought how he might conveniently betray him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Now on the first day of the unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the pasch, the disciples say to him: Whither wilt thou that we go and prepare for thee to eat the pasch?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he sendeth two of his disciples and saith to them: Go ye into the city; and there shall meet you a man carrying a pitcher of water. Follow him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And whithersoever he shall go in, say to the master of the house, The master saith, Where is my refectory, where I may eat the pasch with my disciples?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he will shew you a large dining room furnished. And there prepare ye for us.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And his disciples went their way and came into the city. And they found as he had told them: and they prepared the pasch.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when evening was come, he cometh with the twelve.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when they were at table and eating, Jesus saith: Amen I say to you, one of you that eateth with me shall betray me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But they began to be sorrowful and to say to him, one by one: Is it I?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Who saith to them: One of the twelve, who dippeth with me his hand in the dish.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the Son of man indeed goeth, as it is written of him: but woe to that man by whom the Son of man shall be betrayed. It were better for him, if that man had not been born.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And whilst they were eating, Jesus took bread; and blessing, broke and gave to them and said: Take ye. This is my body.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And having taken the chalice, giving thanks, he gave it to them. And they all drank of it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he said to them: This is my blood of the new testament, which shall be shed for many.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Amen I say to you that I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine until that day when I shall drink it new in the kingdom of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when they had sung an hymn, they went forth to the mount of Olives.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus saith to them: You will all be scandalized in my regard this night. For it is written: I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep shall be dispersed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But after I shall be risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But Peter saith to him: Although all shall be scandalized in thee, yet not I.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus saith to him: Amen I say to thee, to-day, even in this night, before the cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice. Crow twice.... The cocks crow at two different times of the night; viz., about midnight for the first time; and then about the time commonly called the cock crowing; and this was the cock crowing our Saviour spoke of; and therefore the other Evangelists take no notice of the first crowing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But he spoke the more vehemently: Although I should die together with thee, I will not deny thee. And in like manner also said they all.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they came to a farm called Gethsemani. And he saith to his disciples: Sit you here, while I pray.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he taketh Peter and James and John with him: and he began to fear and to be heavy.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he saith to them: My soul is sorrowful even unto death. Stay you here and watch.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when he was gone forward a little, he fell flat on the ground: and he prayed that, if it might be, the hour might pass from him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he saith: Abba, Father, all things are possible to thee: remove this chalice from me; but not what I will, but what thou wilt.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he cometh and findeth them sleeping. And he saith to Peter: Simon, sleepest thou? Couldst thou not watch one hour?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Watch ye: and pray that you enter not into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And going away again, he prayed, saying the same words.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when he returned, he found them again asleep (for their eyes were heavy): and they knew not what to answer him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he cometh the third time and saith to them: Sleep ye now and take your rest. It is enough. The hour is come: behold the Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of sinners.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Rise up: let us go. Behold, he that will betray me is at hand.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And while he was yet speaking, cometh Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve: and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and the scribes and the ancients.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he that betrayed him had given them a sign, saying: Whomsoever I shall kiss, that is he. Lay hold on him: and lead him away carefully.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when he was come, immediately going up to him he saith: Hail, Rabbi! And he kissed him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But they laid hands on him and held him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And one of them that stood by, drawing a sword, struck a servant of the chief priest and cut off his ear.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus answering, said to them: Are you come out as to a robber, with swords and staves to apprehend me?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: I was daily with you in the temple teaching: and you did not lay hands on me. But that the scriptures may be fulfilled.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Then his disciples, leaving him, all fled away.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And a certain young man followed him, having a linen cloth cast about his naked body. And they laid hold on him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But he, casting off the linen cloth, fled from them naked.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they brought Jesus to the high priest. And all the priests and the scribes and the ancients assembled together.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Peter followed him afar off, even into the court of the high priest. And he sat with the servants at the fire and warmed himself.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the chief priests and all the council sought for evidence against Jesus, that they might put him to death: and found none.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: For many bore false witness against him: and their evidences were not agreeing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And some rising up, bore false witness against him, saying:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: We heard him say, I will destroy this temple made with hands and within three days I will build another not made with hands.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And their witness did not agree.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the high priest rising up in the midst, asked Jesus, saying: Answerest thou nothing to the things that are laid to thy charge by these men?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But he held his peace and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him and said to him: Art thou the Christ, the Son of the Blessed God?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus said to him: I am. And you shall see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of the power of God and coming with the clouds of heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Then the high priest rending his garments, saith: What need we any further witnesses?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: You have heard the blasphemy. What think you? Who all condemned him to be guilty of death.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And some began to spit on him and to cover his face and to buffet him and to say unto him: Prophesy. And the servants struck him with the palms of their hands.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Now when Peter was in the court below, there cometh one of the maidservants of the high priest.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when she had seen Peter warming himself looking on him, she saith: Thou also wast with Jesus of Nazareth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But he denied, saying: I neither know nor understand what thou sayest. And he went forth before the court; and the cock crew.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And again a maidservant seeing him, began to say to the standers by: This is one of them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But he denied again. And after a while they that stood by said again to Peter: Surely thou art one of them; for thou art also a Galilean.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But he began to curse and to swear, saying: I know not this man of whom you speak.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And immediately the cock crew again. And Peter remembered the word that Jesus had said unto him: Before the cock crow twice, thou shalt thrice deny me. And he began to weep. Mark Chapter 15 The continuation of the history of the passion.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And straightway in the morning, the chief priests holding a consultation with the ancients and the scribes and the whole council, binding Jesus, led him away and delivered him to Pilate.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Pilate asked him: Art thou the king of the Jews? But he answering, saith to him: Thou sayest it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the chief priests accused him in many things.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Pilate again asked him, saying: Answerest thou nothing? Behold in how many things they accuse thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But Jesus still answered nothing: so that Pilate wondered.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Now on the festival day he was wont to release unto them one of the prisoners, whomsoever they demanded.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And there was one called Barabbas, who was put in prison with some seditious men, who in the sedition had committed murder.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when the multitude was come up, they began to desire that he would do as he had ever done unto them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Pilate answered them and said: Will you that I release to you the king of the Jews?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: For he knew that the chief priests had delivered him up out of envy.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But the chief priests moved the people, that he should rather release Barabbas to them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Pilate again answering, saith to them: What will you then that I do to the king of the Jews?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But they again cried out: Crucify him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Pilate saith to them: Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out the more: Crucify him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And so Pilate being willing to satisfy the people, released to them Barabbas: and delivered up Jesus, when he had scourged him, to be crucified.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the soldiers led him away into the court of the palace: and they called together the whole band.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they clothed him with purple: and, platting a crown of thorns, they put it upon him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they began to salute him: Hail, king of the Jews.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they struck his head with a reed: and they did spit on him. And bowing their knees, they adored him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And after they had mocked him, they took off the purple from him and put his own garments on him: and they led him out to crucify him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they forced one Simon a Cyrenian, who passed by coming out of the country, the father of Alexander and of Rufus, to take up his cross.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they bring him into the place called Golgotha, which being interpreted is, The place of Calvary.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh. But he took it not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And crucifying him, they divided his garments, casting lots upon them, what every man should take.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And it was the third hour: and they crucified him. The third hour.... The ancient account divided the day into four parts, which were named from the hour from which they began; the first, third, sixth, and ninth hour. Our Lord was crucified a little before noon; before the third hour had quite expired; but when the sixth hour was near at hand.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the inscription of his cause was written over: THE KING OF THE JEWS.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And with him they crucify two thieves: the one on his right hand, and the other on his left.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the scripture was fulfilled, which saith: And with the wicked he was reputed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they that passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads and saying: Vah, thou that destroyest the temple of God and in three days buildest it up again:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Save thyself, coming down from the cross.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: In like manner also the chief priests, mocking, said with the scribes one to another: He saved others; himself he cannot save.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Let Christ the king of Israel come down now from the cross, that we may see and believe. And they that were crucified with him, reviled him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole earth until the ninth hour.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And at the ninth hour, Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying: Eloi, Eloi, lamma sabacthani? Which is, being interpreted: My God, My God, Why hast thou forsaken me?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And some of the standers by hearing, said: Behold he calleth Elias.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And one running and filling a sponge with vinegar and putting it upon a reed, gave him to drink, saying: Stay, let us see if Elias come to take him down.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Jesus, having cried out with a loud voice, gave up the ghost.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the veil of the temple was rent in two, from the top to the bottom.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the centurion who stood over against him, seeing that crying out in this manner he had given up the ghost, said: Indeed this man was the son of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And there were also women looking on afar off: among whom was Mary Magdalen and Mary the mother of James the Less and of Joseph and Salome,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Who also when he was in Galilee followed him and ministered to him, and many other women that came up with him to Jerusalem.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when evening was now come (because it was the Parasceve, that is, the day before the sabbath),

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Joseph of Arimathea, a noble counsellor, who was also himself looking for the kingdom of God, came and went in boldly to Pilate and begged the body of Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But Pilate wondered that he should be already dead. And sending for the centurion, he asked him if he were already dead.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when he had understood it by the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Joseph, buying fine linen and taking him down, wrapped him up in the fine linen and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewed out of a rock. And he rolled a stone to the door of the sepulchre.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And Mary Magdalen and Mary the mother of Joseph, beheld where he was laid. Mark Chapter 16 Christ’s resurrection and ascension.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And when the sabbath was past, Mary Magdalen and Mary the mother of James and Salome bought sweet spices, that coming, they might anoint Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And very early in the morning, the first day of the week, they come to the sepulchre, the sun being now risen. The sun being now risen.... They set out before it was light, to go to the sepulchre; but the sun was risen when they arrived there. Or, figuratively, the sun here spoken of is the sun of justice, Christ Jesus our Lord, who was risen before their coming.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they said one to another: Who shall roll us back the stone from the door of the sepulchre?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And looking, they saw the stone rolled back. For it was very great.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And entering into the sepulchre, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, clothed with a white robe: and they were astonished.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: Who saith to them: Be not affrighted; you seek Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He is risen: he is not here. Behold the place where they laid him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But go, tell his disciples and Peter that he goeth before you into Galilee. There you shall see him, as he told you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But they going out, fled from the sepulchre: for a trembling and fear had seized them. And they said nothing to any man: for they were afraid.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But he rising early the first day of the week, appeared first to Mary Magdalen; out of whom he had cast seven devils.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: She went and told them that had been with him, who were mourning and weeping.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they hearing that he was alive and had been seen by her, did not believe.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And after that he appeared in another shape to two of them walking, as they were going into the country.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And they going told it to the rest: neither did they believe them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: At length he appeared to the eleven as they were at table: and he upbraided them with their incredulity and hardness of heart, because they did not believe them who had seen him after he was risen again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And he said to them: Go ye into the whole world and preach the gospel to every creature.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved: but he that believeth not shall be condemned.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And these signs shall follow them that believe: In my name they shall cast out devils. They shall speak with new tongues.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: They shall take up serpents: and if they shall drink any deadly thing, it shall not hurt them. They shall lay their hand upon the sick: and they shall recover.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: And the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken to them, was taken up into heaven and sitteth on the right hand of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Mark
Text: But they going forth preached every where: the Lord working withal, and confirming the word with signs that followed.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon and our hands have handled, of the word of life.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For the life was manifested: and we have seen and do bear witness and declare unto you the life eternal, which was with the Father and hath appeared to us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: That which we have seen and have heard, we declare unto you: that you also may have fellowship with us and our fellowship may be with the Father and with his Son Jesus Christ.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And these things we write to you, that you may rejoice and your joy may be full.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And this is the declaration which we have heard from him and declare unto you: That God is light and in him there is no darkness.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If we say that we have fellowship with him and walk in darkness, we lie and do not the truth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But if we walk in the light, as he also is in the light, we have fellowship one with another: And the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanseth us from all sin.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves and the truth is not in us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just, to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all iniquity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar: and his word is not in us. 1 John Chapter 2 Christ is our advocate. We must keep his commandments and love one another. We must not love the world nor give ear to new teachers, but abide by the spirit of God in the church.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: My little children, these things I write to you, that you may not sin. But if any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the just.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he is the propitiation for our sins: and not for ours only, but also for those of the whole world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And by this we know that we have known him, if we keep his commandments. We have known him, if we keep his commandments.... He speaks of that practical knowledge by love and affection, which can only be proved by our keeping his commandments; and without which we can not be said to know God as we should do.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He who saith that he knoweth him and keepeth not his commandments is a liar: and the truth is not in him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But he that keepeth his word, in him in very deed the charity of God is perfected. And by this we know that we are in him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also to walk even as he walked.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, I write not a new commandment to you, but an old commandment which you had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which you have heard.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Again a new commandment I write unto you: which thing is true both in him and in you, because the darkness is passed and the true light now shineth. A new commandment.... Viz., the commandment of love, which was first given in the old law; but was renewed and extended by Christ. See John 13.34.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that saith he is in the light and hateth his brother is in darkness even until now.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that loveth his brother abideth in the light: and there is no scandal in him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But he that hateth his brother is in darkness and walketh in darkness and knoweth not whither he goeth: because the darkness hath blinded his eyes.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I write unto you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name’s sake.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I write unto you, fathers, because you have known him who is from the beginning. I write unto you, young men, because you have overcome the wicked one.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I write unto you, babes, because you have known the Father. I write unto you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God abideth in you, and you have overcome the wicked one.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Love not the world, nor the things which are in the world. If any man love the world, the charity of the Father is not in him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For all that is in the world is the concupiscence of the flesh and the concupiscence of the eyes and the pride of life, which is not of the Father but is of the world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And the world passeth away and the concupiscence thereof: but he that doth the will of God abideth for ever.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Little children, it is the last hour: and as you have heard that Antichrist cometh, even now there are become many Antichrists: whereby we know that it is the last hour. It is the last hour.... That is, it is the last age of the world. Many Antichrists; ... that is, many heretics, enemies of Christ and his church, and forerunners of the great Antichrist.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: They went out from us but they were not of us. For if they had been of us, they would no doubt have remained with us: but that they may be manifest, that they are not all of us. They were not of us.... That is, they were not solid, steadfast, genuine Christians: otherwise they would have remained in the church.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: But you have the unction from the Holy One and know all things. The unction from the Holy One.... That is, grace and wisdom from the Holy Ghost. Know all things.... The true children of God’s church, remaining in unity, under the guidance of their lawful pastors, partake of the grace of the Holy Ghost, promised to the church and her pastors; and have in the church all necessary knowledge and instruction; so as to have no need to seek it elsewhere, since it can be only found in that society of which they are members.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: I have not written to you as to them that know not the truth, but as to them that know it: and that no lie is of the truth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Who is a liar, but he who denieth that Jesus is the Christ? This is Antichrist, who denieth the Father and the Son.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever denieth the Son, the same hath not the Father. He that confesseth the Son hath the Father also.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: As for you, let that which you have heard from the beginning abide in you. If that abide in you, which you have heard from the beginning, you also shall abide in the Son and in the Father.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And this is the promise which he hath promised us, life everlasting.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: These things have I written to you concerning them that seduce you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And as for you, let the unction, which you have received from him abide in you. And you have no need that any man teach you: but as his unction teacheth you of all things and is truth and is no lie. And as it hath taught you, abide in him. You have no need, etc.... You want not to be taught by any of these men, who, under pretence of imparting more knowledge to you, seek to seduce you (ver. 26), since you are sufficiently taught already, and have all knowledge and grace in the church, with the unction of the Holy Ghost; which these new teachers have no share in.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And now, little children, abide in him, that when he shall appear we may have confidence and not be confounded by him at his coming.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If you know that he is just, know ye, that every one also who doth justice is born of him. 1 John Chapter 3 Of the love of God to us. How we may distinguish the children of God and those of the devil. Of loving one another and of purity of conscience.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Behold what manner of charity the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called and should be the sons of God. Therefore the world knoweth not us, because it knew not him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, we are now the sons of God: and it hath not yet appeared what we shall be. We know that when he shall appear we shall be like to him: because we shall see him as he is.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And every one that hath this hope in him sanctifieth himself, as he also is holy.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever committeth sin committeth also iniquity. And sin is iniquity. Iniquity.... transgression of the law.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And you know that he appeared to take away our sins: and in him there is no sin.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever abideth in him sinneth not: and whosoever sinneth hath not seen him nor known him. Sinneth not.... viz., mortally. See chap. 1.8.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Little children, let no man deceive you. He that doth justice is just, even as he is just.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that committeth sin is of the devil: for the devil sinneth from the beginning. For this purpose the Son of God appeared, that he might destroy the works of the devil.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever is born of God committeth not sin: for his seed abideth in him. And he cannot sin, because he is born of God. Committeth not sin.... That is, as long as he keepeth in himself this seed of grace, and this divine generation, by which he is born of God. But then he may fall from this happy state, by the abuse of his free will, as appears from Rom. 11.20-22; Cor. 9.27; and 10.12; Phil. 2.12; Apoc. 3.11.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this the children of God are manifest, and the children of the devil. Whosoever is not just is not of God, nor he that loveth not his brother.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For this is the declaration which you have heard from the beginning, that you should love one another.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Not as Cain, who was of the wicked one and killed his brother. And wherefore did he kill him? Because his own works were wicked: and his brother’s just.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Wonder not, brethren, if the world hate you.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: We know that we have passed from death to life, because we love the brethren. He that loveth not abideth in death.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever hateth his brother is a murderer. And you know that no murderer hath eternal life abiding in himself.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this we have known the charity of God, because he hath laid down his life for us: and we ought to lay down our lives for the brethren.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that hath the substance of this world and shall see his brother in need and shall shut up his bowels from him: how doth the charity of God abide in him?

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: My little children, let us not love in word nor in tongue, but in deed and in truth.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this we know that we are of the truth and in his sight shall persuade our hearts.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For if our heart reprehend us, God is greater than our heart and knoweth all things.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, if our heart do not reprehend us, we have confidence towards God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And whatsoever we shall ask, we shall receive of him: because we keep his commandments and do those things which are pleasing in his sight.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And this is his commandment: That we should believe in the name of his Son Jesus Christ and love one another, as he hath given commandment unto us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And he that keepeth his commandments abideth in him, and he in him. And in this we know that he abideth in us by the Spirit which he hath given us. 1 John Chapter 4 What spirits are of God, and what are not. We must love one another, because God has loved us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, believe not every spirit, but try the spirits if they be of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world. Try the spirits.... Viz., by examining whether their teaching be agreeable to the rule of the Catholic faith, and the doctrine of the church. For as he says, (ver. 6,) He that knoweth God, heareth us [the pastors of the church]. By this we know the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: By this is the spirit of God known. Every spirit which confesseth that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is of God: Every spirit which confesseth, etc.... Not that the confession of this point of faith alone, is, at all times, and in all cases, sufficient; but that with relation to that time, and for that part of the Christian doctrine, which was then particularly to be confessed, taught, and maintained against the heretics of those days, this was the most proper token, by which the true teachers might be distinguished form the false.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And every spirit that dissolveth Jesus is not of God. And this is Antichrist, of whom you have heard that he cometh: and he is now already in the world. That dissolveth Jesus.... Viz., either by denying his humanity, or his divinity. He is now already in the world.... Not in his person, but in his spirit, and in his precursors.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: You are of God, little children, and have overcome him. Because greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: They are of the world. Therefore of the world they speak: and the world heareth them.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: We are of God. He that knoweth God heareth us. He that is not of God heareth us not. By this we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Dearly beloved, let us love one another: for charity is of God. And every one that loveth is born of God and knoweth God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that loveth not knoweth not God: for God is charity.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: By this hath the charity of God appeared towards us, because God hath sent his only begotten Son into the world, that we may live by him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this is charity: not as though we had loved God, but because he hath first loved us, and sent his Son to be a propitiation for our sins.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: My dearest, if God hath so loved us, we also ought to love one another.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: No man hath seen God at any time. If we love one another, God abideth in us: and his charity is perfected in us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this we know that we abide in him, and he in us: because he hath given us of his spirit.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And we have seen and do testify that the Father hath sent his Son to be the Saviour of the world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God abideth in him, and he in God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And we have known and have believed the charity which God hath to us. God is charity: and he that abideth in charity abideth in God, and God in him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this is the charity of God perfected with us, that we may have confidence in the day of judgment: because as he is, we also are in this world.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Fear is not in charity: but perfect charity casteth out fear, because fear hath pain. And he that feareth is not perfected in charity. Fear is not in charity, etc.... Perfect charity, or love, banisheth human fear, that is, the fear of men; as also all perplexing fear, which makes men mistrust or despair of God’s mercy; and that kind of servile fear, which makes them fear the punishment of sin more than the offence offered to God. But it no way excludes the wholesome fear of God’s judgments, so often recomended in holy writ; nor that fear and trembling, with which we are told to work out our salvation. Phil. 2.12.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Let us therefore love God: because God first hath loved us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If any man say: I love God, and hateth his brother; he is a liar. For he that loveth not his brother whom he seeth, how can he love God whom he seeth not?

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And this commandment we have from God, that he who loveth God love also his brother. 1 John Chapter 5 Of them that are born of God, and of true charity. Faith overcomes the world. Three that bear witness to Christ. Of faith in his name and of sin that is and is not to death.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ, is born of God. And every one that loveth him who begot, loveth him also who is born of him. Is born of God.... That is, is justified, and become a child of God by baptism: which is also to be understood; provided the belief of this fundamental article of the Christian faith be accompanied with all the other conditions, which, by the word of God, and his appointment, are also required to justification; such as a general belief of all that God has revealed and promised: hope, love, repentance, and a sincere disposition to keep God’s holy law and commandments.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: In this we know that we love the children of God: when we love God and keep his commandments.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For this is the charity of God: That we keep his commandments. And his commandments are not heavy.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: For whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world. And this is the victory which overcometh the world: Our faith. Our faith.... Not a bare, speculative, or dead faith; but a faith that worketh by charity. Gal. 5.6

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Who is he that overcometh the world, but he that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God?

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: This is he that came by water and blood, Jesus Christ: not by water only but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit which testifieth that Christ is the truth. Came by water and blood.... Not only to wash away our sins by the water of baptism, but by his own blood.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there are Three who give testimony in heaven, the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost. And these three are one.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And there are three that give testimony on earth: the spirit and the water and the blood. And these three are one. The spirit, and the water, and the blood.... As the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost, all bear witness to Christ’s divinity; so the spirit, which he yielded up, crying out with a loud voice upon the cross; and the water and blood that issued from his side, bear witness to his humanity, and are one; that is, all agree in one testimony.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: If we receive the testimony of men, the testimony of God is greater. For this is the testimony of God, which is greater, because he hath testified of his Son.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that believeth in the Son of God hath the testimony of God in himself. He that believeth not the Son maketh him a liar: because he believeth not in the testimony which God hath testified of his Son. He that believeth not the Son, etc.... By refusing to believe the testimonies given by the three divine persons, that Jesus was the Messias, and the true Son of God, by whom eternal life is obtained and promised to all that comply with his doctrine. In him we have also this lively confidence, that we shall obtain whatever we ask, according to his will, when we ask what is for our good, with perseverance, and in the manner we ought. And this we know, and have experience of, by having obtained the petitions that we have made.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And this is the testimony that God hath given to us eternal life. And this life is in his Son.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that hath the Son hath life. He that hath not the Son hath not life.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: These things I write to you that you may know that you have eternal life: you who believe in the name of the Son of God.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And this is the confidence which we have towards him: That, whatsoever we shall ask according to his will, he heareth us.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And we know that he heareth us whatsoever we ask: we know that we have the petitions which we request of him.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: He that knoweth his brother to sin a sin which is not to death, let him ask: and life shall be given to him who sinneth not to death. There is a sin unto death. For that I say not that any man ask. A sin which is not to death, etc.... It is hard to determine what St. John here calls a sin which is not to death, and a sin which is unto death. The difference can not be the same as betwixt sins that are called venial and mortal: for he says, that if a man pray for his brother, who commits a sin that is not to death, life shall be given him: therefore such a one had before lost the life of grace, and been guilty of what is commonly called a mortal sin. And when he speaks of a sin that is unto death, and adds these words, for that I say not that any man ask, it cannot be supposed that St. John would say this of every mortal sin, but only of some heinous sins, which are very seldom remitted, because such sinners very seldom repent. By a sin therefore which is unto death, interpreters commonly understand a wilfull apostasy from the faith, and from the known truth, when a sinner, hardened by his own ingratitude, becomes deaf to all admonitions, will do nothing for himself, but runs on to a final impenitence. Nor yet does St. John say, that such a sin is never remitted, or cannot be remitted, but only has these words, for that I say not that any man ask the remission: that is, though we must pray for all sinners whatsoever, yet men can not pray for such sinners with such a confidence of obtaining always their petitions, as St. John said before, ver. 14. Whatever exposition we follow on this verse, our faith teacheth us from the holy scriptures, that God desires not the death of any sinner, but that he be converted and live, Ezech. 33.11. Though men’s sins be as red as scarlet, they shall become as white as snow, Isa. 3.18. It is the will of God that every one come to the knowledge of the truth, and be saved. There is no sin so great but which God is willing to forgive, and has left a power in his church to remit the most enormous sins: so that no sinner need despair of pardon, nor will any sinner perish, but by his own fault. A sin unto death.... Some understand this of final impenitence, or of dying in mortal sin; which is the only sin that never can be remitted. But, it is probable, he may also comprise under this name, the sin of apostasy from the faith, and some other such heinous sins as are seldom and hardly remitted: and therefore he gives little encouragement, to such as pray for these sinners, to expect what they ask.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: All iniquity is sin. And there is a sin unto death.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: We know that whosoever is born of God sinneth not: but the generation of God preserveth him and the wicked one toucheth him not.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: We know that we are of God and the whole world is seated in wickedness. And the whole world is seated in wickedness.... That is, a great part of the world. It may also signify, is under the wicked one, meaning the devil, who is elsewhere called the prince of this world, that is, of all the wicked. John 12.31.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: And we know that the Son of God is come. And he hath given us understanding that we may know the true God and may be in his true Son. This is the true God and life eternal. And may be in his true Son. He is, or this is the true God, and life eternal.... Which words are a clear proof of Christ’s divinity, and as such made use of by the ancient fathers.

Book: The First Epistle of St. John the Apostle
Text: Little children, keep yourselves from idols. Amen. Keep yourselves from idols.... An admonition to the newly converted Christians, lest conversing with heathens and idolaters, they might fall back into the sin of idolatry, which may be the sin unto death here mentioned by St. John.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother: to the church of God that is at Corinth, with all the saints that are in all Achaia:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Grace unto you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and the God of all comfort:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Who comforteth us in all our tribulation, that we also may be able to comfort them who are in all distress, by the exhortation wherewith we also are exhorted by God.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us: so also by Christ doth our comfort abound.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Now whether we be in tribulation, it is for your exhortation and salvation: or whether we be comforted, it is for your consolation: or whether we be exhorted, it is for your exhortation and salvation, which worketh the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: That our hope for you may be steadfast: knowing that as you are partakers of the sufferings, so shall you be also of the consolation.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For we would not have you ignorant, brethren, of our tribulation which came to us in Asia: that we were pressed out of measure above our strength, so that we were weary even of life.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But we had in ourselves the answer of death, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God who raiseth the dead.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Who hath delivered and doth deliver us out of so great dangers: in whom we trust that he will yet also deliver us,

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: You helping withal in prayer for us. That for this gift obtained for us, by the means of many persons, thanks may be given by many in our behalf.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For our glory is this: the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity of heart and sincerity of God, and not in carnal wisdom, but in the grace of God, we have conversed in this world: and more abundantly towards you.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For we write no other things to you than what you have read and known. And I hope that you shall know unto the end.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: As also you have known us in part, that we are your glory: as you also are ours, in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And in this confidence I had a mind to come to you before, that you might have a second grace:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And to pass by you into Macedonia: and again from Macedonia to come to you, and by you to be brought on my way towards Judea.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Whereas then I was thus minded, did I use lightness? Or, the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that there should be with me, It is, and It is not?

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But God is faithful: for our preaching which was to you, was not, It is, and It is not.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, by me and Sylvanus and Timothy, was not: It is and It is not. But, It is, was in him. It is, was in him.... There was no inconstancy in the doctrine of the apostles, sometimes, like modern sectaries, saying, It is, and at other times saying, It is not. But their doctrine was ever the same, one uniform yea, in Jesus Christ, one Amen, that is, one truth in him.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For all the promises of God are in him, It is. Therefore also by him, amen to God, unto our glory.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Now he that confirmeth us with you in Christ and that hath anointed us, is God:

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: Who also hath sealed us and given the pledge of the Spirit in our hearts.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But I call God to witness upon my soul that to spare you, I came not any more to Corinth: not because we exercise dominion over your faith: but we are helpers of your joy. For in faith you stand. 2 Corinthians Chapter 2 He grants a pardon to the incestuous man upon his doing penance.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: But I determined this with myself, not to come to you again in sorrow.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For if I make you sorrowful, who is he then that can make me glad, but the same who is made sorrowful by me?

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: And I wrote this same to you: that I may not, when I come, have sorrow upon sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice: having confidence in you all, that my joy is the joy of you all.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
Text: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart, I wrote to you with many tears: not that you should be made sorrowful: but that you might know the charity I have more abundantly towards you.

Book: The Second Epistle of St. Paul to the Corinthians
