Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And they gathered themselves together in every city, and town, and place, to lay their hands on their enemies, and their persecutors. And no one durst withstand them, for the fear of their power had gone through every people.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the judges of the provinces, and the governors, and lieutenants, and every one in dignity, that presided over every place and work, extolled the Jews for fear of Mardochai:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For they knew him to be prince of the palace, and to have great power: and the fame of his name increased daily, and was spread abroad through all men’s mouths.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So the Jews made a great slaughter of their enemies, and killed them, repaying according to what they had prepared to do to them:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Insomuch that even in Susan they killed five hundred men, besides the ten sons of Aman the Agagite, the enemy of the Jews: whose names are these:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Pharsandatha, and Delphon, and Esphatha

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Phoratha, and Adalia, and Aridatha,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Phermesta, and Arisai, and Aridai, and Jezatha.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when they had slain them, they would not touch the spoils of their goods.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And presently the number of them that were killed in Susan was brought to the king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he said to the queen: The Jews have killed five hundred men in the city of Susan, besides the ten sons of Aman: how many dost thou think they have slain in all the provinces? What askest thou more, and what wilt thou have me to command to be done?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And she answered: If it please the king, let it be granted to the Jews, to do to morrow in Susan as they have done to day, and that the ten sons of Aman may be hanged upon gibbets.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king commanded that it should be so done. And forthwith the edict was hung up in Susan, and the ten sons of Aman were hanged.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And on the fourteenth day of the month Adar the Jews gathered themselves together, and they killed in Susan three hundred men: but they took not their substance.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Moreover through all the provinces which were subject to the king’s dominion the Jews stood for their lives, and slew their enemies and persecutors: insomuch that the number of them that were killed amounted to seventy-five thousand, and no man took any of their goods.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now the thirteenth day of the month Adar was the first day with them all of the slaughter, and on the fourteenth day they left off. Which they ordained to be kept holy day, so that all times hereafter they should celebrate it with feasting, joy, and banquets.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But they that were killing in the city of Susan, were employed in the slaughter on the thirteenth and fourteenth day of the same month: and on the fifteenth day they rested. And therefore they appointed that day to be a holy day of feasting and gladness.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But those Jews that dwelt in towns not walled and in villages, appointed the fourteenth day of the month Adar for banquets and gladness, so as to rejoice on that day, and send one another portions of their banquets and meats.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Mardochai wrote all these things, and sent them comprised in letters to the Jews that abode in all the king’s provinces, both those that lay near and those afar off,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: That they should receive the fourteenth and fifteenth day of the month Adar for holy days, and always at the return of the year should celebrate them with solemn honour:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Because on those days the Jews revenged themselves of their enemies, and their mourning and sorrow were turned into mirth and joy, and that these should be days of feasting and gladness, in which they should send one to another portions of meats, and should give gifts to the poor.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the Jews undertook to observe with solemnity all they had begun to do at that time, which Mardochai by letters had commanded to be done.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For Aman, the son of Amadathi of the race of Agag, the enemy and adversary of the Jews, had devised evil against them, to kill them and destroy them; and had cast Phur, that is, the lot.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And afterwards Esther went in to the king, beseeching him that his endeavours might be made void by the king’s letters: and the evil that he had intended against the Jews, might return upon his own head. And so both he and his sons were hanged upon gibbets.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And since that time these days are called Phurim, that is, of lots: because Phur, that is, the lot, was cast into the urn. And all things that were done, are contained in the volume of this epistle, that is, of this book:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the things that they suffered, and that were afterwards changed, the Jews took upon themselves and their seed, and upon all that had a mind to be joined to their religion, so that it should be lawful for none to pass these days without solemnity: which the writing testifieth, and certain times require, as the years continually succeed one another.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: These are the days which shall never be forgot: and which all provinces in the whole world shall celebrate throughout all generations: neither is there any city wherein the days of Phurim, that is, of lots, must not be observed by the Jews, and by their posterity, which is bound to these ceremonies.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And Esther the queen, the daughter of Abihail, and Mardochai the Jew, wrote also a second epistle, that with all diligence this day should be established a festival for the time to come.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And they sent to all the Jews that were in the hundred and twenty-seven provinces of king Assuerus, that they should have peace, and receive truth,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And observe the days of lots, and celebrate them with joy in their proper time: as Mardochai and Esther had appointed, and they undertook them to be observed by themselves and by their seed, fasts, and cries, and the days of lots,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And all things which are contained in the history of this book, which is called Esther. Esther Chapter 10 Assuerus’s greatness. Mardochai’s dignity.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And king Assuerus made all the land, and all the islands of the sea tributary.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And his strength and his empire, and the dignity and greatness wherewith he exalted Mardochai, are written in the books of the Medes, and of the Persians:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And how Mardochai of the race of the Jews, was next after king Assuerus: and great among the Jews, and acceptable to the people of his brethren, seeking the good of his people, and speaking those things which were for the welfare of his seed.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then Mardochai said: God hath done these things. Then Mardochai, etc.... Here St. Jerome advertiseth the reader, that what follows is not in the Hebrew, but is found in the septuagint Greek edition, which the seventy-two interpreters translated out of the Hebrew, or added by the inspiration of the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: I remember a dream that I saw, which signified these same things: and nothing thereof hath failed. A dream.... This dream was prophetical and extraordinary: otherwise the general rule is not to observe dreams.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The little fountain which grew into a river, and was turned into a light, and into the sun, and abounded into many waters, is Esther, whom the king married, and made queen.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But the two dragons are I and Aman.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The nations that were assembled are they that endeavoured to destroy the name of the Jews.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And my nation is Israel, who cried to the Lord, and the Lord saved his people: and he delivered us from all evils, and hath wrought great signs and wonders among the nations:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he commanded that there should be two lots, one of the people of God, and the other of all the nations.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And both lots came to the day appointed already from that time before God to all nations:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the Lord remembered his people, and had mercy on his inheritance.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And these days shall be observed in the month of Adar on the fourteenth, and fifteenth day of the same month, with all diligence, and joy of the people gathered into one assembly, throughout all the generations hereafter of the people of Israel. Esther Chapter 11 The dream of Mardochai, which in the ancient Greek and Latin Bibles was into the beginning of the book, but was detached by St. Jerome, and put in this place.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: In the fourth year of the reign of Ptolemy and Cleopatra, Dositheus, who said he was a priest, and of the Levitical race, and Ptolemy his son brought this epistle of Phurim, which they said Lysimachus the son of Ptolemy had interpreted in Jerusalem.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: In the second year of the reign of Artaxerxes the great, in the first day of the month Nisan, Mardochai the son of Jair, the son of Semei, the son of Cis, of the tribe of Benjamin:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: A Jew who dwelt in the city of Susan, a great man and among the first of the king’s court, had a dream.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now he was of the number of the captives, whom Nabuchodonosor king of Babylon had carried away from Jerusalem with Jechonias king of Juda:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And this was his dream: Behold there were voices, and tumults, and thunders, and earthquakes, and a disturbance upon the earth.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And behold two great dragons came forth ready to fight one against another.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And at their cry all nations were stirred up to fight against the nation of the just.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And that was a day of darkness and danger, of tribulation and distress, and great fear upon the earth.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the nation of the just was troubled fearing their own evils, and was prepared for death.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And they cried to God: and as they were crying, a little fountain grew into a very great river, and abounded into many waters.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The light and the sun rose up, and the humble were exalted, and they devoured the glorious.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when Mardochai had seen this, and arose out of his bed, he was thinking what God would do: and he kept it fixed in his mind, desirous to know what the dream should signify. Esther Chapter 12 Mardochai detects the conspiracy of the two eunuchs.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he abode at that time in the king’s court with Bagatha and Thara the king’s eunuchs, who were porters of the palace.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when he understood their designs, and had diligently searched into their projects, he learned that they went about to lay violent hands on king Artaxerxes, and he told the king thereof.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Then the king had them both examined, and after they had confessed, commanded them to be put to death.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But the king made a record of what was done: and Mardochai also committed the memory of the thing to writing.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the king commanded him, to abide in the court of the palace, and gave him presents for the information.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But Aman the son of Amadathi the Bugite was in great honour with the king, and sought to hurt Mardochai and his people, because of the two eunuchs of the king who were put to death. Esther Chapter 13 A copy of a letter sent by Aman to destroy the Jews. Mardochai’s prayer for the people.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And this was the copy of the letter: Artaxerxes the great king who reigneth from India to Ethiopia, to the princes and governors of the hundred and twenty-seven provinces, that are subject to his empire, greeting.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Whereas I reigned over many nations, and had brought all the world under my dominion, I was not willing to abuse the greatness of my power, but to govern my subjects with clemency and that they might live quietly without any terror, and might enjoy peace, which is desired by all men,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But when I asked my counsellors how this might be accomplished, one that excelled the rest in wisdom and fidelity, and was second after the king, Aman by name,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Told me that there was a people scattered through the whole world, which used new laws, and acted against the customs of all nations, despised the commandments of kings, and violated by their opposition the concord of all nations.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Wherefore having learned this, and seeing one nation in opposition to all mankind using perverse laws, and going against our commandments, and disturbing the peace and concord of the provinces subject to us,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: We have commanded that all whom Aman shall mark out, who is chief over all the provinces, and second after the king, and whom we honour as a father, shall be utterly destroyed by their enemies, with their wives and children, and that none shall have pity on them, on the fourteenth day of the twelfth month Adar of this present year:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: That these wicked men going down to hell in one day, may restore to our empire the peace which they had disturbed.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But Mardochai besought the Lord, remembering all his works,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And said: O Lord, Lord, almighty king, for all things are in thy power, and there is none that can resist thy will, if thou determine to save Israel.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Thou hast made heaven and earth and all things that are under the cope of heaven.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Thou art Lord of all, and there is none that can resist thy majesty.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Thou knowest all things, and thou knowest that it was not out of pride and or any desire of glory, that I refused to worship the proud Aman,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: (For I would willingly and readily for the salvation of Israel have kissed even the steps of his feet,)

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But I feared lest I should transfer the honour of my God to a man, and lest I should adore any one except my God.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And now, O Lord, O king, O God of Abraham, have mercy on thy people, because our enemies resolve to destroy us, and extinguish thy inheritance.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Despise not thy portion, which thou hast redeemed for thyself out of Egypt.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Hear my supplication, and be merciful to thy lot and inheritance, and turn our mourning into joy, that we may live and praise thy name, O Lord, and shut not the mouths of them that sing to thee.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And all Israel with like mind and supplication cried to the Lord, because they saw certain death hanging over their heads. Esther Chapter 14 The prayer of Esther for herself and her people.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Queen Esther also, fearing the danger that was at hand, had recourse to the Lord.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when she had laid away her royal apparel, she put on garments suitable for weeping and mourning: instead of divers precious ointments, she covered her head with ashes and dung, and she humbled her body with fasts: and all the places in which before she was accustomed to rejoice, she filled with her torn hair.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And she prayed to the Lord the God of Israel, saying: O my Lord, who alone art our king, help me a desolate woman, and who have no other helper but thee.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: My danger is in my hands.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: I have heard of my father that thou, O Lord, didst take Israel from among all nations, and our fathers from all their predecessors, to possess them as an everlasting inheritance, and thou hast done to them as thou hast promised.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: We have sinned in thy sight, and therefore thou hast delivered us into the hands of our enemies:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For we have worshipped their gods. Thou art just, O Lord.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And now they are not content to oppress us with most hard bondage, but attributing the strength of their hands to the power of their idols.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: They design to change thy promises, and destroy thy inheritance, and shut the mouths of them that praise thee, and extinguish the glory of thy temple and altar,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: That they may open the mouths of Gentiles, and praise the strength of idols, and magnify for ever a carnal king.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Give not, O Lord, thy sceptre to them that are not, lest they laugh at our ruin: but turn their counsel upon themselves, and destroy him that hath begun to rage against us.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Remember, O Lord, and shew thyself to us in the time of our tribulation, and give me boldness, O Lord, king of gods, and of all power:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Give me a well ordered speech in my mouth in the presence of the lion, and turn his heart to the hatred of our enemy, that both he himself may perish, and the rest that consent to him.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But deliver us by thy hand, and help me, who have no other helper, but thee, O Lord, who hast the knowledge of all things.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And thou knowest that I hate the glory of the wicked, and abhor the bed of the uncircumcised, and of every stranger.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Thou knowest my necessity, that I abominate the sign of my pride and glory, which is upon my head in the days of my public appearance, and detest it as a menstruous rag, and wear it not in the days of my silence,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And that I have not eaten at Aman’s table, nor hath the king’s banquet pleased me, and that I have not drunk the wine of the drink offerings:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And that thy handmaid hath never rejoiced, since I was brought hither unto this day but in thee, O Lord, the God of Abraham.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: O God, who art mighty above all, hear the voice of them, that have no other hope, and deliver us from the hand of the wicked, and deliver me from my fear. Esther Chapter 15 Esther comes into the king’s presence: she is terrified, but God turns his heart.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And he commanded her (no doubt but he was Mardochai) to go to the king, and petition for her people, and for her country.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Remember, (said he,) the days of thy low estate, how thou wast brought up by my hand, because Aman the second after the king hath spoken against us unto death.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And do thou call upon the Lord, and speak to the king for us, and deliver us from death.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And on the third day she laid away the garments she wore, and put on her glorious apparel.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And glittering in royal robes, after she had called upon God the ruler and Saviour of all, she took two maids with her,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And upon one of them she leaned, as if for delicateness and overmuch tenderness she were not able to bear up her own body.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And the other maid followed her lady, bearing up her train flowing on the ground.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But she with a rosy colour in her face, and with gracious and bright eyes hid a mind full of anguish, and exceeding great fear.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: So going in she passed through all doors in order, and stood before the king, where he sat upon his royal throne, clothed with his royal robes, and glittering with gold, and precious stones, and he was terrible to behold.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And when he had lifted up his countenance, and with burning eyes had shewn the wrath of his heart, the queen sunk down, and her colour turned pale, and she rested her weary head upon her handmaid.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And God changed the king’s spirit into mildness, and all in haste and in fear he leaped from his throne, and holding her up in his arms, till she came to herself, caressed her with these words:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: What is the matter, Esther? I am thy brother, fear not.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Thou shalt not die: for this law is not made for thee, but for all others.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Come near then, and touch the sceptre.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And as she held her peace, he took the golden sceptre, and laid it upon her neck, and kissed her, and said: Why dost thou not speak to me?

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: She answered: I saw thee, my lord, as an angel of God, and my heart was troubled for fear of thy majesty.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For thou, my lord, art very admirable, and thy face is full of graces.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And while she was speaking, she fell down again, and was almost in a swoon.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But the king was troubled, and all his servants comforted her. Esther Chapter 16 A copy of the king’s letter in favour of the Jews.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: The great king Artaxerxes, from India to Ethiopia, to the governors and princes of a hundred and twenty-seven provinces, which obey our command, sendeth greeting. From India to Ethiopia.... That is, who reigneth from India to Ethiopia.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Many have abused unto pride the goodness of princes, and the honour that hath been bestowed upon them:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And not only endeavour to oppress the king’s subjects, but not bearing the glory that is given them, take in hand, to practise also against them that gave it.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Neither are they content not to return thanks for benefits received, and to violate in themselves the laws of humanity, but they think they can also escape the justice of God who seeth all things.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And they break out into so great madness, as to endeavour to undermine by lies such as observe diligently the offices committed to them, and do all things in such manner as to be worthy of all men’s praise,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: While with crafty fraud they deceive the ears of princes that are well meaning, and judge of others by their own nature.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now this is proved both from ancient histories, and by the things which are done daily, how the good designs of kings are depraved by the evil suggestions of certain men.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Wherefore we must provide for the peace of all provinces.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Neither must you think, if we command different things, that it cometh of the levity of our mind, but that we give sentence according to the quality and necessity of times, as the profit of the commonwealth requireth.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Now that you may more plainly understand what we say, Aman the son of Amadathi, a Macedonian both in mind and country, and having nothing of the Persian blood, but with his cruelty staining our goodness, was received being a stranger by us:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And found our humanity so great towards him, that he was called our father, and was worshipped by all as the next man after the king:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But he was so far puffed up with arrogancy, as to go about to deprive us of our kingdom and life.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For with certain new and unheard of devices he hath sought the destruction of Mardochai, by whose fidelity and good services our life was saved, and of Esther the partner of our kingdom with all their nation:

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Thinking that after they were slain, he might work treason against us left alone without friends, and might transfer the kingdom of the Persians to the Macedonians.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But we have found that the Jews, who were by that most wicked man appointed to be slain, are in no fault at all, but contrariwise, use just laws,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And are the children of the highest and the greatest, and the ever living God, by whose benefit the kingdom was given both to our fathers and to us, and is kept unto this day.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Wherefore know ye that those letters which he sent in our name, are void and of no effect.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For which crime both he himself that devised it, and all his kindred hang on gibbets, before the gates of this city Susan: not we, but God repaying him as he deserved.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: But this edict, which we now send, shall be published in all cities, that the Jews may freely follow their own laws.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And you shall aid them that they may kill those who had prepared themselves to kill them, on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is called Adar.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: For the almighty God hath turned this day of sadness and mourning into joy to them.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: Wherefore you shall also count this day among other festival days, and celebrate it with all joy, that it may be known also in times to come,

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: That all they who faithfully obey the Persians, receive a worthy reward for their fidelity: but they that are traitors to their kingdom, are destroyed for their wickedness.

Book: The Book of Esther
Text: And let every province and city, that will not be partaker of this solemnity, perish by the sword and by fire, and be destroyed in such manner as to be made unpassable, both to men and beasts, for an example of contempt, and disobedience.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a narration of the things that have been accomplished among us,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: According as they have delivered them unto us, who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: It seemed good to me also, having diligently attained to all things from the beginning, to write to thee in order, most excellent Theophilus,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That thou mayest know the verity of those words in which thou hast been instructed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zachary, of the course of Abia: and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name Elizabeth. Of the course of Abia.... that is, of the rank of Abia, which word in the Greek is commonly put for the employment of one day: but here for the functions of a whole week. For, by the appointment of David, 1 Par. 24., the descendants from Aaron were divided into twenty-four families, of which the eighth was Abia, from whom descended this Zachary, who at this time was in the week of his priestly functions.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they were both just before God, walking in all the commandments and justifications of the Lord without blame.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they had no son, for that Elizabeth was barren: and they both were well advanced in years.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, when he executed the priestly function in the order of his course before God,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: According to the custom of the priestly office, it was his lot to offer incense, going into the temple of the Lord.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all the multitude of the people was praying without, at the hour of incense.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there appeared to him an angel of the Lord, standing on the right side of the altar of incense.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Zachary seeing him, was troubled: and fear fell upon him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But the angel said to him: Fear not, Zachary, for thy prayer is heard: and thy wife Elizabeth shall bear thee a son. And thou shalt call his name John.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And thou shalt have joy and gladness: and many shall rejoice in his nativity.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For he shall be great before the Lord and shall drink no wine nor strong drink: and he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost, even from his mother’s womb.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he shall convert many of the children of Israel to the Lord their God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he shall go before him in the spirit and power of Elias: that he may turn the hearts of the fathers unto the children and the incredulous to the wisdom of the just, to prepare unto the Lord a perfect people.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Zachary said to the angel: Whereby shall I know this? For I am an old man, and my wife is advanced in years.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the angel answering, said to him: I am Gabriel, who stand before God and am sent to speak to thee and to bring thee these good tidings.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold, thou shalt be dumb and shalt not be able to speak until the day wherein these things shall come to pass: because thou hast not believed my words, which shall be fulfilled in their time.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the people were waiting for Zachary: and they wondered that he tarried so long in the temple.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he came out, he could not speak to them: and they understood that he had seen a vision in the temple. And he made signs to them and remained dumb.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, after the days of his office were accomplished, he departed to his own house.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after those days, Elizabeth his wife conceived and hid herself five months, saying:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Thus hath the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein he hath had regard to take away my reproach among men.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And in the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God into a city of Galilee, called Nazareth,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: To a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David: and the virgin’s name was Mary.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the angel being come in, said unto her: Hail, full of grace, the Lord is with thee: blessed art thou among women.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who having heard, was troubled at his saying and thought with herself what manner of salutation this should be.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the angel said to her: Fear not, Mary, for thou hast found grace with God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Behold thou shalt conceive in thy womb and shalt bring forth a son: and thou shalt call his name Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He shall be great and shall be called the Son of the Most High. And the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of David his father: and he shall reign in the house of Jacob for ever.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And of his kingdom there shall be no end.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Mary said to the angel: How shall this be done, because I know not man?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the angel answering, said to her: The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee and the power of the Most High shall overshadow thee. And therefore also the Holy which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold thy cousin Elizabeth, she also hath conceived a son in her old age: and this is the sixth month with her that is called barren.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Because no word shall be impossible with God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Mary said: Behold the handmaid of the Lord: be it done to me according to thy word. And the angel departed from her.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Mary rising up in those days, went into the hill country with haste into a city of Juda.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And she entered into the house of Zachary and saluted Elizabeth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass that when Elizabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the infant leaped in her womb. And Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And she cried out with a loud voice and said: Blessed art thou among women and blessed is the fruit of thy womb.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And whence is this to me that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For behold as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in my ears, the infant in my womb leaped for joy.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And blessed art thou that hast believed, because those things shall be accomplished that were spoken to thee by the Lord.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Mary said: My soul doth magnify the Lord.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Because he hath regarded the humility of his handmaid: for behold from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed. Shall call me blessed.... These words are a prediction of that honour which the church in all ages should pay to the Blessed Virgin. Let Protestants examine whether they are any way concerned in this prophecy.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Because he that is mighty hath done great things to me: and holy is his name.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And his mercy is from generation unto generations, to them that fear him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He hath shewed might in his arm: he hath scattered the proud in the conceit of their heart.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He hath put down the mighty from their seat and hath exalted the humble.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He hath filled the hungry with good things: and the rich he hath sent empty away.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He hath received Israel his servant, being mindful of his mercy.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As he spoke to our fathers: to Abraham and to his seed for ever.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Mary abode with her about three months. And she returned to her own house.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now Elizabeth’s full time of being delivered was come: and she brought forth a son.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And her neighbors and kinsfolks heard that the Lord had shewed his great mercy towards her: and they congratulated with her.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child: and they called him by his father’s name Zachary.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And his mother answering, said: Not so. But he shall be called John.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they said to her: There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they made signs to his father, how he would have him called.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And demanding a writing table, he wrote, saying: John is his name. And they all wondered.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue loosed: and he spoke, blessing God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And fear came upon all their neighbours: and all these things were noised abroad over all the hill country of Judea.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all they that had heard them laid them up in their heart, saying: What an one, think ye, shall this child be? For the hand of the Lord was with him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Zachary his father was filled with the Holy Ghost. And he prophesied, saying:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel: because he hath visited and wrought the redemption of his people.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And hath raised up an horn of salvation to us, in the house of David his servant. Horn of salvation.... That is, A powerful salvation, as Dr. Witham translates it. For in the Scripture, by horn is generally understood strength and power.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As he spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets, who are from the beginning.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Salvation from our enemies and from the hand of all that hate us.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: To perform mercy to our fathers and to remember his holy testament.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The oath, which he swore to Abraham our father, that he would grant to us.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That being delivered from the hand of our enemies, we may serve him without fear:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In holiness and justice before him, all our days.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And thou, child, shalt be called the prophet of the Highest: for thou shalt, go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: To give knowledge of salvation to his people, unto the remission of their sins.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Through the bowels of the mercy of our God, in which the Orient from on high hath visited us: The Orient.... It is one of the titles of the Messias, the true light of the world, and the sun of justice.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: To enlighten them that sit in darkness and in the shadow of death: to direct our feet into the way of peace.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the child grew and was strengthened in spirit: and was in the deserts until the day of his manifestation to Israel. Luke Chapter 2 The birth of Christ. His presentation in the temple. Simeon’s prophecy. Christ at twelve years of age, is found amongst the doctors.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass that in those days there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus that the whole world should be enrolled.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This enrolling was first made by Cyrinus, the governor of Syria.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all went to be enrolled, every one into his own city.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judea, to the city of David, which is called Bethlehem: because he was of the house and family of David.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: To be enrolled with Mary his espoused wife, who was with child.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass that when they were there, her days were accomplished that she should be delivered.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And she brought forth her first born son and wrapped him up in swaddling clothes and laid him in a manger: because there was no room for them in the inn. Her firstborn.... The meaning is, not that she had afterward any other child; but it is a way of speech among the Hebrews, to call them also the firstborn, who are the only children. See annotation Matt. 1. 25.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there were in the same country shepherds watching and keeping the night watches over their flock.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold an angel of the Lord stood by them and the brightness of God shone round about them: and they feared with a great fear.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the angel said to them: Fear not; for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy that shall be to all the people:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For, this day is born to you a Saviour, who is Christ the Lord, in the city of David.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And this shall be a sign unto you. You shall find the infant wrapped in swaddling clothes and laid in a manger.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly army, praising God and saying:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Glory to God in the highest: and on earth peace to men of good will.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, after the angels departed from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to another: Let us go over to Bethlehem and let us see this word that is come to pass, which the Lord hath shewed to us.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they came with haste: and they found Mary and Joseph, and the infant lying in the manger.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And seeing, they understood of the word that had been spoken to them concerning this child.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all that heard wondered: and at those things that were told them by the shepherds.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Mary kept all these words, pondering them in her heart.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things they had heard and seen, as it was told unto them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after eight days were accomplished, that the child should be circumcised, his name was called JESUS, which was called by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after the days of her purification, according to the law of Moses, were accomplished, they carried him to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As it is written in the law of the Lord: Every male opening the womb shall be called holy to the Lord:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And to offer a sacrifice, according as it is written in the law of the Lord, a pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold there was a man in Jerusalem named Simeon: and this man was just and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel. And the Holy Ghost was in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he had received an answer from the Holy Ghost, that he should not see death before he had seen the Christ of the Lord.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he came by the Spirit into the temple. And when his parents brought in the child Jesus, to do for him according to the custom of the law,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He also took him into his arms and blessed God and said

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now thou dost dismiss thy servant, O Lord, according to thy word in peace:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Because my eyes have seen thy salvation,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all peoples:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: A light to the revelation of the Gentiles and the glory of thy people Israel.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And his father and mother were wondering at those things which were spoken concerning him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Simeon blessed them and said to Mary his mother: Behold this child is set for the fall and for the resurrection of many in Israel and for a sign which shall be contradicted. For the fall, etc.... Christ came for the salvation of all men; but here Simeon prophesies what would come to pass, that many through their own wilful blindness and obstinacy would not believe in Christ, nor receive his doctrine, which therefore would be ruin to them: but to others a resurrection, by their believing in him, and obeying his commandments.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And thy own soul a sword shall pierce, that, out of many hearts thoughts may be revealed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Aser. She was far advanced in years and had lived with her husband seven years from her virginity.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And she was a widow until fourscore and four years: who departed not from the temple, by fastings and prayers serving night and day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now she, at the same hour, coming in, confessed to the Lord: and spoke of him to all that looked for the redemption of Israel.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their city Nazareth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the child grew and waxed strong, full of wisdom: and the grace of God was in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And his parents went every year to Jerusalem, at the solemn day of the pasch.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he was twelve years old, they going up into Jerusalem, according to the custom of the feast,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And having fulfilled the days, when they returned, the child Jesus remained in Jerusalem. And his parents knew it not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And thinking that he was in the company, they came a day’s journey and sought him among their kinsfolks and acquaintance.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And not finding him, they returned into Jerusalem, seeking him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, that, after three days, they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, hearing them and asking them questions.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all that heard him were astonished at his wisdom and his answers.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And seeing him, they wondered. And his mother said to him: Son, why hast thou done so to us? Behold thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: How is it that you sought me? Did you not know that I must be about my father’s business?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they understood not the word that he spoke unto them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he went down with them and came to Nazareth and was subject to them. And his mother kept all these words in her heart.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus advanced in wisdom and age and grace with God and men. Luke Chapter 3 John’s mission and preaching. Christ is baptized by him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and Philip his brother tetrarch of Iturea and the country of Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilina:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Under the high priests Annas and Caiphas: the word of the Lord was made unto John, the son of Zachary, in the desert.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he came into all the country about the Jordan, preaching the baptism of penance for the remission of sins.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As it was written in the book of the sayings of Isaias the prophet: A voice of one crying in the wilderness: Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make straight his paths.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Every valley shall be filled and every mountain and hill shall be brought low: and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough ways plain.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He said therefore to the multitudes that went forth to be baptized by him: Ye offspring of vipers, who hath shewed you to flee from the wrath to come?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of penance: and do not begin to say, We have Abraham for our father. For I say unto you that God is able of these stones, to raise up children to Abraham.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For now the axe is laid to the root of the trees. Every tree therefore that bringeth not forth good fruit shall be cut down and cast into the fire.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the people asked him, saying: What then shall we do?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he answering, said to them: He that hath two coats, let him give to him that hath none; and he that hath meat, let him do in like manner.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the publicans also came to be baptized and said to him: Master, what shall we do?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said to them: Do nothing more than that which is appointed you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the soldiers also asked him, saying: And what shall we do? And he said to them: Do violence to no man, neither calumniate any man; and be content with your pay.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as the people were of opinion, and all were thinking in their hearts of John, that perhaps he might be the Christ:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: John answered, saying unto all: I indeed baptize you with water: but there shall come one mightier than I, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to loose. He shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire;

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Whose fan is in his hand: and he will purge his floor and will gather the wheat into his barn: but the chaff he will burn with unquenchable fire.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And many other things exhorting did he preach to the people.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Herod the tetrarch, when he was reproved by him for Herodias, his brother’s wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He added this also above all and shut up John in prison.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now it came to pass, when all the people were baptized, that Jesus also being baptized and praying, heaven was opened.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape, as a dove, upon him. And a voice came from heaven: Thou art my beloved Son. In thee I am well pleased.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus himself was beginning about the age of thirty years: being (as it was supposed) the son of Joseph, who was of Heli, who was of Mathat, Who was of Heli.... St. Joseph, who by nature was the son of Jacob, (St. Matt. 1. 16,) in the account of the law, was son of Heli. For Heli and Jacob were brothers, by the same mother; and Heli, who was the elder, dying without issue, Jacob, as the law directed, married his widow: in consequence of such marriage, his son Joseph was reputed in the law the son of Heli.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Levi, who was of Melchi, who was of Janne, who was of Joseph,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Mathathias, who was of Amos, who was of Nahum, who was of Hesli, who was of Nagge,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Mahath, who was of Mathathias, who was of Semei, who was of Joseph, who was of Juda,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Joanna, who was of Reza, who was of Zorobabel, who was of Salathiel, who was of Neri,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Melchi, who was of Addi, who was of Cosan, who was of Helmadan, who was of Her,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Jesus, who was of Eliezer, who was of Jorim, who was of Mathat, who was of Levi,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Simeon, who was of Judas, who was of Joseph, who was of Jona, who was of Eliakim,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Melea, who was of Menna, who was of Mathatha, who was of Nathan, who was of David,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Jesse, who was of Obed, who was of Booz, who was of Salmon, who was of Naasson,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Aminadab, who was of Aram, who was of Esron, who was of Phares, who was of Judas,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Jacob, who was of Isaac, who was of Abraham, who was of Thare, who was of Nachor,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Sarug, who was of Ragau, who was of Phaleg, who was of Heber, who was of Sale,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Cainan, who was of Arphaxad, who was of Sem, who was of Noe, who was of Lamech,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Mathusale, who was of Henoch, who was of Jared, who was of Malaleel, who was of Cainan,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who was of Henos, who was of Seth, who was of Adam, who was of God. Luke Chapter 4 Christ’s fasting and temptation. He is persecuted in Nazareth. His miracles in Capharnaum.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost, returned from the Jordan and was led by the spirit into the desert,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For the space of forty days, and was tempted by the devil. And he ate nothing in those days. And when they were ended, he was hungry.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the devil said to him: If thou be the Son of God, say to this stone that it be made bread.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus answered him: It is written that Man liveth not by bread alone, but by every word of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the devil led him into a high mountain and shewed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to him: To thee will I give all this power and the glory of them. For to me they are delivered: and to whom I will, I give them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If thou therefore wilt adore before me, all shall be thine.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus answering said to him. It is written: Thou shalt adore the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he brought him to Jerusalem and set him on a pinnacle of the temple and said to him: If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself from hence.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For it is written that He hath given his angels charge over thee that they keep thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And that in their hands they shall bear thee up, lest perhaps thou dash thy foot against a stone.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus answering, said to him: It is said: Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all the temptation being ended, the devil departed from him for a time.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus returned in the power of the spirit, into Galilee: and the fame of him went out through the whole country.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he taught in their synagogues and was magnified by all.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he came to Nazareth, where he was brought up: and he went into the synagogue, according to his custom, on the sabbath day: and he rose up to read.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the book of Isaias the prophet was delivered unto him. And as he unfolded the book, he found the place where it was written:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The spirit of the Lord is upon me. Wherefore he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor, he hath sent me to heal the contrite of heart,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: To preach deliverance to the captives and sight to the blind, to set at liberty them that are bruised, to preach the acceptable year of the Lord and the day of reward.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he had folded the book, he restored it to the minister and sat down. And the eyes of all in the synagogue were fixed on him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he began to say to them: This day is fulfilled this scripture in your ears.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all gave testimony to him. And they wondered at the words of grace that proceeded from his mouth. And they said: Is not this the son of Joseph?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: Doubtless you will say to me this similitude: Physician, heal thyself. As great things as we have heard done in Capharnaum, do also here in thy own country.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said: Amen I say to you that no prophet is accepted in his own country.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In truth I say to you, there were many widows in the days of Elias in Israel, when heaven was shut up three years and six months, when there was a great famine throughout all the earth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And to none of them was Elias sent, but to Sarepta of Sidon, to a widow woman.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there were many lepers in Israel in the time of Eliseus the prophet: and none of them was cleansed but Naaman the Syrian.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all they in the synagogue, hearing these things, were filled with anger.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they rose up and thrust him out of the city: and they brought him to the brow of the hill whereon their city was built, that they might cast him down headlong.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he passing through the midst of them, went his way.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he went down into Capharnaum, a city of Galilee: and there he taught them on the sabbath days.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they were astonished at his doctrine: for his speech was with power.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And in the synagogue there was a man who had an unclean devil: and he cried out with a loud voice,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Saying: Let us alone. What have we to do with thee, Jesus of Nazareth? Art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the holy one of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus rebuked him, saying: Hold thy peace and go out of him. And when the devil had thrown him into the midst, he went out of him and hurt him not at all.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there came fear upon all; and they talked among themselves, saying: What word is this, for with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits, and they go out?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the fame of him was published into every place of the country.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus rising up out of the synagogue, went into Simon’s house. And Simon’s wife’s mother was taken with a great fever: and they besought him for her.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And standing over her, he commanded the fever: and it left her. And immediately rising, she ministered to them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when the sun was down, all they that had any sick with divers diseases brought them to him. But he, laying his hands on every one of them, healed them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And devils went out from many, crying out and saying: Thou art the son of God. And rebuking them he suffered them not to speak; for they knew that he was Christ.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when it was day, going out he went into a desert place: and the multitudes sought him, and came unto him. And they stayed him that he should not depart from them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: To whom he said: To other cities also I must preach the kingdom of God: for therefore am I sent.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee. Luke Chapter 5 The miraculous draught of fishes. The cure of the leper and of the paralytic. The call of Matthew.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, that when the multitudes pressed upon him to hear the word of God, he stood by the lake of Genesareth,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And saw two ships standing by the lake: but the fishermen were gone out of them and were washing their nets.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And going into one of the ships that was Simon’s, he desired him to draw back a little from the land. And sitting, he taught the multitudes out of the ship.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now when he had ceased to speak, he said to Simon: Launch out into the deep and let down your nets for a draught.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Simon answering said to him: Master, we have laboured all the night and have taken nothing: but at thy word I will let down the net.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when they had done this, they enclosed a very great multitude of fishes: and their net broke.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they beckoned to their partners that were in the other ship, that they should come and help them. And they came and filled both the ships, so that they were almost sinking.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Which when Simon Peter saw, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying: Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, O Lord.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For he was wholly astonished, and all that were with him, at the draught of the fishes which they had taken.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And so were also James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were Simon’s partners. And Jesus saith to Simon: Fear not: from henceforth thou shalt catch men.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And having brought their ships to land, leaving all things, they followed him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, when he was in a certain city, behold a man full of leprosy who, seeing Jesus and falling on his face, besought him saying: Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And stretching forth his hand, he touched him, saying: I will. Be thou cleansed. And immediately the leprosy departed from him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he charged him that he should tell no man, but: Go, shew thyself to the priest and offer for thy cleansing according as Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But the fame of him went abroad the more: and great multitudes came together to hear and to be healed by him of their infirmities.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he retired into the desert; and prayed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass on a certain day, as he sat teaching, that there were also Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, that were come out of every town of Galilee and Judea and Jerusalem: and the power of the Lord was to heal them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold, men brought in a bed a man who had the palsy: and they sought means to bring him in and to lay him before him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when they could not find by what way they might bring him in, because of the multitude, they went up upon the roof and let him down through the tiles with his bed into the midst before Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Whose faith when he saw, he said: Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the scribes and Pharisees began to think, saying: Who is this who speaketh blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when Jesus knew their thoughts, answering he said to them: What is it you think in your hearts?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Which is easier to say: Thy sins are forgiven thee; or to say: Arise and walk?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But that you may know that the Son of man hath the power on earth to forgive sins (he saith to the sick of the palsy), I say to thee, Arise, take up thy bed and go into thy house.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And immediately rising up before them, he took up the bed on which he lay: and he went away to his own house, glorifying God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all were astonished: and they glorified God. And they were filled with fear, saying: We have seen wonderful things to-day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after these things, he went forth and saw a publican named Levi, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he said to him: Follow me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And leaving all things, he rose up and followed him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Levi made him a great feast in his own house: And there was a great company of publicans and of others that were at table with them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying to his disciples: Why do you eat and drink with publicans and sinners?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus answering, said to them: They that are whole need not the physician: but they that are sick.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I came not to call the just, but sinners to penance.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they said to him: Why do the disciples of John fast often and make prayers, and the disciples of the Pharisees in like manner; but thine eat and drink?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: To whom he said: Can you make the children of the bridegroom fast whilst the bridegroom is with them?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But the days will come when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them: then shall they fast in those days.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he spoke also a similitude to them: That no man putteth a piece from a new garment upon an old garment: otherwise he both rendeth the new, and the piece taken from the new agreeth not with the old.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles: otherwise the new wine will break the bottles; and it will be spilled and the bottles will be lost.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But new wine must be put into new bottles: and both are preserved.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And no man drinking old hath presently a mind to new: for he saith: The old is better. Luke Chapter 6 Christ excuses his disciples. He cures upon the sabbath day, chooses the twelve and makes a sermon to them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass on the second first sabbath that, as he went through the corn fields, his disciples plucked the ears and did eat, rubbing them in their hands. The second first sabbath.... Some understand this of the sabbath of Pentecost, which was the second in course among the great feasts: others, of a sabbath day that immediately followed any solemn feast.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And some of the Pharisees said to them: Why do you that which is not lawful on the sabbath days?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus answering them, said: Have you not read so much as this, what David did, when himself was hungry and they that were with him:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: How he went into the house of God and took and ate the bread of proposition and gave to them that were with him, which is not lawful to eat but only for the priests?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: The Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass also, on another sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught. And there was a man whose right hand was withered.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the scribes and Pharisees watched if he would heal on the sabbath: that they might find an accusation against him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he knew their thoughts and said to the man who had the withered hand: Arise and stand forth in the midst. And rising he stood forth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then Jesus said to them: I ask you, if it be lawful on the sabbath days to do good or to do evil? To save life or to destroy?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And looking round about on them all, he said to the man: Stretch forth thy hand. And he stretched it forth. And his hand was restored.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they were filled with madness: and they talked one with another, what they might do to Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a mountain to pray: and he passed the whole night in the prayer of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when day was come, he called unto him his disciples: and he chose twelve of them (whom also he named apostles):

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Simon, whom he surnamed Peter, and Andrew his brother, James and John, Philip and Bartholomew,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Matthew and Thomas, James the son of Alpheus, and Simon who is called Zelotes,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jude the brother of James, and Judas Iscariot, who was the traitor.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And coming down with them, he stood in a plain place: and the company of his disciples and a very great multitude of people from all Judea and Jerusalem and the sea coast, both of Tyre and Sidon,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who were come to hear him and to be healed of their diseases. And they that were troubled with unclean spirits were cured.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all the multitude sought to touch him: for virtue went out from him and healed all.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he, lifting up his eyes on his disciples, said: Blessed are ye poor: for yours is the kingdom of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Blessed are ye that hunger now: for you shall be filled. Blessed are ye that weep now: for you shall laugh.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Blessed shall you be when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you and shall reproach you and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man’s sake.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Be glad in that day and rejoice: for behold, your reward is great in heaven, For according to these things did their fathers to the prophets.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But woe to you that are rich: for you have your consolation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Woe to you that are filled: for you shall hunger. Woe to you that now laugh: for you shall mourn and weep.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Woe to you when men shall bless you: for according to these things did their fathers to the false prophets.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I say to you that hear: Love your enemies. Do good to them that hate you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Bless them that curse you and pray for them that calumniate you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And to him that striketh thee on the one cheek, offer also the other. And him that taketh away from thee thy cloak, forbid not to take thy coat also.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Give to every one that asketh thee: and of him that taketh away thy goods, ask them not again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as you would that men should do to you, do you also to them in like manner.
