Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if you love them that love you, what thanks are to you? For sinners also love those that love them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if you do good to them who do good to you, what thanks are to you? For sinners also do this.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if you lend to them of whom you hope to receive, what thanks are to you? For sinners also lend to sinners, for to receive as much.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But love ye your enemies: do good, and lend, hoping for nothing thereby: and your reward shall be great, and you shall be the sons of the Highest. For he is kind to the unthankful and to the evil.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Judge not: and you shall not be judged. Condemn not: and you shall not be condemned. Forgive: and you shall be forgiven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Give: and it shall be given to you: good measure and pressed down and shaken together and running over shall they give into your bosom. For with the same measure that you shall mete withal, it shall be measured to you again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he spoke also to them a similitude: Can the blind lead the blind? Do they not both fall into the ditch?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The disciple is not above his master: but every one shall be perfect, if he be as his master.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And why seest thou the mote in thy brother’s eye: but the beam that is in thy own eye thou considerest not?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Or how canst thou say to thy brother: Brother, let me pull the mote out of thy eye, when thou thyself seest not the beam in thy own eye? Hypocrite, cast first the beam out of thy own eye: and then shalt thou see clearly to take out the mote from thy brother’s eye.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For there is no good tree that bringeth forth evil fruit: nor an evil tree that bringeth forth good fruit.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For every tree is known by its fruit. For men do not gather figs from thorns: nor from a bramble bush do they gather the grape.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good: and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth that which is evil. For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And why call you me, Lord, Lord; and do not the things which I say?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Every one that cometh to me and heareth my words and doth them, I will shew you to whom he is like.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He is like to a man building a house, who digged deep and laid the foundation upon a rock. And when a flood came, the stream beat vehemently upon that house: and it could not shake it: for it was founded on a rock.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he that heareth and doth not is like to a man building his house upon the earth without a foundation: against which the stream beat vehemently. And immediately it fell: and the ruin of that house was great. Luke Chapter 7 Christ heals the centurion’s servant. He raises the widow’s son to life, answers the messengers sent by John and absolves the penitent sinner.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he had finished all his words in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capharnaum.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the servant of a certain centurion who was dear to him, being sick, was ready to die.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he had heard of Jesus, he sent unto him the ancients of the Jews, desiring him to come and heal his servant.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when they came to Jesus, they besought him earnestly, saying to him: He is worthy that thou shouldest do this for him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For he loveth our nation: and he hath built us a synagogue.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus went with them. And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent his friends to him, saying: Lord, trouble not thyself; for I am not worthy that thou shouldst enter under my roof.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For which cause neither did I think myself worthy to come to thee: but say the word, and my servant shall be healed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For I also am a man subject to authority, having under me soldiers: and I say to one, Go, and he goeth: and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doth it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Which Jesus hearing, marvelled: and turning about to the multitude that followed him, he said: Amen I say to you, I have not found so great faith, not even in Israel.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they who were sent, being returned to the house, found the servant whole who had been sick.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass afterwards that he went into a city that is called Naim: and there went with him his disciples and a great multitude.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he came nigh to the gate of the city, behold a dead man was carried out, the only son of his mother: and she was a widow. And a great multitude of the city was with her.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Whom when the Lord had seen, being moved with mercy towards her, he said to her: Weep not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he came near and touched the bier. And they that carried it stood still. And he said: Young man, I say to thee, arise.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he that was dead sat up and began to speak. And he gave him to his mother.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there came a fear upon them all: and they glorified God saying: A great prophet is risen up among us: and, God hath visited his people.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judea and throughout all the country round about.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And John’s disciples told him of all these things.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And John called to him two of his disciples and sent them to Jesus, saying: Art thou he that art to come? Or look we for another?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when the men were come unto him, they said: John the Baptist hath sent us to thee, saying: Art thou he that art to come? Or look we for another?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: (And in that same hour, he cured many of their diseases and hurts and evil spirits: and to many that were blind he gave sight.)

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And answering, he said to them: Go and relate to John what you have heard and seen: the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are made clean, the deaf hear, the dead rise again, to the poor the gospel is preached.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And blessed is he whosoever shall not be scandalized in me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when the messengers of John were departed, he began to speak to the multitudes concerning John. What went ye out into the desert to see? A reed shaken with the wind?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But what went you out to see? A man clothed in soft garments? Behold they that are in costly apparel and live delicately are in the houses of kings.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But what went you out to see? A prophet? Yea, I say to you, and more than a prophet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This is he of whom it is written: Behold I send my angel before thy face, who shall prepare thy way before thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For I say to you: Amongst those that are born of women, there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist. But he that is the lesser in the kingdom of God is greater than he.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all the people hearing, and the publicans, justified God, being baptized with John’s baptism. Justified God.... that is, praised the justice of God, feared and worshipped God, as just and merciful.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But the Pharisees and the lawyers despised the counsel of God against themselves, being not baptized by him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Lord said: Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation? And to what are they like?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They are like to children sitting in the marketplace and speaking one to another and saying: We have piped to you, and you have not danced: we have mourned, and you have not wept.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine. And you say: He hath a devil.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Son of man is come eating and drinking. And you say: Behold a man that is a glutton and a drinker of wine, a friend of publicans and sinners.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And wisdom is justified by all her children.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And one of the Pharisees desired him to eat with him. And he went into the house of the Pharisee and sat down to meat. One of the Pharisees: that is, Simon.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold a woman that was in the city, a sinner, when she knew that he sat at meat in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster box of ointment.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And standing behind at his feet, she began to wash his feet with tears and wiped them with the hairs of her head and kissed his feet and anointed them with the ointment.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Pharisee, who had invited him, seeing it, spoke within himself, saying: This man, if he were if a prophet, would know surely who and what manner of woman this is that toucheth him, that she is a sinner.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus answering, said to him: Simon, I have somewhat to say to thee. But he said: Master, say it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: A certain creditor had two debtors: the one owed five hundred pence and the other fifty.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And whereas they had not wherewith to pay, he forgave them both. Which therefore of the two loveth him most?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Simon answering, said: I suppose that he to whom he forgave most. And he said to him: Thou hast judged rightly.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And turning to the woman, he said unto Simon: Dost thou see this woman? I entered into thy house: thou gavest me no water for my feet. But she with tears hath washed my feet; and with her hairs hath wiped them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Thou gavest me no kiss. But she, since she came in, hath not ceased to kiss my feet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: My head with oil thou didst not anoint. But she with ointment hath anointed my feet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Wherefore, I say to thee: Many sins are forgiven her, because she hath loved much. But to whom less is forgiven, he loveth less. Many sins are forgiven her, because she hath loved much.... In the scripture an effect sometimes seems attributed to one only cause, when there are divers other concurring dispositions; for the sins of this woman, in this verse, are said to be forgiven, because she loved much: but (ver. 50) Christ tells her, Thy faith hath made thee safe. Hence in a true conversion are joined faith, hope, love, sorrow for sin, and other pious dispositions.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to her: Thy sins are forgiven thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves: Who is this that forgiveth sins also?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to the woman: Thy faith hath made thee safe. Go in peace. Luke Chapter 8 The parable of the seed. Christ stills the storm at sea, casts out the legion, heals the issue of blood and raises the daughter of Jairus to life.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass afterwards, that he travelled through the cities and towns, preaching and evangelizing the kingdom of God: and the twelve with him:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who is called Magdalen, out of whom seven devils were gone forth,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Joanna the wife of Chusa, Herod’s steward, and Susanna and many others who ministered unto him of their substance.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when a very great multitude was gathered together and hastened out of the cities, unto him, he spoke by a similitude.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The sower went out to sow his seed. And as he sowed, some fell by the way side. And it was trodden down: and the fowls of the air devoured it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And other some fell upon a rock. And as soon as it was sprung up, it withered away, because it had no moisture.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And other some fell among thorns. And the thorns growing up with it, choked it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And other some fell upon good ground and, being sprung up, yielded fruit a hundredfold. Saying these things, he cried out: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And his disciples asked him what this parable might be.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: To whom he said: To you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God; but to the rest in parables, that seeing they may not see and hearing may not understand. Seeing they may not see.... See the annotation, Mark 4. 12.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they by the way side are they that hear: then the devil cometh and taketh the word out of their heart, lest believing they should be saved.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now they upon the rock are they who when they hear receive the word with joy: and these have no roots: for they believe for a while and in time of temptation they fall away.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And that which fell among thorns are they who have heard and, going their way, are choked with the cares and riches and pleasures of this life and yield no fruit.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But that on the good ground are they who in a good and perfect heart, hearing the word, keep it and bring forth fruit in patience.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now no man lighting a candle covereth it with a vessel or putteth it under a bed: but setteth it upon a candlestick, that they who come in may see the light.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For there is not any thing secret that shall not be made manifest, nor hidden that shall not be known and come abroad.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Take heed therefore how you hear. For whosoever hath, to him shall be given: and whosoever hath not, that also which he thinketh he hath shall be taken away from him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And his mother and brethren came unto him: and they could not come at him for the crowd.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it was told him: Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to see thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who answering, said to them: My mother and my brethren are they who hear the word of God and do it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass on a certain day that he went into a little ship with his disciples. And he said to them: Let us go over to the other side of the lake. And they launched forth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when they were sailing, he slept. And there came down a storm of wind upon the lake: and they were filled and were in danger.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they came and awaked him, saying: Master, we perish. But he arising, rebuked the wind and the rage of the water. And it ceased: and there was a calm.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: Where is your faith? Who being afraid, wondered, saying one to another: Who is this (think you), that he commandeth both the winds and the sea: and they obey him?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they sailed to the country of the Gerasens, which is over against Galilee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he was come forth to the land, there met him a certain man who had a devil now a very long time. And he wore no clothes: neither did he abide in a house, but in the sepulchres.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he saw Jesus, he fell down before him. And crying out with a loud voice, he said: What have I to do with thee, Jesus, Son of the most high God? I beseech thee, do not torment me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For he commanded the unclean spirit to go out of the man. For many times it seized him: and he was bound with chains and kept in fetters: and breaking the bonds, he was driven by the devil into the deserts.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus asked him, saying: What is thy name? But he said: Legion. Because many devils were entered into him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they besought him that he would not command them to go into the abyss.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there was there a herd of many swine feeding on the mountain: and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter into them. And he suffered them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The devils therefore went out of the man and entered into the swine. And the herd ran violently down a steep place into the lake and were stifled.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Which when they that fed them saw done, they fled away and told it in the city and in the villages.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they went out to see what was done. And they came to Jesus and found the man out of whom the devils were departed, sitting at his feet, clothed and in his right mind. And they were afraid.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they also that had seen told them how he had been healed from the legion.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all the multitude of the country of the Gerasens besought him to depart from them: for they were taken with great fear. And he, going up into the ship, returned back again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now the man out of whom the devils were departed besought him that he might be with him. But Jesus sent him away, saying:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Return to thy house and tell how great things God hath done to thee. And he went through the whole city, publishing how great things Jesus had done to him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass that when Jesus was returned, the multitude received him: for they were all waiting for him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold there came a man whose name was Jairus: and he was a ruler of the synagogue. And he fell down at the feet of Jesus, beseeching him that he would come into his house:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For he had an only daughter, almost twelve years old, and she was dying. And it happened as he went that he was thronged by the multitudes.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there was a certain woman having an issue of blood twelve years, who had bestowed all her substance on physicians and could not be healed by any.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: She came behind him and touched the hem of his garment: and immediately the issue of her blood stopped.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said: Who is it that touched me? And all denying, Peter and they that were with him said: Master, the multitudes throng and press thee; and dost thou say, who touched me?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said: Somebody hath touched me; for I know that virtue is gone out from me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the woman seeing that she was not hid, came trembling and fell down before his feet and declared before all the people for what cause she had touched him, and how she was immediately healed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said to her: Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole. Go thy way in peace.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As he was yet speaking, there cometh one to the ruler of the synagogue, saying to him: Thy daughter is dead: trouble him not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus hearing this word, answered the father of the maid: Fear not. Believe only: and she shall be safe.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he was come to the house, he suffered not any man to go in with him, but Peter and James and John, and the father and mother of the maiden.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all wept and mourned for her. But he said: Weep not. The maid is not dead, but sleepeth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they laughed him to scorn, knowing that she was dead.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he taking her by the hand, cried out, saying: Maid, arise.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And her spirit returned: and she arose immediately. And he bid them give her to eat.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And her parents were astonished, whom he charged to tell no man what was done. Luke Chapter 9 Christ sends forth his apostles, feeds five thousand with five loaves, is transfigured and casts out a devil.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then calling together the twelve apostles, he gave them power and authority over all devils and to cure diseases.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: Take nothing for your journey, neither staff, nor scrip, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And whatsoever house you shall enter into, abide there and depart not from thence.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And whosoever will not receive you, when ye go out of that city, shake off even the dust of your feet, for a testimony against them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And going out, they went about through the towns, preaching the gospel and healing every where.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now Herod, the tetrarch, heard of all things that were done by him. And he was in a doubt, because it was said

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: By some that John was risen from the dead: but by other some, that Elias had appeared: and by others, that one of the old prophets was risen again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Herod said: John I have beheaded. But who is this of whom I hear such things? And he sought to see him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the apostles, when they were returned, told him all they had done. And taking them, he went aside into a desert place, apart, which belongeth to Bethsaida.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Which when the people knew, they followed him: and he received them and spoke to them of the kingdom of God and healed them who had need of healing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now the day began to decline. And the twelve came and said to him: Send away the multitude, that, going into the towns and villages round about, they may lodge and get victuals; for we are here in a desert place.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said to them: Give you them to eat. And they said: We have no more than five loaves and two fishes; unless perhaps, we should go and buy food for all this multitude.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now there were about five thousand men. And he said to his disciples: Make them sit down by fifties in a company.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they did so and made them all sit down.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And taking the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven and blessed them: and he broke and distributed to his disciples, to set before the multitude.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they did all eat and were filled. And there were taken up of fragments that remained to them, twelve baskets.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, as he was alone praying, his disciples also were with him: and he asked them, saying: Whom do the people say that I am?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they answered and said: John the Baptist; but some say Elias: and others say that one of the former prophets is risen again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: But whom do you say that I am? Simon Peter answering, said: The Christ of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he strictly charging them, commanded they should tell this to no man.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Saying: The Son of man must suffer many things and be rejected by the ancients and chief priests and scribes and be killed and the third day rise again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to all: If any man will come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross daily and follow me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: for he that shall lose his life for my sake shall save it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For what is a man advantaged, if he gain the whole world and lose himself and cast away himself?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For he that shall be ashamed of me and of my words, of him the Son of man shall be ashamed, when he shall come in his majesty and that of his Father and of the holy angels.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I tell you of a truth: There are some standing here that shall not taste death till they see the kingdom of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, about eight days after these words, that he took Peter and James and John and went up into a mountain to pray.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And whilst he prayed, the shape of his countenance was altered and his raiment became white and glittering.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold two men were talking with him. And they were Moses and Elias,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Appearing in majesty. And they spoke of his decease that he should accomplish in Jerusalem.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep. And waking, they saw his glory and the two men that stood with him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass that, as they were departing from him, Peter saith to Jesus: Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles, one for thee, and one for Moses; and one for Elias: not knowing what he said.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as he spoke these things, there came a cloud and overshadowed them. And they were afraid when they entered into the cloud.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And a voice came out of the cloud; saying: This is my beloved son. Hear him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And whilst the voice was uttered Jesus was found alone. And they held their peace and told no man in those days any of these things which they had seen.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass the day following, when they came down from the mountain, there met him a great multitude.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold a man among the crowd cried out, saying: Master, I beseech thee, look upon my son, because he is my only one.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And lo, a spirit seizeth him, and he suddenly crieth out, and he throweth him down and teareth him, so that he foameth; and bruising him, he hardly departeth from him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I desired thy disciples to cast him out: and they could not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus, answering, said: O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and suffer you? Bring hither thy son.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as he was coming to him, the devil threw him down and tore him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit and cured the boy and restored him to his father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all were astonished at the mighty power of God. But while all wondered at all the things he did, he said to his disciples: Lay you up in your hearts these words, for it shall come to pass that the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they understood not this word: and it was hid from them, so that they perceived it not. And they were afraid to ask him concerning this word.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there entered a thought into them, which of them should be greater.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Jesus seeing the thoughts of their hearts, took a child and set him by him,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And said to them: Whosoever shall receive this child in my name receiveth me; and whosoever shall receive me receiveth him that sent me. For he that is the lesser among you all, he is the greater.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And John, answering, said: Master, we saw a certain man casting out devils in thy name: and we forbade him, because he followeth not with us.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said to him: Forbid him not: for he that is not against you is for you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, when the days of his assumption were accomplishing, that he steadfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he sent messengers before his face: and going, they entered into a city of the Samaritans, to prepare for him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they received him not, because his face was of one going to Jerusalem.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when his disciples, James and John, had seen this, they said: Lord, wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven and consume them?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And turning, he rebuked them, saying: you know not of what spirit you are.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Son of man came not to destroy souls, but to save. And they went into another town.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, as they walked in the way, that a certain man said to him: I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus said to him: The foxes have holes, and the birds of the air nests: but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said to another: Follow me. And he said: Lord, suffer me first to go and to bury my father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said to him: Let the dead bury their dead: but go thou and preach the kingdom of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And another said: I will follow thee, Lord; but let me first take my leave of them that are at my house.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus said to him: No man putting his hand to the plough and looking back is fit for the kingdom of God. Luke Chapter 10 Christ sends forth and instructs his seventy-two disciples. The good Samaritan.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after these things, the Lord appointed also other seventy-two. And he sent them two and two before his face into every city and place whither he himself was to come.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: The harvest indeed is great, but the labourers are few. Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest that he send labourers into his harvest.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Go: Behold I send you as lambs among wolves.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Carry neither purse, nor scrip, nor shoes: and salute no man by the way.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Into whatever house you enter, first say: Peace be to this house.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if the son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon him: but if not, it shall return to you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And in the same house, remain, eating and drinking such things as they have: for the labourer is worthy of his hire. Remove not from house to house.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And into what city soever you enter, and they receive you, eat such things as are set before you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And heal the sick that are therein and say to them: The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But into whatsoever city you enter, and they receive you not, going forth into the streets thereof, say:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Even the very dust of your city that cleaveth to us, we wipe off against you. Yet know this, that the kingdom of God is at hand.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I say to you, it shall be more tolerable at that day for Sodom than for that city.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Woe to thee, Corozain! Woe to thee, Bethsaida! For if in Tyre and Sidon had been wrought the mighty works that have been wrought in you, they would have done penance long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And thou, Capharnaum, which art exalted unto heaven, thou shalt be thrust down to hell.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that heareth you heareth me: and he that despiseth you despiseth me: and he that despiseth me despiseth him that sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the seventy-two returned with joy, saying: Lord, the devils also are subject to us in thy name.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: I saw Satan like lightning falling from heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Behold, I have given you power to tread upon serpents and scorpions and upon all the power of the enemy: and nothing shall hurt you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But yet rejoice not in this, that spirits are subject unto you: but rejoice in this, that your names are written in heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In that same hour, he rejoiced in the Holy Ghost and said: I confess to thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because thou hast hidden these things from the wise and prudent and hast revealed them to little ones. Yea, Father, for so it hath seemed good in thy sight. He rejoiced in the Holy Ghost.... That is, according to his humanity he rejoiced in the Holy Ghost, and gave thanks to his eternal Father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: All things are delivered to me by my Father. And no one knoweth who the Son is, but the Father: and who the Father is, but the Son and to whom the Son will reveal him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And turning to his disciples, he said: Blessed are the eyes that see the things which you see.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For I say to you that many prophets and kings have desired to see the things that you see and have not seen them; and to hear the things that you hear and have not heard them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold a certain lawyer stood up, tempting him and saying, Master, what must I do to possess eternal life?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said to him: What is written in the law? How readest thou?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He answering, said: Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with thy whole heart and with thy whole soul and with all thy strength and with all thy mind: and thy neighbour as thyself.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to him: Thou hast answered right. This do: and thou shalt live.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he willing to justify himself, said to Jesus: And who is my neighbour?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus answering, said: A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho and fell among robbers, who also stripped him and having wounded him went away, leaving him half dead.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it chanced, that a certain priest went down the same way: and seeing him, passed by.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In like manner also a Levite, when he was near the place and saw him, passed by.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But a certain Samaritan, being on his journey, came near him: and seeing him, was moved with compassion:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And going up to him, bound up his wounds, pouring in oil and wine: and setting him upon his own beast, brought him to an inn and took care of him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the next day he took out two pence and gave to the host and said: Take care of him; and whatsoever thou shalt spend over and above, I, at my return, will repay thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Which of these three, in thy opinion, was neighbour to him that fell among the robbers?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said: He that shewed mercy to him. And Jesus said to him: Go, and do thou in like manner.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now it came to pass, as they went, that he entered into a certain town: and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And she had a sister called Mary, who, sitting also at the Lord’s feet, heard his word.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Martha was busy about much serving. Who stood and said: Lord, hast thou no care that my sister hath left me alone to serve? Speak to her therefore, that she help me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Lord answering, said to her: Martha, Martha, thou art careful and art troubled about many things:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But one thing is necessary. Mary hath chosen the best part, which shall not be taken away from her. Luke Chapter 11 Christ teaches his disciples to pray. He casts out a dumb devil, confutes the Pharisees, and pronounces woes against them for their hypocrisy.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass that as he was in a certain place praying, when he ceased, one of his disciples said to him: Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: When you pray, say: Father, hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Give us this day our daily bread.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And forgive us our sins, for we also forgive every one that is indebted to us. And lead us not into temptation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: Which of you shall have a friend and shall go to him at midnight and shall say to him: Friend, lend me three loaves,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Because a friend of mine is come off his journey to me and I have not what to set before him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he from within should answer and say: Trouble me not; the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed. I cannot rise and give thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Yet if he shall continue knocking, I say to you, although he will not rise and give him because he is his friend; yet, because of his importunity, he will rise and give him as many as he needeth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I say to you: Ask, and it shall be given you: seek, and you shall find: knock, and it shall be opened to you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For every one that asketh receiveth: and he that seeketh findeth: and to him that knocketh it shall be opened:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And which of you, if he ask his father bread, will he give him a stone? Or a fish, will he for a fish give him a serpent?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Or if he shall ask an egg, will he reach him a scorpion?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father from heaven give the good Spirit to them that ask him?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he was casting out a devil: and the same was dumb. And when he had cast out the devil, the dumb spoke: and the multitudes, were in admiration at it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But some of them said: He casteth out devils by Beelzebub, the prince of devils.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And others tempting, asked of him a sign from heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he seeing their thoughts, said to them: Every kingdom divided against itself shall be brought to desolation; and house upon house shall fall.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if Satan also be divided against himself, how shall his kingdom stand? Because you say that through Beelzebub I cast out devils.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now if I cast out devils by Beelzebub, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore, they shall be your judges.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But if I by the finger of God cast out devils, doubtless the kingdom of God is come upon you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When a strong man armed keepeth his court, those things are in peace which he possesseth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But if a stronger than he come upon him and overcome him, he will take away all his armour wherein he trusted and will distribute his spoils.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through places without water, seeking rest: and not finding, he saith: I will return into my house whence I came out.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he is come, he findeth it swept and garnished.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then he goeth and taketh with him seven other spirits more wicked than himself: and entering in they dwell there. And the last state of that man becomes worse than the first.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, as he spoke these things, a certain woman from the crowd, lifting up her voice, said to him: Blessed is the womb that bore thee and the paps that gave thee suck.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said: Yea rather, blessed are they who hear the word of God and keep it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the multitudes running together, he began to say: This generation is a wicked generation. It asketh a sign: and a sign shall not be given it, but the sign of Jonas the prophet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For as Jonas was a sign to the Ninivites; so shall the Son of man also be to this generation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The queen of the south shall rise in the judgment with the men of this generation and shall condemn them: because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon. And behold more than Solomon here.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The men of Ninive shall rise in the judgment with this generation and shall condemn it; Because they did penance at the preaching of Jonas. And behold more than Jonas here.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: No man lighteth a candle and putteth it in a hidden place, nor under a bushel: but upon a candlestick, that they that come in may see the light.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The light of thy body is thy eye. If thy eye be single, thy whole body will be lightsome: but if it be evil, thy body also will be darksome.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If then thy whole body be lightsome, having no part of darkness: the whole shall be lightsome and, as a bright lamp, shall enlighten thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as he was speaking, a certain Pharisee prayed him that he would dine with him. And he going in, sat down to eat.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Pharisee began to say, thinking within himself, why he was not washed before dinner.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Lord said to him: Now you, Pharisees, make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter: but your inside is full of rapine and iniquity.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Ye fools, did not he that made that which is without make also that which is within?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But yet that which remaineth, give alms: and behold, all things are clean unto you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But woe to you, Pharisees, because you tithe mint and rue and every herb and pass over judgment and the charity of God. Now these things you ought to have done, and not to leave the other undone.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Woe to you, Pharisees, because you love the uppermost seats in the synagogues and salutations in the marketplace.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Woe to you, because you are as sepulchres that appear not: and men that walk over are not aware.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And one of the lawyers answering, saith to him: Master, in saying these things, thou reproachest us also.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said: Woe to you lawyers also, because you load men with burdens which they cannot bear and you yourselves touch not the packs with one of your fingers. Woe to you lawyers.... He speaks of the doctors of the law of Moses, commonly called the scribes.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Woe to you who build the monuments of the prophets: and your fathers killed them. Woe to you who build, etc.... Not that the building of the monuments of the prophets was in itself blameworthy, but only the intention of these unhappy men, who made use of this outward shew of religion and piety, as a means to carry on their wicked designs against the prince of prophets.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Truly you bear witness that you consent to the doings of your fathers. For they indeed killed them: and you build their sepulchres.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For this cause also the wisdom of God said: I will send to them prophets and apostles: and some of them they will kill and persecute.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That the blood of all the prophets which was shed from the foundation of the world may be required of this generation,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: From the blood of Abel unto the blood of Zacharias, who was slain between the altar and the temple. Yea I say to you: It shall be required of this generation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Woe to you lawyers, for you have taken away the key of knowledge. You yourselves have not entered in: and those that were entering in, you have hindered.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as he was saying these things to them, the Pharisees and the lawyers began violently to urge him and to oppress his mouth about many things,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Lying in wait for him and seeking to catch something from his mouth, that they might accuse him. Luke Chapter 12 Christ warns us against hypocrisy, the fear of the world and covetousness. He admonishes all to watch.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when great multitudes stood about him, so that they trod one upon another, he began to say to his disciples: Beware ye of the leaven of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For there is nothing covered that shall not be revealed: nor hidden that shall not be known.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For whatsoever things you have spoken in darkness shall be published in the light: and that which you have spoken in the ear in the chambers shall be preached on the housetops.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I say to you, my friends: Be not afraid of them who kill the body and after that have no more that they can do.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I will shew you whom you shall fear: Fear ye him who, after he hath killed, hath power to cast into hell. Yea, I say to you: Fear him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings, and not one of them is forgotten before God?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Yea, the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not therefore: you are of more value than many sparrows.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I say to you: Whosoever shall confess me before men, him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he that shall deny me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And whosoever speaketh a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but to him that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when they shall bring you into the synagogues and to magistrates and powers, be not solicitous how or what you shall answer, or what you shall say.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what you must say.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And one of the multitude said to him: Master, speak to my brother that he divide the inheritance with me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said to him: Man, who hath appointed me judge or divider over you?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: Take heed and beware of all covetousness: for a man’s life doth not consist in the abundance of things which he possesseth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he spoke a similitude to them, saying: The land of a certain rich man brought forth plenty of fruits.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he thought within himself, saying: What shall I do, because I have no room where to bestow my fruits?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said: This will I do: I will pull down my barns and will build greater: and into them will I gather all things that are grown to me and my goods.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I will say to my soul: Soul, thou hast much goods laid up for many years. Take thy rest: eat, drink, make good cheer.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But God said to him: Thou fool, this night do they require thy soul of thee. And whose shall those things be which thou hast provided?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: So is he that layeth up treasure for himself and is not rich towards God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to his disciples: Therefore I say to you: Be not solicitous for your life, what you shall eat, nor for your body, what you shall put on.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The life is more than the meat: and the body is more than the raiment.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Consider the ravens, for they sow not, neither do they reap, neither have they storehouse nor barn, and God feedeth them. How much are you more valuable than they?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And which of you by taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If then ye be not able to do so much as the least thing, why are you solicitous for the rest?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Consider the lilies, how they grow: they labour not, neither do they spin. But I say to you, not even Solomon in all his glory was clothed like one of these.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now, if God clothe in this manner the grass that is to-day in the field and to-morrow is cast into the oven: how much more you, O ye of little faith?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And seek not what you shall eat or what you shall drink: and be not lifted up on high.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For all these things do the nations of the world seek. But your Father knoweth that you have need of these things.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But seek ye first the kingdom of God and his justice: and all these things shall be added unto you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Fear not, little flock, for it hath pleased your Father to give you a kingdom.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Sell what you possess and give alms. Make to yourselves bags which grow not old, a treasure in heaven which faileth not: where no thief approacheth, nor moth corrupteth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Let your loins be girt and lamps burning in your hands.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And you yourselves like to men who wait for their lord, when he shall return from the wedding; that when he cometh and knocketh, they may open to him immediately.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Blessed are those servants whom the Lord, when he cometh, shall find watching. Amen I say to you that he will gird himself and make them sit down to meat and passing will minister unto them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if he shall come in the second watch or come in the third watch and find them so, blessed are those servants.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But this know ye, that if the householder did know at what hour the thief would come, he would surely watch and would not suffer his house to be broken open.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Be you then also ready: for at what hour you think not the Son of man will come.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Peter said to him: Lord, dost thou speak this parable to us, or likewise to all?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Lord said: Who thinkest thou is the faithful and wise steward, whom his lord setteth over his family, to give them their measure of wheat in due season?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Blessed is that servant whom, when his lord shall come, he shall find so doing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Verily I say to you, he will set him over all that he possesseth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But if that servant shall say in his heart: My lord is long a coming; and shall begin to strike the men-servants and maid-servants, and to eat and to drink and be drunk:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The lord of that servant will come in the day that he hopeth not, and at the hour that he knoweth not: and shall separate him and shall appoint him his portion with unbelievers.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And that servant, who knew the will of his lord and prepared not himself and did not according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he that knew not and did things worthy of stripes shall be beaten with few stripes. And unto whomsoever much is given, of him much shall be required: and to whom they have committed much, of him they will demand the more.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I am come to cast fire on the earth. And what will I, but that it be kindled?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I have a baptism wherewith I am to be baptized. And how am I straitened until it be accomplished?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Think ye, that I am come to give peace on earth? I tell you, no; but separation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For there shall be from henceforth five in one house divided: three against two, and two against three.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The father shall be divided against the son and the son against his father: the mother against the daughter and the daughter against her mother: the mother-in-law against the daughter-in-law and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said also to the multitudes: When you see a cloud rising from the west, presently you say: A shower is coming. And so it happeneth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when ye see the south wind blow, you say: There will be heat. And it cometh to pass.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: You hypocrites, you know how to discern the face of the heaven and of the earth: but how is it that you do not discern this time?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And why, even of yourselves, do you not judge that which is just?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when thou goest with thy adversary to the prince, whilst thou art in the way, endeavour to be delivered from him: lest perhaps he draw thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the exacter, and the exacter cast thee into prison.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I say to thee, thou shalt not go out thence until thou pay the very last mite. Luke Chapter 13 The necessity of penance. The barren fig tree. The cure of the infirm woman. The journey to Jerusalem.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there were present, at that very time, some that told him of the Galileans, whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he answering, said to them: Think you that these Galileans were sinners above all the men of Galilee, because they suffered such things?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: No, I say to you: but unless you shall do penance, you shall all likewise perish.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Or those eighteen upon whom the tower fell in Siloe and slew them: think you that they also were debtors above all the men that dwelt in Jerusalem?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: No, I say to you: but except you do penance, you shall all likewise perish.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He spoke also this parable: A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard: and he came seeking fruit on it and found none.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to the dresser of the vineyard: Behold, for these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree and I find none. Cut it down therefore. Why cumbereth it the ground?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he answering, said to him: Lord, let it alone this year also, until I dig about it and dung it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if happily it bear fruit: but if not, then after that thou shalt cut it down.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he was teaching in their synagogue on their sabbath.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years. And she was bowed together: neither could she look upwards at all.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Whom when Jesus saw, he called her unto him and said to her: Woman, thou art delivered from thy infirmity.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he laid his hands upon her: and immediately she was made straight and glorified God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the ruler of the synagogue being angry that Jesus had healed on the sabbath answering, said to the multitude: Six days there are wherein you ought to work. In them therefore come and be healed: and not on the sabbath day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Lord answering him, said: Ye hypocrites, doth not every one of you, on the sabbath day, loose his ox or his ass from the manger and lead them to water?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And ought not this daughter of Abraham, whom Satan hath bound, lo, these eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he said these things, all his adversaries were ashamed: and all the people rejoiced for all the things that were gloriously done by him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He said therefore: To what is the kingdom of God like, and whereunto shall I resemble it?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: It is like to a grain of mustard seed, which a man took and cast into his garden: and it grew and became a great tree, and the birds of the air lodged in the branches thereof.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And again he said: Whereunto shall I esteem the kingdom of God to be like?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: It is like to leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he went through the cities and towns teaching and making his journey to Jerusalem.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And a certain man said to him: Lord, are they few that are saved? But he said to them:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Strive to enter by the narrow gate: for many, I say to you, shall seek to enter and shall not be able. Shall seek, etc.... Shall desire to be saved; but for want of taking sufficient pains, and being thoroughly in earnest, shall not attain to it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But when the master of the house shall be gone in and shall shut the door, you shall begin to stand without; and knock at the door, saying: Lord, open to us. And he answering, shall say to you: I know you not, whence you are.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then you shall begin to say: We have eaten and drunk in thy presence: and thou hast taught in our streets.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he shall say to you: I know you not, whence you are. Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth; when you shall see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets, in the kingdom of God: and you yourselves thrust out.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there shall come from the east and the west and the north and the south: and shall sit down in the kingdom of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold, they are last that shall be first: and they are first that shall be last.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The same day, there came some of the Pharisees, saying to him: Depart, and get thee hence, for Herod hath a mind to kill thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: Go and tell that fox: Behold, I cast out devils and do cures, to-day and to-morrow, and the third day I am consummated.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Nevertheless, I must walk to-day and to-morrow and the day following, because it cannot be that a prophet perish, out of Jerusalem.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that killest the prophets; and stonest them that are sent to thee, how often would I have gathered thy children as the bird doth her brood under her wings, and thou wouldest not?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Behold your house shall be left to you desolate. And I say to you that you shall not see me till the time come when you shall say: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord. Luke Chapter 14 Christ heals the dropsical man. The parable of the supper. The necessity of renouncing all to follow Christ.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, when Jesus went into the house of one of the chief of the Pharisees, on the sabbath day, to eat bread, that they watched him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold, there was a certain man before him that had the dropsy.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus answering, spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying: Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath day?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they held their peace. But he taking him, healed him and sent him away.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And answering them, he said: Which of you shall have an ass or an ox fall into a pit and will not immediately draw him out, on the sabbath day?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they could not answer him to these things.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he spoke a parable also to them that were invited, marking how they chose the first seats at the table, saying to them:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When thou art invited to a wedding, sit not down in the first place, lest perhaps one more honourable than thou be invited by him:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he that invited thee and him, come and say to thee: Give this man place. And then thou begin with shame to take the lowest place.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But when thou art invited, go, sit down in the lowest place; that when he who invited thee cometh, he may say to thee: Friend, go up higher. Then shalt thou have glory before them that sit at table with thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Because every one that exalteth himself shall be humbled: and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to him also that had invited him: When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends nor thy brethren nor thy kinsmen nor thy neighbours who are rich; lest perhaps they also invite thee again, and a recompense be made to thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame and the blind.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And thou shalt be blessed, because they have not wherewith to make thee recompense: for recompense shall be made thee at the resurrection of the just.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When one of them that sat at table with him had heard these things, he said to him: Blessed is he that shall eat bread in the kingdom of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said to him: A certain man made a great supper and invited many.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he sent his servant at the hour of supper to say to them that were invited, that they should come: for now all things are ready.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they began all at once to make excuse. The first said to him: I have bought a farm and I must needs go out and see it. I pray thee, hold me excused.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And another said: I have bought five yoke of oxen and I go to try them. I pray thee, hold me excused.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And another said: I have married a wife; and therefore I cannot come.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the servant returning, told these things to his lord. Then the master of the house, being angry, said to his servant: Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city; and bring in hither the poor and the feeble and the blind and the lame.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the servant said: Lord, it is done as thou hast commanded; and yet there is room.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Lord said to the servant: Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I say unto you that none of those men that were invited shall taste of my supper.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there went great multitudes with him. And turning, he said to them:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If any man come to me, and hate not his father and mother and wife and children and brethren and sisters, yea and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple. Hate not, etc.... The law of Christ does not allow us to hate even our enemies, much less our parents: but the meaning of the text is, that we must be in that disposition of soul, as to be willing to renounce, and part with every thing, how near or dear soever it may be to us, that would keep us from following Christ.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And whosoever doth not carry his cross and come after me cannot be my disciple.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For which of you, having a mind to build a tower, doth not first sit down and reckon the charges that are necessary, whether he have wherewithal to finish it:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
