Text: Lest, after he hath laid the foundation and is not able to finish it, all that see it begin to mock him,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Saying: This man began to build and was not able to finish.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Or, what king, about to go to make war against another king, doth not first sit down and think whether he be able, with ten thousand, to meet him that, with twenty thousand, cometh against him?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Or else, while the other is yet afar off, sending an embassy, he desireth conditions of peace.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: So likewise every one of you that doth not renounce all that he possesseth cannot be my disciple.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Salt is good. But if the salt shall lose its savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: It is neither profitable for the land nor for the dunghill: but shall be cast out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear. Luke Chapter 15 The parables of the lost sheep and of the prodigal son.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now the publicans and sinners drew near unto him to hear him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying: This man receiveth sinners and eateth with them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he spoke to them this parable, saying:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: What man of you that hath an hundred sheep, and if he shall lose one of them, doth he not leave the ninety-nine in the desert and go after that which was lost, until he find it?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he hath found it, lay it upon his shoulders, rejoicing?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And coming home, call together his friends and neighbours, saying to them: Rejoice with me, because I have found my sheep that was lost?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I say to you that even so there shall be joy in heaven upon one sinner that doth penance, more than upon ninety-nine just who need not penance.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Or what woman having ten groats, if she lose one groat, doth not light a candle and sweep the house and seek diligently until she find it?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when she hath found it, call together her friends and neighbours, saying: Rejoice with me, because I have found the groat which I had lost.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: So I say to you, there shall be joy before the angels of God upon one sinner doing penance. Before the angels.... By this it is plain that the spirits in heaven have a concern for us below, and a joy at our repentance and consequently a knowledge of it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said: A certain man had two sons.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the younger of them said to his father: Father, give me the portion of substance that falleth to me. And he divided unto them his substance.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And not many days after, the younger son, gathering all together, went abroad into a far country: and there wasted his substance, living riotously.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after he had spent all, there came a mighty famine in that country: and he began to be in want.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he went and cleaved to one of the citizens of that country. And he sent him into his farm to feed swine.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And returning to himself, he said: How many hired servants in my father’s house abound with bread, and I here perish with hunger!

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I will arise and will go to my father and say to him: Father, I have sinned against heaven and before thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I am not worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And rising up, he came to his father. And when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him and was moved with compassion and running to him fell upon his neck and kissed him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the son said to him: Father: I have sinned against heaven and before thee I am not now worthy to be called thy son.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the father said to his servants: Bring forth quickly the first robe and put it on him: and put a ring on his hand and shoes on his feet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And bring hither the fatted calf, and kill it: and let us eat and make merry:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Because this my son was dead and is come to life again, was lost and is found. And they began to be merry.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now his elder son was in the field and when he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard music and dancing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he called one of the servants, and asked what these things meant.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to him: Thy brother is come and thy father hath killed the fatted calf, because he hath received him safe.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he was angry and would not go in. His father therefore coming out began to entreat him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he answering, said to his father: Behold, for so many years do I serve thee and I have never transgressed thy commandment: and yet thou hast never given me a kid to make merry with my friends.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But as soon as this thy son is come, who hath devoured his substance with harlots, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said to him: Son, thou art always with me; and all I have is thine.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But it was fit that we should make merry and be glad: for this thy brother was dead and is come to life again; he was lost, and is found. Luke Chapter 16 The parable of the unjust steward and of the rich man and Lazarus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said also to his disciples: There was a certain rich man who had a steward: and the same was accused unto him, that he had wasted his goods.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he called him and said to him: How is it that I hear this of thee? Give an account of thy stewardship: for now thou canst be steward no longer.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the steward said within himself: What shall I do, because my lord taketh away from me the stewardship? To dig I am not able; to beg I am ashamed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I know what I will do, that when I shall be removed from the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Therefore, calling together every one of his lord’s debtors, he said to the first: How much dost thou owe my lord?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said: An hundred barrels of oil. And he said to him: Take thy bill and sit down quickly and write fifty.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then he said to another: And how much dost thou owe? Who said: An hundred quarters of wheat. He said to him: Take thy bill and write eighty.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the lord commended the unjust steward, forasmuch as he had done wisely: for the children of this world are wiser in their generation than the children of light.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I say to you: Make unto you friends of the mammon of iniquity: that when you shall fail, they may receive you into everlasting dwellings. Mammon of iniquity.... Mammon signifies riches. They are here called the mammon of iniquity, because oftentimes ill gotten, ill bestowed, or an occasion of evil; and at the best are but worldly, and false; and not the true riches of a Christian. They may receive.... By this we see, that the poor servants of God, whom we have relieved by our alms, may hereafter, by their intercession, bring our souls to heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in that which is greater: and he that is unjust in that which is little is unjust also in that which is greater.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If then you have not been faithful in the unjust mammon, who will trust you with that which is the true?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if you have not been faithful in that which is another’s, who will give you that which is your own?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: No servant can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one and love the other: or he will hold to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now the Pharisees, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: you are they who justify yourselves before men, but God knoweth your hearts. For that which is high to men is an abomination before God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The law and the prophets were until John. From that time the kingdom of God is preached: and every one useth violence towards it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass than one tittle of the law to fall.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Every one that putteth away his wife and marrieth another committeth adultery: and he that marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: There was a certain rich man who was clothed in purple and fine linen and feasted sumptuously every day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there was a certain beggar, named Lazarus, who lay at his gate, full of sores,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Desiring to be filled with the crumbs that fell from the rich man’s table. And no one did give him: moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass that the beggar died and was carried by the angels into Abraham’s bosom. And the rich man also died: and he was buried in hell. Abraham’s bosom.... The place of rest, where the souls of the saints resided, till Christ had opened heaven by his death.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And lifting up his eyes when he was in torments, he saw Abraham afar off and Lazarus in his bosom:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he cried and said: Father Abraham, have mercy on me and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water to cool my tongue: for I am tormented in this flame.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Abraham said to him: Son, remember that thou didst receive good things in thy lifetime, and likewise Lazarus evil things: but now he is comforted and thou art tormented.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And besides all this, between us and you, there is fixed a great chaos: so that they who would pass from hence to you cannot, nor from thence come hither.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said: Then, father, I beseech thee that thou wouldst send him to my father’s house, for I have five brethren,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That he may testify unto them, lest they also come into this place of torments.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Abraham said to him: They have Moses and the prophets. Let them hear them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said: No, father Abraham: but if one went to them from the dead, they will do penance.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to him: If they hear not Moses and the prophets, neither will they believe, if one rise again from the dead. Luke Chapter 17 Lessons of avoiding scandal and of the efficacy of faith. The ten lepers. The manner of the coming of Christ.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to his disciples: It is impossible that scandals should not come. But woe to him through whom they come!

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck and he cast into the sea, than that he should scandalize one of these little ones.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Take heed to yourselves. If thy brother sin against thee, reprove him: and if he do penance, forgive him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if he sin against thee seven times in a day, and seven times in a day be converted unto thee, saying: I repent: forgive him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the apostles said to the Lord: Increase our faith.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Lord said: If you had faith like to a grain of mustard seed, you might say to this mulberry tree: Be thou rooted up and be thou transplanted into the sea. And it would obey you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But which of you, having a servant ploughing or feeding cattle, will say to him, when he is come from the field: Immediately go. Sit down to meat.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And will not rather say to him: Make ready my supper and gird thyself and serve me, whilst I eat and drink; and afterwards thou shalt eat and drink?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Doth he thank that servant for doing the things which he commanded him?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I think not. So you also, when you shall have done all these things that are commanded you, say: We are unprofitable servants; we have done that which we ought to do. Unprofitable servants.... Because our service is of no profit to our master; and he justly claims it as our bounden duty. But though we are unprofitable to him, our serving him is not unprofitable to us; for he is pleased to give by his grace a value to our good works, which, in consequence of his promise, entitles them to an eternal reward.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, as he was going to Jerusalem, he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as he entered into a certain town, there met him ten men that were lepers, who stood afar off.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And lifted up their voice, saying: Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Whom when he saw, he said: Go, shew yourselves to the priests. And it came to pass, as they went, they were made clean.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And one of them, when he saw that he was made clean, went back, with a loud voice glorifying God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he fell on his face before his feet, giving thanks. And this was a Samaritan.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus answering, said: Were not ten made clean? And where are the nine?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: There is no one found to return and give glory to God, but this stranger.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to him: Arise, go thy way; for thy faith hath made thee whole.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And being asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said: The kingdom of God cometh not with observation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Neither shall they say: Behold here, or behold there. For lo, the kingdom of God is within you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to his disciples: The days will come when you shall desire to see one day of the Son of man. And you shall not see it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they will say to you: See here, and see there. Go ye not after, nor follow them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For as the lightning that lighteneth from under heaven shineth unto the parts that are under heaven, so shall the Son of man be in his day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But first he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as it came to pass in the days of Noe, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They did eat and drink, they married wives and were given in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark and the flood came and destroyed them all.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Likewise as it came to pass in the days of Lot. They did eat and drink, they bought and sold, they planted and built.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And in the day that Lot went out of Sodom, it rained fire and brimstone from heaven and destroyed them all.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man shall be revealed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In that hour, he that shall be on the housetop, and his goods in the house, let him not go down to take them away: and he that shall be in the field, in like manner, let him not return back.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Remember Lot’s wife.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it: and whosoever shall lose it shall preserve it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I say to you: In that night there shall be two men in one bed. The one shall be taken and the other shall be left.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Two women shall be grinding together. The one shall be taken and the other shall be left. Two men shall be in the field. The one shall be taken and the other shall be left.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They answering, say to him: Where, Lord?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who said to them: Wheresoever the body shall be, thither will the eagles also be gathered together. Luke Chapter 18 We must pray always. The Pharisee and the publican. The danger of riches. The blind man is restored to sight.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he spoke also a parable to them, that we ought always to pray and not to faint,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Saying: There was a judge in a certain city, who feared not God nor regarded man.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there was a certain widow in that city; and she came to him, saying: Avenge me of my adversary. Avenge.... That is, do me justice. It is a Hebraism.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he would not for a long time. But afterwards he said within himself: Although I fear not God nor regard man,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Yet because this widow is troublesome to me, I will avenge her, lest continually coming she weary me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Lord said: Hear what the unjust judge saith.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And will not God revenge his elect who cry to him day and night? And will he have patience in their regard?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I say to you that he will quickly revenge them. But yet the Son of man, when he cometh, shall he find, think you, faith on earth?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And to some who trusted in themselves as just and despised others, he spoke also this parable:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Two men went up into the temple to pray: the one a Pharisee and the other a publican.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Pharisee standing, prayed thus with himself: O God, I give thee thanks that I am not as the rest of men, extortioners, unjust, adulterers, as also is this publican.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I fast twice in a week: I give tithes of all that I possess.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the publican, standing afar off, would not so much as lift up his eyes towards heaven; but struck his breast, saying: O God, be merciful to me a sinner.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I say to you, this man went down into his house justified rather than the other: because every one that exalteth himself shall be humbled: and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they brought unto him also infants, that he might touch them. Which when the disciples saw, they rebuked them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Jesus, calling them together, said: Suffer children to come to me and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Amen, I say to you: Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a child shall not enter into it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And a certain ruler asked him, saying: Good master, what shall I do to possess everlasting life?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said to him: Why dost thou call me good? None is good but God alone.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Thou knowest the commandments: Thou shalt not kill. Thou shalt not commit adultery: Thou shalt not steal: Thou shalt not bear false witness: Honour thy father and mother.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who said: All these things have I kept from my youth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Which when Jesus had heard, he said to him: Yet one thing is wanting to thee. Sell all whatever thou hast and give to the poor: and thou shalt have treasure in heaven. And come, follow me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He having heard these things, became sorrowful: for he was very rich.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus seeing him become sorrowful, said: How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For it is easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they that heard it said: Who then can be saved?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He said to them: The things that are impossible with men are possible with God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then Peter said: Behold, we have left all things and have followed thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who said to them: Amen, I say to you, there is no man that hath left home or parents or brethren or wife or children, for the kingdom of God’s sake,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who shall not receive much more in this present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then Jesus took unto him the twelve and said to them: Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and all things shall be accomplished which were written by the prophets concerning the Son of man.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For he shall be delivered to the Gentiles and shall be mocked and scourged and spit upon.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after they have scourged him, they will put him to death. And the third day he shall rise again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they understood none of these things, and this word was hid from them: and they understood not the things that were said.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now it came to pass, when he drew nigh to Jericho, that a certain blind man sat by the way side, begging.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he heard the multitude passing by, he asked what this meant.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he cried out, saying: Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they that went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried out much more: Son of David, have mercy on me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus standing, commanded him to be brought unto him. And when he was come near, he asked him,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Saying; What wilt thou that I do to thee? But he said: Lord, that I may see.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said to him: Receive thy sight: thy faith hath made thee whole.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And immediately he saw and followed him, glorifying God. And all the people, when they saw it, gave praise to God. Luke Chapter 19 Zacheus entertains Christ. The parable of the pounds. Christ rides upon an ass and weeps over Jerusalem.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And entering he walked through Jericho.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold, there was a man named Zacheus, who was the chief of the publicans: and he was rich.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he sought to see Jesus who he was: and he could not for the crowd, because he was low of stature.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And running before, he climbed up into a sycamore tree, that he might see him: for he was to pass that way.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when Jesus was come to the place, looking up, he saw him and said to him: Zacheus, make haste and come down: for this day I must abide in thy house.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he made haste and came down and received him with joy.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when all saw it, they murmured, saying, that he was gone to be a guest with a man that was a sinner.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Zacheus standing, said to the Lord: Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor; and if I have wronged any man of any thing, I restore him fourfold.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus said to him: This day is salvation come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As they were hearing these things, he added and spoke a parable, because he was nigh to Jerusalem and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately be manifested.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He said therefore: a certain nobleman went into a far country, to receive for himself a kingdom and to return.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And calling his ten servants, he gave them ten pounds and said to them: Trade till I come. He gave them ten pounds.... In the original, what is here translated a pound, is in Latin, mina, in value of our coin, three pounds two shillings and sixpence.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But his citizens hated him and they sent an embassage after him, saying: We will not have this man to reign over us.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass that he returned, having received the kingdom: and he commanded his servants to be called, to whom he had given the money, that he might know how much every man had gained by trading,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the first came saying: Lord, thy pound hath gained ten pounds.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to him: Well done, thou good servant, because thou hast been faithful in a little, thou shalt have power over ten cities.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the second came, saying: Lord, thy pound hath gained five pounds.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to him: Be thou also over five cities.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And another came, saying: Lord, behold here is thy pound, which I have kept laid up in a napkin.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For I feared thee, because thou art an austere man: thou takest up what thou didst not lay down: and thou reapest that which thou didst not sow.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He saith to him: Out of thy own mouth I judge thee, thou wicked servant. Thou knewest that I was an austere man, taking up what I laid not down and reaping that which I did not sow.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And why then didst thou not give my money into the bank, that at my coming I might have exacted it with usury?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them that stood by: Take the pound away from him and give it to him that hath ten pounds.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they said to him: Lord, he hath ten pounds.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I say to you that to every one that hath shall be given, and he shall abound: and from him that hath not, even that which he hath shall be taken from him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But as for those my enemies, who would not have me reign over them, bring them hither and kill them before me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And having said these things, he went before, going up to Jerusalem.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethania, unto the mount called Olivet, he sent two of his disciples,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Saying: Go into the town which is over against you, at your entering into which you shall find the colt of an ass tied, on which no man ever hath sitten: loose him and bring him hither.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if any man shall ask you: Why do you loose him? You shall say thus unto him: Because the Lord hath need of his service.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they that were sent went their way and found the colt standing, as he had said unto them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as they were loosing the colt, the owners thereof said to them: Why loose you the colt?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they said: Because the Lord hath need of him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they brought him to Jesus. And casting their garments on the colt, they set Jesus thereon.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as he went, they spread their clothes underneath in the way.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he was now coming near the descent of Mount Olivet, the whole multitude of his disciples began with joy to praise God with a loud voice, for all the mighty works they had seen,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Saying: Blessed be the king who cometh in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven and glory on high!

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And some of the Pharisees, from amongst the multitude, said to him: Master, rebuke thy disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: To whom he said: I say to you that if these shall hold their peace, the stones will cry out.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he drew near, seeing the city, he wept over it, saying:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If thou also hadst known, and that in this thy day, the things that are to thy peace: but now they are hidden from thy eyes.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For the days shall come upon thee: and thy enemies shall cast a trench about thee and compass thee round and straiten thee on every side,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And beat thee flat to the ground, and thy children who are in thee. And they shall not leave in thee a stone upon a stone: because thou hast not known the time of thy visitation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And entering into the temple, he began to cast out them that sold therein and them that bought.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Saying to them: It is written: My house is the house of prayer. But you have made it a den of thieves.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he was teaching daily in the temple. And the chief priests and the scribes and the rulers of the people sought to destroy him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they found not what to do to him: for all the people were very attentive to hear him. Luke Chapter 20 The parable of the husbandmen. Of paying tribute to Caesar and of the resurrection of the dead.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass that on one of the days, as he was teaching the people in the temple and preaching the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes, with the ancients, met together,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And spoke to him, saying: Tell us, by what authority dost thou these things? Or, who is he that hath given thee this authority?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus answering, said to them: I will also ask you one thing. Answer me:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they thought within themselves, saying: If we shall say, From heaven: he will say: Why then did you not believe in him?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But if we say, of men: the whole people will stone us. For they are persuaded that John was a prophet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they answered that they knew not whence it was.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said to them: Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he began to speak to the people this parable: A certain man planted a vineyard and let it out to husbandmen: and he was abroad for a long time.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen, that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard. Who, beating him, sent him away empty.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And again he sent another servant. But they beat him also and, treating him reproachfully, sent him away empty.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And again he sent the third: and they wounded him also and cast him out.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then the lord of the vineyard said: What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. It may be, when they see him, they will reverence him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Whom, when the husbandmen saw, they thought within themselves, saying: This is the heir. Let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: So casting him out of the vineyard, they killed him. What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do to them?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He will come and will destroy these husbandmen and will give the vineyard to others. Which they hearing, said to him: God forbid.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he looking on them, said: What is this then that is written, The stone, which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be bruised: and upon whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on him the same hour: but they feared the people, for they knew that he spoke this parable to them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And being upon the watch, they sent spies, who should feign themselves just, that they might take hold of him in his words, that they might deliver him up to the authority and power of the governor.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they asked him, saying: Master, we know that thou speakest and teachest rightly: and thou dost not respect any person, but teachest the way of God in truth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute to Caesar, or no?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he, considering their guile, said to them: Why tempt you me?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Shew me a penny. Whose image and inscription hath it? They answering, said to him: Caesar’s.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: Render therefore to Caesar the things, that are Caesar’s: and to God the things that are God’s.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they could not reprehend his word before the people: and wondering at his answer, they held their peace.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there came to him some of the Sadducees, who deny that there is any resurrection: and they asked him,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Saying: Master, Moses wrote unto us: If any man’s brother die, having a wife, and he leave no children, that his brother should take her to wife and raise up seed unto his brother.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: There were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife and died without children.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the next took her to wife: and he also died childless.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the third took her. And in like manner, all the seven: and they left no children and died.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Last of all the woman died also.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In the resurrection therefore, whose wife of them shall she be? For all the seven had her to wife.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said to them: The children of this world marry and are given in marriage:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they that shall be accounted worthy of that world and of the resurrection from the dead shall neither be married nor take wives.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Neither can they die any more for they are equal to the angels and are the children of God, being the children of the resurrection.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now that the dead rise again, Moses also shewed at the bush, when he called the Lord: The God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For he is not the God of the dead, but of the living: for all live to him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And some of the scribes answering, said to him: Master, thou hast said well.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after that they durst not ask him any more questions.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said to them: How say they that Christ is the son of David?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms: The Lord said to my Lord, sit thou on my right hand,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Till I make thy enemies thy footstool.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: David then calleth him Lord. And how is he his son?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And in the hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Beware of the scribes, who desire to walk in long robes and love salutations in the market place and the first chairs in the synagogues and the chief rooms at feasts:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who devour the houses of widows, feigning long prayer. These shall receive greater damnation. Luke Chapter 21 The widow’s mites. The signs that should forerun the destruction of Jerusalem and the end of the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And looking on, he saw the rich men cast their gifts into the treasury.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in two brass mites.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said: Verily, I say to you that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For all these have of their abundance cast into the offerings of God: but she of her want hath cast in all the living that she had.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And some saying of the temple that it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts, he said:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things which you see, the days will come in which there shall not be left a stone upon a stone that shall not be thrown down.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they asked him, saying: Master, when shall these things be? And what shall be the sign when they shall begin to come to pass?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who said: Take heed you be not seduced: for many will come in my name, saying: I am he and the time is at hand. Go ye not therefore after them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when you shall hear of wars and seditions, be not terrified. These things must first come to pass: but the end is not yet presently.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then he said to them: Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there shall be great earthquakes in divers places and pestilences and famines and terrors from heaven: and there shall be great signs.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues and into prisons, dragging you before kings and governors, for my name’s sake.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it shall happen unto you for a testimony.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Lay it up therefore in your hearts, not to meditate before how you shall answer:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which all your adversaries shall not be able to resist and gainsay.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And you shall be betrayed by your parents and brethren and kinsmen and friends: and some of you they will put to death.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And you shall be hated by all men for my name’s sake.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But a hair of your head shall not perish.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In your patience you shall possess your souls.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when you shall see Jerusalem compassed about with an army, then know that the desolation thereof is at hand.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains: and those who are in the midst thereof depart out: and those who are in the countries not enter into it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For these are the days of vengeance, that all things may be fulfilled, that are written.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But woe to them that are with child and give suck in those days: for there shall be great distress in the land and wrath upon this people.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword and shall be led away captives into all nations: and Jerusalem shall be trodden down by the Gentiles till the times of the nations be fulfilled.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there shall be signs in the sun and in the moon and in the stars; and upon the earth distress of nations, by reason of the confusion of the roaring of the sea, and of the waves:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Men withering away for fear and expectation of what shall come upon the whole world. For the powers of heaven shall be moved.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And then they shall see the Son of man coming in a cloud, with great power and majesty.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But when these things begin to come to pass, look up and lift up your heads, because your redemption is at hand.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he spoke to them a similitude. See the fig tree and all the trees:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When they now shoot forth their fruit, you know that summer is nigh;

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: So you also, when you shall see these things come to pass, know that the kingdom of God is at hand.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Amen, I say to you, this generation shall not pass away till all things be fulfilled.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And take heed to yourselves, lest perhaps your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting and drunkenness and the cares of this life: and that day come upon you suddenly.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For as a snare shall it come upon all that sit upon the face of the whole earth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Watch ye, therefore, praying at all times, that you may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that are to come and to stand before the Son of man.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And in the daytime, he was teaching in the temple: but at night going out, he abode in the mount that is called Olivet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple, to hear him. Luke Chapter 22 The treason of Judas. The last supper. The first part of the history of the passion.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now the feast of unleavened bread, which is called the pasch, was at hand.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might put Jesus to death: but they feared the people.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Satan entered into Judas, who was surnamed Iscariot, one of the twelve.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he went and discoursed with the chief priests and the magistrates, how he might betray him to them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they were glad and covenanted to give him money.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he promised. And he sought opportunity to betray him in the absence of the multitude.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the day of the unleavened bread came, on which it was necessary that the pasch should be killed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he sent Peter and John, saying: Go, and prepare for us the pasch, that we may eat.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they said: Where wilt thou that we prepare?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: Behold, as you go into the city, there shall meet you a man carrying a pitcher of water: follow him into the house where he entereth in.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And you shall say to the goodman of the house: The master saith to thee: Where is the guest chamber, where I may eat the pasch with my disciples?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he will shew you a large dining room, furnished. And there prepare.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they going, found as he had said to them and made ready the pasch.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when the hour was come, he sat down: and the twelve apostles with him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: With desire I have desired to eat this pasch with you, before I suffer.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For I say to you that from this time I will not eat it, till it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And having taken the chalice, he gave thanks and said: Take and divide it among you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For I say to you that I will not drink of the fruit of the vine, till the kingdom of God come.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And taking bread, he gave thanks and brake and gave to them, saying: This is my body, which is given for you. Do this for a commemoration of me. Do this for a commemoration of me.... This sacrifice and sacrament is to be continued in the church, to the end of the world, to shew forth the death of Christ, until he cometh. But this commemoration, or remembrance, is by no means inconsistent with the real presence of his body and blood, under these sacramental veils, which represent his death; on the contrary, it is the manner that he himself hath commanded, of commemorating and celebrating his death, by offering in sacrifice, and receiving in the sacrament, that body and blood by which we were redeemed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In like manner, the chalice also, after he had supped, saying: This is the chalice, the new testament in my blood, which shall be shed for you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But yet behold: the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Son of man indeed goeth, according to that which is determined: but yet, woe to that man by whom he shall be betrayed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they began to inquire among themselves, which of them it was that should do this thing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there was also a strife amongst them, which of them should seem to be the greater.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them; and they that have power over them are called beneficent.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But you not so: but he that is the greater among you, let him become as the younger: and he that is the leader, as he that serveth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For which is greater, he that sitteth at table or he that serveth? Is not he that sitteth at table? But I am in the midst of you, as he that serveth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And you are they who have continued with me in my temptations:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I dispose to you, as my Father hath disposed to me, a kingdom;

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That you may eat and drink at my table, in my kingdom: and may sit upon thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Lord said: Simon, Simon, behold Satan hath desired to have you, that he may sift you as wheat.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not: and thou, being once converted, confirm thy brethren.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who said to him: Lord, I am ready to go with thee, both into prison and to death.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said: I say to thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, till thou thrice deniest that thou knowest me. And he said to them:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When I sent you without purse and scrip and shoes, did you want anything?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they said: Nothing. Then said he unto them: But now he that hath a purse, let him take it, and likewise a scrip: and he that hath not, let him sell his coat and buy a sword.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For I say to you that this that is written must yet be fulfilled in me. And with the wicked was he reckoned. For the things concerning me have an end.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they said: Lord, behold, here are two swords. And he said to them: It is enough.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And going out, he went, according to his custom, to the Mount of Olives. And his disciples also followed him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he was come to the place, he said to them: Pray, lest ye enter into temptation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he was withdrawn away from them a stone’s cast. And kneeling down, he prayed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Saying: Father, if thou wilt, remove this chalice from me: but yet not my will, but thine be done.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there appeared to him an angel from heaven, strengthening him. And being in an agony, he prayed the longer.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And his sweat became as drops of blood, trickling down upon the ground.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he rose up from prayer and was come to the disciples, he found them sleeping for sorrow.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: Why sleep you? Arise: pray: lest you enter into temptation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As he was yet speaking, behold a multitude; and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them and drew near to Jesus, for to kiss him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said to him: Judas, dost thou betray the Son of man with a kiss?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they that were about him, seeing what would follow, said to him: Lord, shall we strike with the sword?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Jesus answering, said: Suffer ye thus far. And when he had touched his ear, he healed him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said to the chief priests and magistrates of the temple and the ancients, that were come unto him: Are ye come out, as it were against a thief, with swords and clubs?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When I was daily with you in the temple, you did not stretch forth your hands against me: but this is your hour and the power of darkness.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And apprehending him, they led him to the high priest’s house. But Peter followed afar off.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall and were sitting about it, Peter was in the midst of them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Whom when a certain servant maid had seen sitting at the light and had earnestly beheld him, she said: This man also was with him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he denied him, saying: Woman, I know him not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after a little while, another seeing him, said: Thou also art one of them. But Peter said: O man, I am not. Another, etc.... Observe here, in order to reconcile the four Evangelists, that divers persons concurred in charging Peter with being Christ’s disciple; till at length they brought him to deny him thrice. 1. The porteress that let him in, and afterwards seeing him at the fire, first put the question to him; and then positively affirmed that he was with Christ. 2. Another maid accused him to the standers by; and gave occasion to the man here mentioned to renew the charge against him, which caused the second denial. 3. Others of the company took notice of his being a Galilean; and were seconded by the kinsman of Malchus, who affirmed he had seen him in the garden. And this drew on the third denial.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after the space, as it were of one hour, another certain man affirmed, saying: Of a truth, this man was also with him: for he is also a Galilean.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Peter said: Man, I know not what thou sayest. And immediately, as he was yet speaking, the cock crew.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Lord turning looked on Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, as he had said: Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Peter going out, wept bitterly.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the men that held him mocked him and struck him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they blindfolded him and smote his face. And they asked him saying: Prophesy: Who is it that struck thee?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And blaspheming, many other things they said against him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as soon as it was day, the ancients of the people and the chief priests and scribes came together. And they brought him into their council saying: If thou be the Christ, tell us.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he saith to them: If I shall tell you, you will not believe me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if I shall also ask you, you will not answer me, nor let me go.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But hereafter the Son of man shall be sitting on the right hand of the power of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then said they all: Art thou then the Son of God? Who said: You say that I am.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they said: What need we any further testimony? For we ourselves have heard it from his own mouth. Luke Chapter 23 The continuation of the history of the passion.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the whole multitude of them, rising up, led him to Pilate.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they began to accuse him, saying: We have found this man perverting our nation and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar and saying that he is Christ the king.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Pilate asked him, saying: Art thou the king of the Jews? But he answering, said: Thou sayest it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Pilate said to the chief priests and to the multitudes: I find no cause in this man.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they were more earnest, saying: He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee to this place.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Pilate hearing Galilee, asked if the man were of Galilee?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he understood that he was of Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him away to Herod, who was also himself at Jerusalem in those days.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Herod seeing Jesus, was very glad: for he was desirous of a long time to see him, because he had heard many things of him; and he hoped to see some sign wrought by him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he questioned him in many words. But he answered him nothing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the chief priests and the scribes stood by, earnestly accusing him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Herod with his army set him at nought and mocked him, putting on him a white garment: and sent him back to Pilate.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Herod and Pilate were made friends, that same day: for before they were enemies one to another.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Pilate, calling together the chief priests and the magistrates and the people,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Said to them: You have presented unto me this man as one that perverteth the people. And behold I, having examined him before you, find no cause in this man, in those things wherein you accuse him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: No, nor Herod neither. For, I sent you to him: and behold, nothing worthy of death is done to him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I will chastise him therefore and release him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now of necessity he was to release unto them one upon the feast day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But the whole multitude together cried out, saying: Away with this man, and release unto us Barabbas:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who, for a certain sedition made in the city and for a murder, was cast into prison.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Pilate again spoke to them, desiring to release Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they cried again, saying: Crucify him, Crucify him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them the third time: Why, what evil hath this man done? I find no cause of death in him. I will chastise him therefore and let him go.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they were instant with loud voices, requiring that he might be crucified. And their voices prevailed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he released unto them him who for murder and sedition had been cast into prison, whom they had desired. But Jesus he delivered up to their will.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as they led him away, they laid hold of one Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country; and they laid the cross on him to carry after Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there followed him a great multitude of people and of women, who bewailed and lamented him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Jesus turning to them, said: Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not over me; but weep for yourselves and for your children.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For behold, the days shall come, wherein they will say: Blessed are the barren and the wombs that have not borne and the paps that have not given suck.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains: Fall upon us. And to the hills: Cover us.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For if in the green wood they do these things, what shall be done in the dry?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there were also two other malefactors led with him to be put to death.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when they were come to the place which is called Calvary, they crucified him there: and the robbers, one on the right hand, and the other on the left.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said: Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do. But they, dividing his garments, cast lots.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the people stood beholding. And the rulers with them derided him, saying: He saved others: let him save himself, if he be Christ, the elect of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him and offering him vinegar,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And saying: If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there was also a superscription written over him in letters of Greek and Latin and Hebrew THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And one of those robbers who were hanged blasphemed him, saying: If thou be Christ, save thyself and us.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But the other answering, rebuked him, saying: Neither dost thou fear God, seeing; thou art under the same condemnation?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And we indeed justly: for we receive the due reward of our deeds. But this man hath done no evil.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to Jesus: Lord, remember me when thou shalt come into thy kingdom.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said to him: Amen I say to thee: This day thou shalt be with me in paradise. In paradise.... That is, in the happy state of rest, joy, and peace everlasting. Christ was pleased, by a special privilege, to reward the faith and confession of the penitent thief, with a full discharge of all his sins, both as to the guilt and punishment; and to introduce him immediately after death into the happy society of the saints, whose limbo, that is, the place of their confinement, was now made a paradise by our Lord’s going thither.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it was almost the sixth hour: and there was darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus crying with a loud voice, said: Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit. And saying this, he gave up the ghost.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now, the centurion, seeing what was done, glorified God, saying: Indeed this was a just man.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all the multitude of them that were come together to that sight and saw the things that were done returned, striking their breasts.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all his acquaintance and the women that had followed him from Galilee stood afar off, beholding these things.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold there was a man named Joseph who was a counsellor, a good and a just man,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: (The same had not consented to their counsel and doings) of Arimathea, a city of Judea: who also himself looked for the kingdom of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This man went to Pilate and begged the body of Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And taking him down, he wrapped him in fine linen and laid him in a sepulchre that was hewed in stone, wherein never yet any man had been laid.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it was the day of the Parasceve: and the sabbath drew on. Parasceve.... That is, the eve, or day of preparation for the sabbath.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the women that were come with him from Galilee, following after, saw the sepulchre and how his body was laid.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And returning, they prepared spices and ointments: and on the sabbath day they rested, according to the commandment. Luke Chapter 24 Christ’s resurrection and manifestation of himself to his disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And on the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they came to the sepulchre, bringing the spices which they had prepared.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they found the stone rolled back from the sepulchre.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And going in, they found not the body of the Lord Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, as they were astonished in their mind at this, behold, two men stood by them, in shining apparel.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as they were afraid and bowed down their countenance towards the ground, they said unto them: Why seek you the living with the dead?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He is not here, but is risen. Remember how he spoke unto you, when he was yet in Galilee,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Saying: The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men and be crucified and the third day rise again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they remembered his words.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And going back from the sepulchre, they told all these things to the eleven and to all the rest.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it was Mary Magdalen and Joanna and Mary of James and the other women that were with them, who told these things to the apostles.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And these words seemed to them as idle tales: and they did not believe them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Peter rising up, ran to the sepulchre and, stooping down, he saw the linen cloths laid by themselves: and went away wondering in himself at that which was come to pass.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold, two of them went, the same day, to a town which was sixty furlongs from Jerusalem, named Emmaus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they talked together of all these things which had happened.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass that while they talked and reasoned with themselves, Jesus himself also, drawing near, went with them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But their eyes were held, that they should not know him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: What are these discourses that you hold one with another as you walk and are sad?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the one of them, whose name was Cleophas, answering, said to him: Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem, and hast not known the things that have been done there in these days?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: To whom he said: What things? And they said: Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, who was a prophet, mighty in work and word before God and all the people.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And how our chief priests and princes delivered him to be condemned to death and crucified him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But we hoped that it was he that should have redeemed Israel. And now besides all this, to-day is the third day since these things were done.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Yea and certain women also of our company affrighted us who, before it was light, were at the sepulchre,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And not finding his body, came, saying that they had also seen a vision of angels, who say that he is alive.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And some of our people went to the sepulchre and found it so as the women had said: but him they found not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
