Text: Then he said to them: O foolish and slow of heart to believe in all things, Which the prophets have spoken.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things and so, to enter into his glory?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded to them in all the scriptures the things that were concerning him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they drew nigh to the town whither they were going: and he made as though he would go farther.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they constrained him, saying: Stay with us, because it is towards evening and the day is now far spent. And he went in with them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, whilst he was at table with them, he took bread and blessed and brake and gave to them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And their eyes were opened: and they knew him. And he vanished out of their sight.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they said one to the other: Was not our heart burning within us, whilst he spoke in the way and opened to us the scriptures?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And rising up, the same hour, they went back to Jerusalem: and they found the eleven gathered together, and those that were with them,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Saying: The Lord is risen indeed and hath appeared to Simon.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they told what things were done in the way: and how they knew him in the breaking of bread.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now, whilst they were speaking these things, Jesus stood in the midst of them and saith to them: Peace be to you. It is I: Fear not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they being troubled and frightened, supposed that they saw a spirit.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: Why are you troubled, and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: See my hands and feet, that it is I myself. Handle, and see: for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as you see me to have.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he had said this, he shewed them his hands and feet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But while they yet believed not and wondered for joy, he said: Have you here any thing to eat?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they offered him a piece of a broiled fish and a honeycomb.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he had eaten before them, taking the remains, he gave to them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: These are the words which I spoke to you while I was yet with you, that all things must needs be fulfilled which are written in the law of Moses and in the prophets and in the psalms, concerning me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then he opened their understanding, that they might understand the scriptures.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: Thus it is written, and thus it behoved Christ to suffer and to rise again from the dead, the third day:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And that penance and remission of sins should be preached in his name, unto all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And you are witnesses of these things.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I send the promise of my Father upon you: but stay you in the city till you be endued with power from on high. The promise of my Father.... that is, the Holy Ghost, whom Christ had promised that his Father and he would send, John 14. 26, and 17. 7.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he led them out as far as Bethania: and lifting up his hands, he blessed them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it came to pass, whilst he blessed them, he departed from them and was carried up to heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they adoring went back into Jerusalem with great joy.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they were always in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen. THE HOLY GOSPEL OF JESUS CHRIST ACCORDING TO ST. JOHN St. John the Apostle and Evangelist was the son of Zebedee and Salome, brother to James the Greater. He was called the Beloved disciple of Christ and stood by at his Crucifixion. He wrote the Gospel after the other Evangelists, about sixty-three years after our Lord’s Ascension. Many things that they had omitted were supplied by him. The original was written in Greek; and by the Greeks he is titled: The Divine. St. Jerome relates that, when he was earnestly requested by the brethren to write the Gospel, he answered he would do it, if by ordering a common fast, they would all put up their prayers together to the Almighty God; which being ended replenished with the clearest and fullest revelation coming from Heaven, he burst forth into that preface: IN THE BEGINNING WAS THE WORD. John Chapter 1 The divinity and incarnation of Christ. John bears witness of him. He begins to call his disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In the beginning was the Word: and the Word was with God: and the Word was God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The same was in the beginning with God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: All things were made by him: and without him was made nothing that was made.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In him was life: and the life was the light of men.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the light shineth in darkness: and the darkness did not comprehend it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This man came for a witness, to give testimony of the light, that all men might believe through him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He was not the light, but was to give testimony of the light.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That was the true light, which enlighteneth every man that cometh into this world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He was in the world: and the world was made by him: and the world knew him not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He came unto his own: and his own received him not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But as many as received him, he gave them power to be made the sons of God, to them that believe in his name.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who are born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Word was made flesh and dwelt among us (and we saw his glory, the glory as it were of the only begotten of the Father), full of grace and truth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: John beareth witness of him and crieth out, saying: This was he of whom I spoke: He that shall come after me is preferred before me: because he was before me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And of his fulness we all have received: and grace for grace.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For the law was given by Moses: grace and truth came by Jesus Christ.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: No man hath seen God at any time: the only begotten Son who is in the Bosom of the Father, he hath declared him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent from Jerusalem priests and Levites to him, to ask him: Who art thou?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he confessed and did not deny: and he confessed: I am not the Christ.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they asked him: What then? Art thou Elias? And he said: I am not. Art thou the prophet? And he answered: No.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They said therefore unto him: Who art thou, that we may give an answer to them that sent us? What sayest thou of thyself?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He said: I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, make straight the way of the Lord, as said the prophet Isaias.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they that were sent were of the Pharisees.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they asked him and said to him: Why then dost thou baptize, if thou be not Christ, nor Elias, nor the prophet?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: John answered them, saying: I baptize with water: but there hath stood one in the midst of you, whom you know not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The same is he that shall come after me, who is preferred before me: the latchet of whose shoe I am not worthy to loose.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things were done in Bethania, beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The next day, John saw Jesus coming to him; and he saith: Behold the Lamb of God. Behold him who taketh away the sin of the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This is he of whom I said: After me there cometh a man, who is preferred before me: because he was before me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I knew him not: but that he may be made manifest in Israel, therefore am I come baptizing with water.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And John gave testimony, saying: I saw the Spirit coming down, as a dove from heaven; and he remained upon him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I knew him not: but he who sent me to baptize with water said to me: He upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending and remaining upon him, he it is that baptizeth with the Holy Ghost.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I saw: and I gave testimony that this is the Son of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The next day again John stood and two of his disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And beholding Jesus walking, he saith: Behold the Lamb of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the two disciples heard him speak: and they followed Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus turning and seeing them following him, saith to them: What seek you? Who said to him: Rabbi (which is to say, being interpreted, Master), where dwellest thou?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He saith to them: Come and see. They came and saw where he abode: and they stayed with him that day. Now it was about the tenth hour.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the two who had heard of John and followed him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He findeth first his brother Simon and saith to him: We have found the Messias, which is, being interpreted, the Christ.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he brought him to Jesus. And Jesus looking upon him, said: Thou art Simon the son of Jona. Thou shalt be called Cephas, which is interpreted Peter.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: On the following day, he would go forth into Galilee: and he findeth Philip, And Jesus saith to him: follow me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Philip findeth Nathanael and saith to him: We have found him of whom Moses, in the law and the prophets did write, Jesus the son of Joseph of Nazareth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Nathanael said to him: Can any thing of good come from Nazareth? Philip saith to him: Come and see.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him and he saith of him: Behold an Israelite indeed, in whom there is no guile.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Nathanael saith to him: Whence knowest thou me? Jesus answered and said to him: Before that Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Nathanael answered him and said: Rabbi: Thou art the Son of God. Thou art the King of Israel.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered and said to him: Because I said unto thee, I saw thee under the fig tree, thou believest: greater things than these shalt thou see.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he saith to him: Amen, amen, I say to you, you shall see the heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man. John Chapter 2 Christ changes water into wine. He casts the sellers out of the temple.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the third day, there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee: and the mother of Jesus was there.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus also was invited, and his disciples, to the marriage.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the wine failing, the mother of Jesus saith to him: They have no wine.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus saith to her: Woman, what is that to me and to thee? My hour is not yet come. What is that to me, etc.... These words of our Saviour, spoken to his mother, have been understood by some commentators as harsh, they not considering the next following verse: Whatsoever he shall say to you, do ye, which plainly shows that his mother knew of the miracle that he was to perform, and that it was at her request he wrought it; besides the manner of speaking the words as to the tone, and the countenance shown at the same time, which could only be known to those who were present, or from what had followed: for words indicating anger in one tone of voice, would be understood quite the reverse in another.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: His mother saith to the waiters: Whatsoever he shall say to you, do ye.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now there were set there six waterpots of stone, according to the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three measures apiece.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith to them: Fill the waterpots with water. And they filled them up to the brim.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus saith to them: Draw out now and carry to the chief steward of the feast. And they carried it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when the chief steward had tasted the water made wine and knew not whence it was, but the waiters knew who had drawn the water: the chief steward calleth the bridegroom,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And saith to him: Every man at first setteth forth good wine, and when men have well drunk, then that which is worse. But thou hast kept the good wine until now.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee and manifested his glory. And his disciples believed in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: After this, he went down to Capharnaum, he and his mother and his brethren and his disciples: and they remained there not many days.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the pasch of the Jews was at hand: and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he found in the temple them that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he had made, as it were, a scourge of little cords, he drove them all out of the temple, the sheep also and the oxen: and the money of the changers he poured out, and the tables he overthrew.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And to them that sold doves he said: Take these things hence, and make not the house of my Father a house of traffic.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And his disciples remembered, that it was written: The zeal of thy house hath eaten me up.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews, therefore, answered, and said to him: What sign dost thou shew unto us, seeing thou dost these things?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered and said to them: Destroy this temple; and in three days I will raise it up.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews then said: Six and forty years was this temple in building; and wilt thou raise it up in three days?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he spoke of the temple of his body.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When therefore he was risen again from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this: and they believed the scripture and the word that Jesus had said.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now when he was at Jerusalem, at the pasch, upon the festival day, many believed in his name, seeing his signs which he did.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Jesus did not trust himself unto them: for that he knew all men,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And because he needed not that any should give testimony of man: for he knew what was in man. John Chapter 3 Christ’s discourse with Nicodemus. John’s testimony.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This man came to Jesus by night and said to him: Rabbi, we know that thou art come a teacher from God; for no man can do these signs which thou dost, unless God be with him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered and said to him: Amen, amen, I say to thee, unless a man be born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Nicodemus saith to him: How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born again?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered: Amen, amen, I say to thee, unless a man be born again of water and the Holy Ghost, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God. Unless a man be born again, etc.... By these words our Saviour hath declared the necessity of baptism; and by the word water it is evident that the application of it is necessary with the words. Matt. 28. 19.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh: and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Wonder not that I said to thee: You must be born again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Spirit breatheth where he will and thou hearest his voice: but thou knowest not whence he cometh and whither he goeth. So is every one that is born of the Spirit.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Nicodemus answered and said to him: How can these things be done?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered and said to him: Art thou a master in Israel, and knowest not these things?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Amen, amen, I say to thee that we speak what we know and we testify what we have seen: and you receive not our testimony.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If I have spoken to you earthly things, and you believe not: how will you believe, if I shall speak to you heavenly things?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And no man hath ascended into heaven, but he that descended from heaven, the Son of man who is in heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the desert, so must the Son of man be lifted up:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That whosoever believeth in him may not perish, but may have life everlasting.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For God so loved the world, as to give his only begotten Son: that whosoever believeth in him may not perish, but may have life everlasting.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For God sent not his Son into the world, to judge the world: but that the world may be saved by him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that believeth in him is not judged. But he that doth not believe is already judged: because he believeth not in the name of the only begotten Son of God. Is not judged.... He that believeth, viz., by a faith working through charity, is not judged, that is, is not condemned; but the obstinate unbeliever is judged, that is, condemned already, by retrenching himself from the society of Christ and his church.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And this is the judgment: Because the light is come into the world and men loved darkness rather than the light: for their works were evil. The judgment.... That is, the cause of his comdemnation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For every one that doth evil hateth the light and cometh not to the light, that his works may not be reproved.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he that doth truth cometh to the light, that his works may be made manifest: because they are done in God. He that doth truth.... that is, he that acteth according to truth, which here signifies the Law of God. Thy law is truth. Psa. 118. 142.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: After these things, Jesus and his disciples came into the land of Judea: and there he abode with them and baptized.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And John also was baptizing in Ennon near Salim: because there was much water there. And they came and were baptized.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For John was not yet cast into prison.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there arose a question between some of John’s disciples and the Jews, concerning purification.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they came to John and said to him: Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond the Jordan, to whom thou gavest testimony: behold, he baptizeth and all men come to him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: John answered and said: A man cannot receive any thing, unless it be given him from heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: You yourselves do bear me witness that I said, I am not Christ, but that I am sent before him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the bridegroom, who standeth and heareth Him, rejoiceth with joy because of the bridegroom’s voice. This my joy therefore is fulfilled.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He must increase: but I must decrease.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that cometh from above is above all. He that is of the earth, of the earth he is, and of the earth he speaketh. He that cometh from heaven is above all.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth: and no man receiveth his testimony.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for God doth not give the Spirit by measure.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Father loveth the Son: and he hath given all things into his hand.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that believeth in the Son hath life everlasting: but he that believeth not the Son shall not see life: but the wrath of God abideth on him. John Chapter 4 Christ talks with the Samaritan woman. He heals the ruler’s son.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When Jesus therefore understood that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus maketh more disciples and baptizeth more than John,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: (Though Jesus himself did not baptize, but his disciples),

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He left Judea and went again into Galilee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he was of necessity to pass through Samaria.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He cometh therefore to a city of Samaria, which is called Sichar, near the land which Jacob gave to his son Joseph.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with his journey, sat thus on the well. It was about the sixth hour.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: There cometh a woman of Samaria, to draw water. Jesus saith to her: Give me to drink.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For his disciples were gone into the city to buy meats.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then that Samaritan woman saith to him: How dost thou, being a Jew; ask of me to drink, who am a Samaritan woman? For the Jews do not communicate with the Samaritans.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered and said to her: If thou didst know the gift of God and who he is that saith to thee: Give me to drink; thou perhaps wouldst have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The woman saith to him: Sir, thou hast nothing wherein to draw, and the well is deep. From whence then hast thou living water?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well and drank thereof, himself and his children and his cattle?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered and said to her: Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again: but he that shall drink of the water that I will give him shall not thirst for ever.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But the water that I will give him shall become in him a fountain of water, springing up into life everlasting.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The woman said to him: Sir, give me this water, that I may not thirst, nor come hither to draw.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith to her: Go, call thy husband, and come hither.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The woman answered and said: I have no husband. Jesus said to her: Thou hast said well: I have no husband.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For thou hast had five husbands: and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband. This, thou hast said truly.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The woman saith to him: Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Our fathers adored on this mountain: and you say that at Jerusalem is the place where men must adore. This mountain.... Garizim, where the Samaritans had their schismatical temple.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith to her: Woman, believe me that the hour cometh, when you shall neither on this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, adore the Father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: You adore that which you know not: we adore that which we know. For salvation is of the Jews.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But the hour cometh and now is, when the true adorers shall adore the Father in spirit and in truth. For the Father also seeketh such to adore him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: God is a spirit: and they that adore him must adore him in spirit and in truth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The woman saith to him: I know that the Messias cometh (who is called Christ): therefore, when he is come, he will tell us all things.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith to her: I am he, who am speaking with thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And immediately his disciples came. And they wondered that he talked with the woman. Yet no man said: What seekest thou? Or: Why talkest thou with her?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The woman therefore left her waterpot and went her way into the city and saith to the men there:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Come, and see a man who has told me all things whatsoever I have done. Is not he the Christ?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They went therefore out of the city and came unto him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In the mean time, the disciples prayed him, saying: Rabbi, eat.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he said to them: I have meat to eat which you know not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The disciples therefore said one to another: Hath any man brought him to eat?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith to them: My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, that I may perfect his work.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Do not you say: There are yet four months, and then the harvest cometh? Behold, I say to you, lift up your eyes, and see the countries. For they are white already to harvest.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he that reapeth receiveth wages and gathereth fruit unto life everlasting: that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For in this is the saying true: That it is one man that soweth, and it is another that reapeth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I have sent you to reap that in which you did not labour. Others have laboured: and you have entered into their labours.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now of that city many of the Samaritans believed in him, for the word of the woman giving testimony: He told me all things whatsoever I have done.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: So when the Samaritans were come to him, they desired that he would tarry there. And he abode there two days.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And many more believed in him, because of his own word.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they said to the woman: We now believe, not for thy saying: for we ourselves have heard him and know that this is indeed the Saviour of the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now after two days, he departed thence and went into Galilee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For Jesus himself gave testimony that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he was come into Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all the things he had done at Jerusalem on the festival day: for they also went to the festival day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He came again therefore into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain ruler, whose son was sick at Capharnaum.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He having heard that Jesus was come from Judea into Galilee, went to him and prayed him to come down and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore said to him: Unless you see signs and wonders, you believe not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The ruler saith to him: Lord, come down before that my son die.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith to him: Go thy way. Thy son liveth. The man believed the word which Jesus said to him and went his way.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And as he was going down, his servants met him: and they brought word, saying, that his son lived.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He asked therefore of them the hour wherein he grew better. And they said to him: Yesterday at the seventh hour, the fever left him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The father therefore knew that it was at the same hour that Jesus said to him: Thy son liveth. And himself believed, and his whole house.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This is again the second miracle that Jesus did, when he was come out of Judea into Galilee. John Chapter 5 Christ heals on the sabbath the man languishing thirty-eight years. His discourse upon this occasion.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: After these things was a festival day of the Jews: and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now there is at Jerusalem a pond, called Probatica, which in Hebrew is named Bethsaida, having five porches. Probatica.... That is, the sheep pond; either so called, because the sheep were washed therein, that were to be offered up in sacrifice in the temple, or because it was near the sheep gate. That this was a pond where miracles were wrought is evident from the sacred text; and also that the water had no natural virtue to heal, as one only of those put in after the motion of the water was restored to health; for if the water had the healing quality, the others would have the like benefit, being put into it about the same time.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In these lay a great multitude of sick, of blind, of lame, of withered: waiting for the moving of the water.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And an angel of the Lord descended at certain times into the pond and the water was moved. And he that went down first into the pond after the motion of the water was made whole of whatsoever infirmity he lay under.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there was a certain man there that had been eight and thirty years under his infirmity.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Him when Jesus had seen lying, and knew that he had been now a long time, he saith to him: Wilt thou be made whole?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The infirm man answered him: Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pond. For whilst I am coming, another goeth down before me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith to him: Arise, take up thy bed and walk.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And immediately the man was made whole: and he took up his bed and walked. And it was the sabbath that day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews therefore said to him that was healed: It is the sabbath. It is not lawful for thee to take up thy bed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He answered them: He that made me whole, he said to me: Take up thy bed and walk.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They asked him therefore: Who is that man who said to thee: Take up thy bed and walk?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he who was healed knew not who it was: for Jesus went aside from the multitude standing in the place.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Afterwards, Jesus findeth him in the temple and saith to him: Behold thou art made whole: sin no more, lest some worse thing happen to thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The man went his way and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him whole.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus, because he did these things on the sabbath.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Jesus answered them: My Father worketh until now; and I work.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Hereupon therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he did not only break the sabbath but also said God was his Father, making himself equal to God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then Jesus answered and said to them: Amen, amen, I say unto you, the Son cannot do any thing of himself, but what he seeth the Father doing: for what things soever he doth, these the Son also doth in like manner.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For the Father loveth the Son and sheweth him all things which himself doth: and greater works than these will he shew him, that you may wonder.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For as the Father raiseth up the dead and giveth life: so the Son also giveth life to whom he will.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For neither does the Father judge any man: but hath given all judgment to the Son.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That all men may honour the Son, as they honour the Father. He who honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father who hath sent him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Amen, amen, I say unto you that he who heareth my word and believeth him that sent me hath life everlasting: and cometh not into judgment, but is passed from death to life.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Amen, amen, I say unto you, that the hour cometh, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God: and they that hear shall live.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For as the Father hath life in himself, so he hath given to the Son also to have life in himself.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he hath given him power to do judgment, because he is the Son of man.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Wonder not at this: for the hour cometh wherein all that are in the graves shall hear the voice of the Son of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they that have done good things shall come forth unto the resurrection of life: but they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of judgment. Unto the resurrection of judgment.... That is, condemnation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I cannot of myself do any thing. As I hear, so I judge. And my judgment is just: because I seek not my own will, but the will of him that sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: There is another that beareth witness of me: and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: You sent to John: and he gave testimony to the truth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I receive not testimony from man: but I say these things, that you may be saved.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He was a burning and a shining light: and you were willing for a time to rejoice in his light.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I have a greater testimony than that of John: for the works which the Father hath given me to perfect, the works themselves which I do, give testimony of me, that the Father hath sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Father himself who hath sent me hath given testimony of me: neither have you heard his voice at any time, nor seen his shape.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And you have not his word abiding in you: for whom he hath sent, him you believe not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Search the scriptures: for you think in them to have life everlasting. And the same are they that give testimony of me. Or.... You search the scriptures. Scrutamini.... It is not a command for all to read the scriptures; but a reproach to the Pharisees, that reading the scriptures as they did, and thinking to find everlasting life in them, they would not receive him to whom all those scriptures gave testimony, and through whom alone they could have that true life.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And you will not come to me that you may have life.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I receive not glory from men.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I know you, that you have not the love of God in you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I am come in the name of my Father, and you receive me not: if another shall come in his own name, him you will receive.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: How can you believe, who receive glory one from another: and the glory which is from God alone, you do not seek?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Think not that I will accuse you to the Father. There is one that accuseth you, Moses, in whom you trust.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For if you did believe Moses, you would perhaps believe me also: for he wrote of me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe my words? John Chapter 6 Christ feeds five thousand with five loaves. He walks upon the sea and discourses of the bread of life.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which is that of Tiberias.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And a great multitude followed him, because they saw the miracles which he did on them that were diseased.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore went up into a mountain: and there he sat with his disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now the pasch, the festival day of the Jews, was near at hand.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When Jesus therefore had lifted up his eyes and seen that a very great multitude cometh to him, he said to Philip: Whence shall we buy bread, that these may eat?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And this he said to try him: for he himself knew what he would do.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Philip answered him: Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them that every one may take a little.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: One of his disciples, Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, saith to him:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: There is a boy here that hath five barley loaves and two fishes. But what are these among so many?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then Jesus said: Make the men sit down. Now, there was much grass in the place. The men therefore sat down, in number about five thousand.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus took the loaves: and when he had given thanks, he distributed to them that were set down. In like manner also of the fishes, as much as they would.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when they were filled, he said to his disciples: gather up the fragments that remain, lest they be lost.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They gathered up therefore and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves which remained over and above to them that had eaten.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now those men, when they had seen what a miracle Jesus had done, said: This is of a truth the prophet that is to come into the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore, when he knew that they would come to take him by force and make him king, fled again into the mountain himself alone.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when evening was come, his disciples went down to the sea.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when they had gone up into a ship, they went over the sea to Capharnaum. And it was now dark: and Jesus was not come unto them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the sea arose, by reason of a great wind that blew.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When they had rowed therefore about five and twenty or thirty furlongs, they see Jesus walking upon the sea and drawing nigh to the ship. And they were afraid.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he saith to them: It is I. Be not afraid.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They were willing therefore to take him into the ship. And presently the ship was at the land to which they were going.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The next day, the multitude that stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other ship there but one: and that Jesus had not entered into the ship with his disciples, but that his disciples were gone away alone.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But other ships came in from Tiberias, nigh unto the place where they had eaten the bread, the Lord giving thanks.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When therefore the multitude saw that Jesus was not there, nor his disciples, they took shipping and came to Capharnaum, seeking for Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they said to him: Rabbi, when camest thou hither?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered them and said: Amen, amen, I say to you, you seek me, not because you have seen miracles, but because you did eat of the loaves and were filled.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Labour not for the meat which perisheth, but for that which endureth unto life everlasting, which the Son of man will give you. For him hath God, the Father, sealed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They said therefore unto him: What shall we do, that we may work the works of God?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered and said to them: This is the work of God, that you believe in him whom he hath sent.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They said therefore to him: What sign therefore dost thou shew that we may see and may believe thee? What dost thou work?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Our fathers did eat manna in the desert, as it is written: He gave them bread from heaven to eat.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then Jesus said to them: Amen, amen, I say to you; Moses gave you not bread from heaven, but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For the bread of God is that which cometh down from heaven and giveth life to the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They said therefore unto him: Lord, give us always this bread.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said to them: I am the bread of life. He that cometh to me shall not hunger: and he that believeth in me shall never thirst.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I said unto you that you also have seen me, and you believe not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: All that the Father giveth to me shall come to me: and him that cometh to me, I will not cast out.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Because I came down from heaven, not to do my own will but the will of him that sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now this is the will of the Father who sent me: that of all that he hath given me, I should lose nothing; but should raise it up again in the last day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And this is the will of my Father that sent me: that every one who seeth the Son and believeth in him may have life everlasting. And I will raise him up in the last day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews therefore murmured at him, because he had said: I am the living bread which came down from heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they said: Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How then saith he: I came down from heaven?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore answered and said to them: Murmur not among yourselves.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: No man can come to me, except the Father, who hath sent me, draw him. And I will raise him up in the last day. Draw him.... Not by compulsion, nor by laying the free will under any necessity, but by the strong and sweet motions of his heavenly grace.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: It is written in the prophets: And they shall all be taught of God. Every one that hath heard of the Father and hath learned cometh to me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Not that any man hath seen the Father: but he who is of God, he hath seen the Father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Amen, amen, I say unto you: He that believeth in me hath everlasting life.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I am the bread of life.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Your fathers did eat manna in the desert: and are dead.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This is the bread which cometh down from heaven: that if any man eat of it, he may not die.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I am the living bread which came down from heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If any man eat of this bread, he shall live for ever: and the bread that I will give is my flesh, for the life of the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews therefore strove among themselves, saying: How can this man give us his flesh to eat?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then Jesus said to them: Amen, amen, I say unto you: except you eat the flesh of the Son of man and drink his blood, you shall not have life in you. Except you eat—and drink, etc.... To receive the body and blood of Christ, is a divine precept, insinuated in this text; which the faithful fulfil, though they receive but in one kind; because in one kind they receive both body and blood, which cannot be separated from each other. Hence, life eternal is here promised to the worthy receiving, though but in one kind. Ver. 52. If any man eat of this bread, he shall live for ever; and the bread that I will give, is my flesh for the life of the world. Ver. 58. He that eateth me, the same also shall live by me. Ver. 59. He that eateth this bread, shall liver for ever.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that eateth my flesh and drinketh my blood hath everlasting life: and I will raise him up in the last day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For my flesh is meat indeed: and my blood is drink indeed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that eateth my flesh and drinketh my blood abideth in me: and I in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As the living Father hath sent me and I live by the Father: so he that eateth me, the same also shall live by me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This is the bread that came down from heaven. Not as your fathers did eat manna and are dead. He that eateth this bread shall live for ever.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things he said, teaching in the synagogue, in Capharnaum.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Many therefore of his disciples, hearing it, said: This saying is hard; and who can hear it?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Jesus, knowing in himself that his disciples murmured at this, said to them: Doth this scandalize you?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If then you shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before? If then you shall see, etc.... Christ by mentioning his ascension, by this instance of his power and divinity, would confirm the truth of what he had before asserted; and at the same time correct their gross apprehension of eating his flesh, and drinking his blood, in a vulgar and carnal manner, by letting them know he should take his whole body living with him to heaven; and consequently not suffer it to be as they supposed, divided, mangled, and consumed upon earth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: It is the spirit that quickeneth: the flesh profiteth nothing. The words that I have spoken to you are spirit and life. The flesh profiteth nothing.... Dead flesh separated from the spirit, in the gross manner they supposed they were to eat his flesh, would profit nothing. Neither doth man’s flesh, that is to say, man’s natural and carnal apprehension, (which refuses to be subject to the spirit, and words of Christ,) profit any thing. But it would be the height of blasphemy, to say the living flesh of Christ (which we receive in the blessed sacarament, with his spirit, that is, with his soul and divinity) profiteth nothing. For if Christ’s flesh had profitedus nothing, he would never have taken flesh for us, nor died in us nothing, he would never have taken flesh for us, nor died in the flesh for us. Are spirit and life.... By proposing to you a heavenly sacrament, in which you shall receive, in a wonderful manner, spirit, grace, and life, in its very fountain.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But there are some of you that believe not. For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that did not believe and who he was that would betray him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said: Therefore did I say to you that no man can come to me, unless it be given him by my Father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: After this, many of his disciples went back and walked no more with him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then Jesus said to the twelve: Will you also go away?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Simon Peter answered him: Lord, to whom shall we go? Thou hast the words of eternal life.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And we have believed and have known that thou art the Christ, the Son of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered them: Have not I chosen you twelve? And one of you is a devil.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now he meant Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon: for this same was about to betray him, whereas he was one of the twelve. John Chapter 7 Christ goes up to the feast of the tabernacles. He teaches in the temple.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: After these things, Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now the Jews feast of tabernacles was at hand.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And his brethren said to, him: Pass from hence and go into Judea, that thy disciples also may see thy works which thou dost.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For there is no man that doth any thing in secret, and he himself seeketh to be known openly. If thou do these things, manifest thyself to the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For neither did his brethren believe in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then Jesus said to them: My time is not yet come; but your time is always ready.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The world cannot hate you: but me it hateth, because I give testimony of it, that the works thereof are evil,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Go you up to this festival day: but I go not up to this festival day, because my time is not accomplished.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When he had said these things, he himself stayed in Galilee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But after his brethren were gone up, then he also went up to the feast, not openly, but, as it were, in secret.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews therefore sought him on the festival day and said: Where is he?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And there was much murmuring among the multitude concerning him. For some said: He is a good man. And others said: No, but he seduceth the people.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Yet no man spoke openly of him, for fear of the Jews.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now, about the midst of the feast, Jesus went up into the temple and taught.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the Jews wondered, saying: How doth this man know letters, having never learned?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered them and said: My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If any man will do the will of him, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God, or whether I speak of myself.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory: but he that seeketh the glory of him that sent him, he is true and there is no injustice in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Did not Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keepeth the law?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Why seek you to kill me? The multitude answered and said: Thou hast a devil. Who seeketh to kill thee?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered and said to them: One work I have done: and you all wonder.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Therefore, Moses gave you circumcision (not because it is of Moses, but of the fathers): and on the sabbath day you circumcise a man.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If a man receive circumcision on the sabbath day, that the law of Moses may not be broken: are you angry at me, because I have healed the whole man on the sabbath day?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Judge not according to the appearance: but judge just judgment.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Some therefore of Jerusalem said: Is not this he whom they seek to kill?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And behold, he speaketh openly: and they say nothing to him. Have the rulers known for a truth that this is the Christ?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But we know this man, whence he is: but when the Christ cometh, no man knoweth, whence he is.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore cried out in the temple, teaching and saying: You both know me, and you know whence I am. And I am not come of myself: but he that sent me is true, whom you know not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I know him, because I am from him: and he hath sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They sought therefore to apprehend him: and no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But of the people many believed in him and said: When the Christ cometh, shall he do more miracles than this man doth?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Pharisees heard the people murmuring these things concerning him: and the rulers and Pharisees sent ministers to apprehend him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore said to them: Yet a little while I am with you: and then I go to him that sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: You shall seek me and shall not find me: and where I am, thither you cannot come.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews therefore said among themselves: Whither will he go, that we shall not find him? Will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles and teach the Gentiles?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: What is this saying that he hath said: You shall seek me and shall not find me? And: Where I am, you cannot come?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And on the last, and great day of the festivity, Jesus stood and cried, saying: If any man thirst, let him come to me and drink.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that believeth in me, as the scripture saith: Out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now this he said of the Spirit which they should receive who believed in him: for as yet the Spirit was not given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Of that multitude therefore, when they had heard these words of his, some said: This is the prophet indeed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Others said: This is the Christ. But some said: Doth the Christ come out of Galilee?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Doth not the scripture say: That Christ cometh of the seed of David and from Bethlehem the town where David was?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: So there arose a dissension among the people because of him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And some of them would have apprehended him: but no man laid hands upon him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The ministers therefore came to the chief priests and the Pharisees. And they said to them: Why have you not brought him?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The ministers answered: Never did man speak like this man.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Pharisees therefore answered them: Are you also seduced?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Hath any one of the rulers believed in him, or of the Pharisees?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But this multitude, that knoweth not the law, are accursed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Nicodemus said to them (he that came to him by night, who was one of them):

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Doth our law judge any man, unless it first hear him and know what he doth?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They answered and said to him: Art thou also a Galilean? Search the scriptures, and see that out of Galilee a prophet riseth not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And every man returned to his own house. John Chapter 8 The woman taken in adultery. Christ justifies his doctrine.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus went unto mount Olivet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And early in the morning he came again into the temple: and all the people came to him. And sitting down he taught them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the scribes and Pharisees bring unto him a woman taken in adultery: and they set her in the midst,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And said to him: Master, this woman was even now taken in adultery.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now Moses in the law commanded us to stone such a one. But what sayest thou?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And this they said tempting him, that they might accuse him. But Jesus bowing himself down, wrote with his finger on the ground.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When therefore they continued asking him, he lifted up himself and said to them: He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And again stooping down, he wrote on the ground.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they hearing this, went out one by one, beginning at the eldest. And Jesus alone remained, and the woman standing in the midst.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then Jesus lifting up himself, said to her: Woman, where are they that accused thee? Hath no man condemned thee?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Who said: No man, Lord. And Jesus said: Neither will I condemn thee. Go, and now sin no more.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Again therefore, Jesus spoke to: them, saying: I am the light of the world. He that followeth me walketh not in darkness, but shall have the light of life.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Pharisees therefore said to him: Thou givest testimony of thyself. Thy testimony is not true.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered and said to them: Although I give testimony of myself, my testimony is true: for I know whence I came, and whither I go: but you know not whence I come, or whither I go.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: You judge according to the flesh: I judge not any man.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if I do judge, my judgment is true: because I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And in your law it is written that the testimony of two men is true.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I am one that give testimony of myself: and the Father that sent me giveth testimony of me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They said therefore to him: Where is thy Father? Jesus answered: Neither me do you know, nor my Father. If you did know me, perhaps you would know my Father also.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These words Jesus spoke in the treasury, teaching in the temple: and no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Again therefore Jesus said to them: I go: and you shall seek me. And you shall die in your sin. Whither I go, you cannot come.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews therefore said: Will he kill himself, because he said: Whither I go you cannot come?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said to them: You are from beneath: I am from above. You are of this world: I am not of this world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Therefore I said to you that you shall die in your sins. For if you believe not that I am he, you shall die in your sin.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They said therefore to him: Who art thou? Jesus said to them: The beginning, who also speak unto you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Many things I have to speak and to judge of you. But he that sent me, is true: and the things I have heard of him, these same I speak in the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they understood not that he called God his Father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore said to them: When you shall have lifted up, the Son of man, then shall you know that I am he and that I do nothing of myself. But as the Father hath taught me, these things I speak.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he that sent me is with me: and he hath not left me alone. For I do always the things that please him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When he spoke these things, many believed in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then Jesus said to those Jews who believed him: If you continue in my word, you shall be my disciples indeed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And you shall know the truth: and the truth shall make you free.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They answered him: We are the seed of Abraham: and we have never been slaves to any man. How sayest thou: You shall be free?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered them: Amen, amen, I say unto you that whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now the servant abideth not in the house for ever: but the son abideth for ever.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If therefore the son shall make you free, you shall be free indeed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I know that you are the children of Abraham: but you seek to kill me, because my word hath no place in you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I speak that which I have seen with my Father: and you do the things that you have seen with your father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They answered and said to him: Abraham is our father. Jesus saith to them: If you be the children of Abraham, do the works of Abraham.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But now you seek to kill me, a man who have spoken the truth to you, which I have heard of God. This Abraham did not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: You do the works of your father. They said therefore to him: We are not born of fornication: we have one Father, even God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore said to them: If God were your Father, you would indeed love me. For from God I proceeded and came. For I came not of myself: but he sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Why do you not know my speech? Because you cannot hear my word.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: You are of your father the devil: and the desires of your father you will do. He was a murderer from the beginning: and he stood not in the truth, because truth is not in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own: for he is a liar, and the father thereof.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But if I say the truth, you believe me not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Which of you shall convince me of sin? If I say the truth to you, why do you not believe me:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that is of God heareth the words of God. Therefore you hear them not, because you are not of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews therefore answered and said to him: Do not we say well that thou art a Samaritan and hast a devil?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered: I have not a devil: but I honour my Father. And you have dishonoured me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I seek not my own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Amen, amen, I say to you: If any man keep my word, he shall not see death for ever.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews therefore said: Now we know that thou hast a devil. Abraham is dead, and the prophets: and thou sayest: If any man keep my word, he shall not taste death for ever.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Art thou greater than our father Abraham who is dead? And the prophets are dead. Whom dost thou make thyself?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered: If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing. It is my Father that glorifieth me, of whom you say that he is your God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And you have not known him: but I know him. And if I shall say that I know him not, I shall be like to you, a liar. But I do know him and do keep his word.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Abraham your father rejoiced that he might see my day: he saw it and was glad.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews therefore said to him: Thou art not yet fifty years old. And hast thou seen Abraham?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus said to them: Amen, amen, I say to you, before Abraham was made, I AM.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They took up stones therefore to cast at him. But Jesus hid himself and went out of the temple. John Chapter 9 He gives sight to the man born blind.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus passing by, saw a man who was blind from his birth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And his disciples asked him: Rabbi, who hath sinned, this man or his parents, that he should be born blind?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered: Neither hath this man sinned, nor his parents; but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
