Text: I must work the works of him that sent me, whilst it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When he had said these things, he spat on the ground and made clay of the spittle and spread the clay upon his eyes,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And said to him: Go, wash in the pool of Siloe, which is interpreted, Sent. He went therefore and washed: and he came seeing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The neighbours, therefore, and they who had seen him before that he was a beggar, said: Is not this he that sat and begged? Some said: This is he.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But others said: No, but he is like him. But he said: I am he.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They said therefore to him: How were thy eyes opened?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He answered: That man that is called Jesus made clay and anointed my eyes and said to me: Go to the pool of Siloe and wash. And I went: I washed: and I see.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they said to him: Where is he? He saith: I know not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They bring him that had been blind to the Pharisees.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now it was the sabbath, when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Again therefore the Pharisees asked him how he had received his sight. But he said to them: He put clay upon my eyes: and I washed: and I see.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Some therefore of the Pharisees said: This man is not of God, who keepeth not the sabbath. But others said: How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles? And there was a division among them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They say therefore to the blind man again: What sayest thou of him that hath opened thy eyes? And he said: He is a prophet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews then did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind and had received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And asked them, saying: Is this your son, who you say was born blind? How then doth he now see?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: His parents answered them and said: We know that this is our son and that he was born blind:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But how he now seeth, we know not: or who hath opened his eyes, we know not. Ask himself: he is of age: Let him speak for himself.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things his parents said, because they feared the Jews: for the Jews had already agreed among themselves that if any man should confess him to be Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Therefore did his parents say: He is of age. Ask himself.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They therefore called the man again that had been blind and said to him: Give glory to God. We know that this man is a sinner.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He said therefore to them: If he be a sinner, I know not. One thing I know, that whereas I was blind. now I see.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They said then to him: What did he to thee? How did he open thy eyes?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He answered them: I have told you already, and you have heard. Why would you hear it again? Will you also become his disciples?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They reviled him therefore and said: Be thou his disciple; but we are the disciples of Moses.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: We know that God spoke to Moses: but as to this man, we know not from whence he is.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The man answered and said to them: why, herein is a wonderful thing, that you know not from whence he is, and he hath opened my eyes.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now we know that God doth not hear sinners: but if a man be a server of God and doth his, will, him he heareth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: From the beginning of the world it hath not been heard, that any man hath opened the eyes of one born blind.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Unless this man were of God, he could not do anything.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They answered and said to him: Thou wast wholly born in sins; and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus heard that they had cast him out. And when he had found him, he said to him: Dost thou believe in the Son of God?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He answered, and said: Who is he, Lord, that I may believe in him?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said to him: Thou hast both seen him; and it is he that talketh with thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he said: I believe, Lord. And falling down, he adored him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus said: For judgment I am come into this world: that they who see not may see; and they who see may become blind. I am come, etc.... Not that Christ came for that end, that any one should be made blind: but that the Jews, by the abuse of his coming, and by their not receiving him, brought upon themselves this judgment of blindness.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And some of the Pharisees, who were with him, heard: and they said unto him: Are we also blind?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus said to them: If you were blind, you should not have sin: but now you say: We see. Your sin remaineth. If you were blind, etc.... If you were invincibly ignorant, and had neither read the scriptures, nor seen my miracles, you would not be guilty of the sin of infidelity: but now, as you boast of your knowledge of the scriptures, you are inexcusable. John Chapter 10 Christ is the door and the good shepherd. He and his Father are one.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Amen, amen, I say to you: He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold but climbeth up another way, the same is a thief and a robber.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: To him the porter openeth: and the sheep hear his voice. And he calleth his own sheep by name and leadeth them out.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he hath let out his own sheep, he goeth before them: and the sheep follow him, because they know his voice.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But a stranger they follow not, but fly from him, because they know not the voice of strangers.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This proverb Jesus spoke to them. But they understood not what he spoke to them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore said to them again: Amen, amen, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: All others, as many as have come, are thieves and robbers: and the sheep heard them not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I am the door. By me, if any man enter in, he shall be saved: and he shall go in and go out, and shall find pastures.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The thief cometh not, but for to steal and to kill and to destroy. I am come that they may have life and may have it more abundantly.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd giveth his life for his sheep.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But the hireling and he that is not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming and leaveth the sheep and flieth: and the wolf catcheth and scattereth the sheep,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the hireling flieth, because he is a hireling: and he hath no care for the sheep.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I am the good shepherd: and I know mine, and mine know me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As the Father knoweth me, and I know the Father: and I lay down my life for my sheep.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And other sheep I have that are not of this fold: them also I must bring. And they shall hear my voice: And there shall be one fold and one shepherd.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Therefore doth the Father love me: because I lay down my life, that I may take it again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: No man taketh it away from me: but I lay it down of myself. And I have power to lay it down: and I have power to take it up again. This commandment have I received of my Father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: A dissension rose again among the Jews for these words.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And many of them said: He hath a devil and is mad. Why hear you him?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Others said: These are not the words of one that hath a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it was the feast of the dedication at Jerusalem: and it was winter.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus walked in the temple, in Solomon’s porch.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews therefore came round about him and said to him: How long dost thou hold our souls in suspense? If thou be the Christ, tell us plainly.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered them: I speak to you, and you believe not: the works that I do in the name of my Father, they give testimony of me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But you do not believe, because you are not of my sheep.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: My sheep hear my voice. And I know them: and they follow me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I give them life everlasting: and they shall not perish for ever. And no man shall pluck them out of my hand.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That which my Father hath given me is greater than all: and no one can snatch them out of the hand of my Father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I and the Father are one. I and the Father are one.... That is, one divine nature, but two distinct persons.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews then took up stones to stone him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered them: Many good works I have shewed you from my Father. For which of those works do you stone me?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews answered him: For a good work we stone thee not, but for blasphemy: and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered them: Is it not written in your law: I said, you are gods?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If he called them gods to whom the word of God was spoken; and the scripture cannot be broken:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Do you say of him whom the Father hath sanctified and sent into the world: Thou blasphemest; because I said: I am the Son of God?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But if I do, though you will not believe me, believe the works: that you may know and believe that the Father is in me and I in the Father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They sought therefore to take him: and he escaped out of their hands.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he went again beyond the Jordan, into that place where John was baptizing first. And there he abode.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And many resorted to him: and they said: John indeed did no sign.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But all things whatsoever John said of this man were true. And many believed in him. John Chapter 11 Christ raises Lazarus to life. The rulers resolve to put him to death.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now there was a certain man sick, named Lazarus, of Bethania, of the town of Mary and of Martha her sister.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: (And Mary was she that anointed the Lord with ointment and wiped his feet with her hair: whose brother Lazarus was sick.)

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: His sisters therefore sent to him, saying: Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus hearing it, said to them: This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God: that the Son of God may be glorified by it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister Mary and Lazarus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When he had heard therefore that he was sick, he still remained in the same place two days.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then after that, he said to his disciples: Let us go into Judea again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The disciples say to him: Rabbi, the Jews but now sought to stone thee. And goest thou thither again?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered: Are there not twelve hours of the day? If a man walk in the day he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of this world:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But if he walk in the night, he stumbleth, because the light is not in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things he said; and after that he said to them: Lazarus our friend sleepeth: but I go that I may awake him out of sleep.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: His disciples therefore said: Lord, if he sleep, he shall do well.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Jesus spoke of his death: and they thought that he spoke of the repose of sleep.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then therefore Jesus said to them plainly: Lazarus is dead.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I am glad, for your sakes; that I was not there, that you may believe. But, let us go to him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Thomas therefore, who is called Didymus, said to his fellow disciples: Let us also go, that we may die with him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore came: and found that he had been four days already in the grave.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: (Now Bethania was near Jerusalem, about fifteen furlongs off.)

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And many of the Jews were come to Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Martha therefore, as soon as she heard that Jesus was come, went to meet him: but Mary sat at home.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Martha therefore said to Jesus: Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But now also I know that whatsoever thou wilt ask of God, God will give it thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith to her: Thy brother shall rise again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Martha saith to him: I know that he shall rise again, in the resurrection at the last day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus said to her: I am the resurrection and the life: he that believeth in me, although he be dead, shall live:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And every one that liveth and believeth in me shall not die for ever. Believest thou this?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: She saith to him: Yea, Lord, I have believed that thou art Christ, the Son of the living God, who art come into this world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when she had said these things, she went and called her sister Mary secretly, saying: The master is come and calleth for thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: She, as soon as she heard this, riseth quickly and cometh to him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For Jesus was not yet come into the town: but he was still in that place where Martha had met him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews therefore, who were with her in the house and comforted her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up speedily and went out, followed her, saying: She goeth to the grave to weep there.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When Mary therefore was come where Jesus was, seeing him, she fell down at his feet and saith to him. Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus, therefore, when he saw her weeping, and the Jews that were come with her weeping, groaned in the spirit and troubled himself,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And said: Where have you laid him? They say to him: Lord, come and see.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus wept.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews therefore said: Behold how he loved him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But some of them said: Could not he that opened the eyes of the man born blind have caused that this man should not die?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore again groaning in himself, cometh to the sepulchre. Now it was a cave; and a stone was laid over it.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith: Take away the stone. Martha, the sister of him that was dead, saith to him: Lord, by this time he stinketh, for he is now of four days.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith to her: Did not I say to thee that if thou believe, thou shalt see the glory of God?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They took therefore the stone away. And Jesus lifting up his eyes, said: Father, I give thee thanks that thou hast heard me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I knew that thou hearest me always: but because of the people who stand about have I said it, that they may believe that thou hast sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When he had said these things, he cried with a loud voice: Lazarus, come forth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And presently he that had been dead came forth, bound feet and hands with winding bands. And his face was bound about with a napkin. Jesus said to them: Loose him and let him go.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Many therefore of the Jews, who were come to Mary and Martha and had seen the things that Jesus did, believed in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them the things that Jesus had done.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The chief priests, therefore, and the Pharisees gathered a council and said: What do we, for this man doth many miracles?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If we let him alone so, all will believe in him; and the Romans will come, and take away our place and nation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But one of them, named Caiphas, being the high priest that year, said to them: You know nothing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Neither do you consider that it is expedient for you that one man should die for the people and that the whole nation perish not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And this he spoke not of himself: but being the high priest of that year, he prophesied that Jesus should die for the nation.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And not only for the nation, but to gather together in one the children of God that were dispersed.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: From that day therefore they devised to put him to death.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Wherefore Jesus walked no more openly among the Jews: but he went into a country near the desert, unto a city that is called Ephrem. And there he abode with his disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the pasch of the Jews was at hand: and many from the country went up to Jerusalem, before the pasch, to purify themselves.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They sought therefore for Jesus; and they discoursed one with another, standing in the temple: What think you that he is not come to the festival day? And the chief priests and Pharisees had given a commandment that, if any man knew where he was, he should tell, that they might apprehend him. John Chapter 12 The anointing of Christ’s feet. His riding into Jerusalem upon an ass. A voice from heaven.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore, six days before the pasch, came to Bethania, where Lazarus had been dead, whom Jesus raised to life.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they made him a supper there: and Martha served. But Lazarus was one of them that were at table with him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Mary therefore took a pound of ointment of right spikenard, of great price, and anointed the feet of Jesus and wiped his feet with her hair. And the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, he that was about to betray him, said:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence and given to the poor?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now he said this not because he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief and, having the purse, carried the things that were put therein.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore said: Let her alone, that she may keep it against the day of my burial.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For the poor you have always with you: but me you have not always. See the annotation of St. Matt. 26. 11.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: A great multitude therefore of the Jews knew that he was there; and they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But the chief priests thought to kill Lazarus also:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Because many of the Jews, by reason of him, went away and believed in Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And on the next day, a great multitude that was come to the festival day, when they had heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Took branches of palm trees and went forth to meet him and cried Hosanna. Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord, the king of Israel.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus found a young ass and sat upon it, as it is written:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Fear not, daughter of Sion: behold thy king cometh, sitting on an ass’s colt.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things his disciples did not know at the first: but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written of him and that they had done these things to him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The multitude therefore gave testimony, which was with him, when he called Lazarus out of the grave and raised him from the dead.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For which reason also the people came to meet him, because they heard that he had done this miracle.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves: Do you see that we prevail nothing? Behold, the whole world is gone after him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now there were certain Gentiles among them, who came up to adore on the festival day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These therefore came to Philip, who was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and desired him, saying: Sir, we would see Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Philip cometh and telleth Andrew. Again Andrew and Philip told Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Jesus answered them, saying: The hour is come that the Son of man should be glorified.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Amen, amen, I say to you, unless the grain of wheat falling into the ground die,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Itself remaineth alone. But if it die it bringeth forth much fruit. He that loveth his life shall lose it and he that hateth his life in this world keepeth it unto life eternal.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If any man minister to me, let him follow me: and where I am, there also shall my minister be. If any man minister to me, him will my Father honour.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now is my soul troubled. And what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour. But for this cause I came unto this hour.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Father, glorify thy name. A voice therefore came from heaven: I have both glorified it and will glorify it again.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The multitude therefore that stood and heard said that it thundered. Others said: An angel spoke to him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered and said: This voice came not because of me, but for your sakes.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now is the judgment of the world: now shall the prince of this world be cast out.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all things to myself.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: (Now this he said, signifying what death he should die.)

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The multitude answered him: We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever. And how sayest thou: The Son of man must be lifted up? Who is this Son of man?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore said to them: Yet a little while, the light is among you. Walk whilst you have the light, that the darkness overtake you not. And he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Whilst you have the light, believe in the light, that you may be the children of light. These things Jesus spoke: and he went away and hid himself from them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And whereas he had done so many miracles before them, they believed not in him:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That the saying of Isaias the prophet might be fulfilled, which he said: Lord, who hath believed our hearing? And to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Therefore they could not believe, because Isaias said again: They could not believe.... Because they would not, saith St. Augustine, Tract. 33, in Joan. See the annotation, St. Mark 4. 12.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He hath blinded their eyes and hardened their heart, that they should not see with their eyes, nor understand with their heart and be converted: and I should heal them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things said Isaias, when he saw his glory, and spoke of him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: However, many of the chief men also believed in him: but because of the Pharisees they did not confess him, that they might not be cast out of the synagogue.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For they loved the glory of men more than the glory of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Jesus cried and said: He that believeth in me doth not believe in me, but in him that sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he that seeth me, seeth him that sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I am come, a light into the world, that whosoever believeth in me may not remain in darkness.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if any man hear my words and keep them not, I do not judge him for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that despiseth me and receiveth not my words hath one that judgeth him. The word that I have spoken, the same shall judge him in the last day.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For I have not spoken of myself: but the Father who sent me, he gave me commandment what I should say and what I should speak.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I know that his commandment is life everlasting. The things therefore that I speak, even as the Father said unto me, so do I speak. John Chapter 13 Christ washes his disciples’ feet. The treason of Judas. The new commandment of love.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Before the festival day of the pasch, Jesus knowing that his hour was come, that he should pass out of this world to the Father: having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them unto the end. Before the festival day of the pasch.... This was the fourth and last pasch of the ministry of Christ, and according to the common computation, was in the thirty-third year of our Lord: and in the year of the world 4036. Some chronologers are of opinion that our Saviour suffered in the thirty-seventh year of his age: but these different opinions on this subject are of no consequence.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when supper was done (the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon, to betray him),

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Knowing that the Father had given him all things into his hands and that he came from God and goeth to God,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He riseth from supper and layeth aside his garments and, having taken a towel, girded himself.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: After that, he putteth water into a basin and began to wash the feet of the disciples and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was girded.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He cometh therefore to Simon Peter. And Peter saith to him: Lord, dost thou wash my feet?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered and said to him: What I do, thou knowest not now; but thou shalt know hereafter.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Peter saith to him: Thou shalt never wash my feet, Jesus answered him: If I wash thee not, thou shalt have no part with me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Simon Peter saith to him: Lord, not only my feet, but also my hands and my head.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith to him: He that is washed needeth not but to wash his feet, but is clean wholly. And you are clean, but not all.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For he knew who he was that would betray him; therefore he said: You are not all clean.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then after he had washed their feet and taken his garments, being set down again, he said to them: Know you what I have done to you?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: You call me Master and Lord. And you say well: for so I am.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If then I being your Lord and Master, have washed your feet; you also ought to wash one another’s feet.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For I have given you an example, that as I have done to you, so you do also.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Amen, amen, I say to you: The servant is not greater than his lord: neither is the apostle greater than he that sent him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If you know these things, you shall be blessed if you do them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I speak not of you all: I know whom I have chosen. But that the scripture may be fulfilled: He that eateth bread with me shall lift up his heel against me,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: At present I tell you, before it come to pass: that when it shall come to pass, you may believe that I am he.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Amen, amen, I say to you, he that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me: and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When Jesus had said these things, he was troubled in spirit; and he testified, and said: Amen, amen, I say to you, one of you shall betray me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The disciples therefore looked one upon another, doubting of whom he spoke.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now there was leaning on Jesus’ bosom one of his disciples, whom Jesus loved.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him and said to him: Who is it of whom he speaketh?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He therefore, leaning on the breast of Jesus, saith to him: Lord, who is it?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered: He it is to whom I shall reach bread dipped. And when he had dipped the bread, he gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after the morsel, Satan entered into him. And Jesus said to him: That which thou dost, do quickly. That which thou dost, do quickly.... It is not a license, much less a command, to go about his treason: but a signification to him that Christ would not hinder or resist what he was about, do it as soon as he pleased: but was both ready and desirous to suffer for our redemption.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now no man at the table knew to what purpose he said this unto him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For some thought, because Judas had the purse, that Jesus had said to him: Buy those things which we have need of for the festival day: or that he should give something to the poor.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He therefore, having received the morsel, went out immediately. And it was night.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When he therefore was gone out, Jesus said: Now is the Son of man glorified; and God is glorified in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If God be glorified in him, God also will glorify him in himself: and immediately will he glorify him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Little children, yet a little while I am with you. You shall seek me. And as I said to the Jews: Whither I go you cannot come; so I say to you now.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: A new commandment I give unto you: That you love one another, as I have loved you, that you also love one another.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: By this shall all men know that you are my disciples, if you have love one for another.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Simon Peter saith to him: Lord, whither goest thou? Jesus answered: Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now: but thou shalt follow hereafter.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Peter saith to him: Why cannot I follow thee now? I will lay down my life for thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered him: Wilt thou lay down thy life for me? Amen, amen, I say to thee, the cock shall not crow, till thou deny me thrice. John Chapter 14 Christ’s discourse after his last supper.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Let not your heart be troubled. You believe in God: believe also in me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In my Father’s house there are many mansions. If not, I would have told you: because I go to prepare a place for you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And if I shall go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and will take you to myself: that where I am, you also may be.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And whither I go you know: and the way you know.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Thomas saith to him: Lord, we know not whither thou goest. And how can we know the way?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith to him: I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No man cometh to the Father, but by me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If you had known me, you would without doubt have known my Father also: and from henceforth you shall know him. And you have seen him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Philip saith to him: Lord, shew us the Father; and it is enough for us.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus saith to him: Have I been so long a time with you and have you not known me? Philip, he that seeth me seeth the Father also. How sayest thou: Shew us the Father?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Do you not believe that I am in the Father and the Father in me? The words that I speak to you, I speak not of myself. But the Father who abideth in me, he doth the works.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Believe you not that I am in the Father and the Father in me?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Otherwise believe for the very works’ sake. Amen, amen, I say to you, he that believeth in me, the works that I do, he also shall do: and greater than these shall he do.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Because I go to the Father: and whatsoever you shall ask the Father in my name, that will I do: that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If you shall ask me any thing in my name, that I will do.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If you love me, keep my commandments.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I will ask the Father: and he shall give you another Paraclete, that he may abide with you for ever: Paraclete.... That is, a comforter: or also an advocate; inasmuch as by inspiring prayer, he prays, as it were, in us, and pleads for us. For ever.... Hence it is evident that this Spirit of Truth was not only promised to the persons of the apostles, but also to their successors through all generations.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it seeth him not, nor knoweth him. But you shall know him; because he shall abide with you and shall be in you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I will not leave you orphans: I will come to you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Yet a little while and the world seeth me no more. But you see me: because I live, and you shall live.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In that day you shall know that I am in my Father: and you in me, and I in you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that hath my commandments and keepeth them; he it is that loveth me. And he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father: and I will love him and will manifest myself to him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Judas saith to him, not the Iscariot: Lord, how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself to us, and not to the world?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered and said to him: If any one love me, he will keep my word. And my Father will love him and we will come to him and will make our abode with him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that loveth me not keepeth not my words. And the word which you have heard is not mine; but the Father’s who sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things have I spoken to you, abiding with you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But the Paraclete, the Holy Ghost, whom the Father will send in my name, he will teach you all things and bring all things to your mind, whatsoever I shall have said to you. Teach you all things.... Here the Holy Ghost is promised to the apostles and their successors, particularly, in order to teach them all truth, and to preserve them from error.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Peace I leave with you: my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, do I give unto you. Let not your heart be troubled: nor let it be afraid.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: You have heard that I said to you: I go away, and I come unto you. If you loved me you would indeed be glad, because I go to the Father: for the Father is greater than I. For the Father is greater than I.... It is evident, that Christ our Lord speaks here of himself as he is made man: for as God he is equal to the Father. (See Phil. 2.) Any difficulty of understanding the meaning of these words will vanish, when the relative circumstances of the text here are considered: for Christ being at this time shortly to suffer death, signified to his apostles his human nature by these very words: for as God he could not die. And therefore as he was both God and man, it must follow that according to his humanity he was to die, which the apostles were soon to see and believe, as he expresses, ver. 29. And now I have told you before it come to pass: that when it shall come to pass, you may believe.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And now I have told you before it come to pass: that when it shall come to pass, you may believe.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I will not now speak many things with you. For the prince of this world: cometh: and in me he hath not any thing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But that the world may know that I love the Father: and as the Father hath given me commandment, so do I. Arise, let us go hence. John Chapter 15 A continuation of Christ’s discourse to his disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I am the true vine: and my Father is the husbandman.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit, he will take away: and every one that beareth fruit, he will purge it, that it may bring forth more fruit.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now you are clean, by reason of the word which I have spoken to you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Abide in me: and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, unless it abide in the vine, so neither can you, unless you abide in me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I am the vine: you the branches. He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same beareth much fruit: for without me you can do nothing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If any one abide not in me, he shall be cast forth as a branch and shall wither: and they shall gather him up and cast him into the fire: and he burneth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If you abide in me and my words abide in you, you shall ask whatever you will: and it shall be done unto you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In this is my Father glorified: that you bring forth very much fruit and become my disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As the Father hath loved me, I also have loved you. Abide in my love.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If you keep my commandments, you shall abide in my love: as I also have kept my Father’s commandments and do abide in his love.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things I have spoken to you, that my joy may be in you, and your joy may be filled.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This is my commandment, that you love one another, as I have loved you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Greater love than this no man hath, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: You are my friends, if you do the things that I command you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I will not now call you servants: for the servant knoweth not what his lord doth. But I have called you friends: because all things, whatsoever I have heard of my Father, I have made known to you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: You have not chosen me: but I have chosen you; and have appointed you, that you should go and should bring forth fruit; and your fruit should remain: that whatsoever you shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things I command you, that you love one another.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If the world hate you, know ye that it hath hated me before you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If you had been of the world, the world would love its own: but because you are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Remember my word that I said to you: The servant is not greater than his master. If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they have kept my word, they will keep yours also.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But all these things they will do to you for my name’s sake: because they know not him that sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have sin: but now they have no excuse for their sin.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He that hateth me hateth my Father also.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: If I had not done among them the works that no other man hath done, they would not have sin: but now they have both seen and hated both me and my Father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But that the word may be fulfilled which is written in their law: they hated me without cause.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But when the Paraclete cometh, whom I will send you from the Father, the Spirit of truth, who proceedeth from the Father, he shall give testimony of me. Whom I will send.... This proves, against the modern Greeks, that the Holy Ghost proceedeth from the Son, as well as from the Father: otherwise he could not be sent by the Son.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And you shall give testimony, because you are with me from the beginning. John Chapter 16 The conclusion of Christ’s last discourse to his disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things have I spoken to you, that you may not be scandalized.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They will put you out of the synagogues: yea, the hour cometh, that whosoever killeth you will think that he doth a service to God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And these things will they do to you; because they have not known the Father nor me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But these things I have told you, that when the hour shall come, you may remember that I told you of them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I told you not these things from the beginning, because I was with you. And now I go to him that sent me, and none of you asketh me: Whither goest thou?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But because I have spoken these things to you, sorrow hath filled your heart.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But I tell you the truth: it is expedient to you that I go. For if I go not, the Paraclete will not come to you: but if I go, I will send him to you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he is come, he will convince the world of sin and of justice and of judgment. He will convince the world of sin, etc.... The Holy Ghost, by his coming brought over many thousands, first, to a sense of their sin in not believing in Christ. Secondly, to a conviction of the justice of Christ, now sitting at the right hand of his Father. And thirdly, to a right apprehension of the judgment prepared for them that choose to follow Satan, who is already judged and condemned.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Of sin: because they believed not in me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And of justice: because I go to the Father: and you shall see me no longer.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And of judgment: because the prince of this world is already judged.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I have yet many things to say to you: but you cannot bear them now.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will teach you all truth. For he shall not speak of himself: but what things soever he shall hear, he shall speak. And the things that are to come, he shall shew you. Will teach you all truth.... See the annotation on chap. 14. ver. 26.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: He shall glorify me: because he shall receive of mine and shall shew it to you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: All things whatsoever the Father hath are mine. Therefore I said that he shall receive of me and shew it to you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: A little while, and now you shall not see me: and again a little while, and you shall see me: because I go to the Father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then some of his disciples said one to another: What is this that he saith to us: A little while, and you shall not see me: and again a little while, and you shall see me, and, Because I go to the Father?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They said therefore: What is this that he saith, A little while? We know not what he speaketh.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Jesus knew that they had a mind to ask him. And he said to them: Of this do you inquire among yourselves, because I said: A little while, and you shall not see me; and again a little while, and you shall see me?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Amen, amen, I say to you, that you shall lament and weep, but the world shall rejoice: and you shall be made sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: A woman, when she is in labour, hath sorrow, because her hour is come; but when she hath brought forth the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: So also you now indeed have sorrow: but I will see you again and your heart shall rejoice. And your joy no man shall take from you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And in that day you shall not ask me any thing. Amen, amen, I say to you: if you ask the Father any thing in my name, he will give it you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Hitherto, you have not asked any thing in my name. Ask, and you shall receive; that your joy may be full.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things I have spoken to you in proverbs. The hour cometh when I will no longer speak to you in proverbs, but will shew you plainly of the Father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: In that day, you shall ask in my name: and I say not to you that I will ask the Father for you.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For the Father himself loveth you, because you have loved me and have believed that I came out from God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I came forth from the Father and am come into the world: again I leave the world and I go to the Father.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: His disciples say to him: Behold, now thou speakest plainly and speakest no proverb.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now we know that thou knowest all things and thou needest not that any man should ask thee. By this we believe that thou camest forth from God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered them: Do you now believe?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Behold, the hour cometh, and it is now come, that you shall be scattered every man to his own and shall leave me alone. And yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things I have spoken to you, that in me you may have peace. In the world you shall have distress. But have confidence. I have overcome the world. John Chapter 17 Christ’s prayer for his disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: These things Jesus spoke: and lifting up his eyes to heaven, he said: Father, the hour is come. Glorify thy Son, that thy Son may glorify thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As thou hast given him power over all flesh, that he may give eternal life to all whom thou hast given him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now this is eternal life: That they may know thee, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom thou hast sent.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I have glorified thee on the earth; I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And now glorify thou me, O Father, with thyself, with the glory which I had, before the world was, with thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I have manifested thy name to the men whom thou hast given me out of the world. Thine they were: and to me thou gavest them. And they have kept thy word.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now they have known that all things which thou hast given me are from thee:

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Because the words which thou gavest me, I have given to them. And they have received them and have known in very deed that I came out from thee: and they have believed that thou didst send me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I pray for them. I pray not for the world, but for them whom thou hast given me: because they are thine.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And all my things are thine, and thine are mine: and I am glorified in them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And now I am not in the world, and these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep them in thy name whom thou hast given me: that they may be one, as we also are.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: While I was with them, I kept them in thy name. Those whom thou gavest me have I kept: and none of them is lost, but the son of perdition: that the scripture may be fulfilled.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And now I come to thee: and these things I speak in the world, that they may have my joy filled in themselves.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I have given them thy word, and the world hath hated them: because they are not of the world, as I also am not of the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I pray not that thou shouldst take them out of the world, but that thou shouldst keep them from evil.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They are not of the world, as I also am not of the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Sanctify them in truth. Thy word is truth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As thou hast sent me into the world, I also have sent them into the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And for them do I sanctify myself, that they also may be sanctified in truth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And not for them only do I pray, but for them also who through their word shall believe in me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That they all may be one, as thou, Father, in me, and I in thee; that they also may be one in us: that the world may believe that thou hast sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the glory which thou hast given me, I have given to them: that, they may be one, as we also are one.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: I in them, and thou in me: that they may be made perfect in one: and the world may know that thou hast sent me and hast loved them, as thou hast also loved me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Father, I will that where I am, they also whom thou hast given me may be with me: that they may see my glory which thou hast given me, because thou hast loved me before the creation of the world.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Just Father, the world hath not known thee: but I have known thee. And these have known that thou hast sent me.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And I have made known thy name to them and will make it known: that the love wherewith thou hast loved me may be in them, and I in them. John Chapter 18 The history of the passion of Christ.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When Jesus had said these things, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron, where there was a garden, into which he entered with his disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Judas also, who betrayed him, knew the place: because Jesus had often resorted thither together with his disciples.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Judas therefore having received a band of soldiers and servants from the chief priests and the Pharisees, cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore, knowing all things that should come upon him, went forth and said to them: Whom seek ye?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They answered him: Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus saith to them: I am he. And Judas also, who betrayed him, stood with them.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: As soon therefore as he had said to them: I am he; they went backward and fell to the ground.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Again therefore he asked them: Whom seek ye? And they said: Jesus of Nazareth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered: I have told you that I am he. If therefore you seek me, let these go their way,

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That the word might be fulfilled which he said: Of them whom thou hast given me, I have not lost any one.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it and struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear. And the name of the servant was Malchus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore said to Peter: Put up thy sword into the scabbard. The chalice which my father hath given me, shall I not drink it?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then the band and the tribune and the servants of the Jews took Jesus and bound him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they led him away to Annas first, for he was father-in-law to Caiphas, who was the high priest of that year.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now Caiphas was he who had given the counsel to the Jews: That it was expedient that one man should die for the people.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Simon Peter followed Jesus: and so did another disciple. And that disciple was known to the high priest and went in with Jesus into the court of the high priest.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But Peter stood at the door without. The other disciple therefore, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the portress and brought in Peter.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The maid therefore that was portress saith to Peter: Art not thou also one of this man’s disciples? He saith: I am not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now the servants and ministers stood at a fire of coals, because it was cold, and warmed themselves. And with them was Peter also, standing and warming himself.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The high priest therefore asked Jesus of his disciples and of his doctrine.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered him: I have spoken openly to the world. I have always taught in the synagogue and in the temple, whither all the Jews resort: and in secret I have spoken nothing.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Why askest thou me? Ask them who have heard what I have spoken unto them. Behold they know what things I have said.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And when he had said these things, one of the servants standing by gave Jesus a blow, saying: Answerest thou the high priest so?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered him: If I have spoken evil, give testimony of the evil; but if well, why strikest thou me?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Annas sent him bound to Caiphas the high priest.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said therefore to him: Art not thou also one of his disciples? He denied it and said: I am not.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: One of the servants of the high priest (a kinsman to him whose ear Peter cut off) saith to him: Did not I see thee in the garden with him?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Again therefore Peter denied: and immediately the cock crew.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then they led Jesus from Caiphas to the governor’s hall. And it was morning: and they went not into the hall, that they might not be defiled, but that they might eat the pasch.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Pilate therefore went out to them, and said: What accusation bring you against this man?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They answered and said to him: If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him up to thee.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Pilate therefore said to them: Take him you, and judge him according to your law. The Jews therefore said to him: It is not lawful for us to put any man to death.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: That the word of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he said, signifying what death he should die.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Pilate therefore went into the hall again and called Jesus and said to him: Art thou the king of the Jews?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered: Sayest thou this thing of thyself, or have others told it thee of me?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Pilate answered: Am I a Jew? Thy own nation and the chief priests have delivered thee up to me. What hast thou done?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered: My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom were of this world, my servants would certainly strive that I should not be delivered to the Jews: but now my kingdom is not from hence.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Pilate therefore said to him: Art thou a king then? Jesus answered: Thou sayest that I am a king. For this was I born, and for this came I into the world; that I should give testimony to the truth. Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Pilate saith to him: What is truth? And when he said this, he went out again to the Jews and saith to them: I find no cause in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But you have a custom that I should release one unto you at the Pasch. Will you, therefore, that I release unto you the king of the Jews?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then cried they all again, saying: Not this man, but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was a robber. John Chapter 19 The continuation of the history of the Passion of Christ.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then therefore Pilate took Jesus and scourged him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And the soldiers platting a crown of thorns, put it upon his head: and they put on him a purple garment.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And they came to him and said: Hail, king of the Jews. And they gave him blows.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Pilate therefore went forth again and saith to them: Behold, I bring him forth unto you, that you may know that I find no cause in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: (Jesus therefore came forth, bearing the crown of thorns and the purple garment.) And he saith to them: Behold the Man.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When the chief priests, therefore, and the servants had seen him, they cried out, saying: Crucify him, Crucify him. Pilate saith to them: Take him you, and crucify him: for I find no cause in him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The Jews answered him: We have a law; and according to the law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When Pilate therefore had heard this saying, he feared the more.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he entered into the hall again; and he said to Jesus: Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him no answer.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Pilate therefore saith to him: Speakest thou not to me? Knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee, and I have power to release thee?

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus answered: Thou shouldst not have any power against me, unless it were given thee from above. Therefore, he that hath delivered me to thee hath the greater sin.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And from henceforth Pilate sought to release him. But the Jews cried out, saying: If thou release this man, thou art not Caesar’s friend. For whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against Caesar.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now when Pilate had heard these words, he brought Jesus forth and sat down in the judgment seat, in the place that is called Lithostrotos, and in Hebrew Gabbatha.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And it was the parasceve of the pasch, about the sixth hour: and he saith to the Jews: Behold your king. The parasceve of the pasch.... That is, the day before the paschal sabbath. The eve of every sabbath was called the parasceve, or day of preparation. But this was the eve of a high sabbath, viz., that which fell in the paschal week.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But they cried out: Away with him: Away with him: Crucify him. Pilate saith to them: shall I crucify your king? The chief priests answered: We have no king but Caesar.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then therefore he delivered him to them to be crucified. And they took Jesus and led him forth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And bearing his own cross, he went forth to the place which is called Calvary, but in Hebrew Golgotha.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Where they crucified him, and with him two others, one on each side, and Jesus in the midst.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Pilate wrote a title also: and he put it upon the cross. And the writing was: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: This title therefore many of the Jews did read: because the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city. And it was written in Hebrew, in Greek, and in Latin.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate: Write not: The King of the Jews. But that he said: I am the King of the Jews.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Pilate answered: What I have written, I have written.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The soldiers therefore, when they had crucified him, took his garments, (and they made four parts, to every soldier a part) and also his coat. Now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: They said then one to another: Let us not cut it but let us cast lots for it, whose it shall be; that the scripture might be fulfilled, saying: They have parted my garments among them, and upon my vesture they have cast lots. And the soldiers indeed did these things.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now there stood by the cross of Jesus, his mother and his mother’s sister, Mary of Cleophas, and Mary Magdalen.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: When Jesus therefore had seen his mother and the disciple standing whom he loved, he saith to his mother: Woman, behold thy son.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: After that, he saith to the disciple: Behold thy mother. And from that hour, the disciple took her to his own.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Afterwards, Jesus knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the scripture might be fulfilled, said: I thirst.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Now there was a vessel set there, full of vinegar. And they, putting a sponge full of vinegar about hyssop, put it to his mouth.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Jesus therefore, when he had taken the vinegar, said: It is consummated. And bowing his head, he gave up the ghost.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: Then the Jews (because it was the parasceve), that the bodies might not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day (for that was a great sabbath day), besought Pilate that their legs might be broken: and that they might be taken away.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: The soldiers therefore came: and they broke the legs of the first, and of the other that was crucified with him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But after they were come to Jesus, when they saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: But one of the soldiers with a spear opened his side: and immediately there came out blood and water.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And he that saw it hath given testimony: and his testimony is true. And he knoweth that he saith true: that you also may believe.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: For these things were done that the scripture might be fulfilled: You shall not break a bone of him.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And again another scripture saith: They shall look on him whom they pierced.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And after these things, Joseph of Arimathea (because he was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews), besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus. And Pilate gave leave. He came therefore and took away the body of Jesus.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
Text: And Nicodemus also came (he who at the first came to Jesus by night), bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about an hundred pound weight.

Book: The Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ According to St. Luke
